translated: And he remained thus, intent on imploring.

original: anyatamaś ca satvo 'nyatamasmāt satvanikāyāc cyutvā tasyāḥ prajāpatyāḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: anyatamaḥ ca satvaḥ nyatamasmāt satva nikāyāt cyutvā tasyāḥ prajāpatyāḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ
translated: And a certain being, having fallen from a certain class of beings, entered the womb of that woman.

analyzed: pañca āveṇikāḥ dharmāḥ ekatye paṇḍita jātīye mātṛgrāme
translated: There are five special qualities of a certain wise woman.

analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: raktam puruṣam jānāti
translated: She knows a man who is passionate.

analyzed: viraktam puruṣam jānāti
translated: She knows a man who is dispassionate.

original: kālaṃ jānāti ṛtuṃ jānāti /🔽garbham avakrāntaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: kālam jānāti ṛtum jānāti  garbham avakrāntam jānāti
translated: She knows the right time. She knows the season.🔽She knows when the embryo has entered.

original: yasya sakāśād garbho 'vakrāmati taṃ jānāti /🔽dārakaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: yasya sakāśāt garbhaḥ vakrāmati tam jānāti  dārakam jānāti
translated: She knows from whom the embryo has entered.🔽She knows if it is a boy.

analyzed: dārikām jānāti
translated: She knows if it is a girl.

original: saced dārako bhavati dakṣiṇaṃ kukṣiṃ niśritya tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: saced dārakaḥ bhavati dakṣiṇam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: If it is a boy, he stays on the right side of the womb.

original: saced dārikā bhavati vāmaṃ kukṣiṃ niśritya tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: saced dārikā bhavati vāmam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: If it is a girl, she stays on the left side of the womb.

analyzed: sā ātta manāḥ ātta manāḥ svāmine ārocayati
translated: She, with a delighted mind, informs her husband:

analyzed: diṣṭyā āryaputra vardhase
translated: By good luck, noble sir, you are prospering.

analyzed: āpannasatvā asmi saṃvṛttā
translated: I have become pregnant.

original: yathā ca me dakṣiṇaṃ kukṣiṃ niśritya tiṣṭhati niyataṃ dārako bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: yathā ca me dakṣiṇam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati niyatam dārakaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And because he stays on the right side of my womb, surely it will be a boy.

analyzed: saḥ pi ātta manāḥ ātta manāḥ
translated: He, with a delighted mind,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: physician.

original: pūrvakāyam atyunnamayya abhyunnamayya dakṣiṇaṃ bāhum abhiprasārya udānam udānayati /
analyzed: pūrva kāyam atyunnamayya abhyunnamayya dakṣiṇam bāhum abhiprasārya udānam udānayati
translated: raising his upper body, stretching out his right arm, utters a solemn utterance:

analyzed: api eva aham cira kāla abhilaṣitam putra mukham paśyeyam
translated: May I see the face of a son, longed for for a long time.

analyzed: jātaḥ me syāt na avajātaḥ
translated: May he be born to me, not unborn.

analyzed: kṛtyāni me kurvīta  bhṛtaḥ pratibibhṛyāt
translated: May he do my duties for me.🔽May he support those whom I support.

analyzed: dāyāt yam pratipadyeta
translated: May he inherit my wealth.

analyzed: kula vaṃśaḥ me cirasthitikaḥ syāt
translated: May my family line last long.

original: asmākaṃ cāpy atītakālagatānām alpaṃ vā prabhūtaṃ vā dānāni datvā kṛtyāni kṛtvā asmākaṃ nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādekṣyati /
analyzed: asmākam ca api atīta kāla gatānām alpam vā prabhūtam vā dānāni da tvā kṛtyāni kṛtvā asmākam nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādekṣyati
translated: And when we have passed away, having given gifts, small or great, and performed meritorious deeds, may he announce the gifts in our names.

original: idaṃ tayor yatratatropapannayor gacchator anugacchatv iti /
analyzed: idam tayoḥ yatra tatra upapannayoḥ gacchatoḥ anugacchatu iti
translated: This is so that when they are reborn wherever they go, it will follow them.

analyzed: āpannasatvām ca enām viditvā upari prāsāda tala gatām a yantritām dhārayati
translated: And when she became pregnant, he placed her in the upper palace, where she was entertained without being restrained.

original: śīte śītopakaraṇair uṣṇe uṣṇopakaraṇair vaidyaprajñaptair āhārair nātitiktair nātyamlair🔽nātilavaṇair nātimadhurair nātikaṭukair nātikaṣāyais tiktāmlalavaṇamadhurakaṭukakaṣāyavivarjitair
analyzed: śīte śīta upakaraṇaiḥ uṣṇe uṣṇa upakaraṇaiḥ vaidya prajñaptaiḥ āhāraiḥ na ati tiktaiḥ na ati amlaiḥ  na ati lavaṇaiḥ na ati madhuraiḥ na ati kaṭukaiḥ na ati kaṣāyaiḥ tikta amla lavaṇa madhura kaṭuka kaṣāya vivarjitaiḥ
translated: In the cold, with cold things, in the hot, with hot things, with food prescribed by physicians, not too bitter, not too sour,🔽not too salty, not too sweet, not too sharp, not too astringent,

original: āhārair hārārdhahāravibhūṣitagātrīm apsarasam iva nandanavanavicāriṇīṃ mañcān mañcaṃ
analyzed: āhāraiḥ hāra ardhahāra vibhūṣita gātrīm apsarasam iva nandana vana vicāriṇīm mañcāt mañcam
translated: with food free from bitterness, sourness, saltiness, sweetness, sharpness, and astringency, with her body adorned with necklaces and half-necklaces, like a celestial nymph roaming in the Nandana Grove, from bed to bed,

analyzed: pīṭhāt pīṭham an avatarantīm adharimām bhūmim
translated: from seat to seat, not descending to the lower ground.

original: na cāsyāḥ kiṃcid amanojñaśabdaśravaṇaṃ yāvad eva garbhasya paripākāya /
analyzed: na ca asyāḥ kiṃcid a manojña śabda śravaṇam yāvat eva garbhasya paripākāya
translated: And she did not hear any unpleasant sounds at all, until the embryo was fully developed.

original: sā aṣṭānāṃ vā navānāṃ vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā /
analyzed: sā aṣṭānām vā navānām vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā
translated: After nine or ten months had passed, she gave birth.

analyzed: dārakaḥ jātaḥ
translated: A boy was born,

analyzed: abhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ
translated: handsome, good-looking, and inspiring.

analyzed: janmani ca asya tat kulam nanditam
translated: And at his birth, that family was delighted.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā nāmadheyaṃ vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā nāmadheyam vyavasthāpyate
translated: When he was born, a great birth festival was held and his name was established.

analyzed: kim bhavatu dārakasya nāma iti
translated: What should be the boy's name?

analyzed: jñātayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The relatives said:

analyzed: yasmāt asya janmani sarva kulam nanditam
translated: Since his birth, the whole family is delighted.

original: tasmād bhavatu dārakasya nanda iti nāmeti /
analyzed: tasmāt bhavatu dārakasya nandaḥ iti nāma iti
translated: Therefore, let the boy's name be Nanda.

original: tasya nanda iti nāma vyavasthāpitam //🔽nando dārako 'ṣṭābhyo dhātrībhyo datto dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ kṣīradhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ maladhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ krīḍanikābhyāṃ
analyzed: tasya nandaḥ iti nāma vyavasthāpitam  nandaḥ dārakaḥ ṣṭābhyaḥ dhātrībhyaḥ dattaḥ dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyām dvābhyām kṣīradhātrībhyām dvābhyām maladhātrībhyām dvābhyām krīḍanikābhyām
translated: His name was established as Nanda.🔽The boy Nanda was given to eight nurses, two nurses to hold him, two to feed him, two to clean him, and two to play with him.

original: so 'ṣṭābhir dhātrībhir unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍenānyaiś cottaptottaptair upakaraṇaviśeṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭābhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiḥ ca uttapta uttaptaiḥ upakaraṇa viśeṣaiḥ
translated: He was raised and nourished by the eight nurses with milk, curd, butter, ghee, cream, and other special nourishing foods.

analyzed: āśu vardhate hrada stham iva paṅkajam
translated: He grew quickly like a lotus in a pond.

original: yadā mahān saṃvṛttaḥ paṃcavarṣaḥ ṣaḍvarṣo vā /
analyzed: yadā mahān saṃvṛttaḥ paṃca varṣaḥ ṣaṣ varṣaḥ vā
translated: When he became a big boy, five or six years old,

analyzed: tadā kusīdaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ parama kusīdaḥ
translated: he became lazy, extremely lazy.

analyzed: na icchati śayana asanāt api utthātum
translated: He did not even want to get up from his bed or seat.

analyzed: tena tīkṣṇa niśita buddhi tayā antar gṛha sthena eva śāstrāṇi adhītāni
translated: Therefore, due to his sharp and keen intellect, he studied the scriptures while still living at home.

analyzed: atha śreṣṭhinaḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then the merchant had this thought:

original: so 'pi me kadācit karhicid devatārādhanayā putro jātaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ pi me kadācid karhicit devatā ārādhanayā putraḥ jātaḥ
translated: He too, at some time or other, was born as my son through the propitiation of a deity.

analyzed: saḥ pi kusīdaḥ parama kusīdaḥ
translated: But he is lazy, extremely lazy.

analyzed: śayana asanāt api na uttiṣṭhate
translated: He does not even get up from his bed or seat.

analyzed: tat kim mama anena īdṛś jātīyena putreṇa
translated: So what use is such a son to me?

original: yo nāma svasthaśarīro bhūtvā paśur iva saṃtiṣṭhatīti //
analyzed: yaḥ nāma svastha śarīraḥ bhūtvā paśuḥ iva saṃtiṣṭhati iti
translated: He is like an animal, just staying there, with a healthy body.

analyzed: sa ca śreṣṭhī pūraṇa abhiprasannaḥ
translated: And that merchant was devoted to Pūraṇa.

original: tena ṣaṭ tīrthikāḥ śāstāraḥ svagṛham āhūtāḥ /
analyzed: tena ṣaṭ tīrthikāḥ śāstāraḥ sva gṛham āhūtāḥ
translated: He invited six non-Buddhist teachers to his house,

original: api nāma ayaṃ dārakas teṣāṃ darśanād gauravajātaḥ śayanāsanād api tāvad uttiṣṭhet /
analyzed: api nāma ayam dārakaḥ teṣām darśanāt gaurava jātaḥ śayana asanāt api tāvat uttiṣṭhet
translated: thinking, Perhaps this boy, out of respect for them, will get up from his bed or seat just by seeing them.

original: atha kusīdo dārakas tāṃś chāstṝn dṛṣṭvā cakṣuḥsaṃprekṣaṇām api na kṛtavān /🔽kaḥ punar vāda utthāsyati vā abhivādayiṣyati vā /
analyzed: atha kusīdaḥ dārakaḥ tān śāstṝn dṛṣṭvā cakṣuḥ saṃprekṣaṇām api na kṛtavān  kaḥ punar vādaḥ utthāsyati vā abhivādayiṣyati vā
translated: But the lazy boy, seeing those teachers, did not even give them a glance.🔽So what need is there to mention that he would get up or pay homage to them?

analyzed: āsanena vai upanimantrayiṣyati
translated: Or invite them to a seat?

original: atha sa gṛhapatis tām evāvasthāṃ dṛṣṭvā suṣṭhutaram utkaṇṭhitaḥ kare kapolaṃ datvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa gṛhapatiḥ tām eva avasthām dṛṣṭvā suṣṭhutaram utkaṇṭhitaḥ kare kapolam da tvā cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Then the householder, seeing that very state, became even more anxious, placed his cheek in his hand, and remained absorbed in thought.

original: atrāntare nāsti kiṃcid buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam /
analyzed: atra antare na asti kiṃcid buddhānām bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing unknown, unseen, uncognized, or unrecognized by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ lokānugrahapravṛttakānām ekārakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām mahā kāruṇikānām loka anugraha pravṛttakānām eka ārakṣāṇām
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas, the Greatly Compassionate Ones, who engage in benefiting the world, to have one protector,🔽who dwell in tranquility and insight, who are skilled in the three means of conversion,

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā vihāriṇām tri damatha vastu kuśalānām catur ogha uttīrṇānām catur ṛddhipāda caraṇa tala supratiṣṭhitānām
translated: who have well-established feet in the four bases of supernatural power,

analyzed: caturṣu saṃgraha vastuṣu dīrgha rātra kṛta paricayānām pañca aṅga viprahīṇānām pañca gati samatikrāntānām
translated: who have long been accustomed to the four means of gathering disciples, who are free from the five factors, who have transcended the five destinies,

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṅga samanvāgatānām ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇānām sapta bodhyaṅga kusuma āḍhyānām aṣṭāṅga mārga deśikānām
translated: who possess the six factors, who have perfected the six perfections, who are adorned with the seven factors of enlightenment, who teach the eightfold path,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: physician, p.

analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti kuśalānām daśa bala balinām daśa diś samāpūrṇa yaśasām daśa śata vaśavarti prativiśiṣṭānām
translated: skilled in the nine successive absorptions, possessing the strength of the ten powers, whose fame fills the ten directions, who surpass the one hundred and ten powers,

original: trī rātres trir divasasya ca buddhacakṣuṣā lokaṃ vyavalokya jñānadarśanaṃ pravartate /🔽ko hīyate ko vardhate kaḥ kṛcchraprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭaprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādhaprāptaḥ kaḥ
analyzed: tris rātreḥ tris divasasya ca buddha cakṣuṣā lokam vyavalokya jñāna darśanam pravartate  kaḥ hīyate kaḥ vardhate kaḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭa prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādha prāptaḥ kaḥ
translated: having surveyed the world with the Buddha's eye three times in the night and three times in the day, their knowledge and insight proceeds thus:🔽Who is declining? Who is growing? Who has met with misfortune? Who has met with danger? Who has met with an obstruction?

analyzed: kṛcchra saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptaḥ
translated: Who has met with misfortune, danger, and obstruction? Who is going to an unhappy state? Who is inclined towards an unhappy state? Who is leaning towards an unhappy state?

original: kam aham apāyād uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam /
analyzed: kam aham apāyāt uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I lift up from an unhappy state and establish in heaven and liberation?

analyzed: kasya kāma paṅka nimagnasya hasta uddhāram anupradadyām
translated: Whom shall I give a helping hand to, who is sunk in the mud of desire?

analyzed: kam ārya dhana virahitam ārya dhana aiśvarya ādhipatye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I establish in the lordship and sovereignty of the noble wealth, who is devoid of the noble wealth?

analyzed: kasya ajñāna timira paṭala paryavanaddha netrasya jñāna añjana śalākayā cakṣuḥ viśodhayāmi  kasya an avaropitāni kuśala mulāni avaropayeyam
translated: With the ointment stick of knowledge, I shall purify the eye of whose eye is covered by the cataract of ignorance?🔽In whom shall I plant the roots of virtue that have not been planted?

analyzed: kasya avaropitāni paripācayeyam
translated: In whom shall I ripen the roots of virtue that have been planted?

analyzed: kasya paripakvāni vimocayeyam āha ca
translated: Whose [roots of virtue] are ripe that I might liberate? And he said:

analyzed: api eva atikramet velām sāgaraḥ makara ālayaḥ
translated: Even the ocean, the abode of makaras, might transgress its shoreline,

original: na tu vaineyavatsānāṃ buddho velām atikramet // / //
analyzed: na tu vaineya vatsānām buddhaḥ velām atikramet
translated: But the Buddha would not transgress the shoreline of those beings to be trained.

analyzed: paśyati bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One saw:

original: ayaṃ dārakaḥ kusīdo maddarśanād vīryam ārapsyate yāvad anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ pariṇāmayiṣyatīti /
analyzed: ayam dārakaḥ kusīdaḥ mad darśanāt vīryam ārapsyate yāvat anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam pariṇāmayiṣyati iti
translated: This child is lazy, but by seeing me he will arouse energy and will dedicate his mind to supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: tato bhagavatā tīrthyānāṃ madadarpacchittyarthaṃ dārakasya ca kuśalamūlasaṃjananārthaṃ sūryasahasrātirekaprabhāḥ kanakavarṇamarīcaya utsṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā tīrthyānām mada darpa chitti artham dārakasya ca kuśala mūla saṃjanana artham sūrya sahasra atireka prabhāḥ kanaka varṇa marīcayaḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to destroy the pride and arrogance of the tīrthikas and to generate roots of virtue in the child, emitted rays of golden light surpassing a thousand suns.

analyzed: yaiḥ tat gṛham samantāt avabhāsitam
translated: By which that house was completely illuminated.

analyzed: kalpa sahasra paribhāvitāḥ ca maitrī aṃśavaḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ
translated: And he emitted rays of friendliness contemplated for a thousand eons.

analyzed: yaiḥ asya spṛṣṭa mātram śarīram prahlāditam
translated: By which, as soon as his body was touched, it was refreshed.

original: sa itaś cāmutaś ca prekṣitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ itas ca amutas ca prekṣitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: He began to look here and there,

original: kasya prabhāvān mama śarīraṃ prahlāditam iti /
analyzed: kasya prabhāvāt mama śarīram prahlāditam iti
translated: By whose power is my body refreshed?

original: tato bhagavān bhikṣugaṇaparivṛtas tad gṛhaṃ praviveśa /
analyzed: tatas bhagavān bhikṣu gaṇa parivṛtaḥ tat gṛham praviveśa
translated: Then the Blessed One, surrounded by a group of monks, entered that house.

original: dadarśa kusīdo buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣulakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛta aśītyā
analyzed: dadarśa kusīdaḥ buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahā puruṣu lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtaḥ aśītyā
translated: He saw the Buddha, the Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man, his body radiant with the eighty minor marks,

analyzed: ca anuvyaṃjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham jaṅgamam
translated: adorned with a fathom-wide halo, his radiance surpassing a thousand suns, like a moving jeweled mountain,

analyzed: iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: beautiful in every way.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ paraṃ prasādam āpannaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar param prasādam āpannaḥ
translated: And having seen him, he attained supreme confidence.

original: sahasā svayam evotthāya bhagavato 'rthe āsanaṃ prajñapayati /
analyzed: sahasā svayam eva utthāya bhagavataḥ rthe āsanam prajñapayati
translated: He suddenly got up by himself and prepared a seat for the Blessed One.

analyzed: evam ca āha etu bhagavān
translated: And he said, Let the Blessed One come.

analyzed: svāgatam bhagavataḥ
translated: Welcome to the Blessed One.

analyzed: niṣīdatu bhagavān prajñapte eva āsane iti
translated: May the Blessed One sit down on the prepared seat.

original: athāsya mātāpitarāv antarjanaś cādṛṣṭapūrvaprabhāvaṃ dṛṣṭvā paramaṃ vismayam āpannāḥ //
analyzed: atha asya mātā pitarau antar janaḥ ca adṛṣṭa pūrva prabhāvam dṛṣṭvā paramam vismayam āpannāḥ
translated: Then his mother, father, and attendants, seeing the previously unseen power, were filled with supreme wonder.

original: tataḥ kusīdo dārako harṣavikasitābhyāṃ nayanābhyāṃ bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvā purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: tatas kusīdaḥ dārakaḥ harṣa vikasitābhyām nayanābhyām bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Then the young Kūṣmāṇḍa, with eyes blooming with joy, bowed at the feet of the Blessed One and sat in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: tasmai bhagavatā aneka prakāram kausīdyasya avarṇaḥ bhāṣitaḥ
translated: For him, the Blessed One spoke in many ways about the dispraise of laziness

analyzed: vīrya ārambhasya ca anuśaṃsaḥ
translated: and the benefits of undertaking effort.

analyzed: candana mayīm ca asya yaṣṭim anuprayacchati
translated: He also gave him a sandalwood staff.

analyzed: imām dāraka yaṣṭim ākoṭaya iti
translated: Son, strike this staff.

analyzed: sa tām ākoṭayitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: He began to strike it.

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, tribal chieftains, charioteers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas. He was known as the one with great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: He was a recipient of robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, remedies for sickness, and requisites, together with the community of monks.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: śrāvastyām anyatamo gṛhapatiḥ śreṣṭhī prativasati āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogo vistīrṇaviśālaparigraho vaiśravaṇadhanasamudito vaiśravaṇadhanapratispardhī
analyzed: śrāvastyām anyatamaḥ gṛhapatiḥ śreṣṭhī prativasati āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ vistīrṇa viśāla parigrahaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana samuditaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana pratispardhī
translated: In Śrāvastī, there lived a certain householder, a guildmaster, who was wealthy, had great riches, great wealth, extensive and vast possessions, equal to Vaiśravaṇa in wealth, rivaling Vaiśravaṇa in wealth.

original: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam /🔽sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam  sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: He took a wife from a family equal to his own.🔽He played with her, took pleasure with her, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ gṛhapateḥ patnī āpannasatvā saṃvṛttā /
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ gṛhapateḥ patnī āpannasatvā saṃvṛttā
translated: While the householder was playing, taking pleasure, and enjoying himself, his wife became pregnant.

analyzed: sā navānām māsānām atyayāt prasūtā
translated: After nine months had passed, she gave birth.

analyzed: dārakaḥ jātaḥ abhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ
translated: A boy was born who was handsome, good-looking, and beautiful.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā vaḍika iti nāmadheyaṃ kṛtavān pitā /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā vaḍikaḥ iti nāmadheyam kṛtavān pitā
translated: At his birth, a great celebration was held, and his father gave him the name Vaḍika.

original: vaḍiko dārako 'ṣṭābhyo dhātrībhyo dattaḥ aṃsadhātrībhyāṃ kṣīradhātrībhyāṃ maladhātrībhyāṃ krīḍanikābhyāṃ dhātrībhyām /
analyzed: vaḍikaḥ dārakaḥ ṣṭābhyaḥ dhātrībhyaḥ dattaḥ aṃsadhātrībhyām kṣīradhātrībhyām maladhātrībhyām krīḍanikābhyām dhātrībhyām
translated: The boy Vaḍi was given to eight nurses: two nurses to hold him, two wet nurses, two nurses to bathe him, and two nurses to play with him.

original: so 'ṣṭābhir dhātrībhir unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiś cottaptottaptair upakaraṇaviśeṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭābhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiḥ ca uttapta uttaptaiḥ upakaraṇa viśeṣaiḥ
translated: He was raised and nourished by those eight nurses with milk, curd, butter, ghee, butter-oil, and other special nourishing foods.

analyzed: āśu vardhate hrada stham iva paṅkajam
translated: He grew quickly, like a lotus in a pond.

original: yadā mahān saṃvṛttaḥ pañcavarṣo ṣaḍvarṣo vā /
analyzed: yadā mahān saṃvṛttaḥ pañca varṣaḥ ṣaṣ varṣaḥ vā
translated: When he became a big boy, five or six years old,

original: tadā gurau bhaktiṃ kṛtvā sarvaśāstrāṇi adhītāni /
analyzed: tadā gurau bhaktim kṛtvā sarva śāstrāṇi adhītāni
translated: he made devotion to his teacher and studied all the scriptures.

analyzed: tīkṣṇa buddhi tayā śīghram sarva śāstrasya pāram gataḥ
translated: Due to his sharp intellect, he quickly mastered all the scriptures.

original: tad anantaraṃ tasya vaḍikasya kiṃcit pūrvajanmakṛtakarmavipākena śarīre kāyikaṃ duḥkhaṃ patitam iti duḥkhī bhūtaś cintāparaḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tat anantaram tasya vaḍikasya kiṃcid pūrva janma kṛta karma vipākena śarīre kāyikam duḥkham patitam iti duḥkhī bhūtaḥ cintā paraḥ sthitaḥ
translated: After that, due to the ripening of some karma from a previous birth, Vaḍi suffered physical pain in his body. He became sorrowful and remained thoughtful.

analyzed: kim pāpam kṛtam mayā
translated: What evil have I done?

original: yad idaṃ kāyikaṃ duḥkhaṃ mama śarīre jātam /
analyzed: yat idam kāyikam duḥkham mama śarīre jātam
translated: Why has this physical pain arisen in my body?

original: tasya pitāpi putrasyedaṃ kāyikaṃ duḥkhabhāvaṃ dṛṣṭvā mahadudvignaḥ putrātyayaśaṅkhayā
analyzed: tasya pitā api putrasya idam kāyikam duḥkha bhāvam dṛṣṭvā mahat udvignaḥ putra atyaya śaṅkhayā
translated: Seeing this physical suffering of his son, the father was greatly distressed, fearing the loss of his son.

original: dīnamānasaḥ śokāśruvyāptavadanas tvaritaṃ vaidyam āhūya tasya putrasya rogaṃ darśayati / ko rogaḥ /
analyzed: dīna mānasaḥ śoka aśru vyāpta vadanaḥ tvaritam vaidyam āhūya tasya putrasya rogam darśayati kaḥ rogaḥ
translated: With a sorrowful mind, his face filled with tears of sorrow, he quickly summoned a physician and showed him the illness of his son. What is the illness?

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: The physician said:

original: kena hetunā mama putrasya dehe jāta iti /
analyzed: kena hetunā mama putrasya dehe jātaḥ iti
translated: For what reason has this illness arisen in my son's body?

original: tataḥ sa vaidyas tasya rogacihnaṃ dṛṣṭvā cikitsāṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa vaidyaḥ tasya roga cihnam dṛṣṭvā cikitsām kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then that physician, seeing the signs of his illness, began to treat him.

analyzed: tathā api tasya roga śāntiḥ na bhavati
translated: Nevertheless, his illness was not cured.

analyzed: punar vṛddhiḥ bhavati
translated: It increased again.

original: pitā putrasya rogaṃ vṛddhaṃ jātaṃ dṛṣṭvā avaśyaṃ putro mariṣyati /
analyzed: pitā putrasya rogam vṛddham jātam dṛṣṭvā avaśyam putraḥ mariṣyati
translated: Seeing the illness of his son increase, the father thought, My son will certainly die.

original: yad vaidyenāpi cāsya rogasya cikitsituṃ na śakyate /
analyzed: yat vaidyena api ca asya rogasya cikitsitum na śakyate
translated: Since even the physician is unable to treat his illness.

analyzed: iti mūrcchayā bhūmau patitaḥ
translated: He fell to the ground in a faint.

original: taṃ dṛṣṭvā bhūyo 'pi putrasya cintā jātā /
analyzed: tam dṛṣṭvā bhūyas u pi putrasya cintā jātā
translated: Seeing him, the son's anxiety arose again.

analyzed: bhūyas u pi cintayā mānasī vyathā jātā
translated: And again, mental pain arose from worry.

original: sa dārako rogī bhūto 'śakyo 'pi vadituṃ kathaṃcit pitaraṃ babhāṣe /
analyzed: sa dārakaḥ rogī bhūtaḥ śakyaḥ pi vaditum kathaṃcid pitaram babhāṣe
translated: Though the sick boy was unable to speak, he somehow spoke to his father:

analyzed: mā tāta sāhasam
translated: Father, do not be rash.

analyzed: dhairyam avalambya uttiṣṭha
translated: Take courage and rise up.

original: mamātyayāśaṅkayā mā bhūs tvam api mādṛśaḥ /
analyzed: mama atyaya āśaṅkayā mā bhūḥ tvam api mādṛśaḥ
translated: Do not become like me out of fear of my death.

original: mama nāmnā devānāṃ pūjāṃ kuru / dānaṃ dehi /
analyzed: mama nāmnā devānām pūjām kuru dānam dehi
translated: In my name, worship the gods, give charity.

analyzed: tatas mama svasthā svāstham bhaviṣyati
translated: Then I will be at ease.

original: sa gṛhapatir iti putrasya vaca ākarṇya sarvadevebhyaḥ pūjāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: sa gṛhapatiḥ iti putrasya vacaḥ ākarṇya sarva devebhyaḥ pūjām kṛtavān
translated: The householder, having heard the words of his son, made offerings to all the gods.

analyzed: sarva brāhmaṇa tīrthika parivrājakebhyaḥ dānam dattavān
translated: He gave charity to all the Brahmins, ascetics, and wandering mendicants.

analyzed: tathā api tasya roga śāntiḥ na bhavati
translated: Still, his illness was not cured.

analyzed: tadā tasya mahān mānasaḥ duḥkhaḥ bhūt
translated: Then he had great mental suffering.

analyzed: sarva deveṣu pūjā kṛtā
translated: Offerings were made to all the gods.

analyzed: dānā u pi dattaḥ pitrā mama
translated: My father also gave charity.

analyzed: tathā api svasthā na bhavati
translated: Still, I am not well.

original: tatas tathāgataguṇān anusmṛtya buddhaṃ namaskāraṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tathāgata guṇān anusmṛtya buddham namaskāram kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then, remembering the qualities of the Tathagata, he began to pay homage to the Buddha.

original: atrāntare nāsti kiṃcid buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam /
analyzed: atra antare na asti kiṃcid buddhānām bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing unknown, unseen, unknown, or unrecognized by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ lokānugrahapravṛttakānām ekārakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām mahā kāruṇikānām loka anugraha pravṛttakānām eka ārakṣāṇām
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas, the Greatly Compassionate Ones, who engage in benefiting the world, to have a single protector.

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā vihāriṇām tri damatha vastu kuśalānām catur ogha uttīrṇānām catur ṛddhipāda caraṇa tala supratiṣṭhitānām
translated: They dwell in tranquility and insight, are skilled in the three foundations of mindfulness, have crossed the four rivers, and their feet are well-planted in the four bases of supernatural power.

analyzed: caturṣu saṃgraha vastuṣu dīrgha rātra kṛta paricayānām pañca aṅga viprahīṇānām pañca gati samatikrāntānām
translated: For a long time they have been familiar with the four means of gathering disciples, have abandoned the five factors, have transcended the five destinies,

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṅga samanvāgatānām ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇānām sapta bodhyaṅga kusuma āḍhyānām aṣṭāṅga mārga deśikānām
translated: are endowed with the six factors, have perfected the six perfections, are adorned with the seven factors of enlightenment, teach the eightfold path,

analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti kuśalānām daśa bala balinām daśa diś samāpūrṇa yaśasām daśa śata vaśavarti prativiśiṣṭānām
translated: are skilled in the nine successive abodes and attainments, possess the ten powers, their fame fills the ten directions, and they surpass the ten hundred lords of the desire realm.

analyzed: tris rātreḥ tris divasasya ca
translated: Three times by night and three times by day,

original: buddhacakṣuṣā lokaṃ vyavalokya jñānadarśanaṃ pravartate /🔽ko hīyate ko vardhate kaḥ kṛcchraprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭaprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādhaprāptaḥ kaḥ
analyzed: buddha cakṣuṣā lokam vyavalokya jñāna darśanam pravartate  kaḥ hīyate kaḥ vardhate kaḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭa prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādha prāptaḥ kaḥ
translated: having surveyed the world with the eye of a Buddha, their knowledge and insight proceeds thus:🔽Who is declining? Who is growing? Who has met with misfortune? Who has met with difficulty? Who has met with trouble?

analyzed: kṛcchra saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptaḥ
translated: Who has met with misfortune, difficulty, and trouble? Who is on a low path? Who is on a sloping path? Who is on a downward path?

original: kam aham apāyād uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam /
analyzed: kam aham apāyāt uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom can I lift up from the lower realms and establish in heaven and liberation?

analyzed: kasya kāma paṅka nimagnasya hasta uddhāram anupradadyām
translated: Whose hand can I extend to pull them out of the mud of desire?

analyzed: kam ārya dhana virahitam ārya dhana aiśvarya ādhipatye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom can I establish in the sovereignty of the noble wealth that is lacking?

analyzed: kasya ajñāna timira paṭala paryavanaddha netrasya jñāna añjana śalākayā cakṣuḥ viśodhayāmi
translated: For whom can I remove the cataract of ignorance that covers the eye with the ointment of knowledge?

analyzed: kasya an avaropitāni kuśala mulāni avaropayeyam
translated: For whom can I plant the roots of virtue that have not been planted?

analyzed: kasya avaropitāni paripācayeyam
translated: For whom can I ripen those that have been planted?

analyzed: kasya paripakvāni vimocayeyam āha ca
translated: For whom can I liberate those that have ripened? He also said:

analyzed: api eva atikramet velām sāgaraḥ makara ālayaḥ
translated: Even the ocean, the abode of makaras, may overstep its boundaries,

original: na tu vaineyavatsānāṃ buddho velām atikramet // / //
analyzed: na tu vaineya vatsānām buddhaḥ velām atikramet
translated: But the Buddha does not overstep the boundaries of those to be trained who are like his children.

original: tato bhagavatā vaḍikasya gṛhapateḥ putrasya tām avasthāṃ dṛṣṭvā sūryasahasrātirekaprabhāḥ kanakavarṇā marīcayaḥ sṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā vaḍikasya gṛhapateḥ putrasya tām avasthām dṛṣṭvā sūrya sahasra atireka prabhāḥ kanaka varṇāḥ marīcayaḥ sṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Then, seeing the state of the merchant's son, the Blessed One emitted golden rays surpassing a thousand suns,

analyzed: yaiḥ tat gṛham samantāt avabhāsitam
translated: By which that house was completely illuminated.

analyzed: kalpa sahasra paribhāvitāḥ ca maitrī aṃśavaḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ
translated: And he released the rays of friendliness that had been cultivated for a thousand eons.

analyzed: yaiḥ asya spṛṣṭa mātram śarīram prahlāditam
translated: By whom, as soon as his body was touched, he was delighted.

analyzed: tatas bhagavān tasya dvāra koṣṭhakam anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One arrived at his door.

analyzed: dauvārika puruṣeṇa asya niveditam bhagavān dvāre tiṣṭhati iti
translated: The doorman reported to him, The Blessed One is standing at the door.

analyzed: atha vaḍikaḥ śreṣṭhi putraḥ labdha prasādaḥ dhi gata samāśvāsaḥ āha
translated: Then Vaḍi, the son of the merchant, having gained faith and attained consolation, said:

analyzed: praviśatu bhagavān
translated: Let the Blessed One enter.

analyzed: svāgatam bhagavate
translated: Welcome to the Blessed One.

analyzed: ākāṅkṣāmi bhagavataḥ darśanam iti
translated: I desire to see the Blessed One.

original: atha bhagavān praviśya prajñapta evāsane niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān praviśya prajñapte eva āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered and sat down on the prepared seat,

analyzed: niṣadya bhagavān vaḍikam uvāca
translated: having sat down, the Blessed One said to Vaḍi:

analyzed: kim te vaḍika bādhate iti
translated: What afflicts you, Vaḍi?

analyzed: vaḍikaḥ uvāca
translated: Vaḍi said:

analyzed: kāyikam ca me duḥkham cetasikam
translated: My physical and mental pain,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: doctor.

analyzed: ca iti bhagavatā sarva satveṣu maitrī upadiṣṭā
translated: Then the Blessed One taught him friendliness towards all beings.

analyzed: ayam te cetasikasya pratipakṣaḥ iti
translated: This is the remedy for your mental pain.

analyzed: laukikam ca cittam utpādayāmāsa
translated: And he gave rise to a worldly thought:

original: aho bata śakro devendro gandhamādanāt parvatāt kṣīrikām oṣadhīm ānayed iti /
analyzed: aho bata śakraḥ deva indraḥ gandhamādanāt parvatāt kṣīrikām oṣadhīm ānayet iti
translated: Oh, may Śakra, lord of the gods, bring the medicinal herb called 'milk-producing' from the Gandhamādana mountain.

original: sahacittotpādād bhagavataḥ śakro devendro gandhamādanāt parvatāt kṣīrikām oṣadhīm ānīya bhagavate dattavān /
analyzed: saha citta utpādāt bhagavataḥ śakraḥ deva indraḥ gandhamādanāt parvatāt kṣīrikām oṣadhīm ānīya bhagavate dattavān
translated: As soon as the Blessed One had this thought, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, brought the medicinal herb called Kṣīrikā from the Gandhamādana mountain and offered it to the Blessed One.

original: bhagavatā ca svapāṇinā gṛhītvā vaḍikāya dattā /
analyzed: bhagavatā ca sva pāṇinā gṛhītvā vaḍikāya dattā
translated: The Blessed One took it in his own hand and gave it to Bāḍa.

analyzed: iyam te kāyikasya duḥkhasya paridāha śamanī iti
translated: This will relieve the burning sensation of your physical pain.

original: sa kāyikaṃ prasrabdhisukhaṃ labdhvā bhagavato 'ntike cittaṃ prasādayāmāsa /
analyzed: sa kāyikam prasrabdhi sukham labdhvā bhagavataḥ ntike cittam prasādayāmāsa
translated: Having obtained the blissful ease of the body, he had faith in the Blessed One.

original: prasannacittaś ca rājñaḥ prasenajito nivedya bhagavantaṃ saśrāvakasaṃghaṃ bhojayitvā śatasahasreṇa vastreṇācchadya sarvapuṣpamālyair abhyarcitavān
analyzed: prasanna cittaḥ ca rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ nivedya bhagavantam sa śrāvaka saṃgham bhojayitvā śata sahasreṇa vastreṇa ācchadya sarva puṣpa mālyaiḥ abhyarcitavān
translated: With a faithful mind, he informed King Prasenajit, fed the Blessed One and the community of monks, covered them with a hundred thousand garments, and honored them with all flowers and garlands.

analyzed: tatas cetanām puṣṇāti sma
translated: Then he nourished his intention.

analyzed: praṇidhim ca cakāra
translated: And he made a vow:

original: anenāhaṃ kuśalamūlena cittotpādena deyadharmaparityāgena yathaivāhaṃ bhagavatā anuttareṇa vaidyarājena cikitsitaḥ /
analyzed: anena aham kuśala mūlena citta utpādena deya dharma parityāgena yathā eva aham bhagavatā anuttareṇa vaidya rājena cikitsitaḥ
translated: By this wholesome root, this thought, this giving of the Dharma to be given, just as I have been treated by the Blessed One, the supreme king of physicians,

original: evam aham apy anāgate 'dhvani andhe loke anāyake apariṇāyake buddho bhūyāsam atīrṇānāṃ satvānāṃ tārayita /
analyzed: evam aham api anāgate dhvani andhe loke anāyake apariṇāyake buddhaḥ bhūyāsam a tīrṇānām satvānām tārayita
translated: in the future, in a blind world, without a guide, without a leader, may I become a Buddha, to liberate those beings who are not yet liberated,

analyzed: a muktānām mocayitā  an āśvastānām āśvāsayitā
translated: He is the liberator of those not liberated.🔽He is the one who gives solace to those without solace.

analyzed: a parinirvṛtānām parinirvāpayitā iti
translated: He is the one who causes those not completely emancipated to attain complete emancipation.

original: atha bhagavān vaḍikasya dhātuparaṃparāṃ karmaparaṃparāṃ ca jñātvā smitaṃ prāvirakārṣīt /
analyzed: atha bhagavān vaḍikasya dhātu paraṃparām karma paraṃparām ca jñātvā smitam prāvirakārṣīt
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the succession of Vāḍika's elements and the succession of his karma, smiled.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: he dwells in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: tena khalu samayena śrāvastyāṃ dvau śreṣṭhinau /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena śrāvastyām dvau śreṣṭhinau
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī, there were two chief merchants.

analyzed: tau anyonyam prativiruddhau babhūvatuḥ
translated: They became hostile towards each other.

analyzed: tābhyām ekaḥ pūraṇaḥ bhiprasannaḥ
translated: Of the two, one was devoted to Pūraṇa,

analyzed: dvitīyaḥ buddhe bhagavati

original: tatas tayoḥ parasparaṃ kathāsāṃkathyaviniścaye vartamāne pūraṇopāsaka āha /
analyzed: tatas tayoḥ parasparam kathā sāṃkathya viniścaye vartamāne pūraṇa upāsakaḥ āha
translated: Then, while they were engaged in discussion and debate, the lay follower of Pūraṇa said,

analyzed: buddhāt pūraṇaḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ iti
translated: Pūraṇa is superior to the Buddha.

analyzed: buddha upāsakaḥ āha
translated: The lay follower of the Buddha said,

analyzed: bhagavān samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ viśiṣṭataraḥ iti
translated: The Blessed One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, is superior.

analyzed: tatas tābhyām sarva sva apaharaṇe bandha nikṣepaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then, they made a wager on the loss of all their possessions.

analyzed: yāvat rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ śrutam
translated: Eventually, this came to the ears of King Prasenajit.

analyzed: tena amātyānām ājñā dattā
translated: He gave an order to his ministers,

analyzed: tayoḥ mīmāṃsā kartavyā iti
translated: You should investigate this matter.

original: tatas tair amātyaiḥ sarvavijite ghaṇṭāvaghoṣaṇaṃ kāritam /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ amātyaiḥ sarva vijite ghaṇṭā avaghoṣaṇam kāritam

analyzed: saptame divase buddha tīrthika upāsakayoḥ mīmāṃsā bhaviṣyati

original: ye cādbhutāni draṣṭukāmās te āgacchantv iti /
analyzed: ye ca adbhutāni draṣṭu kāmāḥ te āgacchantu iti
translated: Those who wish to see miracles should come.

original: tataḥ saptame divase vistīrṇāvakāśe pṛthivīpradeśe 'nekeṣu prāṇiśatasahasreṣu saṃnipatiteṣu
analyzed: tatas saptame divase vistīrṇa avakāśe pṛthivī pradeśe nekeṣu prāṇi śata sahasreṣu saṃnipatiteṣu
translated: Then on the seventh day, in an area with plenty of space, many hundreds of thousands of living beings had gathered,

original: gaganatale cānekeṣu devatāsahasreṣu saṃnipatiteṣu gomayamaṇḍalake kḷpte sarvagandhamālyeṣūpahṛteṣu
analyzed: gagana tale ca anekeṣu devatā sahasreṣu saṃnipatiteṣu gomaya maṇḍalake kḷpte sarva gandha mālyeṣu upahṛteṣu
translated: and in the sky many thousands of gods had assembled, on a circle of cow dung, with all kinds of incense and garlands brought,

analyzed: pūrvataram tīrthika upāsakena satya upayācanam kṛtam
translated: first the tīrthika follower made a request for truth:

analyzed: yena satyena pūraṇa prabhṛtayaḥ ṣaṭ śāstāraḥ loke śreṣṭhāḥ
translated: By the truth that Pūraṇa and the other six teachers are the best in the world,

original: anena satyenemāni puṣpāṇi ayaṃ ca dhūpaḥ idaṃ ca pānīyaṃ tān upagacchantv iti //🔽evaṃ pravyāhatamātre Speyer /
analyzed: anena satyena imāni puṣpāṇi ayam ca dhūpaḥ idam ca pānīyam tān upagacchantu iti  evam pravyāhata mātre speyeḥ
translated: by this truth, may these flowers, this incense, and this water go to them.🔽As soon as this was spoken,

analyzed: pravyāhṛta mātre
translated: as soon as it was spoken,

analyzed: tāni puṣpāṇi bhūmau patitāni
translated: those flowers fell on the ground,

analyzed: agniḥ nirvṛtaḥ
translated: the fire went out,

original: pānīyaṃ pṛthivyām astaṃ parikṣayaṃ paryādānaṃ gatam /
analyzed: pānīyam pṛthivyām astam parikṣayam paryādānam gatam
translated: and the water disappeared into the earth.

analyzed: tatas mahā jana kāyena kilakilā prakṣveḍā uccais nādaḥ muktaḥ
translated: Then a loud cry of Kiliki! and Kiliki! was uttered by the great assembly.

original: yam abhivīkṣya tīrthyopāsakas tūṣṇībhūto maṅkubhūtaḥ Speyer /
analyzed: yam abhivīkṣya tīrthya upāsakaḥ tūṣṇībhūtaḥ maṅku bhūtaḥ speyeḥ
translated: Seeing this, the heretic lay disciple became silent, dejected,

analyzed: madgu bhūtaḥ
translated: with a drooping body,

analyzed: srasta skandhaḥ dhomukhaḥ niṣpratibhānaḥ
translated: with shoulders slumped, looking down, without eloquence,

original: pradhyānaparamaḥ kare kapolaṃ datvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ //
analyzed: pradhyāna paramaḥ kare kapolam da tvā cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: with his chin resting on his hand, he remained absorbed in thought.

original: tato bhagavacchrāvakeṇa harṣotkaṇṭhajātena prasādavikasitābhyāṃ nayanābhyām ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇajānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya
analyzed: tatas bhagavat śrāvakeṇa harṣa utkaṇṭha jātena prasāda vikasitābhyām nayanābhyām eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇa jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya
translated: Then a disciple of the Blessed One, filled with joy and longing, with eyes blooming with faith, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

analyzed: satya upayācanam kṛtam
translated: and made a true request:

analyzed: yena satyena bhagavān sarva satvānām agryaḥ
translated: By the truth that the Blessed One is foremost among all beings,

original: anena satyenemāni puṣpāṇi dhūpa udakaṃ bhagavantam upagacchantv iti /

original: evaṃ pravyāhṛtamātro tāni puṣpāṇi haṃsapaṃktir ivākāśe jetavanābhimukhaṃ saṃprasthitāni /🔽dhupo 'bhrakūṭavat /

translated: As soon as this was said, the flowers, like a row of geese in the sky, set out facing the Jeta Grove.🔽The incense was like a mass of clouds.

analyzed: udakam vaiḍūrya śalākavat
translated: The water was like a crystal staff.

original: atha sa mahājanakāyas tat prātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā kilakilāpravekṣveḍoccaiḥśabdhaṃ kurvaṃs teṣāṃ saṃprasthitānāṃ pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhaḥ
analyzed: atha sa mahā jana kāyaḥ tat prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā kilakilā pravekṣveḍā uccais śabdham kurvan teṣām saṃprasthitānām pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhaḥ

analyzed: vaidya p

translated: Then those flowers remained above the Blessed One.

analyzed: dhūpaḥ udakam ca agratas

original: tataḥ sa mahājanakāyo labdhaprasādo bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvā purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśrāvaṇāya /

analyzed: teṣām bhagavān idam sūtram bhāṣate sma

analyzed: saṃghe agra prajñaptiḥ

analyzed: buddhe agra prajñaptiḥ katamā

analyzed: ye kecid dharme
translated: Those who have faith in the Dharma,

analyzed: agre te bhiprasannāḥ
translated: they have faith in the foremost.

original: teṣām agre 'bhiprasannānām agra eva vipākaḥ pratikāṃkṣitavyo deveṣu vā devabhūtānāṃ manuṣyeṣu vā manuṣyabhūtānām /

translated: This, brahmins and householders, is called the declaration of the community as the best.

translated: By this wholesome root, this resolve, this giving up of the Dharma to be given, may I become a Buddha in a world that is blind, without a leader, without a guide, to liberate those beings who are not liberated,🔽to free those who are not freed,

analyzed: an āśvastānām āśvāsayitā
translated: to comfort those who are not at ease,

analyzed: a parinirvṛtānām parinirvāpayitā iti
translated: to fully liberate those who are not fully liberated.

translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the sequence of causes and the sequence of actions of that lay follower of another sect, smiled.

analyzed: dharmatā khalu yasmin samaye buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ smitam prāviṣkurvanti tasmin samaye nīla pīta lohita avadātāḥ arciṣaḥ mukhāt niścārya kāścid adhastāt
translated: It is a natural law that whenever Buddhas, Blessed Ones, smile, rays of blue, yellow, red, and white light issue forth from their mouths. Some go below

analyzed: kāścid upariṣṭāt gacchanti
translated: and some go above.

analyzed: yāḥ adhastāt gacchanti
translated: Those that go below

original: tāḥ saṃjīvaṃ kālasūtraṃ saṃghātaṃ rauravaṃ mahārauravaṃ tapanaṃ pratāpanam avīcim
analyzed: tāḥ saṃjīvam kālasūtram saṃghātam rauravam mahārauravam tapanam pratāpanam avīcim
translated: go to Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghata, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, and Avīci,

analyzed: arbudam nirarbudam aṭaṭam hahavam huhuvam utpalam padmam mahāpadmam narakān gatvā  ye uṣṇa narakāḥ teṣu śītībhūtāḥ nipatanti
translated: They go to the hells of Saṃjīva, Kālasūtra, Saṃghāta, Raurava, Mahāraurava, Tapana, Pratāpana, Avīci,

analyzed: ye śīta narakāḥ teṣu uṣṇībhūtāḥ nipatanti
translated: and the hot hells become cool, and the cool hells become hot.

original: tena teṣāṃ satvānāṃ kāraṇāviśeṣāḥ pratiprasrabhyante /🔽teṣām evaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: tena teṣām satvānām kāraṇā viśeṣāḥ pratiprasrabhyante  teṣām evam bhavati
translated: The beings there think,

analyzed: kim nu vayam bhavantaḥ itas cyutāḥ āhosvit anyatra upapannāḥ iti
translated: What? Have we died here and been reborn elsewhere?

analyzed: teṣām prasāda saṃjanana artham bhagavān nirmitam visarjayati
translated: In order to generate faith in them, the Blessed One sends forth a magical creation.

analyzed: teṣām nirmitam dṛṣṭvā evam bhavati
translated: Seeing the magical creation, they think,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: This is a doctor.

original: na hy eva vayaṃ bhavanta itaś cyutā nāpy anyatropapannāḥ /
analyzed: na hi eva vayam bhavantaḥ itas cyutāḥ na api anyatra upapannāḥ
translated: We have not died here nor have we been reborn elsewhere.

analyzed: api tu ayam apūrva darśanaḥ satvaḥ
translated: But this is a being never seen before.

analyzed: asya anubhāvena asmākam kāraṇā viśeṣāḥ pratiprasrabdhāḥ iti
translated: By his power, our particular causes of suffering have been alleviated.

original: te nirmite cittam abhiprasādya tan narakavedanīyaṃ karma kṣapayitvā devamanuṣyeṣu pratisandhiṃ gṛhṇanti /
analyzed: te nirmite cittam abhiprasādya tat naraka vedanīyam karma kṣapayitvā deva manuṣyeṣu pratisandhim gṛhṇanti
translated: Having generated faith in the magical creation, they exhaust that karma to be experienced in hell, and take rebirth among gods and humans.

analyzed: yatra satyānām bhājana bhūtāḥ bhavanti
translated: There they become vessels for the truths.

analyzed: yāḥ upariṣṭāt gacchanti
translated: Those that go upwards

analyzed: tāḥ cāturmahārājikān trayastriṃśān
translated: go to the Caturmaharajakas, the Trayastrimsas,

analyzed: yāmān tuṣitān nirmāṇa ratīn paranirmitavaśavartinaḥ brahmakāyikān brahmapurohitān
translated: the Yamas, the Tusitas, the Nirmanaratis, the Paranirmitavasavartins, the Brahmakayikas, the Brahmapurohitas,

original: mahābrahmaṇaḥ parīttābhān apramāṇābhān ābhāsvarān parīttaśubhān apramāṇaśubhāñ śubhakṛtsnān
analyzed: mahābrahmaṇaḥ parīttābhān apramāṇābhān ābhāsvarān parīttaśubhān apramāṇaśubhām śubhakṛtsnān
translated: the Mahabrahmans, the Parittas, the Apramanas, the Abhasvaras, the Parittasubhas, the Apramanasubhas, the Subhakṛtsnas,

original: anabhrakān puṇyaprasavān bṛhatphalān abṛhān atapān sudṛśān sudarśanān akaniṣṭhān
analyzed: anabhrakān puṇyaprasavān bṛhatphalān abṛhān atapān sudṛśān sudarśanān akaniṣṭhān
translated: the Anabhrakas, the Punyaprasavas, the Brihatphalas, the Avaras, the Atapans, the Sudarśanas, the Sudarśanas, the Akaniṣṭhas,

original: devān gatvā anityaṃ duḥkhaṃ śūnyam anātmety udghoṣayanti /
analyzed: devān gatvā anityam duḥkham śūnyam anātmā iti udghoṣayanti
translated: having gone to the gods, they proclaim: Impermanent, suffering, empty, non-self.

analyzed: gāthā dvayam ca bhāṣante
translated: And they speak two verses:

analyzed: ārabhadhvam niṣkrāmata yujyadhvam buddha śāsane
translated: Arise, go forth, apply yourselves to the Buddha's teaching,

original: dhunīta mṛtyunaḥ sainyaṃ naḍāgāram iva kuñjaraḥ // / //
analyzed: dhunīta mṛtyunaḥ sainyam naḍa āgāram iva kuñjaraḥ
translated: Dispel the army of death like an elephant a hut of reeds.

original: yo hy asmin dharmavinaye apramattaś cariṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi asmin dharma vinaye apramattaḥ cariṣyati
translated: For he who will practice heedfully in this Dharma and Vinaya,

analyzed: prahāya jāti saṃsāram duḥkhasya antam kariṣyati iti
translated: Having abandoned the cycle of birth, will make an end to suffering.

original: atha tā arciṣas trisāhasramahāsāhasraṃ lokadhātum anvāhiṇḍya bhagavantam eva pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanugacchanti /
analyzed: atha tāḥ arciṣaḥ tri sāhasra mahā sāhasram lokadhātum anvāhiṇḍya bhagavantam eva pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanugacchanti
translated: Then those flames, having circled the great trichiliocosm, return and disappear into the Blessed One's back.

original: tad yadi bhagavān atītaṃ karma vyākartukāmo bhavati /
analyzed: tat yadi bhagavān atītam karma vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If the Blessed One wishes to explain an action in the past,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pṛṣṭhatas ntardhīyante
translated: they disappear into the Blessed One's back.

analyzed: anāgatam vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain an action in the future,

analyzed: purastāt antardhīyante
translated: they disappear in front.

analyzed: naraka upapattim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain rebirth in hell,

analyzed: pāda tale ntardhīyante
translated: they disappear into the soles of his feet.

analyzed: tiryak upapattim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain rebirth as an animal,

analyzed: pārṣṇyām antardhīyante
translated: they disappear into his heels.

analyzed: preta upapattim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain rebirth as a hungry ghost,

analyzed: pādāṅguṣṭhe ntardhīyante
translated: they disappear into his big toes.

analyzed: manuṣya upapattim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain human rebirth,

analyzed: jānunoḥ antardhīyante
translated: they disappear into his knees.

analyzed: bala cakravarti rājyam vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain the status of a powerful wheel-turning king,

analyzed: vāme kara tale ntardhīyante
translated: they disappear into the left palm.

analyzed: cakravarti rājyam vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain the status of a wheel-turning king,

analyzed: dakṣiṇe kara tale ntardhīyante
translated: they disappear into the right palm.

analyzed: deva upapattim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to explain rebirth as a god,

analyzed: nābhyām antardhīyante
translated: They disappear into the navel.

analyzed: śrāvaka bodhim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to prophesy the enlightenment of a disciple,

analyzed: āsye ntardhīyante
translated: they disappear into the mouth.

analyzed: pratyeka bodhim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to prophesy the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha,

analyzed: ūrṇāyām antardhīyante
translated: they disappear into the tuft of hair between the eyebrows.

analyzed: anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim vyākartu kāmaḥ bhavati
translated: If he wishes to prophesy the supreme perfect enlightenment,

analyzed: uṣṇīṣe antardhīyante
translated: they disappear into the ushnisha.

original: atha tā arciṣo bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavata ūṣṇīṣe 'ntarhitāḥ /
analyzed: atha tāḥ arciṣaḥ bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ ūṣṇīṣe ntarhitāḥ
translated: Then those flames circumambulated the Blessed One three times and disappeared into the ushnisha on the Blessed One's head.

analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ kṛta kara puṭaḥ bhagavantam papraccha
translated: Then the venerable Ananda, with palms joined, asked the Blessed One:

analyzed: nānāvidhaḥ raṅga sahasra citraḥ
translated: A mass of light, variegated with a thousand colors,

original: vaktrāntarān niṣkasitaḥ kalāpaḥ /🔽avabhāsitā yena diśaḥ samantād
analyzed: vaktra antarāt niṣkasitaḥ kalāpaḥ  avabhāsitāḥ yena diśaḥ samantāt
translated: has issued forth from the mouth.🔽By which the directions all around are illuminated,

analyzed: divākareṇa udayatā yathā eva
translated: just like when the sun rises.

analyzed: gāthāḥ ca bhāṣate  vigata udbhavā dainya mada prahīṇā
translated: And he spoke these verses:🔽The Buddhas, who have removed the cause of the world,

analyzed: buddhāḥ jagati uttama hetu bhūtāḥ  na akāraṇam śaṅkha mṛṇāla gauram
translated: have abandoned pride and arrogance.🔽The Jinas, the conquerors of the enemies, do not display a smile

analyzed: smitam upadarśayanti jināḥ jita arayaḥ
translated: that is the color of a conch or a lotus without a reason.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy.

analyzed: tad kālam svayam adhigamya vīra buddhyā
translated: At that time, O hero, having understood by yourself with your wisdom,

analyzed: śrotṝṇām śramaṇa jinendra kāṅkṣitānām
translated: For the sake of the disciples, O Jina, who are desirous,

analyzed: dhīrābhiḥ muni vṛṣa vāgbhiḥ uttamābhiḥ
translated: With your wise and excellent words, O best of sages,

analyzed: utpannam vyapanaya saṃśayam śubhābhiḥ  lavaṇajala adrirāja dhairyāḥ
translated: Remove the doubts that have arisen with your auspicious words.🔽The fully enlightened lords, whose firmness is like the ocean and the king of mountains,

analyzed: saṃbuddhāḥ smitam upadarśayanti nāthāḥ
translated: Do not display a smile without a reason.

analyzed: yasya arthe smitam upadarśayanti dhīrāḥ
translated: For the sake of which the wise display a smile,

original: taṃ śrotuṃ samabhilaṣanti te janaughāḥ // / // iti
analyzed: tam śrotum samabhilaṣanti te jana oghāḥ iti
translated: Those multitudes of people desire to hear that.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: evam etat ānanda evam etat
translated: So it is, Ananda, so it is.

original: nāhetvapratyayam ānanda tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitaṃ prāviṣkurvanti /
analyzed: na a hetu a pratyayam ānanda tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitam prāviṣkurvanti
translated: Ananda, the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones do not display a smile without a cause or condition.

original: paśyasy ānanda anena tīrthikopāsakena mamaivaṃvidhaṃ satkāraṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: paśyasi ānanda anena tīrthika upāsakena mama evaṃvidham satkāram kṛtam
translated: Ananda, do you see how this heretic devotee has shown me such respect?

analyzed: evam bhadanta
translated: Yes, Bhadanta.

original: eṣa ānanda tīrthopāsako 'nena kuśalamūlena cittotpādena deyadharmaparityāgena ca
analyzed: eṣaḥ ānanda tīrtha upāsakaḥ nena kuśala mūlena citta utpādena deya dharma parityāgena ca
translated: Ananda, this heretic devotee, by this wholesome root, this thought, and this relinquishment of the gift,

original: trikalpāsaṃkhyeyasamudānītāṃ bodhiṃ samudānīya mahākaruṇāparibhāvitāḥ ṣaṭ pāramitāḥ
analyzed: tri kalpa asaṃkhyeya samudānītām bodhim samudānīya mahā karuṇā paribhāvitāḥ ṣaḍ pāramitāḥ
translated: having attained enlightenment that has been accomplished over three incalculable eons, having been suffused with great compassion, and having fulfilled the six perfections,

analyzed: paripūrya acalaḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: Having fulfilled it, he will become a perfectly awakened buddha named Acala.

original: daśabhir balaiś caturbhir vaiśāradyais tribhir āveṇikaiḥ smṛtyupasthānair mahākaruṇayā ca /
analyzed: daśabhiḥ balaiḥ caturbhiḥ vaiśāradyaiḥ tribhiḥ āveṇikaiḥ smṛti upasthānaiḥ mahā karuṇayā ca
translated: With the ten powers, the four confidences, the three special establishments of mindfulness, and great compassion.

original: ayam asya deyadharmo yo mamāntike cittaprasāda iti //
analyzed: ayam asya deya dharmaḥ yaḥ mama antike citta prasādaḥ iti
translated: This is his gift of Dharma, the faith in me.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks were satisfied and delighted in what the Blessed One had said.

analyzed: rājā
translated: The King. Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and offered the requisites of robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for the sick. He was the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he and his community of monks received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for the sick.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: tena khalu samayena rājā prasenajit kauśalo rājā ca ajātaśatruḥ ubhāv apy etau parasparaṃ viruddhau babhūvatauḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ rājā ca ajātaśatruḥ ubhau api etau parasparam viruddhau babhūvatauḥ
translated: At that time, King Prasenajit of Kosala and King Ajatashatru were both hostile towards each other.

original: athā rājā ajātaśatruś caturaṅgabalakāyaṃ saṃnahya hastikāyam aśvakāyaṃ rathakāyaṃ pattikāyaṃ rājānaṃ prasenajitaṃ kauśalam abhiniryāto yuddhāya
analyzed: athā rājā ajātaśatruḥ caturaṅga balakāyam saṃnahya hasti kāyam aśva kāyam ratha kāyam patti kāyam rājānam prasenajitam kauśalam abhiniryātaḥ yuddhāya
translated: Then King Ajatashatru, having equipped an army with four divisions - an elephant division, a horse division, a chariot division, and an infantry division - set out from Rajagriha to fight King Prasenajit of Kosala.

analyzed: aśrauṣīt rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala heard:

original: rājā ajātaśatruś caturaṅgabalakāyaṃ saṃnahya hastikāyam aśvakāyaṃ rathakāyaṃ pattikāyaṃ ca abhiniryāto yuddhāyeti /
analyzed: rājā ajātaśatruḥ caturaṅga balakāyam saṃnahya hasti kāyam aśva kāyam ratha kāyam patti kāyam ca abhiniryātaḥ yuddhāya iti
translated: King Ajatashatru, having equipped an army with four divisions - an elephant division, a horse division, a chariot division, and an infantry division - has set out from Rajagriha to fight.

original: śrutvā ca caturaṅgabalakāyaṃ saṃnahya hastikāyam aśvakāyaṃ rathakāyaṃ pattikāyaṃ rājānam ajātaśatruṃ pratyabhiniryāto yuddhāya /
analyzed: śrutvā ca caturaṅga balakāyam saṃnahya hasti kāyam aśva kāyam ratha kāyam patti kāyam rājānam ajātaśatrum pratyabhiniryātaḥ yuddhāya
translated: Having heard this, he also equipped an army with four divisions - an elephant division, a horse division, a chariot division, and an infantry division - and set out from Sravasti to fight King Ajatashatru.

original: atha rājñā ajātaśatruṇā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kauśalasya sarvo hastikāyaḥ paryastaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājñā ajātaśatruṇā rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kauśalasya sarvaḥ hasti kāyaḥ paryastaḥ
translated: Then King Ajatashatru defeated all of King Prasenajit of Kosala's elephant division,

analyzed: aśva kāyaḥ ratha kāyaḥ patti kāyaḥ paryastaḥ
translated: his horse division, chariot division, and infantry division.

original: rājā prasenajit kauśalo jito bhīto bhagnaḥ parājitaḥ parāpṛṣṭhīkṛta ekarathena śrāvastīṃ praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ jitaḥ bhītaḥ bhagnaḥ parājitaḥ parāpṛṣṭhīkṛtaḥ eka rathena śrāvastīm praviṣṭaḥ
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala was defeated, frightened, broken, vanquished, driven to the rear, and entered Śrāvastī on a single chariot.

analyzed: evam yāvat tris api
translated: Thus, up to three times.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy.

original: atha rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ śokāgaraṃ praviśya kare kapolaṃ datvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ śoka āgaram praviśya kare kapolam da tvā cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala, having entered his grief chamber, placed his cheek in his hand and remained there, absorbed in thought.

original: tatra ca śrāvastyām anyatamaḥ śreṣṭhī āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogo vistīrṇaviśālaparigraho vaiśravaṇadhanasamudito vaiśravaṇadhanapratispardhī
analyzed: tatra ca śrāvastyām anyatamaḥ śreṣṭhī āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ vistīrṇa viśāla parigrahaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana samuditaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana pratispardhī
translated: And in Śrāvastī, there was a certain guildmaster who was wealthy, had great riches and property, had extensive and vast possessions, was equal to Vaiśravaṇa in wealth, and rivaled Vaiśravaṇa in wealth.

original: tena śrutaṃ yathā rājā prasenajit kauśalo jito bhagnaḥ parāpṛṣṭhīkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tena śrutam yathā rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ jitaḥ bhagnaḥ parāpṛṣṭhīkṛtaḥ
translated: He heard how King Prasenajit of Kosala was defeated, broken, driven to the rear,

analyzed: eka rathena iha praviṣṭaḥ iti
translated: and entered here on a single chariot.

original: śrutvā ca punar yena rājā prasenajit kauśalas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar yena rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: And having heard, he approached King Prasenajit of Kosala.

original: upasaṃkramya rājānaṃ prasenajitaṃ kauśalaṃ jayenāyuṣā ca vardhayitvā ca Speyer / uvāca
analyzed: upasaṃkramya rājānam prasenajitam kauśalam jayena āyuṣā ca vardhayitvā ca speyeḥ uvāca
translated: Having approached, he congratulated King Prasenajit of Kosala on his victory and long life, and said:

analyzed: kimartham deva śokaḥ kriyate
translated: For what purpose, Your Majesty, is grief made?

analyzed: aham devasya tāvat suvarṇam anuprayacchāmi
translated: I, Your Majesty, will give you gold.

original: yena devaḥ punar api yatheṣṭapracāraṇaṃ kariṣyatīti /
analyzed: yena devaḥ punar api yathā iṣṭa pracāraṇam kariṣyati iti
translated: so that the king can again move about as he wishes.

analyzed: tena tasya mahān suvarṇa rāśiḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: He made a large heap of gold for him,

original: yatropaviṣṭaḥ puruṣa utthitaṃ puruṣaṃ na paśyati /
analyzed: yatra upaviṣṭaḥ puruṣaḥ utthitam puruṣam na paśyati
translated: where a seated person could not see a standing person,

analyzed: utthitaḥ vai upaviṣṭam
translated: or a standing person a seated one.

original: atha rājñā prasenajitkauśalyena svaviṣaye carapuruṣāḥ samantata utsṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: atha rājñā prasenajit kauśalyena sva viṣaye cara puruṣāḥ samantataḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kosala sent out spies throughout his realm,

analyzed: śṛṇuta jana pravādān iti
translated: saying, Listen for people's rumors.

original: yāvaj jetavane dvau mallāv anyonyaṃ saṃjalpaṃ kurutaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat jetavane dvau mallau anyonyam saṃjalpam kurutaḥ
translated: As far as in the Jeta Grove, two wrestlers were conversing with each other,

analyzed: asti kesarī nāma saṃgrāmaḥ
translated: saying, There is a battle called Kesari.

original: tatra ye kātarāḥ puruṣās te saṃgrāmaśirasi sthāpyante /
analyzed: tatra ye kātarāḥ puruṣāḥ te saṃgrāma śirasi sthāpyante
translated: In that, the cowardly men are placed at the head of the battle.

analyzed: ye madhyāḥ te madhye
translated: The middling ones are in the middle.

original: ye utkṛṣṭāḥ śūrapuruṣās te pṛṣṭhata iti /
analyzed: ye utkṛṣṭāḥ śūra puruṣāḥ te pṛṣṭhatas iti
translated: The best, the brave men, are in the rear.

analyzed: tatas te rājñe iti veditavantaḥ
translated: Then they informed the king.

original: śrutvā ca rājā prasenajit kauśalas tathā caturaṅgabalakāyaṃ saṃnāhya hastikāyam aśvakāyaṃ rathakāyaṃ pattikāyaṃ ca rājānam ajātaśatrum abhiniryāto
analyzed: śrutvā ca rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ tathā caturaṅga balakāyam saṃnāhya hasti kāyam aśva kāyam ratha kāyam patti kāyam ca rājānam ajātaśatrum abhiniryātaḥ
translated: Having heard that, King Prasenajit of Kosala, having equipped his four-division army, the elephant division, the cavalry, the chariot division, and the infantry, set out against King Ajatashatru

analyzed: yuddhāya
translated: for battle.

original: tato rājñā prasenajitā kauśalena rājño 'jātaśatror vaidehīputrasya sarvo hastikāyaḥ paryastaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājñā prasenajitā kauśalena rājñaḥ jātaśatroḥ vaidehī putrasya sarvaḥ hasti kāyaḥ paryastaḥ
translated: He defeated his entire elephant force,

analyzed: aśva kāyaḥ ratha kāyaḥ patti kāyaḥ paryastaḥ
translated: his horse force, chariot force, and infantry force.

original: rājānam apy ajātaśatruṃ vaidehīputraṃ jitaṃ bhītabhagnaparājitaṃ parāpṛṣṭhīkṛtaṃ jīvagrāhaṃ gṛhītvā ekarathe 'bhiropya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ
analyzed: rājānam api ajātaśatrum vaidehī putram jitam bhīta bhagna parājitam parāpṛṣṭhīkṛtam jīva grāham gṛhītvā eka rathe yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: He also defeated King Ajātaśatru of Magadha, the son of Vaidehī, and terrified, broken, defeated, and turned back, he captured him alive and put him on a single chariot, and approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣīdati /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣīdati
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇo rājā prasenajitkauśalo bhagavantam ity avocat /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇaḥ rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ bhagavantam iti avocat
translated: While sitting to one side, King Prasenajit of Kośala said this to the Blessed One:

original: ayaṃ hi bhadanta rājā ajātaśatrur dīrgharātram avairasya me vairī /

analyzed: yasmāt vayasya putraḥ yam bhavati

analyzed: atha rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kauśalasya etat abhavat

analyzed: yat mayā rājyam pratilabdham

analyzed: tat asya śreṣṭhinaḥ prasādāt

original: yanv aham enaṃ vareṇa pravārayeyam iti /

analyzed: sa kathayati

analyzed: sapta aham me yathā abhirucitam rājyam anuprayacchata iti

analyzed: tatas rājñā sarva vijite ghaṇṭā avaghoṣaṇam kāritam

analyzed: rājā ca prasenajit sa parivāraḥ
translated: and King Prasenajit with his retinue,

analyzed: yāvantaḥ ca kāśi kośaleṣu jana kāyāḥ prativasanti
translated: and all the people living in Kashi and Kosala,

analyzed: teṣām dūta saṃpreṣaṇam kṛtam

analyzed: saptāham yūyam sakalāḥ yatheṣṭa cāriṇaḥ sukha sparśam viharata
