analyzed: nāvā stambham ca snātram ca tathā ītiḥ pratisārakam pratihāryakam
translated: Boat, pillar, and bathing, and thus inquiry, and reversal, and counteraction,

analyzed: pāñca vārṣikam stutiḥ vara daḥ kāśikam divya bhojanam
translated: Five-yearly, praise, giver of boons, Kāśikā, divine food.

analyzed: nāvikāḥ
translated: Boatmen. Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, tribal chieftains, Brahmins, householders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, and was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and was a recipient of robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick, together with the community of monks.

original: śrāvastyāṃ viharati nadyā ajiravatyā adhastān nāvikagrāme /🔽atha te nāvikā yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati nadyāḥ ajiravatyāḥ adhastāt nāvika grāme  atha te nāvikāḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: He was dwelling at Śrāvastī, below the village of boatmen on the river Ajiravatī.🔽Then those boatmen approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte nyaṣīdan /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte nyaṣīdan
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇāṃs tān nāvikān bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇān tān nāvikān bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati
translated: The Blessed One instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted the boatmen with a discourse on the Dharma while they were sitting in one place.

original: anekaparyāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: aneka paryāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm
translated: Having instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted them with a discourse on the Dharma in many ways, he remained silent.

original: atha te nāvikā utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantam ūcuḥ /
analyzed: atha te nāvikāḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam ūcuḥ
translated: Then those boatmen rose from their seats, arranged their upper robes over one shoulder, made the gesture of supplication to the Blessed One, and said to the Blessed One:

original: adhivāsayatu bhagavān asmākaṃ nadyā ajiravatyās tīre śvo bhaktena sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghena /
analyzed: adhivāsayatu bhagavān asmākam nadyāḥ ajiravatyāḥ tīre śvas bhaktena sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena
translated: May the Blessed One consent to a meal tomorrow with the community of monks on the bank of the Ajiravati River,

analyzed: nau saṃkrameṇa uttārayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: we will ferry across with a boat.

analyzed: adhivāsayati bhagavān nāvikānām tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One consented to the boatmen by remaining silent.

original: atha nāvikā nadyā ajiravatyās tīram apagatapāṣāṇaśarkarakaṭhallaṃ vyavasthāpayāmāsur ucchritacchatradhvajapatākaṃ nānāpuṣpāvakīrṇaṃ gandhaghaṭikāvadhūpitam
analyzed: atha nāvikāḥ nadyāḥ ajiravatyāḥ tīram apagata pāṣāṇa śarkara kaṭhallam vyavasthāpayāmāsuḥ ucchrita chatra dhvaja patākam nānā puṣpa avakīrṇam gandha ghaṭikā avadhūpitam
translated: Then the boatmen cleared the bank of the Ajiravati River of stones, pebbles, and gravel, set up parasols, banners, and flags, scattered various flowers, and fumigated with incense.

analyzed: praṇītam āhāram kṛtavantaḥ
translated: They prepared excellent food.

original: prabhūtaṃ ca puṣpasaṃgrahaṃ kṛtvā nausaṃkramaṃ puṣpamaṇḍapair alaṃkārayāmāsuḥ /
analyzed: prabhūtam ca puṣpa saṃgraham kṛtvā nau saṃkramam puṣpa maṇḍapaiḥ alaṃkārayāmāsuḥ
translated: Having gathered a great amount of flowers, they decorated the boat crossing with flower canopies.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ca dūtena kālam ārocayāmāsuḥ
translated: And they announced the time to the Blessed One through a messenger:

analyzed: samayaḥ bhadanta sajjam bhaktam
translated: The time is right, Bhadanta, the food is ready.

analyzed: yasya idānīm bhagavān kālam manyate iti
translated: Now it is time for the Blessed One to do as he sees fit.

original: atha bhagavān bhikṣugaṇaparivṛto bhikṣusaṃghapuraskṛto yena nāvikagrāmakas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān bhikṣu gaṇa parivṛtaḥ bhikṣu saṃgha puraskṛtaḥ yena nāvika grāmakaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, surrounded by a group of monks, with the community of monks in front, went to the boatman's village.

original: upasaṃkramya purastād bhikṣusaṃghasya prajñapta evāsane nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya purastāt bhikṣu saṃghasya prajñapte eva āsane nyaṣīdat
translated: Having arrived, he sat down on the seat prepared in front of the community of monks.

original: atha te nāvikāḥ sukhopaniṣaṇṇaṃ buddhapramukhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ viditvā śucinā praṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena svahastaṃ saṃtarpayati saṃpravārayati
analyzed: atha te nāvikāḥ sukha upaniṣaṇṇam buddha pramukham bhikṣu saṃgham viditvā śucinā praṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sva hastam saṃtarpayati saṃpravārayati
translated: Then the boatmen, knowing that the community of monks headed by the Buddha was seated in comfort, satisfied and contented them with excellent, fresh food, with their own hands.

original: anekaparyāyeṇa śucinā praṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena svahastaṃ saṃtarpya saṃpravārya
analyzed: aneka paryāyeṇa śucinā praṇītena khādanīyena bhojanīyena sva hastam saṃtarpya saṃpravārya
translated: Having satisfied and contented them in many ways with excellent, fresh food, with their own hands,🔽knowing that the Blessed One had finished his meal and washed his hands and bowl, they took lower seats

original: bhagavantaṃ bhuktavantaṃ viditvā dhautahastam apanītapātraṃ nīcatarāṇy āsanāni gṛhītvā
analyzed: bhagavantam bhuktavantam viditvā dhauta hastam apanīta pātram nīcatarāṇi āsanāni gṛhītvā
translated: and sat down in front of the Blessed One to hear the Dharma.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ purastāt niṣaṇṇāḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: sat down in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha bhagavāṃs teṣāṃ nāvikānām āśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśīṃ caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: atha bhagavān teṣām nāvikānām āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśīm catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikīm dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the inclinations, propensities, temperaments, and natures of those boatmen, gave them a discourse on the Dharma that penetrated the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā anekair nāvikaiḥ srotaāpattiphalāni prāptāni /
analyzed: yām śrutvā anekaiḥ nāvikaiḥ srotaāpatti phalāni prāptāni
translated: Having heard it, many of the boatmen attained the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: kaiścid sakṛdāgāmi phalāni kaiścid anāgāmi phalāni
translated: Some attained the fruit of once-returning, some the fruit of non-returning.

analyzed: kaiścid pravrajya sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Some, having gone forth, realized arhatship through the complete destruction of the defilements.

analyzed: kaiścid śrāvaka bodhau cittāni utpāditāni  kaiścid pratyeka bodhau
translated: Some generated the intention for the enlightenment of a disciple.🔽Some for the enlightenment of a solitary buddha.

analyzed: kaiścid anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Some for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sarvā ca sā parṣad buddhanimnā dharmapravaṇā saṃghaprāgbhārā vyavasthitā /
analyzed: sarvā ca sā parṣad buddha nimnā dharma pravaṇā saṃgha prāgbhārā vyavasthitā
translated: And the entire assembly was established with the Buddha at the head, with the Dharma as the standard, and with the Saṅgha in the lead.

original: tatas tair nāvikair bhagavān mahatā satkāreṇa nausaṃkrameṇottāritaḥ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghena //🔽Vaidya / p /
analyzed: tatas taiḥ nāvikaiḥ bhagavān mahatā satkāreṇa nau saṃkrameṇa uttāritaḥ sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena 🔽vaidya p
translated: Then those boatmen, with great honor, ferried the Blessed One across the river on a boat, together with the community of monks.

original: bhikṣavo buddhapūjādarśanād āvarjitamanaso buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ buddha pūjā darśanāt āvarjita manasaḥ buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, their minds captivated by seeing the worship of the Buddha, asked the Blessed Buddha:

analyzed: kutra imāni bhagavataḥ kuśala mūlāni kṛtāni iti
translated: Blessed One, where were these roots of virtue created by the Blessed One?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatenaiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni /
analyzed: tathāgatena eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: Monks, the Tathāgata himself created and accumulated these actions in other births in the past, when he was in the process of completing the perfections. When the conditions were fulfilled and the time had come, they approached like a flood, inevitably to be experienced.

analyzed: yena tathāgatasya evaṃvidhā pūjā
translated: By which the Tathāgata has such worship.

analyzed: icchatha bhikṣavaḥ śrotum
translated: Do you wish to hear, monks, about the creation and accumulation of these actions?

analyzed: evam bhadanta  tena hi bhikṣavaḥ śṛṇuta
translated: Yes, Bhadanta.

original: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta / bhāṣiṣye //🔽bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani bhāgīratho nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi tathāgato
analyzed: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye  bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani bhāgīrathaḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi tathāgataḥ
translated: Then listen, monks, and pay careful attention, I will speak.

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: Monks, in the past, long ago, there appeared in the world a perfectly awakened Buddha named Bhāgīratha, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

analyzed: śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He, having realized with his own direct knowledge this world—with its gods, Māras, and Brahmās, this population with its ascetics and brahmins, gods and humans—made it known to others.

original: sa dvāṣaṣṭyarhatsahasraparivṛto janapadacārikāṃ caran gaṅgātīram anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa dvāṣaṣṭi arhat sahasra parivṛtaḥ janapada cārikām caran gaṅgā tīram anuprāptaḥ
translated: Surrounded by an entourage of sixty-two thousand arhats, he was wandering through the countryside and arrived on the banks of the Ganges.

original: tasmin samaye 'nyataraḥ sārthavāho 'nekaśataparivāro nadyāṃ gaṅgāyāṃ sārtham uttārayati /
analyzed: tasmin samaye nyataraḥ sārthavāhaḥ neka śata parivāraḥ nadyām gaṅgāyām sārtham uttārayati
translated: At that time, a certain caravan leader was crossing the river Ganges with a retinue of many hundreds.

analyzed: tasmin ca pradeśe mahat taskara bhayam
translated: And in that region there was a great fear of robbers.

original: atha dadarśa sārthavāho bhāgīrathaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ dvāṣaṣṭyarhatsahasraparivṛtam /
analyzed: atha dadarśa sārthavāhaḥ bhāgīratham samyaksaṃbuddham dvāṣaṣṭi arhat sahasra parivṛtam
translated: Then the caravan leader saw the Perfectly Awakened One Bhagiratha surrounded by an entourage of sixty-two thousand arhats.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar cittam prasādayāmāsa
translated: And having seen him, he had faith in his mind.

analyzed: prasanna cittaḥ ca bhagavantam āmantritavān
translated: And with a faithful mind he invited the Blessed One.

analyzed: tat prathamataram eva bhagavantam tārayiṣyāmi iti
translated: I will be the first to cross you, Blessed One.

analyzed: adhivāsayati bhāgīrathaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sārthavāhasya tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Bhagiratha accepted the invitation of the caravan leader by remaining silent.

original: tatas tena sārthavāhena bhāgīrathaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dvāṣaṣṭyarhatsahasraparivṛto mahatyā vibhūtyā nausaṃkrameṇottāritaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tena sārthavāhena bhāgīrathaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dvāṣaṣṭi arhat sahasra parivṛtaḥ mahatyā vibhūtyā nau saṃkrameṇa uttāritaḥ
translated: Then the caravan leader had the Perfectly Awakened One Bhagiratha, surrounded by an entourage of sixty-two thousand arhats, crossed by a boat bridge with great splendor.

original: praṇītena cāhāreṇa saṃtarpyānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānaṃ kṛtam //
analyzed: praṇītena ca āhāreṇa saṃtarpya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: And having satisfied him with excellent food, he made a vow for supreme perfect enlightenment.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena sārthavāho babhūva / ahaṃ saḥ /🔽mayā sa bhāgīrathaḥ /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena sārthavāhaḥ babhūva aham saḥ  mayā sa bhāgīrathaḥ
translated: What do you think, monks, the one who was the caravan leader at that time, on that occasion, was none other than I.

analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dvāṣaṣṭi arhat sahasra parivṛtaḥ nau saṃkrameṇa uttāritaḥ
translated: By me, the Blessed One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, surrounded by sixty-two thousand Arhats, was ferried across by a boat bridge.

analyzed: praṇītena āhāreṇa saṃtarpitaḥ
translated: He was satisfied with excellent food.

analyzed: praṇidhānam ca kṛtam
translated: And a vow was made.

original: tasya me karmaṇo vipākenānantasaṃsāre mahatsukham anubhūtam /
analyzed: tasya me karmaṇaḥ vipākena ananta saṃsāre mahat sukham anubhūtam
translated: By the ripening of that karma, I experienced great happiness in the endless cycle of existence.

original: idānīm apy anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasyaivavidhā pūjā /
analyzed: idānīm api anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya evavidhā pūjā
translated: Even now, having fully awakened to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, such worship is performed.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train thus:

original: yac chāstāraṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat śāstāram satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: 'We will honor, respect, revere, and worship the Teacher.

original: śāstāraṃ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvopaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śāstāram satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having honored, respected, revered, and worshipped the Teacher, we will rely on him and abide.'

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Monks, you should train in this way.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: Delighted, those monks rejoiced in what the Blessed One had said.

analyzed: stambhaḥ
translated: The Pillar. Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: merchants, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, and was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick, along with his community of disciples.

original: kauravyeṣu janapadacārikāṃ caran kauravyaṃ nagaram anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: kauravyeṣu janapada cārikām caran kauravyam nagaram anuprāptaḥ
translated: He was wandering through the country of the Kurus and arrived at the city of Kauravya.

original: sa ca kauravyo janakāyo buddhavaineya udāracitaḥ pradānaruciś ca /
analyzed: sa ca kauravyaḥ jana kāyaḥ buddha vaineyaḥ udāra citaḥ pradāna ruciḥ ca
translated: And that multitude of people in Kauravya was to be guided by the Buddha, had lofty thoughts, and delighted in giving.

analyzed: tatas bhagavataḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the Blessed One:

original: yanv ahaṃ śakraṃ devendraṃ marudgaṇaparivṛtam āhveyeyam /
analyzed: yanu aham śakram deva indram marut gaṇa parivṛtam āhveyā iyam
translated: If I were to summon Śakra, lord of the gods, surrounded by a retinue of Maruts,

analyzed: yad darśanāt eṣām kuśala mūla vivṛddhiḥ
translated: by seeing him there would be an increase in their roots of virtue.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy. p.

original: syād iti / tato bhagavāṃl laukikaṃ cittam utpādayati /
analyzed: syāt iti tatas bhagavān laukikam cittam utpādayati
translated: It might be so. Then the Blessed One gave rise to a worldly thought:

original: aho bata śakro devendro marudgaṇasahāyo gośīrṣacandanamayaṃ stambham ādāya gacched iti //
analyzed: aho bata śakraḥ deva indraḥ marut gaṇa sahāyaḥ gośīrṣa candana mayam stambham ādāya gacchet iti
translated: Oh, may Shakra, Lord of the Gods, together with the Marut troop, come taking a pillar made of go-shirsh-chanda-na.

original: sahacittotpādāc chakro devendro marudgaṇaparivṛto āgato yatra viśvakarmā catvāraś ca mahārājā anekadevanāgayakṣakumbhāṇḍaparivṛto gośīrṣacandanastambham
analyzed: saha citta utpādāt śakraḥ deva indraḥ marut gaṇa parivṛtaḥ āgataḥ yatra viśvakarmā catvāraḥ ca mahā rājāḥ aneka deva nāga yakṣa kumbhāṇḍa parivṛtaḥ gośīrṣa candana stambham
translated: As soon as this thought arose, Shakra, Lord of the Gods, surrounded by the Marut troop, came to where Vishvakarma and the Four Great Kings, surrounded by many gods, nagas, yakshas, and kumbhandas, were taking a pillar made of go-shirsh-chanda-na.

analyzed: ādāya
translated: They took it.

original: hāhākārakilakilāprakṣveḍoccair nādaṃ kurvāṇā bhagavato 'rthe gośīrṣacandanamayaṃ prāsādam abhisaṃskṛtavantaḥ /
analyzed: hāhākāra kilakilā prakṣveḍā uccais nādam kurvāṇāḥ bhagavataḥ rthe gośīrṣa candana mayam prāsādam abhisaṃskṛtavantaḥ
translated: With cries of Haa Haa and Kili Kili, they made a loud noise and, for the sake of the Blessed One, they constructed a palace made of go-shirsh-chanda-na.

original: tatas tasmin prāsāde śakreṇa devendreṇa bhagavān saśrāvakasaṃgho divyenāhāreṇa divyena śayanāsanena divyair gandhamālyapuṣpaiḥ satkṛto gurukṛto
analyzed: tatas tasmin prāsāde śakreṇa deva indreṇa bhagavān sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ divyena āhāreṇa divyena śayanāsanena divyaiḥ gandha mālya puṣpaiḥ satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ
translated: Then, in that palace, Shakra, Lord of the Gods, honored the Blessed One, together with the assembly of disciples, with divine food, divine bedding and seats, and divine incense, garlands, and flowers. He revered them, respected them,

analyzed: mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ
translated: and made offerings to them.

original: atha kauravyo janakāyas tāṃ divyāṃ vibhūṣikāṃ dṛṣṭvā paraṃ vismayam āpanna imāṃ cintām āpede /
analyzed: atha kauravyaḥ jana kāyaḥ tām divyām vibhūṣikām dṛṣṭvā param vismayam āpannaḥ imām cintām āpede
translated: Then, the people of Kauravya, seeing that divine decoration, were filled with the utmost wonder and had this thought:

analyzed: nūnam buddhaḥ bhagavān loke gryaḥ
translated: Surely the Blessed Buddha is the foremost in the world.

original: yat tu nāma sendrair devaiḥ pūjyata iti āvarjitamanā bhagavantam upasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: yat tu nāma sa indraiḥ devaiḥ pūjyate iti āvarjita manāḥ bhagavantam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: But when he heard that the Blessed One was being worshipped by the gods with Indra, he went to the Blessed One with a devoted mind.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: Having bowed at the feet of the Blessed One, he sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇaḥ kauravyo janakāyas tasmin prāsāde 'tyarthaṃ prasādam utpādayati //
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇaḥ kauravyaḥ jana kāyaḥ tasmin prāsāde tyartham prasādam utpādayati
translated: While sitting to one side, the Kaurava people produced an extremely delightful state in that palace.

original: tena bhagavāṃs tat prāsādam antardhāpya anityatāpratisaṃyuktāṃ tādṛśīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: tena bhagavān tat prāsādam antardhāpya anityatā pratisaṃyuktām tādṛśīm dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, having made that palace disappear, gave a Dharma talk on the nature of impermanence.

original: yāṃ śrutvā anekaiḥ kauravyanivāsibhir manuṣyaiḥ srotaāpattiphalāny anuprāptāni /
analyzed: yām śrutvā anekaiḥ kauravya nivāsibhiḥ manuṣyaiḥ srotaāpatti phalāni anuprāptāni
translated: Having heard it, many people living in Kaurava attained the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: kaiścid sakṛdāgāmi phalāni kaiścid anāgāmi phalāni
translated: Some attained the fruit of once-returning, some the fruit of non-returning.

original: kaiścit pravrajya sarvakleśaprahāṇād arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /🔽kaiścic chrāvakabodhau cittāny utpāditāni /
analyzed: kaiścid pravrajya sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam  kaiścid śrāvaka bodhau cittāni utpāditāni
translated: Some, having gone forth, realized arhatship through the complete destruction of the defilements.🔽Some generated the mind of enlightenment in the Śrāvaka vehicle.

analyzed: kaiścid pratyekāyām bodhau
translated: Some in the pratyekabuddha vehicle.

analyzed: kaiścid anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Some in the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: sarvā ca sā parṣad buddhanimnā dharmapravaṇā saṃghaprāgbhārā vyavasthitā /
analyzed: sarvā ca sā parṣad buddha nimnā dharma pravaṇā saṃgha prāgbhārā vyavasthitā
translated: And that entire assembly was established with the Buddha as its leader, with the Dharma as its inclination, and with the Saṅgha as its vanguard.

original: tatas te bhikṣavo bhagavato divyapūjādarśanād āvarjitamanaso buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: tatas te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ divya pūjā darśanāt āvarjita manasaḥ buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Then those monks, their minds captivated by seeing the divine worship of the Blessed One, asked the Buddha, the Blessed One:

analyzed: kutra imāni bhagavatā kuśala mūlāni kṛtāni iti
translated: Blessed One, where were these roots of virtue created?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatenaiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni /
analyzed: tathāgatena eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: Monks, the Tathāgata himself created and accumulated these actions in other births in the past, when he was in the same situation as you. The conditions have been fulfilled and the time has come. They are as inevitable as the rising of the tide.

analyzed: yena tathāgatasya evaṃvidhā pūjā
translated: By which the Tathāgata has such worship.

analyzed: icchatha bhikṣavaḥ śrotum
translated: Monks, do you wish to hear about it?

analyzed: evam bhadanta
translated: Yes, Bhadanta.

analyzed: tena hi bhikṣavaḥ śṛṇuta
translated: Then, monks, listen.

original: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta / bhāṣiṣye //
analyzed: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye
translated: Listen well and pay attention. I will speak.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani brahmā nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi tathāgato
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani brahmā nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi tathāgataḥ
translated: Monks, in the past, long ago, there appeared in the world a perfectly awakened Buddha named Brahma. He was a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One,

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

analyzed: śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He was the teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: atha brahmā samyaksaṃbuddho dvāṣaṣṭyarhatsahasraparivṛto janapadacārikāṃ carann anyatamāṃ rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: atha brahmā samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dvāṣaṣṭi arhat sahasra parivṛtaḥ janapada cārikām caran anyatamām rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then the Perfectly Awakened One Brahma, surrounded by a retinue of sixty-two thousand Arhats, was wandering through the country and arrived at a certain royal capital.

analyzed: aśrauṣīt rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ
translated: The anointed king, a kshatriya, heard:

original: brahmā samyaksaṃbuddho dvāṣaṣṭyarhatsahasraparivṛto janapadacārikāṃ carann asmākaṃ vijitam anuprāpta iti /
analyzed: brahmā samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dvāṣaṣṭi arhat sahasra parivṛtaḥ janapada cārikām caran asmākam vijitam anuprāptaḥ iti
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Brahma, surrounded by a retinue of sixty-two thousand Arhats, is wandering through the country and has arrived in my realm.

original: śrutvā ca punar mahatyā rājarddhyā mahatā rājānubhāvena yena bhagavān brahmā samyaksaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar mahatyā rāja ṛddhyā mahatā rāja anubhāvena yena bhagavān brahmā samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: And having heard this, he approached the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Brahma, with great royal splendor and great royal majesty.

original: upasaṃkramya brahmaṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya brahmaṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Brahma, and sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇaṃ rājānaṃ kṣatriyaṃ mūrdhābhiṣiktaṃ bhagavān bodhikarakair dharmaiḥ samādāpayati /🔽atha sa labdhaprasāda utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇam rājānam kṣatriyam mūrdhābhiṣiktam bhagavān bodhi karakaiḥ dharmaiḥ samādāpayati  atha sa labdha prasādaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: While the anointed king, a kshatriya, was sitting to one side, the Blessed One instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted him with a discourse on the Dharma.

analyzed: adhivāsayatu 🔽vaidya p
translated: Then, having gained confidence, he rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with his palms together, and said this to the Blessed One:🔽May the Blessed One, together with the community of monks,🔽accept tomorrow's meal from me.🔽The Blessed One accepted by remaining silent.

analyzed: me bhagavān asyām rājadhānyām traimāsya vāsāya
translated: May the Blessed One, together with the community of monks, consent to stay in this capital city for three months.

analyzed: aham bhagavantam sa śrāvaka saṃgham upasthāsyāmi cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ iti
translated: I will attend upon the Blessed One, the community of monks, and the community of nuns with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: adhivāsayati brahmā samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājñaḥ tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One, consented to the king by remaining silent.

original: atha sa rājā mūrdhābhiṣikto bhagavato 'rthe gośīrṣacandanamayaṃ prāsādaṃ kārayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha sa rājā mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ bhagavataḥ rthe gośīrṣa candana mayam prāsādam kārayāmāsa
translated: Then that anointed king, for the sake of the Blessed One, had a palace made of gośīrṣa sandalwood.

original: sa taṃ vicitrair vastrālaṃkārair alaṃkṛtaṃ nānāpuṣpāvakīrṇaṃ gandhaghaṭikādhūpitaṃ
analyzed: sa tam vicitraiḥ vastra alaṃkāraiḥ alaṃkṛtam nānā puṣpa avakīrṇam gandha ghaṭikā dhūpitam
translated: He offered it, adorned with various garments and ornaments, strewn with various flowers, fumigated with incense,

original: bhagavataḥ saśrāvakasaṃghasya niryātya traimāsyaṃ praṇītenāhāreṇa saṃtarpya vividhair
analyzed: bhagavataḥ sa śrāvaka saṃghasya niryātya traimāsyam praṇītena āhāreṇa saṃtarpya vividhaiḥ
translated: to the Blessed One and the community of monks, and for three months satisfied them with excellent food, and clothed them with various special garments,

analyzed: vastra viśeṣaiḥ ācchādya anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau praṇidhim cakāra
translated: and made the aspiration for highest, complete enlightenment.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣikto babhūva / ahaṃ saḥ /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ babhūva aham saḥ
translated: What do you think, monks? The one who at that time, on that occasion, was the anointed kṣatriya king, I am he.

original: yan mayā brahmaṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasyaivaṃvidhā pūjā kṛtā /
analyzed: yat mayā brahmaṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya evaṃvidhā pūjā kṛtā
translated: The worship of the Perfectly Awakened One Brahmā was done by me in this way.

original: tasya me karmaṇo vipākenānantasaṃsāre mahatsukham anubhūtam /
analyzed: tasya me karmaṇaḥ vipākena ananta saṃsāre mahat sukham anubhūtam
translated: As a result of that action of mine, great happiness was experienced by me in the endless cycle of existence.

original: idānīm apy anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasyaivavidhā pūjā /
analyzed: idānīm api anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbuddhasya evavidhā pūjā
translated: Now also, having attained supreme perfect awakening, worship is done in this way.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train thus:

original: yac chāstāraṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat śāstāram satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will honor the teacher, respect him, revere him, and make offerings to him.

original: śāstāraṃ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvopaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śāstāram satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having honored, respected, revered, and made offerings to the teacher, we will rely on him and abide.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Monks, you should train in this way.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks were satisfied and delighted in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: snātram
translated: The Bathhouse. Edited by Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, respected, revered, and worshipped by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, citizens,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: merchants, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, is known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he, together with the community of monks, receives robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: tena khalu samayena śrāvastyāṃ pañcamātrāṇi vaṇikśatāni kāntāramārgapratipannāni /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena śrāvastyām pañca mātrāṇi vaṇij śatāni kāntāra mārga pratipannāni
translated: At that time, five hundred merchants from Śrāvastī had set out on a desert path.

analyzed: te mārgāt paribhraṣṭāḥ vālukā sthalam anuprāptāḥ
translated: They went astray from the path and reached a sandy place.

original: te dharmaśramaparipīḍitāḥ kṣīṇapathyādanāś ca madhyāhnasamaye tīkṣṇakararaśmisaṃtāpitā
analyzed: te dharma śrama paripīḍitāḥ kṣīṇa pathya adanāḥ ca madhyāhna samaye tīkṣṇa kara raśmi saṃtāpitā
translated: Afflicted by the heat of the Dharma, their provisions exhausted, at midday, scorched by the rays of the hot-rayed sun,

original: jaloddhṛtā iva matsyāḥ pṛthivyām āvartante duḥkhāṃ tīvrāṃ kharāṃ kaṭukām amanāpāṃ
analyzed: jala uddhṛtāḥ iva matsyāḥ pṛthivyām āvartante duḥkhām tīvrām kharām kaṭukām amanāpām
translated: like fish pulled out of water, they rolled on the ground, experiencing painful, sharp, harsh, and unpleasant

analyzed: vedanām vedayamānāḥ
translated: sensations.

analyzed: tāni devatā sahasrāṇi āyācante
translated: They implored thousands of gods,

analyzed: tat yathā śiva varuṇa kubera vāsava ādīni
translated: such as Śiva, Varuṇa, Kubera, and Indra.

analyzed: na ca enān kaścid paritrātum samarthaḥ
translated: But no one was able to save them.

analyzed: tatra ca anyataraḥ upāsakaḥ buddha śāsana abhijñaḥ
translated: Among them, there was a certain lay disciple who knew the teachings of the Buddha.

analyzed: sa tān vaṇijaḥ āha
translated: He said to those merchants:

analyzed: bhavantaḥ buddham śaraṇam gacchantu iti
translated: Sirs, go for refuge to the Buddha.

original: tata ekaraveṇa sarva eva buddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ //
analyzed: tatas eka raveṇa sarve eva buddham śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: Then all of them together went for refuge to the Buddha with one voice.

original: atrāntare nāsti kiṃcid buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam /
analyzed: atra antare na asti kiṃcid buddhānām bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing unknown, unseen, uncognized, or unrecognized by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ lokānugrahapravṛttakānām ekārakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām mahā kāruṇikānām loka anugraha pravṛttakānām eka ārakṣāṇām
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas, the Greatly Compassionate Ones, who have turned to grace the world, who have one protection,

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā vihāriṇām tri damatha vastu kuśalānām catur ogha uttīrṇānām catur ṛddhipāda caraṇa tala supratiṣṭhitānām
translated: who dwell in tranquility and insight, who are skilled in the three means of conversion, who have crossed over the four floods, whose feet are well-placed on the four bases of supernatural power,

analyzed: caturṣu saṃgraha vastuṣu dīrgha rātra kṛta paricayānām pañca aṅga viprahīṇānām pañca gati samatikrāntānām
translated: who have long practiced the four means of gathering disciples, who are free from the five parts, who have transcended the five destinies,

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṅga samanvāgatānām ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇānām sapta bodhyaṅga kusuma āḍhyānām aṣṭāṅga mārga deśikānām
translated: who possess the six factors, who have fulfilled the six perfections, who are adorned with the seven factors of enlightenment, who teach the eightfold path,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: the doctor, p.

original: navānupūrvavihārasamāpattikuśalānāṃ daśabalabalināṃ daśadiksamāpūrṇayaśasāṃ daśaśatavaśavartiprativiśiṣṭānāṃ trī rātres trir divasasya
analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti kuśalānām daśa bala balinām daśa diś samāpūrṇa yaśasām daśa śata vaśavarti prativiśiṣṭānām tris rātreḥ tris divasasya
translated: They are skilled in the nine successive absorptions, possess the strength of the ten powers, have fame that fills the ten directions, and surpass the ten hundred lords of the desire realm. Three times at night and three times during the day,

analyzed: buddha cakṣuṣā lokam vyavalokya jñāna darśanam pravartate
translated: they survey the world with the eye of a Buddha and their knowledge and vision proceed thus:

original: ko hīyate ko vardhate kaḥ kṛcchraprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭaprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādhaprāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchrasaṃkaṭasaṃbādhaprāptaḥ ko 'pāyanimnaḥ ko 'pāyapravaṇaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ hīyate kaḥ vardhate kaḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭa prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādha prāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchra saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptaḥ pāya nimnaḥ kaḥ pāya pravaṇaḥ
translated: Who is declining? Who is growing? Who is experiencing difficulties? Who is in a tight spot? Who is in a difficult, tight spot? Who is headed for misfortune? Who is inclined towards misfortune?

analyzed: kaḥ pāya prāgbhāraḥ
translated: Who is leaning towards misfortune?

analyzed: kam aham apāyāt uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam

analyzed: kasya kāma paṅka nimagnasya hasta uddhāram anupradadyām

analyzed: kam ārya dhana virahitam ārya dhana aiśvarya ādhipatye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I establish in the lordship and sovereignty of the noble wealth that is lacking?

analyzed: kasya ajñāna timira paṭala paryavanaddha netrasya jñāna añjana śalākayā cakṣuḥ viśodhayāmi
translated: Whom shall I purify the eye of with the ointment of knowledge, whose eye is covered by the cataracts of ignorance and delusion?

analyzed: kasya an avaropitāni kuśala mulāni avaropayeyam
translated: In whom shall I plant the roots of virtue that have not been planted?

analyzed: kasya avaropitāni paripācayeyam
translated: In whom shall I bring to maturity those that have been planted?

analyzed: kasya paripakvāni vimocayeyam āha ca
translated: Whose [karmic] fruits are ripe that I might liberate? And he said:

analyzed: api eva atikramet velām sāgaraḥ makara ālayaḥ
translated: The ocean, the abode of makaras, may indeed transgress its boundary,

original: na tu vaineyavatsānāṃ buddho velām atikramet // / //
analyzed: na tu vaineya vatsānām buddhaḥ velām atikramet
translated: But the Buddha does not transgress the boundary of those beings to be trained who are like calves.

original: yāvat paśyati bhagavān saṃbahulān vaṇijo vyasanasaṃkaṭasaṃbādhaprāptān /
analyzed: yāvat paśyati bhagavān saṃbahulān vaṇijaḥ vyasana saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptān
translated: ... Then the Blessed One saw many merchants who had fallen into a dangerous and difficult situation.

original: tataś cakṣuḥsaṃpreṣaṇamātreṇa jetavane 'ntarhito bhikṣugaṇaparivṛtas taṃ pradeśam anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: tatas cakṣuḥ saṃpreṣaṇa mātreṇa jetavane ntarhitaḥ bhikṣu gaṇa parivṛtaḥ tam pradeśam anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then, by merely directing his gaze, he disappeared from Jetavana, surrounded by a group of monks, and arrived at that place.

analyzed: dadṛśuḥ te vaṇijaḥ bhagavatam sa bhikṣu saṃgham
translated: Those merchants saw the Blessed One with the assembly of monks.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca uccais nādam muktavantaḥ
translated: And having seen him, they let out a loud cry.

analyzed: tatas bhagavatā laukikam cittam utpāditam
translated: Then the Blessed One generated a worldly thought:

analyzed: aho bata śakraḥ deva indraḥ māhendram varṣam utsṛjatu
translated: Oh, may Śakra, Lord of the Gods, let loose a rain from the Mahendra cloud,

analyzed: śītalāḥ ca vāyavaḥ vāntu iti

original: sahacittotpādād bhagavataḥ śakreṇa māhendraṃ varṣam utsṛṣṭam /
analyzed: saha citta utpādāt bhagavataḥ śakreṇa māhendram varṣam utsṛṣṭam
translated: Immediately upon the Blessed One's generation of that thought, Śakra let loose a rain from the Mahendra cloud,

analyzed: śītalāḥ ca vāyavaḥ preṣitāḥ

original: yatas teṣāṃ vaṇijāṃ tṛṣā vigatā /🔽dāhaś ca praśāntaḥ /
analyzed: yatas teṣām vaṇijām tṛṣā vigatā  dāhaḥ ca praśāntaḥ
translated: Thereby the thirst of those merchants was quenched,🔽and the burning sensation was pacified.

analyzed: tatas taiḥ vaṇigbhiḥ saṃjñā pratilabdhā

analyzed: bhagavatā ca eṣām mārgaḥ ākhyātaḥ yena śrāvastīm anuprāptāḥ

original: te mārgaśramaṃ prativinodya tato bhagavatsakāśam upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: te mārga śramam prativinodya tatas bhagavat sakāśam upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Having rested from their fatigue on the road, they then approached the Blessed One.

original: teṣāṃ bhagavatā tādṛśī caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikī dharmadeśanā kṛtā /
analyzed: teṣām bhagavatā tādṛśī catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikī dharma deśanā kṛtā

analyzed: yām śrutvā kaiścid srotaāpatti phalam adhigatam  kaiścid sakṛdāgāmi phalam

analyzed: kaiścid anāgāmi phalam

original: kaiścit pravrajya sarvakleśaprahāṇād arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /🔽kaiścic chrāvakabodhau cittāny utpāditāni /
analyzed: kaiścid pravrajya sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam  kaiścid śrāvaka bodhau cittāni utpāditāni
translated: Some, having gone forth, directly realized arhatship through the complete abandonment of all defilements.🔽Some generated the intention for the enlightenment of a disciple.

analyzed: kaiścid pratyekāyām bodhau
translated: Some for the enlightenment of a solitary buddha.

analyzed: kaiścid anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Some for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: yadbhūyasā ca sā parṣad buddhanimnā dharmapravaṇā saṃghaprāgbhārā vyavasthitā //
analyzed: yat bhūyasā ca sā parṣad buddha nimnā dharma pravaṇā saṃgha prāgbhārā vyavasthitā
translated: And for the most part, that assembly was established with the Buddha as its leader, with the Dharma as its guide, and with the Saṅgha as its support.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ

analyzed: āścaryam bhagavān
translated: It is amazing, Blessed One,

original: yāvad ime vaṇijo bhagavatā kāntāramārgāt paritrātāḥ /

translated: how these merchants have been saved from the wilderness path by the Blessed One.🔽Bhikṣus, in the past, in times gone by, in this fortunate eon, when people lived to two hundred years, there appeared in the world a teacher named Kāśyapa, who was a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a blessed one.

analyzed: saha citta utpādāt ca māhendra varṣam vṛṣṭam
translated: And as soon as the thought arose, a rain from the Maheśvara clouds poured down,

analyzed: śītalāḥ ca vāyavaḥ pravātāḥ iti
translated: and cool winds blew.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatenaiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: tathāgatena eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: Monks, these actions were performed and accumulated by the Tathāgata himself in other births, in other existences, in the past. When the conditions were incomplete, they were stored up, and when the conditions were complete, they matured. Like a flood, they approached, and they were certain to come.

analyzed: mayā etāni karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: These actions were performed and accumulated by me.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience their results?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor in the wind element.

translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated are ripened in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated. Both wholesome and unwholesome actions.

analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api

analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When the conditions are complete and the time has come, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

translated: Monks, in the past, long ago, there appeared in the world a perfectly awakened Buddha named Candana, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, a leader of men to be tamed,

analyzed: anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā  vaidya p
translated: In the past, monks, in a previous time, there appeared in the world a perfectly awakened Buddha named Candana, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, a leader of men to be tamed, an unsurpassed trainer of men to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /🔽atha candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddho janapadacārikāṃ carann anyatamāṃ rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ /

translated: He was the teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.🔽Then the Perfectly Awakened One Candana, wandering on his journey through the country, arrived at a certain royal capital.

original: atha rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣikto yena candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ yena candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then a king, a Kṣatriya consecrated on his head, approached the Perfectly Awakened One Candana.

translated: While the king, a Kṣatriya consecrated on his head, was sitting to one side, the Perfectly Awakened One Candana instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted him with a discourse on the Dharma.

translated: Then the king, a Kṣatriya consecrated on his head, rose from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, and with his right knee🔽 Translation: In the past, monks, in a previous time, there appeared in the world a perfectly awakened Buddha named Candana, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, a leader of men to be tamed, an unsurpassed trainer of men to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.🔽He was the teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.🔽Then the Perfectly Awakened One Candana, wandering on his journey through the country, arrived at a certain royal capital.

original: jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddas tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya
analyzed: jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddaḥ tena añjalim praṇamya
translated: He placed his knee on the ground, bowed to the Blessed One with folded hands,

analyzed: candanam samyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān asyām rājadhānyām traimāsya vāsāya sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena iti
translated: May the Blessed One consent to stay in this capital for three months with the community of monks.

analyzed: adhivāsayati candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājñaḥ tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One consented to the king by remaining silent.

original: tatra ca samayena mahatī anāvṛṣṭiḥ prādurbhūtā /
analyzed: tatra ca samayena mahatī anāvṛṣṭiḥ prādurbhūtā
translated: At that time, there was a great drought

analyzed: yayā nadī udapānāni alpa salilāni saṃvṛttāni
translated: due to which the rivers and ponds had little water,

analyzed: puṣpa phala viyuktāḥ ca pādapāḥ
translated: and the trees were devoid of flowers and fruits.

original: tato rājā candanaṃ samyaksaṃbuddham adhyeṣituṃ pravṛttaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājā candanam samyaksaṃbuddham adhyeṣitum pravṛttaḥ
translated: Then the king began to request the Blessed One:

original: bhagavann asmin nagaramadhye puṣkariṇīṃ gandhodakaparipūrṇāṃ karayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: bhagavan asmin nagara madhye puṣkariṇīm gandha udaka paripūrṇām karayiṣyāmi
translated: Blessed One, I will have a pond filled with fragrant water built in the middle of this city,

analyzed: yatra bhagavān sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ snāsyati
translated: where the Blessed One with the community of disciples will bathe.

original: apy eva nāma bhagavataḥ snānād asmin me vijite devo varṣed iti /
analyzed: api eva nāma bhagavataḥ snānāt asmin me vijite devaḥ varṣet iti
translated: Perhaps by the Blessed One's bathing, the gods will rain in my kingdom.

original: adhivāsayati bhagavāṃś candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddho rajñas tuṣṇībhāvena /
analyzed: adhivāsayati bhagavān candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rajñaḥ tuṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Candana, accepted the king's invitation by remaining silent.

original: tato rajñā kṣatriyeṇa mūrdhābhiṣiktenāmātyebhya ājñā dattā /
analyzed: tatas rajñā kṣatriyeṇa mūrdhābhiṣiktena amātyebhyaḥ ājñā dattā
translated: Then the anointed king of the kṣatriyas gave instructions to his ministers:

analyzed: gandha udakam sajjīkurvantu bhavantaḥ
translated: Sirs, prepare scented water,

analyzed: ratna mayān ca kumbhān
translated: and jeweled vases.

original: yena vayaṃ bhagavantaṃ saśrāvakasaṃghaṃ snāpayiṣyāma iti /
analyzed: yena vayam bhagavantam sa śrāvaka saṃgham snāpayiṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: So that we may bathe the Blessed One and his community of disciples.

original: tato rājñā āmātyagaṇaparivṛtena tan nagaram apagatapāṣāṇaśarkarakaṭhallaṃ vyavasthāpitum ucchritadhvajapatākaṃ nānāpuṣpāvakīrṇaṃ gandhodakapariṣiktaṃ 🔽vicitradhūpadhūpitam /

translated: Then the king, surrounded by a group of ministers, had that city cleared of stones, pebbles, and gravel, arranged with raised flags and banners, strewn with various flowers, sprinkled with scented water,🔽perfumed with various incense,

analyzed: puṣkariṇī ca asya kāritā
translated: and a lotus pond was made.

original: tato bhagavāṃś candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddaḥ sarvānugrahārtham ekacīvarakaḥ puṣkariṇyāṃ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhagavān candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddaḥ sarva anugraha artham eka cīvarakaḥ puṣkariṇyām sthitaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Candana, for the sake of universal grace, stood in the pond in a single robe.

original: tato rājñāmātyagaṇaparivṛtena candanaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ saśrāvakasaṃgho nānāgandhaparibhāvitenodakena snāpitaḥ /

translated: Then the king, surrounded by a group of ministers, bathed the Perfectly Awakened One Candana and his community of disciples with water perfumed with various scents.

original: sahasnānād eva candanasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya śakreṇa devendreṇa tathāvidhaṃ māhendraṃ varṣam utsṛṣṭaṃ yena sarvasasyāni niṣpannāni /
analyzed: saha snānāt eva candanasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya śakreṇa deva indreṇa tathāvidham māhendram varṣam utsṛṣṭam yena sarva sasyāni niṣpannāni
translated: And immediately after the bath, Śakra, Lord of the Gods, released such a Māhendra rain of sandalwood that all the crops were harvested.

original: taddhaitukaṃ ca mahājanakāyena buddhe bhagavati śraddhā pratilabdhā /
analyzed: tad haitukam ca mahā jana kāyena buddhe bhagavati śraddhā pratilabdhā
translated: And because of that, the great multitude gained faith in the Buddha, the Blessed One.

analyzed: aneke ca gandha stūpāḥ pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ
translated: And many fragrant stūpas were erected.

original: ye ca tatra candanaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: ye ca tatra candanam samyaksaṃbuddham śaraṇam gatāḥ
translated: And all those who took refuge in the Perfectly Awakened One Sandalwood

analyzed: sarve te parinirvṛtāḥ
translated: have passed into parinirvāṇa.

analyzed: aham ekaḥ teṣām avaśiṣṭaḥ
translated: I alone remain of them.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava evaṃ śikṣitavyam /🔽yac chāstāraṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam  yat śāstāram satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train thinking thus:🔽'We will honor, respect, revere, and worship the Teacher.

original: śāstāraṃ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvopaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śāstāram satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having honored, respected, revered, and worshipped the Teacher, we will rely on him and abide.'

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Monks, you should train in this way.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te ca bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te ca bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: And those monks, with their minds uplifted, rejoiced in what the Blessed One said.🔽The Sūtra of the Wise and the Foolish

analyzed: ītiḥ
translated: is finished.

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: traders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he and his community of monks received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: rājagṛham upaniśritya viharati veṇuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: He was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Bamboo Grove, at the squirrels' feeding ground.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: [Vidy. p. 1.]

analyzed: tasmin ca nāḍakanthāyām mahā jana marakaḥ babhūva
translated: And in that Naḍakānthā, there was a great mortality of people.

original: tato janakāyo rogaiḥ pīḍitaḥ tāni tāni devatāsahasrāṇy āyācate śivavaruṇakuberavāsavādīni /
analyzed: tatas jana kāyaḥ rogaiḥ pīḍitaḥ tāni tāni devatā sahasrāṇi āyācate śiva varuṇa kubera vāsava ādīni
translated: Then the multitude, afflicted by diseases, implored those and other thousands of gods, Śiva, Varuṇa, Kubera, Vāsava, and so on.

original: na cāsya sā ītir upaśamaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: na ca asya sā ītiḥ upaśamam gacchati
translated: But his illness did not subside.

analyzed: atha anyatamaḥ upāsakaḥ nāḍakanthāyām prativasati
translated: Then a certain lay follower was dwelling in Naḍakānthā.

analyzed: sa nāḍakantheyān brāhmaṇa gṛhapatīn idam avocat
translated: He said this to the brahmin householders of Naḍakānthā:

analyzed: eta yūyam buddham śarāṇam gacchata
translated: You should go to the Buddha for refuge.

analyzed: tam ca bhagavantam āyācadhvam iha āgamanāya
translated: And you should request that Blessed One to come here.

original: apy eva bhagavatā svalpakṛcchreṇāsyā īter vyupaśamaḥ syād iti /
analyzed: api eva bhagavatā su alpa kṛcchreṇa asyāḥ īteḥ vyupaśamaḥ syāt iti
translated: Perhaps through the Blessed One's little effort, this calamity will be pacified.

original: atha nāḍakantheyā brāhmaṇagṛhapatayo bhagavantam āyācituṃ pravṛttāḥ /
analyzed: atha nāḍakantheyāḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ bhagavantam āyācitum pravṛttāḥ
translated: Then the brāhmaṇas and householders of Nādikā began to request the Blessed One,

analyzed: āgacchatu bhagavān asmāt vyasana saṃkaṭāt mocanāya iti
translated: May the Blessed One come to free us from this calamity and distress.

original: atrāntare nāsti kiṃcid buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam /
analyzed: atra antare na asti kiṃcid buddhānām bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing unknown, unseen, uncognized, or unperceived by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ lokānugrahapravṛttakānām ekārakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām mahā kāruṇikānām loka anugraha pravṛttakānām eka ārakṣāṇām
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas, the Greatly Compassionate Ones, who act to favor the world, to have one protector,🔽who dwell in tranquility and insight, who are skilled in the three means of conversion,

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā vihāriṇām tri damatha vastu kuśalānām catur ogha uttīrṇānām catur ṛddhipāda caraṇa tala supratiṣṭhitānām
translated: who have well-established feet in the four bases of supernatural power,

analyzed: caturṣu saṃgraha vastuṣu dīrgha rātra kṛta paricayānām pañca aṅga viprahīṇānām pañca gati samatikrāntānām
translated: who have long practiced the four means of gathering [disciples], who are free from the five parts [of existence], who have transcended the five destinies,

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṅga samanvāgatānām ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇānām sapta bodhyaṅga kusuma āḍhyānām aṣṭāṅga mārga deśikānām
translated: who are endowed with the six superknowledges, who have fulfilled the six perfections, who are rich with the flowers of the seven factors of enlightenment, who teach the eightfold path,

analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti kuśalānām daśa bala balinām daśa diś samāpūrṇa yaśasām daśa śata vaśavarti prativiśiṣṭānām
translated: who are skilled in the nine successive abodes and concentrations, who are strong with the ten powers, whose fame fills the ten directions, who are superior to the lords of the ten hundred (trichiliocosms),

analyzed: tris rātreḥ tris divasasya ca
translated: three times by night and three times by day,

analyzed: buddha cakṣuṣā lokam vyavalokya jñāna darśanam pravartate
translated: having surveyed the world with the eye of a Buddha, knowledge and insight proceed thus:

original: ko hīyate ko vardhate kaḥ kṛcchraprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭaprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādhaprāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchrasaṃkaṭasaṃbādhaprāptaḥ ko 'pāyanimnaḥ ko 'pāyapravaṇaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ hīyate kaḥ vardhate kaḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭa prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādha prāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchra saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptaḥ pāya nimnaḥ kaḥ pāya pravaṇaḥ
translated: Who is declining? Who is growing? Who has met with misfortune? Who has met with difficulty? Who has met with a calamity? Who has met with misfortune, difficulty, and a calamity? Who is on a low path? Who is on a sloping path?

analyzed: kaḥ pāya prāgbhāraḥ
translated: Who is on a path that leads to a precipice?

original: kam aham apāyād uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam /
analyzed: kam aham apāyāt uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I lift up from the lower realms and establish in heaven and liberation?

analyzed: kasya kāma paṅka nimagnasya hasta uddhāram anupradadyām
translated: Whom shall I give a helping hand to, who is sunk in the mire of desire?

analyzed: kam ārya dhana virahitam ārya dhana aiśvarya ādhipatye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I establish in the lordship and sovereignty of the noble wealth, who is devoid of the noble wealth?

analyzed: kasya ajñāna timira paṭala paryavanaddha netrasya jñāna añjana śalākayā cakṣuḥ viśodhayāmi  kasya an avaropitāni kuśala mulāni avaropayeyam
translated: Whose eyes, obscured by the cataract of ignorance, will I open with the ointment of knowledge?🔽Whose roots of virtue have not yet been planted will I cause to be planted?

analyzed: kasya avaropitāni paripācayeyam
translated: Whose planted roots of virtue will I bring to maturity?

analyzed: kasya paripakvāni vimocayeyam āha ca
translated: Whose mature roots of virtue will I liberate? He also says:

analyzed: api eva atikramet velām sāgaraḥ makara ālayaḥ
translated: The ocean, the abode of makaras, may indeed transgress its shoreline,

original: na tu vaineyavatsānāṃ buddho velām atikramet // / //
analyzed: na tu vaineya vatsānām buddhaḥ velām atikramet
translated: But the Buddha does not transgress the shoreline of those beings to be trained who are like calves.

original: atha bhagavān pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya bhikṣugaṇaparivṛto bhikṣusaṃghapuraskṛto nāḍakanthām anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya bhikṣu gaṇa parivṛtaḥ bhikṣu saṃgha puraskṛtaḥ nāḍakanthām anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, in the morning, having dressed and taking his bowl and robe, surrounded by the assembly of monks and with the community of monks in front, arrived at Nāḍakanthā.

original: tato bhagavatā tan nagaraṃ sarvaṃ hṛdimaitryā sphuṭam /
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā tat nagaram sarvam hṛdimaitryā sphuṭam
translated: Then the Blessed One, with the love in his heart, pervaded that entire city.

analyzed: yatas marakāḥ prakrāntāḥ
translated: From which the demons departed.

analyzed: ītiḥ ca vyupaśāntā
translated: And the plague subsided.

original: tatas teṣāṃ brāhmaṇagṛhapatīnāṃ buddhadarśanān mahāprasāda utpannaḥ /
analyzed: tatas teṣām brāhmaṇa gṛhapatīnām buddha darśanāt mahā prasādaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: Then those brahmins and householders, having seen the Buddha, gave rise to great faith.

analyzed: prasāda jātaiḥ ca bhagavān sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ saṃpravāritaḥ
translated: And those who had given rise to faith fully satisfied the Blessed One, together with the community of disciples, with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicine for the sick, and other requisites.

original: tatas tebhyo bhagavatā tādṛśī caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikī dharmadeśanā kṛtā /
analyzed: tatas tebhyaḥ bhagavatā tādṛśī catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikī dharma deśanā kṛtā
translated: Then the Blessed One gave them a teaching on the Dharma that was connected with the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā anekair brāhmaṇagṛhapatibhiḥ srotaāpattiphalam anuprāptam /🔽aparaiḥ sakṛdāgāmiphalam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā anekaiḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatibhiḥ srotaāpatti phalam anuprāptam  aparaiḥ sakṛdāgāmi phalam
translated: Having heard it, many brahmins and householders attained the fruit of stream-entry.🔽Some attained the fruit of once-returning.

analyzed: aparaiḥ anāgāmi phalam
translated: Some attained the fruit of non-returning.

analyzed: aparaiḥ pravrajya sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Some, having gone forth, directly realized arhatship through the complete destruction of the defilements.

original: sarvaṃ ca tan nagaraṃ buddhanimnaṃ dharmapravaṇaṃ saṃghaprāgbhāraṃ saṃvṛttam //
analyzed: sarvam ca tat nagaram buddha nimnam dharma pravaṇam saṃgha prāgbhāram saṃvṛttam
translated: And the whole city became inclined towards the Buddha, inclined towards the Dharma, and inclined towards the Saṅgha.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the one who removes all doubts:

original: āścaryaṃ bhadanta yāvad ime satvā bhagavataḥ prasādād vyasanagatāḥ santo vyasanāt parimuktā iti /
analyzed: āścaryam bhadanta yāvat ime satvāḥ bhagavataḥ prasādāt vyasana gatāḥ santaḥ vyasanāt parimuktāḥ iti
translated: It is wonderful, Bhadanta, that these beings, having fallen into misfortune through faith in the Blessed One, have been freed from misfortune.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatenaivaitāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: tathāgatena eva etāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: Monks, these actions were performed and accumulated by the Tathāgata himself in other births, in the past, when he was wandering about as a seeker. When the conditions were complete and the time had come, he experienced the results:

analyzed: mayā etāni karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni  vaidya p
translated: I have performed and accumulated these actions.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Doctor, who else will experience them?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated do not ripen in the external earth element.🔽Nor in the water element.

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Nor in the fire element.

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor in the wind element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /🔽na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpakoṭiśatair api /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca  na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated ripen in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated.🔽Actions do not perish even after hundreds of millions of eons.

analyzed: karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Even after hundreds of eons, actions...

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //🔽bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani candro nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi tathāgato🔽'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām  bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani candraḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi tathāgataḥ  rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: When the conditions are complete and the time has come, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

analyzed: śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: Monks, in the past, a perfectly awakened buddha named Candra appeared in the world, a tathāgata, an arhat, a perfectly awakened one, perfected in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavat.

original: atha candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddho janapadacārikāṃ carann anyatamāṃ rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: atha candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ janapada cārikām caran anyatamām rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then the Perfectly Awakened One Candra, wandering by stages through the country, arrived at a certain royal capital.

analyzed: aśrauṣīt rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ
translated: The anointed king, a kṣatriya, heard:

analyzed: candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ smākam vijitam anuprāptaḥ iti
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Candra has arrived in my realm.

original: śrutvā ca punar mahatyā rājarddhyā mahatā rājānubhāvena samanvāgato yena candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar mahatyā rāja ṛddhyā mahatā rāja anubhāvena samanvāgataḥ yena candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Having heard this, he approached the Perfectly Awakened One Candra, endowed with great royal splendor and great royal majesty.

original: upasaṃkramya candrasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya candrasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte nyaṣīdat
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Candra and sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇaṃ rājānaṃ kṣatriyaṃ mūrdhābhiṣiktaṃ candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddho bodhikarakair dharmaiḥ samādāpayati /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇam rājānam kṣatriyam mūrdhābhiṣiktam candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bodhi karakaiḥ dharmaiḥ samādāpayati
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Candra instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted the anointed king, a kṣatriya, who was sitting to one side, with talk consistent with the Dharma.

original: atha rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣikto labdhaprasāda utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ
analyzed: atha rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ labdha prasādaḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam
translated: Then the anointed king, a kṣatriya, having gained faith, rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder,

original: kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhas
analyzed: kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: placed his right knee on the ground, and with palms joined addressed the Perfectly Awakened One Candra:🔽May the Blessed One, together with the community of monks, accept tomorrow's meal from me.

original: tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya candraṃ samyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat /
analyzed: tena añjalim praṇamya candram samyaksaṃbuddham idam avocat
translated: He joined his palms in respect to the Perfectly Awakened One Candra and said this:

original: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān iha vāsaṃ traimāsyaṃ sārdhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghena /
analyzed: adhivāsayatu me bhagavān iha vāsam traimāsyam sārdham bhikṣu saṃghena
translated: May the Blessed One, together with the community of monks, consent to stay here for three months.

analyzed: aham bhagavantam upasthāsyāmi cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ iti
translated: I will serve the Blessed One with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: adhivāsayati candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājñaḥ tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Candra consented to the king's request by remaining silent.

original: tasya ca rājño nagare tena samayena mahājanamarako babhūva /
analyzed: tasya ca rājñaḥ nagare tena samayena mahā jana marakaḥ babhūva
translated: And at that time in the king's city there was a great epidemic among the people.

analyzed: ītiḥ ca
translated: And a famine.

analyzed: yena sa mahā jana kāyaḥ tīva saṃtarpyate
translated: By which a great multitude was greatly afflicted.

analyzed: tatas rājñā vyādhi praśamana artham candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ dhīṣṭaḥ
translated: Then for the purpose of alleviating the disease, the Perfectly Awakened One Candra was requested by the king.

original: sādhu bhagavan kriyatām asyā īter upaśamopāya iti /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavan kriyatām asyāḥ īteḥ upaśama upāyaḥ iti
translated: It would be good, Blessed One, if a means of alleviating this famine could be made.

original: tato bhagavāṃś candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddho rājānam uvāca /
analyzed: tatas bhagavān candraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ rājānam uvāca
translated: Then the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Candra, said to the king:

original: gaccha mahārāja imāṃ saṃghāṭīṃ dhvajāgre baddhā mahatā satkāreṇa sve vijite paryāṭaya /
analyzed: gaccha mahā rāja imām saṃghāṭīm dhvaja agre baddhā mahatā satkāreṇa sve vijite paryāṭaya
translated: Go, great king, and having bound this outer robe to the top of a banner, travel through your own kingdom with great honor.

analyzed: asya ca mahāntam utsavam kuru
translated: And make a great festival for this.

analyzed: sarvam ca mahā jana kāyam buddha anusmṛtau samādāpaya iti
translated: and to make the whole great assembly take up the recollection of the Buddha.
