analyzed: muṣyante deva mahā rāja rājagṛha nivāsinaḥ paurāḥ
translated: Your Majesty, the citizens of Rājagṛha are being deprived.

original: yatra nāma devāḥ pramattāḥ santaḥ pramādavihāriṇo divyān viṣayān apahāya bhagavantaṃ pūjayanti /
analyzed: yatra nāma devāḥ pramattāḥ santaḥ pramāda vihāriṇaḥ divyān viṣayān apahāya bhagavantam pūjayanti
translated: For the gods, being heedless and indulging in heedlessness, have abandoned their divine pleasures and are worshipping the Blessed One.

analyzed: sādhu devaḥ ughāṭyatām kriyākāraḥ iti
translated: Well then, Your Majesty, let the proclamation be made.

original: tato rājñā ajātaśatruṇā kriyākāram udghāṭya rājagṛhe nagare ghaṇṭāvaghoṣaṇaṃ kāritam /
analyzed: tatas rājñā ajātaśatruṇā kriyākāram udghāṭya rājagṛhe nagare ghaṇṭā avaghoṣaṇam kāritam
translated: Then King Ajatashatru, having made the proclamation, had a bell rung in the city of Rajagriha, saying:

analyzed: kriyatām bhagavataḥ satkāraḥ yathāsukham iti
translated: Let the worship of the Blessed One be done as you please.

original: tato rājagṛhanivāsinaḥ paurāḥ saparivārā hṛṣṭatuṣṭapramuditā udagraprītisaumanasyajātāḥ puṣpagandhamālyāny ādāya bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāntāḥ
analyzed: tatas rājagṛha nivāsinaḥ paurāḥ sa parivārāḥ hṛṣṭa tuṣṭa pramuditāḥ udagra prīti saumanasya jātāḥ puṣpa gandha mālyāni ādāya bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Then the citizens of Rajagriha, together with their retinues, delighted, satisfied, joyful, elated, and full of happiness and gladness, took flowers, incense, and garlands and went to see the Blessed One.

original: tato devair manuṣyaiś ca bhagavato mahān satkāraḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tatas devaiḥ manuṣyaiḥ ca bhagavataḥ mahān satkāraḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then the gods and humans made great offerings to the Blessed One.

original: bhagavatā ca tad adhiṣṭhānaṃ devamanuṣyāṇāṃ tādṛśī caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikī dharmadeśanā kṛtā /
analyzed: bhagavatā ca tat adhiṣṭhānam deva manuṣyāṇām tādṛśī catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikī dharma deśanā kṛtā
translated: And the Blessed One gave a Dharma talk to the gods and humans on that occasion, which was related to the four noble truths and which caused them to penetrate them.

original: yāṃ śrutvā anekair devamanuṣyaiḥ satyadarśanaṃ kṛtam //
analyzed: yām śrutvā anekaiḥ deva manuṣyaiḥ satya darśanam kṛtam
translated: Having heard it, many gods and humans attained the fruit of seeing the truths.

original: bhikṣavo bhagavataḥ pūjāṃ dṛṣṭvā saṃśayajātā buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ pūjām dṛṣṭvā saṃśaya jātāḥ buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, having seen the worship of the Blessed One, became doubtful, and asked the Buddha, the Blessed One:

original: āścaryaṃ bhadanta yad bhagavataḥ śāsane evaṃvidha utsava iti /
analyzed: āścaryam bhadanta yat bhagavataḥ śāsane evaṃvidhaḥ utsavaḥ iti
translated: It is wonderful, Bhadanta, that there is such a festival in the Blessed One's teaching.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, this is not the first time that I have been worshipped by gods and humans.

original: tathāgatenaivaitāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: tathāgatena eva etāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: “Monks, these actions were performed and accumulated by the Tathāgata himself in other lives, in other births, in the past. They were many in number, great in number, and were accumulated in the past. They have come together and their conditions have matured. They follow me like an echo. They will certainly come to pass.

analyzed: mayā etāni karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: I performed and accumulated these actions.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience them?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated do not ripen upon the external earth element.🔽Nor upon the water element.

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Nor upon the fire element.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: [Vaidya 1]

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor upon the wind element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca
translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated ripen upon the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated. Both virtuous and non-virtuous actions.

analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: Actions do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

analyzed: karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Even after a hundred aeons, actions ripen upon embodied beings.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When the conditions are complete and the time has come, they certainly bear fruit.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani ratnaśailo nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi tathāgato
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani ratnaśailaḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi tathāgataḥ
translated: Monks, in the past, in a time gone by, the Perfectly Awakened One named Ratnashekhara appeared in the world, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, a One of Perfect Knowledge and Conduct, a Sugata, a Knower of the World, an unsurpassed Trainer of those who can be trained, a Teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with (perfect) knowledge and (perfect) conduct, the Well-Gone One, knower of the world, incomparable leader of persons to be tamed,

analyzed: śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Fortunate One.

original: sa janapadacārikāṃ carann anyatamāṃ rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa janapada cārikām caran anyatamām rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: Wandering through the country, he arrived at a certain royal capital.

original: tasyāṃ ca rājadhānyāṃ dharmabuddhir nāma rājā rājyaṃ kārayati tasyāṃ ca rājadhānyāṃ mahatī ītiḥ /
analyzed: tasyām ca rājadhānyām dharmabuddhiḥ nāma rājā rājyam kārayati tasyām ca rājadhānyām mahatī ītiḥ
translated: In that royal capital, a king named Dharmabuddhi was ruling the kingdom, and in that royal capital there was a great calamity.

original: tatas tena rājñā ītipraśamanahetor bhagavān śrāvakasaṃghatraimāsye bhaktenopanimantritaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tena rājñā īti praśamana hetoḥ bhagavān śrāvaka saṃgha traimāsye bhaktena upanimantritaḥ
translated: Then, in order to quell the calamity, the Blessed One and the community of disciples were invited by the king for a meal lasting three months.

original: trāyāṇāṃ māsānām atyayena sā ītiḥ praśāntā /
analyzed: trāyāṇām māsānām atyayena sā ītiḥ praśāntā
translated: At the end of the three months, the calamity was pacified.

original: tato rājño nāgaraiś cāvarjitamānasais tathāgatasya saśrāvakasaṃghasya pañcavārṣikaṃ kṛtam / āha ca /
analyzed: tatas rājñaḥ nāgaraiḥ ca āvarjita mānasaiḥ tathāgatasya sa śrāvaka saṃghasya pañca vārṣikam kṛtam āha ca
translated: Then, with their minds full of devotion, the king and the citizens made a five-year offering to the Tathāgata and the community of disciples, and said:

analyzed: rāja bhūtena ānanda ratnaśailaḥ mahā dyutiḥ
translated: O Ānanda, when King Ratanaśaila of great splendor

analyzed: avīṣṭaḥ śānti kāmena akārṣīt pañca vārṣikam iti
translated: was afflicted by a calamity, he made a five-year offering out of a desire for peace.

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva / ahaṃ saḥ /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva aham saḥ
translated: What do you think, monks? At that time, at that moment, the one who was the king was none other than me.

original: yan mayā ratnaśailasya tathāgatasya pañcavārṣikaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yat mayā ratnaśailasya tathāgatasya pañca vārṣikam kṛtam
translated: The five-year festival I held for the Tathāgata Ratnaśaila,

analyzed: tena me saṃsāre mahat sukham anubhūtam
translated: by that I experienced great happiness in saṃsāra,

analyzed: tad haitukaḥ ca idānīm tathāgatasya evaṃvidhaḥ satkāraḥ
translated: and now, for that reason, there is such veneration for the Tathāgata.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca me śāsane anekāni pañcavārṣikaśatāni bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca me śāsane anekāni pañca vārṣika śatāni bhaviṣyati
translated: And after my parinirvāṇa, there will be many hundreds of five-year festivals in my teaching.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train thus:

original: yac chāstāraṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat śāstāram satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will honor, respect, revere, and worship the Teacher.

original: śāstāraṃ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvopaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śāstāram satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having honored, respected, revered, and worshipped the Teacher, we will rely on him and abide.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Monks, you should train in this way.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te ca bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te ca bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks, with their minds uplifted, rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: stutiḥ
translated: Praise. Edited by Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, respected, worshipped by kings and royal ministers, by the wealthy, by town-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: with merchants, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, is known as the one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: the recipient of robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for the sick, together with the community of monks.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: tena khalu samayena śrāvastyāṃ pañcamātrāṇi gāndharvikaśatāni goṣṭhikānāṃ prativasanti /
analyzed: tena khalu samayena śrāvastyām pañca mātrāṇi gāndharvika śatāni goṣṭhikānām prativasanti
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī, there were five hundred groups of musicians living together.

original: tatra ca kāle supriyo nāma gāndharvikarājo 'bhyāgataḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca kāle supriyaḥ nāma gāndharvika rājaḥ bhyāgataḥ
translated: And at that time, a king of musicians named Suprīya arrived.

analyzed: tasya evaṃvidhā śaktiḥ
translated: He had such abilities.

analyzed: ekasyām tantryām sāpta svarān ādarśayati
translated: On a single string, he could demonstrate seven notes.

analyzed: ekaviṃśatim mūrcchināḥ
translated: On twenty-one strings,

original: sa ṣaṇmahānagarāṇy apaṭukāny udghoṣayamāṇaḥ śrāvastīm anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa ṣaṣ mahā nagarāṇi a paṭukāni udghoṣayamāṇaḥ śrāvastīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: he could play the music of the six great cities. Having announced it, he arrived in Śrāvastī.

analyzed: śrāvastī nivāsibhiḥ ca gāndharvikaiḥ rājñe niveditam
translated: And the musicians living in Śrāvastī reported it to the king.

analyzed: rājā āha alpa utsukāḥ bhavantu bhavantaḥ
translated: The king said, You should not be so eager.

analyzed: vayam atra kāla jñāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: We will know the time here.

analyzed: vaidya p  atha supriyasya gāndharvika rājasya etat abhavat
translated: Vidy. p.🔽Then this occurred to Suprīya, the king of Gandharvas:

original: evam anuśrūyate rājā prasenajid gāndharve 'tīva kuśalaḥ /
analyzed: evam anuśrūyate rājā prasenajit gāndharve tīva kuśalaḥ
translated: It is heard that King Prasenajit is very skilled in Gandharva music.

original: yanv aham anena saha vādam ārocayeyam iti /
analyzed: yanu aham anena saha vādam ārocayeyam iti
translated: If so, let me challenge him to a contest.

original: tataḥ supriyo gāndharvikarājo yena rājā prasenajit kauśalas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tatas supriyaḥ gāndharvika rājaḥ yena rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then Suprīya, the king of Gandharvas, approached King Prasenajit of Kośala.

original: upasaṃkramya rājānaṃ prasenajitaṃ kauśalam idam āvocat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya rājānam prasenajitam kauśalam idam āvocat
translated: Having approached, he said this to King Prasenajit of Kośala:

original: śrutaṃ me rājan yathā tvaṃ gāndharvakuśala iti /
analyzed: śrutam me rājan yathā tvam gāndharva kuśalaḥ iti
translated: Your Majesty, I have heard that you are skilled in Gandharva music.

analyzed: yadi te aguru
translated: If you are not afraid,

analyzed: mīmāṃsasva iti
translated: let us have a contest.

original: tato rājñā prasenajitā tasya vikṣepaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājñā prasenajitā tasya vikṣepaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then King Prasenajit made an appointment with him,

original: uktaś ca / sādho asti me gurur jetavane sthito 'nuttaro gāndharvikarājaḥ /
analyzed: uktaḥ ca sādho asti me guruḥ jetavane sthitaḥ nuttaraḥ gāndharvika rājaḥ
translated: and said, Good man, I have a teacher, the unsurpassed king of Gandharvas, who is staying in the Jeta Grove.

analyzed: ehi tat samīpam yāsyāmaḥ iti
translated: Come, let us go to him.

original: atha rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ pañcamātrair gāndharvikaśataiḥ parivṛtaḥ supriyeṇa gāndharvikarājenānekaiś ca prāṇiśatasahasrair jetavanaṃ gataḥ
analyzed: atha rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ pañca mātraiḥ gāndharvika śataiḥ parivṛtaḥ supriyeṇa gāndharvika rājena anekaiḥ ca prāṇi śata sahasraiḥ jetavanam gataḥ
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kośala, surrounded by five hundred Gandharvas, by Suprīya, the king of Gandharvas, and by many hundreds of thousands of living beings, went to the Jeta Grove.

original: atrāntare nāsti kiṃcid buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam /
analyzed: atra antare na asti kiṃcid buddhānām bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing unknown, unseen, uncognized, or undiscerned by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ lokānugrahapravṛttakānām ekārakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām mahā kāruṇikānām loka anugraha pravṛttakānām eka ārakṣāṇām
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas, who are greatly compassionate, who act to benefit the world, who have one protector,

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā vihāriṇām tri damatha vastu kuśalānām catur ogha uttīrṇānām catur ṛddhipāda caraṇa tala supratiṣṭhitānām
translated: who dwell in tranquility and insight, who are skilled in the three means of instruction, who have crossed over the four floods, whose feet are well-placed in the four bases of supernatural power,

analyzed: caturṣu saṃgraha vastuṣu dīrgha rātra kṛta paricayānām pañca aṅga viprahīṇānām pañca gati samatikrāntānām
translated: who have long been familiar with the four means of gathering disciples, who are free from the five factors, who have transcended the five destinies,

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṅga samanvāgatānām ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇānām sapta bodhyaṅga kusuma āḍhyānām aṣṭāṅga mārga deśikānām
translated: who possess the six factors, who have perfected the six perfections, who are adorned with the seven factors of enlightenment, who teach the eightfold path,

analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti kuśalānām daśa bala balinām daśa diś samāpūrṇa yaśasām daśa śata vaśavarti prativiśiṣṭānām
translated: who are skilled in the nine successive abodes, who possess the ten powers, whose fame fills the ten directions, who are superior to the ten hundred lords of the desire realm,

analyzed: tris rātreḥ tris divasasya ca
translated: three times by night and three times by day,

analyzed: buddha cakṣuṣā lokam vyavalokya jñāna darśanam pravartate
translated: they survey the world with the eye of a buddha, and knowledge and insight proceed.

original: ko hīyate ko vardhate kaḥ kṛcchraprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭaprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādhaprāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchrasaṃkaṭasaṃbādhaprāptaḥ ko 'pāyanimnaḥ ko 'pāyapravaṇaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ hīyate kaḥ vardhate kaḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭa prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādha prāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchra saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptaḥ pāya nimnaḥ kaḥ pāya pravaṇaḥ
translated: Who is declining? Who is prospering? Who has met with misfortune? Who is in a difficult situation? Who is in a tight spot? Who is in misfortune, difficulty, and a tight spot? Who is headed for misfortune? Who is inclined towards misfortune?

analyzed: kaḥ pāya prāgbhāraḥ
translated: Who is leaning towards misfortune?

original: kam aham apāyād uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam /
analyzed: kam aham apāyāt uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I lift up from misfortune and establish in heaven and liberation?

analyzed: kasya kāma paṅka nimagnasya hasta uddhāram anupradadyām
translated: Whom shall I give a helping hand to, who is sunk in the mud of desire?

analyzed: kam ārya dhana virahitam ārya dhana aiśvarya ādhipatye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I establish in the lordship and sovereignty of the noble wealth, who is devoid of the noble wealth?

analyzed: kasya ajñāna timira paṭala paryavanaddha netrasya jñāna añjana śalākayā cakṣuḥ viśodhayāmi  kasya an avaropitāni kuśala mulāni avaropayeyam
translated: With the ointment stick of knowledge, I shall purify the eye of whose eye is covered by the cataract of the veil of the darkness of ignorance?🔽In whom shall I plant the roots of virtue that have not been planted?

analyzed: kasya avaropitāni paripācayeyam
translated: Whom shall I ripen whose roots of virtue have been planted?

analyzed: kasya paripakvāni vimocayeyam āha ca
translated: Whom shall I liberate whose roots of virtue have ripened? He also says:

analyzed: api eva atikramet velām sāgaraḥ makara ālayaḥ
translated: Even the ocean, the abode of makaras, may overstep its shoreline,

analyzed: na a hetu a pratyayam ānanda tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitam prāviṣkurvanti
translated: Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones do not smile without a cause or condition.

original: paśyasy ānanda ebhir gāndharvikair mamaivaṃvidhaṃ satkāraṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: paśyasi ānanda ebhiḥ gāndharvikaiḥ mama evaṃvidham satkāram kṛtam
translated: Do you see, Ānanda, how these musicians have shown me such respect?

analyzed: evam bhadanta
translated: Yes, Blessed One.

original: ete ānanda gāndharvikāḥ anena kuśalamūlena cittotpādena deyadharmaparityāgena ca
analyzed: ete ānanda gāndharvikāḥ anena kuśala mūlena citta utpādena deya dharma parityāgena ca
translated: Ānanda, these musicians, by this wholesome root, this thought of enlightenment, this relinquishment of the gift to be given,

original: yathākālānugatāṃ pratyekāṃ bodhiṃ samudānīya anāgate 'dhvani varṇasvarā nāma pratyekabuddhā
analyzed: yathākāla anugatām pratyekām bodhim samudānīya anāgate dhvani varṇasvarā nāma pratyekabuddhā
translated: having attained the individual enlightenment that accords with the time, in the future will be Pratyekabuddhas named Varṇa-svara,

analyzed: bhaviṣyanti hīna dīna anukampakāḥ prānta śayanāsana bhaktāḥ eka dakṣiṇīyāḥ lokasya
translated: having compassion for the lowly and wretched, devoted to secluded sleeping and sitting places, the world's sole recipient of offerings.

original: ayam eṣāṃ deyadharmo yo mamāntike cittaprasāda iti //
analyzed: ayam eṣām deya dharmaḥ yaḥ mama antike citta prasādaḥ iti
translated: This is their gift to be given, namely the serene faith in me.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayānāṃ chettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśayānām chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, being doubtful, asked the Blessed One, the Destroyer of Doubts,

original: kāni bhadanta bhagavatā kuśalamūlāni kṛtāni yeṣām ayam anubhāva iti /
analyzed: kāni bhadanta bhagavatā kuśala mūlāni kṛtāni yeṣām ayam anubhāvaḥ iti
translated: Venerable, what wholesome roots were planted by the Blessed One, that this is the result?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tathāgatenaitāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: tathāgatena etāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: Monks, these actions were performed and accumulated by the Tathāgata himself in other births, with the right conditions and not without conditions, bound to come to pass, and have now come to pass.

analyzed: mayā etāni karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: These actions were performed and accumulated by me.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience their results?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated are not ripened in the external earth element.🔽Nor in the water element.

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Nor in the fire element.

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor in the air element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /🔽na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpakoṭiśatair api /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca  na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated are ripened in the aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres that have been appropriated. Both wholesome and unwholesome actions.🔽Actions do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

analyzed: karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Even after a hundred aeons, actions do not perish.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When they meet the necessary conditions and the right time, they indeed bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani prabodhano nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi tathāgato🔽'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani prabodhanaḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi tathāgataḥ  rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: Monks, in the past, in a time gone by, there appeared in the world a Perfectly Awakened One named Prabodhana, a Tathāgata,

analyzed: śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One.

original: sa janapadacārikāṃ carann anyatamāṃ rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa janapada cārikām caran anyatamām rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: He, wandering through the country, arrived at a certain royal capital.

analyzed: atha rājñaḥ udyānam sarva kuśala saṃpannam babhūva
translated: Then the king's garden became endowed with all good qualities.

original: atha sa bhagavāṃs tad udyānaṃ praviśya rājānugrahārtham anyatamaṃ vṛkṣam upaniśritya niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa bhagavān tat udyānam praviśya rāja anugraha artham anyatamam vṛkṣam upaniśritya niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then that Blessed One, having entered that garden, sat down leaning on a certain tree, in order to show favor to the king.

analyzed: tatas saṃstaram prajñapya tejaḥ dhātum samāpannaḥ
translated: Then, having spread out a seat, he entered the fire element.

original: atha rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ strīmayena tūryeṇa vādyamānenodyānaṃ praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ strī mayena tūryeṇa vādyamānena udyānam praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Then the anointed king, with women's music being played, entered the garden.

original: atha sa rājā tad udyānam anuvicaran dadarśa bhagavantaṃ prabodhanaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ
analyzed: atha sa rājā tat udyānam anuvicaran dadarśa bhagavantam prabodhanam samyaksaṃbuddham
translated: Then that king, wandering through that garden, saw the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Prabodhana,

original: prāsādikaṃ prasādanīyaṃ śāntamānasaṃ parameṇa cittadamavyupaśamena samanvāgataṃ suvarṇayūpam
analyzed: prāsādikam prasādanīyam śānta mānasam parameṇa citta dama vyupaśamena samanvāgatam suvarṇa yūpam
translated: He was handsome, inspiring confidence, with a peaceful mind, endowed with the highest self-control and tranquility, like a golden sacrificial post.

analyzed: iva śriyā jvalantam
translated: He was handsome, inspiring confidence, with a peaceful mind, endowed with the highest self-control and tranquility, shining with glory like a golden sacrificial post.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ prasādajātaḥ sa rājā sāntaḥpuro vividhena vādyena vādyamānena bhagavantaṃ tataḥ samādheḥ prabodhayāmāsa /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar prasāda jātaḥ sa rājā sa antaḥpuraḥ vividhena vādyena vādyamānena bhagavantam tatas samādheḥ prabodhayāmāsa
translated: Seeing him, the king, filled with faith, together with his harem, with various musical instruments being played, awakened the Blessed One from that concentration.

analyzed: praṇītena ca āhareṇa pratipāditavān
translated: And he offered him excellent food.

analyzed: anuttarāyām ca samyaksaṃbodhau kṛtavān
translated: And he made the aspiration for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva / ahaṃ saḥ /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva aham saḥ
translated: What do you think, monks? The one who was the king at that time, on that occasion, was none other than me.

original: yan mayā prabodhanasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pūjā kṛtā /
analyzed: yat mayā prabodhanasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pūjā kṛtā
translated: The worship I offered to the Perfectly Awakened One Prabodhana,

original: tenaiva hetunā idānīṃ mama gāndharvikair evaṃvidhaṃ satkāraḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tena eva hetunā idānīm mama gāndharvikaiḥ evaṃvidham satkāraḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: by that very cause, now this kind of honor has been done to me by the musicians.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava evaṃ śikṣitavyam /🔽yac chāstāraṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam  yat śāstāram satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train thus:🔽'We will honor the teacher, respect the teacher, revere the teacher, and venerate the teacher.

original: śāstāraṃ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvopaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śāstāram satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having honored, respected, revered, and venerated the teacher, we will rely on him and live.'

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks were delighted and rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: vara daḥ
translated: The Giver of Boons. Edited by Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, tribal chieftains, charioteers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, who was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he and his community of monks received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: atha śrāvastyām anyatamaḥ pāradāriko maline karmaṇi vartate /
analyzed: atha śrāvastyām anyatamaḥ pāradārikaḥ maline karmaṇi vartate
translated: Now in Śrāvastī there was a certain adulterer who was engaged in a defiled action.

analyzed: sa rāja puruṣaiḥ gṛhītvā rājñaḥ upanāmitaḥ
translated: He was seized by the king's men and brought before the king.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: The physician.

original: tato rājñā aparādhika iti kṛtvā vadhya utsṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājñā aparādhikaḥ iti kṛtvā vadhyaḥ utsṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Then the king, considering him guilty, sentenced him to death.

original: sa rājapuruṣair nīlāmbaravasanair udyataśastraiḥ karavīramālābaddhakaṇṭheguṇo rathyāvīthīcatvaraśṛṅgāṭakeṣv anuśrāvyamāṇo dakṣiṇena nagaradvāreṇa
analyzed: sa rāja puruṣaiḥ nīla ambara vasanaiḥ udyata śastraiḥ karavīra mālā baddha kaṇṭheguṇaḥ rathyā vīthī catvara śṛṅgāṭakeṣu anuśrāvyamāṇaḥ dakṣiṇena nagara dvāreṇa
translated: He is led out through the southern gate of the city,

analyzed: apanīyate
translated: his neck bound with a noose of karavīra flowers, being announced in the streets, crossroads, and public places by royal messengers in blue garments and with raised weapons.

original: atrāntare nāsti kiṃcid buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam /
analyzed: atra antare na asti kiṃcid buddhānām bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing unknown, unseen, uncognized, or unrecognized by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ lokānugrahapravṛttakānām ekārakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām mahā kāruṇikānām loka anugraha pravṛttakānām eka ārakṣāṇām
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas, the Greatly Compassionate Ones, who act to favor the world, to have one protector,🔽who dwell in tranquility and insight, who are skilled in the three means of conversion,

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā vihāriṇām tri damatha vastu kuśalānām catur ogha uttīrṇānām catur ṛddhipāda caraṇa tala supratiṣṭhitānām
translated: who are well-established in the palms of the feet of the four bases of supernatural power,

analyzed: caturṣu saṃgraha vastuṣu dīrgha rātra kṛta paricayānām pañca aṅga viprahīṇānām pañca gati samatikrāntānām
translated: who have long been familiar with the four means of gathering disciples, who are free from the five factors, who have transcended the five destinies,

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṅga samanvāgatānām ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇānām sapta bodhyaṅga kusuma āḍhyānām aṣṭāṅga mārga deśikānām
translated: who possess the six factors, who have perfected the six perfections, who are adorned with the seven factors of enlightenment, who teach the eightfold path,

analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti kuśalānām daśa bala balinām daśa diś samāpūrṇa yaśasām daśa śata vaśavarti prativiśiṣṭānām
translated: skilled in the nine successive abodes of meditation, possessing the strength of the ten powers, whose fame fills the ten directions, superior to those who have mastered the ten hundred skills,

analyzed: tris rātreḥ tris divasasya ca
translated: three times by night and three times by day,

analyzed: buddha cakṣuṣā lokam vyavalokya jñāna darśanam pravartate
translated: having surveyed the world with the eye of a Buddha, knowledge and insight proceed thus:

original: ko hīyate ko vardhate kaḥ kṛcchraprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭaprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādhaprāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchrasaṃkaṭasaṃbādhaprāptaḥ ko 'pāyanimnaḥ ko 'pāyapravaṇaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ hīyate kaḥ vardhate kaḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭa prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādha prāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchra saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptaḥ pāya nimnaḥ kaḥ pāya pravaṇaḥ
translated: Who is declining? Who is growing? Who has met with misfortune? Who has met with difficulty? Who has met with a calamity? Who has met with misfortune, difficulty, and a calamity? Who is on a low path? Who is on a downward path?

analyzed: kaḥ pāya prāgbhāraḥ
translated: Who is on a path leading to a fall?

original: kam aham apāyād uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam /
analyzed: kam aham apāyāt uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I lift up from the lower realms and establish in heaven and liberation?

analyzed: kasya kāma paṅka nimagnasya hasta uddhāram anupradadyām
translated: Whom shall I give a helping hand to, who is sinking in the mud of desire?

analyzed: kam ārya dhana virahitam ārya dhana aiśvarya ādhipatye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I establish in the sovereignty of the wealth of the noble ones, who is devoid of the wealth of the noble ones?

analyzed: kasya ajñāna timira paṭala paryavanaddha netrasya jñāna añjana śalākayā cakṣuḥ viśodhayāmi  kasya an avaropitāni kuśala mulāni avaropayeyam
translated: With the ointment stick of knowledge, I shall purify the eye of whose eye is covered by the cataracts of ignorance?🔽In whom shall I plant the roots of virtue that have not been planted?

analyzed: kasya avaropitāni paripācayeyam
translated: In whom shall I bring to maturity the roots of virtue that have been planted?

analyzed: kasya paripakvāni vimocayeyam āha ca
translated: Whose [karmic] fruits are ripe that I may liberate? And he said:

analyzed: api eva atikramet velām sāgaraḥ makara ālayaḥ
translated: The ocean, the abode of makaras, may indeed transgress its boundary,

original: na tu vaineyavatsānāṃ buddho velām atikramet // / //
analyzed: na tu vaineya vatsānām buddhaḥ velām atikramet
translated: But the Buddha does not transgress the boundary of those beings to be trained who are like calves.

original: atha bhagavān pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya śrāvastīṃ piṇḍāya prāvikṣat /
analyzed: atha bhagavān pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya śrāvastīm piṇḍāya prāvikṣat
translated: Then the Blessed One, having dressed in the morning, took his bowl and robe and entered Śrāvastī for alms.

original: dadarśa sa puruṣo buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam🔽śītyānuvañjanair virājitagātraṃ vyāmaprabhālaṃkṛtaṃ sūryasahasrātirekaprabhaṃ jaṅgamam
analyzed: dadarśa sa puruṣaḥ buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam  śītyā anuvañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham jaṅgamam
translated: That man saw the Blessed Buddha, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks, adorned with a fathom-wide halo, with a brilliance surpassing a thousand suns, like a moving jeweled mountain, completely auspicious.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punar bhagavataḥ pādayor nipatya bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ nipatya bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: And having seen him, he fell at the feet of the Blessed One and said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: varāhaḥ smi bhagavan
translated: I am a pig, Blessed One.

analyzed: iṣṭam me jīvitam prayaccha iti
translated: Please grant me my life.

analyzed: tatas bhagavān āyuṣmantam ānandam āmantrayate
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the venerable Ānanda:

analyzed: gaccha ānanda rājānam prasenajitam
translated: Go, Ānanda, and tell King Prasenajit:

analyzed: vada anuprayaccha me etam puruṣam
translated: 'Give me that man.

analyzed: pravrājayāmi iti
translated: I will ordain him.'

original: athāyuṣmān ānando yena rājā prasenajit kauśalas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān ānandaḥ yena rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Venerable Ānanda approached King Prasenajit of Kośala,

original: upasaṃkramya rājānaṃ prasenajitaṃ kauśalaṃ bhagavadvacanenovāca / anujānīhi /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya rājānam prasenajitam kauśalam bhagavat vacanena uvāca anujānīhi
translated: and having approached, he spoke to King Prasenajit of Kośala with the Blessed One's words: Give permission.

analyzed: bhagavān etam puruṣam pravrājayati iti
translated: The Blessed One wants to go forth this man.

analyzed: bhavyarūpaḥ iti viditvā rājñā prasenajit kauśalena anujñātaḥ
translated: Knowing that he was suitable, he was given permission by King Prasenajit of Kośala.

original: sa bhagavatā pravrājita upasaṃpaditaś ca /🔽tena yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakaṃ saṃsāracakraṃ
analyzed: sa bhagavatā pravrājitaḥ upasaṃpaditaḥ ca  tena yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakam saṃsāra cakram
translated: He was gone forth by the Blessed One and ordained.🔽Endowed with that, striving, making effort,

analyzed: tat yathā saṃkṣiptāni viśālībhavanti
translated: For example, what was contracted becomes expanded.

original: hastinaḥ krośanti aśvāś ca heṣante ṛṣabhā nardante gṛhagatāni vividhavādyabhāṇḍāni svayaṃ nadanti /
analyzed: hastinaḥ krośanti aśvāḥ ca heṣante ṛṣabhāḥ nardante gṛha gatāni vividha vādya bhāṇḍāni svayam nadanti
translated: Elephants trumpet, horses neigh, bulls bellow, various musical instruments in houses sound by themselves.

analyzed: andhāḥ cakṣūṃṣi pratilabhante
translated: The blind receive sight.

analyzed: badhirāḥ śrotram mūkāḥ pravyāharaṇa samarthāḥ bhavanti
translated: The deaf receive hearing. The mute become able to speak.

analyzed: pariśiṣṭa indriya vikalāḥ indriyāṇi paripūrṇāni pratilabhante  madya mada ākṣiptāḥ vimadībhavanti
translated: Those deficient in other faculties receive them fully.🔽Those intoxicated by alcohol become sober.

analyzed: viṣa pītāḥ nirviṣībhavanti
translated: Those poisoned become free from poison.

analyzed: anyonya vairiṇaḥ maitrīm pratilabhante
translated: Mutual enemies become friendly.

analyzed: gurviṇyaḥ svastinaḥ prajāyante
translated: Pregnant women give birth safely.

analyzed: bandhana baddhāḥ vimucyante
translated: Those bound in prison are released.

analyzed: adhanāḥ dhanāni pratilabhante
translated: The poor receive wealth.

original: āntarikṣāś ca devāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragā divyaṃ puṣpam utsṛjanti //
analyzed: āntarikṣāḥ ca deva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ divyam puṣpam utsṛjanti
translated: Celestial beings, Asuras, Garudas, Kinnaras, and great serpents scatter divine flowers from the sky.

original: atha bhagavān evaṃvidhayā vibhūtyā rājakulaṃ praveṣṭum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān evaṃvidhayā vibhūtyā rājakulam praveṣṭum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One began to enter the royal palace with such splendor.

original: rājā ca bimbisāraḥ svayam eva bahirdvāraśālastho gośirṣacandanodakena pādyaṃ gṛhītvā bhagavataḥ pādau bhikṣusaṃghasya ca prākṣalayati /
analyzed: rājā ca bimbisāraḥ svayam eva bahirdvāra śāla sthaḥ gośirṣa candana udakena pādyam gṛhītvā bhagavataḥ pādau bhikṣu saṃghasya ca prākṣalayati
translated: And King Bimbisāra himself, standing outside the gatehouse, took water for washing the feet with, made of Gośīrṣa sandalwood, and washed the feet of the Blessed One and the community of monks.

original: sukhopaniṣaṇṇaṃ buddhapramukhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ viditvā śatarasenāhāreṇa pratipādayāmāsa /
analyzed: sukha upaniṣaṇṇam buddha pramukham bhikṣu saṃgham viditvā śata rasena āhāreṇa pratipādayāmāsa
translated: Knowing that the Buddha and the community of monks were seated comfortably, he served a meal of a hundred flavors.

analyzed: bhuktavantam kāśika vastraiḥ ācchāditavān
translated: After they had eaten, he covered them with Kāśika silk garments.

analyzed: tad haitukam ca āvarjitāḥ māgadhakāḥ paurāḥ
translated: And because of that, the people of Magadha were captivated.

original: tato bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Then the monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, who removes all doubts:

analyzed: kutra imāni bhagavatā kuśala mūlāni kṛtāni
translated: Blessed One, where were these roots of virtue created by the Blessed One,

original: yato bhagavata evaṃvidhā pūjā bhikṣusaṃghasya ceti /
analyzed: yatas bhagavataḥ evaṃvidhā pūjā bhikṣu saṃghasya ca iti
translated: so that the Blessed One and the community of monks are honored in this way?

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, in the past, in a different age, in this same city of Rājagṛha, there was a king named Mahāsudarśana.🔽He was a wheel-turning king, a righteous Dharma king, who had conquered the border regions, and was endowed with the seven treasures.🔽What were the seven?🔽They were the wheel treasure, the elephant treasure, the horse treasure, the jewel treasure, the woman treasure, the steward treasure, and the counselor treasure - this was the seventh.🔽He had a full one thousand sons, who were brave, heroic, and able to crush the armies of others.🔽He ruled over this earth, as far as the ocean, without stick or sword, by the Dharma, and with justice.🔽He had a capital city named Kusumapura, which was long, wide, and prosperous, with a great many inhabitants.🔽It was well-supplied with food, filled with various goods, and crowded with men, women, boys, and girls.🔽It was adorned with seven moats filled with water, with stairs made of the four precious substances.🔽It was surrounded by seven railings, seven ornamental nets, and seven lines of trees.🔽It was adorned with seven layers of palm trees made of the four precious substances.🔽It was adorned with seven layers of watchtowers made of the four precious substances.🔽It was adorned with seven layers of city walls made of the four precious substances.🔽It was adorned with seven layers of gates made of the four precious substances.🔽It was adorned with seven layers of moats filled with water, with stairs

original: tathāgatenaivaitāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: tathāgatena eva etāni bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: “Monks, these actions were performed and accumulated by the Tathāgata himself in other lives, in other births, in the past.

analyzed: mayā etāni karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: I performed and accumulated these actions.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience them?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated do not ripen upon the external earth element.🔽Nor upon the water element,

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: nor upon the fire element,

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: nor upon the wind element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /🔽na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpakoṭiśatair api /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca  na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated ripen upon the appropriated aggregates, elements, and sense bases.🔽Actions do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

analyzed: karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Even after a hundred aeons, actions ripen upon beings.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When the conditions and time are right, they certainly bear fruit.🔽Monks, in the past, in a certain village, there lived a certain householder.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani kṣemaṃkaro nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi tathāgato
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani kṣemaṃkaraḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi tathāgataḥ
translated: He had a son named Śreṣṭhika, who was well-known, famous, and wealthy.

original: 'rhan samyaksaṃbuddho vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ
analyzed: rhan samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ
translated: the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Perfected One, the Understander of the world, the unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, the Teacher of gods and men, the Buddha, the Fortunate One.

analyzed: śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: the Worthy One, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the Perfected One, the one with good conduct and good view, the Sugata, the knower of the world, the unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, the Teacher of gods and humans, the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: sa janapadacārikāṃ carann anyatamāṃ rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: sa janapada cārikām caran anyatamām rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: He, while wandering through the country, arrived at a certain royal capital.

analyzed: aśrauṣīt rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ
translated: The king, a consecrated kṣatriya, heard:

original: kṣemaṃkaraḥ samyaksaṃbuddho janapadacārikāṃ carann asmākaṃ rājadhānīm anuprāpta iti /
analyzed: kṣemaṃkaraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ janapada cārikām caran asmākam rājadhānīm anuprāptaḥ iti
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Kṣemaṅkara, while wandering through the country, has arrived at my royal capital.

original: śrutvā ca mahatyā rājarddhyā mahatā rājānubhāvena samanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca mahatyā rāja ṛddhyā mahatā rāja anubhāvena samanvāgataḥ
translated: Having heard that, endowed with great royal prosperity and great royal majesty,

analyzed: yena bhagavān kṣemaṃkaraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: he approached the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Kṣemaṅkara.

original: upasaṃkramya kṣemaṃkarasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya kṣemaṃkarasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Kṣemaṅkara and sat down to one side.

original: ekānte niṣaṇṇaṃ rājānaṃ kṣatriyaṃ mūrdhābhiṣiktam kṣemaṃkaraḥ samyaksaṃbuddho bodhikarakair dharmaiḥ samādāpayati /
analyzed: ekānte niṣaṇṇam rājānam kṣatriyam mūrdhābhiṣiktam kṣemaṃkaraḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bodhi karakaiḥ dharmaiḥ samādāpayati
translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Kṣemaṅkara instructed the king, the consecrated kṣatriya, who was sitting to one side, with teachings that inspire awakening.

original: atha sa rājā labdhaprasādaḥ kṣemaṃkaraṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ rājakule nimantrya śatarasenāhāreṇa pratipādayāmāsa /
analyzed: atha sa rājā labdha prasādaḥ kṣemaṃkaram samyaksaṃbuddham rājakule nimantrya śata rasena āhāreṇa pratipādayāmāsa
translated: Then the king, having gained faith, invited the Perfectly Awakened One Kṣemaṃkara to the royal palace and offered him a meal of a hundred flavors.

analyzed: śata sāhasreṇa ca vastreṇa ācchādayāmāsa
translated: He also clothed him with a hundred thousand garments.

original: parinirvṛtasya ca samantayojanaṃ stūpaṃ kāritavān krośam uccatvena //
analyzed: parinirvṛtasya ca samanta yojanam stūpam kāritavān krośam ucca tvena
translated: And after his parinirvāṇa, he built a stūpa for him, one yojana in circumference and one krośa in height.

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva / ahaṃ saḥ /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva aham saḥ
translated: Monks, what do you think? The one who was the king at that time, on that occasion, was none other than me.

original: yan mayā kṣemaṃkarasya samyaksaṃbuddhasyaivaṃvidhāṃ pūjā kṛtā /
analyzed: yat mayā kṣemaṃkarasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya evaṃvidhām pūjā kṛtā
translated: Because I made such offerings to the Perfectly Awakened One Kṣemaṃkara,

analyzed: tena mayā saṃsāre nantam sukham anubhūtam
translated: I experienced endless happiness in saṃsāra.

original: idānīṃ tenaiva hetunā rājā bimbisāreṇāpi tathāgatasya me evaṃvidhā pūjā kṛtā /
analyzed: idānīm tena eva hetunā rājā bimbisāreṇa api tathāgatasya me evaṃvidhā pūjā kṛtā
translated: And now, for the very same reason, King Bimbisāra has made such offerings to me, the Tathāgata.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava evaṃ śikṣitavyam /🔽yac chāstāraṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam  yat śāstāram satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train in this way:🔽'We will honor, respect, revere, and worship the Teacher.

original: śāstāraṃ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvopaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śāstāram satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having honored, respected, revered, and worshipped the Teacher, we will rely on him and abide.'

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks were delighted and rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: divya bhojanam
translated: divine food.

original: ed / Speyer / vol / I🔽buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: e t speyer vol i  buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair🔽iti devanāgayakṣāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragābhyarcito buddho bhagavān jñāto mahāpuṇyo
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ  iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers, country-folk, traders, local rulers, Brahmins, and householders, as well as gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, who was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, who was the knower of the world, the guide of human and divine beings, the teacher of gods and humans, the enlightened one, the blessed one, together with the community of monks and the community of nuns,

analyzed: rājagṛhe viharati veṇuvane kalandakanivāpe
translated: was dwelling in Rājagṛha, in the Bamboo Grove, at the squirrels' feeding ground.

original: tatra anyataraḥ śreṣṭhī āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogo vistīrṇaviśālaparigraho vaiśravaṇadhanasamudito
analyzed: tatra anyataraḥ śreṣṭhī āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ vistīrṇa viśāla parigrahaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana samuditaḥ
translated: There, a certain guild president was wealthy, with great riches and great possessions, with a vast and extensive following, equal in wealth to Vaiśravaṇa,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: a physician.

analyzed: vaiśravaṇa dhana pratispardhī tīrthya abhiprasannaḥ ca
translated: equal in wealth to Vaiśravaṇa, and devoted to non-Buddhist traditions.

original: sa āyuṣmatā mahāmaudgalyāyanenāvarjitaḥ śāsane ca avatārito bhagavaty atyartham abhiprasannaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ āyuṣmatā mahāmaudgalyāyanena āvarjitaḥ śāsane ca avatāritaḥ bhagavati atyartham abhiprasannaḥ
translated: He was attracted by the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana and introduced to the teaching. He became extremely devoted to the Blessed One.

analyzed: sa ca gṛhapatiḥ udāra adhimuktaḥ
translated: And that householder had lofty aspirations.

analyzed: tena āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ uktaḥ
translated: He said to the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana,

analyzed: sahāyaḥ me bhava
translated: Be my companion.

analyzed: icchāmi bhagavataḥ pūjām kartum iti
translated: I wish to make an offering to the Blessed One.

original: adhivāsayaty āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanas tasya gṛhapates tūṣṇībhāvena /
analyzed: adhivāsayati āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ tasya gṛhapateḥ tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana assented to the householder by remaining silent.

original: athāyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanas taṃ gṛhapatim ādāya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ tam gṛhapatim ādāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana, taking that householder with him, approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat down to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇa āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyano bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇaḥ āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: While sitting to one side, the venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana said this to the Blessed One:

original: ayaṃ bhadanta gṛhapatir ākāṅkṣati bhagavantaṃ saśrāvakasaṃghaṃ bhojayitum /🔽tad asya bhagavān adhivāsayed anukampām upādāyeti /
analyzed: ayam bhadanta gṛhapatiḥ ākāṅkṣati bhagavantam sa śrāvaka saṃgham bhojayitum  tat asya bhagavān adhivāsayet anukampām upādāya iti
translated: Venerable, this householder wishes to feed the Blessed One and the community of monks.🔽May the Blessed One, out of compassion, consent to his request.

analyzed: adhivāsayati bhagavān tasya gṛhapateḥ tūṣṇībhāvnā
translated: The Blessed One assented to the householder by remaining silent.

original: atha sa gṛhapatir bhagavatas tūṣṇībhāvenādhivāsanāṃ viditvā śatarasam āhāraṃ samudānayati /
analyzed: atha sa gṛhapatiḥ bhagavataḥ tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsanām viditvā śata rasam āhāram samudānayati
translated: Then, the householder, knowing the Blessed One's silent consent, prepared a hundred-flavored meal,

analyzed: puṣpa gandha mālya vilepanāni ca
translated: and flowers, incense, garlands, and ointments.

analyzed: āyuṣmatā api mahāmaudgalyāyanena śakraḥ deva indraḥ dhīṣṭaḥ
translated: And the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana requested Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

analyzed: kriyatām asya gṛhapateḥ upasaṃhāraḥ iti
translated: Please assist this householder.

original: tataḥ śakreṇa devendreṇa veṇuvanaṃ nandavanam abhinirmitam /
analyzed: tatas śakreṇa deva indreṇa veṇu vanam nanda vanam abhinirmitam
translated: Then Śakra, Lord of the Gods, magically created a bamboo grove and a Nandana grove,

analyzed: airāvaṇa su pratiṣṭhita sadṛśāni ca nāga sahasrāṇi
translated: and thousands of elephants like Airāvaṇa and Supratiṣṭhita,

analyzed: vāla vyajanena vījayanti  supriya pañcaśikha tumbaru prabhṛtīni speyeḥ śtumburu ś
translated: fanning with yak-tail whisks.

original: cānekāni gandharvasahasrāṇy upanītāni ye vicitrair vādyaviśeṣair vādyaṃ kurvanti /
analyzed: ca anekāni gandharva sahasrāṇi upanītāni ye vicitraiḥ vādya viśeṣaiḥ vādyam kurvanti
translated: And many thousands of gandharvas led by Suprīya, Pañcaśikha, Tumburu, and others,

analyzed: divyam ca sudhā bhojanam
translated: prepared divine nectar food.

original: tataḥ sa gṛhapatir divyamānuṣair upakaraṇair bhagavantam upasthāya sarvāṅgeṇa bhagavataḥ pādayor nipatya praṇīdhānaṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas sa gṛhapatiḥ divya mānuṣaiḥ upakaraṇaiḥ bhagavantam upasthāya sarva aṅgeṇa bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ nipatya praṇīdhānam kartum ārabdhaḥ

translated: By this wholesome action, this thought, this giving up of the gift of Dharma, may I become a Buddha in a world that is blind, leaderless, and without a guide, to liberate those beings who are not liberated,🔽to free those who are not freed,🔽to comfort those who are not at ease,

analyzed: a parinirvṛtānām parinirvāpayitā iti
translated: By this wholesome root, this thought of enlightenment, this giving up of the gift, may I become a Buddha in a world that is blind, a leader in a world that is leaderless, a teacher in a world that is teacherless, an unsurpassed guide for those to be tamed, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those to be tamed, a teacher of gods and men, a Buddha, a Bhagavat, a deliverer of those to be delivered, a liberator of those to be liberated, a comforter of those to be comforted, a parinirvāṇa-er of those not yet parinirvāṇa-ed.

translated: These actions were performed and accumulated by me.

translated: The Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa, wandering by stages through the country, has arrived at my royal capital.

original: śrutvā ca punar mahatyā rājarddhyā mahatā rājānubhāvena samanvāgato yena bhagavān pūrṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhas tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: śrutvā ca punar mahatyā rāja ṛddhyā mahatā rāja anubhāvena samanvāgataḥ yena bhagavān pūrṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Having heard this, he approached the Blessed One, the Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa, endowed with great royal prosperity and great royal majesty.

original: upasaṃkramya pūrṇasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya pūrṇasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa and sat to one side.

original: ekānte niṣaṇṇaṃ rājānaṃ kṣatriyaṃ mūrdhābhiṣiktaṃ pūrṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddho bodhikarakair dharmaiḥ samādāpayati /
analyzed: ekānte niṣaṇṇam rājānam kṣatriyam mūrdhābhiṣiktam pūrṇaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ bodhi karakaiḥ dharmaiḥ samādāpayati
translated: While he was sitting to one side, the Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa instructed the head-anointed kṣatriya king with teachings that bring about awakening.

original: atha rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ pūrṇaṃ samyaksaṃbuddhaṃ saśrāvakasaṃghaṃ traimāsyaṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārair 🔽upanimantritavān /
analyzed: atha rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ pūrṇam samyaksaṃbuddham sa śrāvaka saṃgham traimāsyam cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ  upanimantritavān
translated: Then the head-anointed kṣatriya king invited the Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa and his community of disciples to a three-month rains retreat, with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick.

original: adhivāsitaṃ ca pūrṇena samyaksaṃbuddhena rājñas tūṣṇībhāvena /
analyzed: adhivāsitam ca pūrṇena samyaksaṃbuddhena rājñaḥ tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: [But] the Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa accepted the king's invitation with silence.

original: atha rājā kṣatriyo mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ pūrṇasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tūṣṇībhāvenādhivāsanāṃ
analyzed: atha rājā kṣatriyaḥ mūrdhābhiṣiktaḥ pūrṇasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsanām
translated: Then the head-anointed kṣatriya king, understanding that the Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa had accepted his invitation by remaining silent,

analyzed: viditvā traimāsyam cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ upasthāpya
translated: Having known this, he served the Blessed One for three months with robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicine for the sick, and other necessities,

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ratna maya pratimām kārayitvā buddha harṣam kāritavān
translated: and had a jeweled statue of the Blessed One made, and a Buddha festival was held.

analyzed: yatra anekaiḥ prāṇi śata sahasraiḥ mahā prasādaḥ labdhaḥ
translated: At which many hundreds of thousands of living beings received great faith.

analyzed: tathā itu tad pratyayam ca te parinirvṛtāḥ
translated: And for that very reason, they attained final nirvāṇa.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidyā.

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva / ahaṃ saḥ /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena rājā babhūva aham saḥ
translated: What do you think, monks? The one who was the king at that time, on that occasion, was none other than me.

original: yan mayā pūrṇasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tādṛśī pūjā kṛtā /
analyzed: yat mayā pūrṇasya samyaksaṃbuddhasya tādṛśī pūjā kṛtā
translated: Because I made such an offering to the Perfectly Awakened One Pūrṇa,

analyzed: tena me saṃsāre nantam sukham anubhūtam
translated: I experienced endless happiness in saṃsāra.

original: tenaiva ca hetunā tathāgatasya ca me śreṣṭhinā śakreṇa ca īdṛśī pūjā kṛtā /
analyzed: tena eva ca hetunā tathāgatasya ca me śreṣṭhinā śakreṇa ca īdṛśī pūjā kṛtā
translated: And for that very reason, the Tathāgata was made such an offering by the merchant and Śakra.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava evaṃ śikṣitavyam /🔽yac chāstāraṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ evam śikṣitavyam  yat śāstāram satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Therefore, monks, you should train thus:🔽'We will honor, respect, revere, and worship the Teacher.

original: śāstāraṃ satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvopaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śāstāram satkṛtya gurukṛtya mānayitvā pūjayitvā upaniśritya vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Having honored, respected, revered, and worshipped the Teacher, we will rely on him and abide.'

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks were delighted and rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy. p.

analyzed: tṛtīyaḥ vargaḥ
translated: The third chapter.

analyzed: tasya uddānam
translated: Its summary:

original: candano hy atha padmaś ca cakraṃ daśaśirās tathā /
analyzed: candanaḥ hi atha padmaḥ ca cakram daśaśirāḥ tathā
translated: Chandana, Padma, Cakra, Dasha-shira,

analyzed: sūkṣmatvac śītadīptaḥ ca nāvikā gandhamādanaḥ
translated: Sukshma-tvak, Shita-dipta, Navika, Gandhamadana,

original: nirmalo valgusvaraś ca vargo bhavati sattamaḥ //
analyzed: nirmalaḥ valgu svaraḥ ca vargaḥ bhavati sattamaḥ
translated: Nirmala, Valgu-swara - this becomes the excellent seventh chapter.

analyzed: candanaḥ
translated: Chandana. Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, tribal chieftains, charioteers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas. He was known as the one with great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: the one who obtained robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for the sick, together with the community of monks.

original: magadheṣu janapadeṣu cārikāṃ caran gaṅgātīram anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: magadheṣu janapadeṣu cārikām caran gaṅgā tīram anuprāptaḥ
translated: He was wandering through the Magadha country and reached the bank of the Ganges.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena gaṅgātīrasya nātidūre stūpam avarugṇaṃ vātātapābhyāṃ pariśīrṇam /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena gaṅgā tīrasya na atidūre stūpam avarugṇam vāta ātapābhyām pariśīrṇam
translated: At that time, not far from the bank of the Ganges, there was a stupa that had been damaged by wind and sun.

original: bhikṣubhir dṛṣṭvā bhagavān pṛṣṭaḥ kasya bhagavann ayaṃ stūpa iti /
analyzed: bhikṣubhiḥ dṛṣṭvā bhagavān pṛṣṭaḥ kasya bhagavan ayam stūpaḥ iti
translated: The monks saw it and asked the Blessed One, Blessed One, whose stupa is this?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

analyzed: candanaḥ nāma pratyekabuddhaḥ babhūva tasya iti
translated: It belongs to a pratyekabuddha named Candana.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The monks said,

original: kuto bhagavaṃś candanasya pratyekabuddhasyotpattir nāmābhinirvṛttiś ceti /
analyzed: kutas bhagavan candanasya pratyekabuddhasya utpattiḥ nāma abhinirvṛttiḥ ca iti
translated: Blessed One, where did the pratyekabuddha Candana originate and where did he attain final nirvāṇa?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: icchatha yūyaṃ bhikṣavaḥ śrotuṃ yathā candanasya pratyekabuddhasyotpattir nāmābhinirvṛttiś ca /
analyzed: icchatha yūyam bhikṣavaḥ śrotum yathā candanasya pratyekabuddhasya utpattiḥ nāma abhinirvṛttiḥ ca
translated: Monks, do you wish to hear how the pratyekabuddha Candana originated and attained final nirvāṇa?

analyzed: evam bhadanta
translated: Yes, Bhadanta.

analyzed: tena hi bhikṣavaḥ śṛṇuta
translated: Then, monks, listen.

original: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta / bhāṣiṣye //
analyzed: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye
translated: Listen well and pay attention. I will speak.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani vārāṇasyāṃ nagaryāṃ brahmadatto nāma rājā rājyaṃ
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani vārāṇasyām nagaryām brahmadattaḥ nāma rājā rājyam
translated: Monks, in the past, long ago, in the city of Vārāṇasī, there was a king named Brahmadatta who ruled the earth as far as the ocean.

original: kārayati ṛddhaṃ ca sphītaṃ ca kṣemaṃ ca subhikṣaṃ ca ākīrṇabahujanamanuṣyaṃ ca praśāntakalikalahaḍimbaḍamaraṃ
analyzed: kārayati ṛddham ca sphītam ca kṣemam ca subhikṣam ca ākīrṇa bahu jana manuṣyam ca praśānta kali kalaha ḍimba ḍamaram
translated: He ruled over a prosperous, flourishing, safe, and well-populated kingdom, free from troubles, quarrels, famine, and disease,

analyzed: taskara roga apagatam śāli ikṣu go mahiṣī saṃpannam
translated: with plenty of food, sugarcane, cattle, and buffaloes.

analyzed: dhārmikaḥ dharma rājaḥ dharmeṇa rājyam kārayati
translated: He was a righteous king who ruled his kingdom righteously.

original: so 'putraḥ putrābhinandī śivavaruṇakuberaśakrabrahmādīn anyāṃś ca devatāviśeṣān āyācate tadyathā /
analyzed: saḥ putraḥ putra abhinandī śiva varuṇa kubera śakra brahma ādīn anyān ca devatā viśeṣān āyācate tat yathā
translated: He was sonless, and longed for a son. He made offerings to Śiva, Varuṇa, Kubera, Śakra, Brahmā, and other specific gods, such as

original: ārāmadevatā vanadevatāś catvaradevatāḥ śṛṅgāṭakadevatā balipratigrāhikā devatāḥ /
analyzed: ārāma devatāḥ vana devatāḥ catvara devatāḥ śṛṅgāṭaka devatāḥ bali pratigrāhikāḥ devatāḥ
translated: gods of groves, gods of forests, gods of crossroads, gods of junctions, gods who receive offerings,

original: sahajāḥ sahadhārmikā nityānubaddhā api devatā āyācate /
analyzed: sahajāḥ saha dhārmikāḥ nityānubaddhāḥ api devatāḥ āyācate
translated: gods born together, gods of the same Dharma, and gods who are always attached.

original: asti caiṣa loke pravādo yadāyācanahetoḥ putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: asti ca eṣa loke pravādaḥ yadā āyācana hetoḥ putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: There is this saying in the world: Sons and daughters are born as a result of making offerings.

analyzed: tat ca na evam
translated: But that is not so.

original: yady evam abhaviṣyad ekaikasya putrasahasram abhaviṣyat tadyathā rājñaś cakravartinaḥ /
analyzed: yadi evam abhaviṣyat ekaikasya putra sahasram abhaviṣyat tat yathā rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ
translated: If it were so, each person would have a thousand sons, like a universal monarch.

original: api tu trayāṇāṃ sthānānāṃ saṃmukhībhāvāt putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: api tu trayāṇām sthānānām saṃmukhībhāvāt putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: But rather, sons and daughters are born when three factors come together.

analyzed: katameṣām trayāṇām
translated: What are the three?

analyzed: mātā pitarau raktau bhavataḥ saṃnipatitau
translated: When the mother and father are passionate and come together,

analyzed: mātā ca kalyā bhavati ṛtumatī
translated: and the mother is healthy and in season,

analyzed: gandharvaḥ ca pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: and the gandharva is present,

original: eṣāṃ trayāṇāṃ sthānānāṃ saṃmukhībhāvāt putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: eṣām trayāṇām sthānānām saṃmukhībhāvāt putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: from the coming together of these three factors, sons and daughters are born.

analyzed: sa ca evam āyācana paraḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: And he remained thus, making requests.

analyzed: tasya ca udyāne mahāpadmini
translated: And in his garden there was a large lotus pond.

analyzed: tatra padmam atipramāṇam jātam
translated: There a lotus of extraordinary size was born.

original: tad divase divase vardhate na tu phullati /
analyzed: tat divase divase vardhate na tu phullati
translated: It grew day by day, but did not bloom.

analyzed: tatas ārāmikeṇa rājñe niveditam
translated: Then the gardener reported it to the king.

original: rajñā uktaḥ parīkṣyatām etat padmam iti /
analyzed: rajñā uktaḥ parīkṣyatām etat padmam iti
translated: The king said, Examine that lotus.

original: yāvad apareṇa samayena sūryodaye tat padmaṃ vikasitam /
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena sūrya udaye tat padmam vikasitam
translated: Then at another time, at sunrise, that lotus opened.

original: tasya ca padmasya karṇikāyāṃ dārakaḥ paryaṅkaṃ baddhvāvasthitaḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca padmasya karṇikāyām dārakaḥ paryaṅkam baddhvā avasthitaḥ
translated: And on the pericarp of that lotus, a boy was sitting cross-legged.

analyzed: abhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ
translated: He was handsome, good-looking,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: a doctor.

original: prāsādiko gauraḥ kanakavarṇaś chatrākāraśirāḥ pralambabāhur vistīrṇalalāṭaḥ uccaghoṣaḥ
analyzed: prāsādikaḥ gauraḥ kanaka varṇaḥ chatra ākāra śirāḥ pralamba bāhuḥ vistīrṇa lalāṭaḥ ucca ghoṣaḥ
translated: He was beautiful, fair-complexioned, golden-colored, with a head shaped like a parasol, long arms, a broad forehead, a loud voice,🔽and a large head.

original: saṃgatabrūs tuṅganāsaḥ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtagātro 'śītyānuvyañjanair virājitagātraḥ /
analyzed: saṃgatabrūḥ tuṅga nāsaḥ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛta gātraḥ śītyā anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātraḥ
translated: He had a well-proportioned body, a prominent nose, and was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man and the eighty minor marks.

original: tasya mukhāt padmagandho vāti śarīrāc ca candanagandhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya mukhāt padma gandhaḥ vāti śarīrāt ca candana gandhaḥ
translated: From his mouth came the fragrance of lotuses, and from his body the fragrance of sandalwood.

analyzed: tatas ārāmikeṇa rājñe niveditam
translated: Then the park keeper reported to the king.

original: tato rājā sāmātyaḥ sāntaḥpuraś ca tad udyānaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājā sa amātyaḥ sa antaḥpuraḥ ca tat udyānam gataḥ
translated: Then the king, together with his ministers and harem, went to that park.

original: sahadarśanāt tena dārakeṇa rājā saṃbhāṣitaḥ / ehi tāta /
analyzed: saha darśanāt tena dārakeṇa rājā saṃbhāṣitaḥ ehi tāta
translated: As soon as he saw the child, the king was addressed by him: Come, father.

analyzed: aham te putrasya putraḥ iti
translated: I am your son, you who have no son.

analyzed: tatas rājā hṛṣṭa tuṣṭa pramuditaḥ uvāca
translated: Then the king, delighted, satisfied, and joyful, said:

analyzed: evam eva putra yathā vadasi iti
translated: Just so, son, as you say.

original: tato rājā padminīm avagāhya taṃ dārakaṃ padmakarṇikāyāṃ gṛhītvā pāṇitale sthāpitavān /
analyzed: tatas rājā padminīm avagāhya tam dārakam padma karṇikāyām gṛhītvā pāṇi tale sthāpitavān
translated: Then the king, having entered the lotus pond, took the child from the lotus calyx and placed him in his palm.

original: yatra yatra sa dārakaḥ pādau sthāpayati /
analyzed: yatra yatra sa dārakaḥ pādau sthāpayati
translated: Wherever the child placed his feet,

analyzed: tatra tatra padmāni prādurbhavanti
translated: there lotuses appeared.

original: tatas tasya candana iti nāma kṛtam //
analyzed: tatas tasya candanaḥ iti nāma kṛtam
translated: Then his name was given as Candana.

analyzed: yadā candanaḥ dārakaḥ nupūrveṇa mahān saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: And when the child Candana had gradually grown up,

analyzed: tadā nāgaraiḥ rājā vijñaptaḥ
translated: then the citizens informed the king:

analyzed: iha asmākam deva nagara parva pratyupasthitam
translated: Here, O god, our city festival has arrived.

original: tad arhati devaś candanaṃ kumāram utsraṣṭam Speyer / utsraṣṭum/
analyzed: tat arhati devaḥ candanam kumāram utsraṣṭam speyeḥ utsraṣṭum
translated: Therefore, O god, it is fitting that you release Prince Candana to

analyzed: asmābhiḥ saha parva anubhaviṣyati
translated: enjoy the festival with us.

analyzed: padmaiḥ ca sarvam adhiṣṭhānam alaṃkariṣyati iti
translated: He will adorn the entire palace with lotuses.

analyzed: rājā āha evam astu iti
translated: The king said, So be it.

original: tataś candanaḥ sarvālaṃkāravibhūṣito 'mātyaputraparivṛto vividhair vādyair vādyamānai rājakulād bahir upayāti nagaraparva pratyanubhavitum
analyzed: tatas candanaḥ sarva alaṃkāra vibhūṣitaḥ mātya putra parivṛtaḥ vividhaiḥ vādyaiḥ vādyamānaiḥ rājakulāt bahis upayāti nagara parva pratyanubhavitum
translated: Then Candana, adorned with all ornaments, surrounded by the sons of ministers, with various musical instruments playing, went out of the royal palace to enjoy the city festival.

original: tatra tasya gacchataḥ padavinyāse padavinyāse padmāni prādurbhavanti darśanīyāni manoramāṇi ca /
analyzed: tatra tasya gacchataḥ pada vinyāse pada vinyāse padmāni prādurbhavanti darśanīyāni manoramāṇi ca
translated: As he was going there, beautiful and delightful lotuses appeared with each step he took.

analyzed: tāni arka raśmibhiḥ spṛṣṭa mātrāṇi mlāyanti śuṣyanti
translated: As soon as they were touched by the sun's rays, they withered and dried up.

original: atha tasya śuddhasatvasya kalyāṇāśayasya pūrvabuddhāvaropitakuśalamūlasya taddarśanād yoniśo manasikāra utpannaḥ /
analyzed: atha tasya śuddha satvasya kalyāṇa āśayasya pūrva buddha avaropita kuśala mūlasya tad darśanāt yoniśas manasikāraḥ utpannaḥ
translated: Then, for that pure being with a wholesome intention, who had planted roots of merit under previous Buddhas, a proper reflection arose from seeing that:

analyzed: yathā imāni padmāni utpanna mātrāṇi śobhante
translated: Just as these lotuses, as soon as they appear, are beautiful,

analyzed: arka raśmi paritāpitāni mlāyanti śuṣyanti
translated: but when scorched by the sun's rays, wither and dry up,

analyzed: evam etat api śarīram iti

analyzed: tad kālam svayam adhigamya vīra buddhyā
translated: At that time, O hero, having understood by yourself with your wisdom,

translated: O Jina, O leader of ascetics, the listeners are longing.

analyzed: dhīrābhiḥ muni vṛṣa vāgbhiḥ uttamābhiḥ
translated: With your sublime and excellent words, O wise one, O bull among sages,

analyzed: utpannam vyapanaya saṃśayam śubhābhiḥ  lavaṇajala adrirāja dhairyāḥ

analyzed: saṃbuddhāḥ smitam upadarśayanti nāthāḥ
translated: Do not display a smile without reason.

analyzed: yasya arthe smitam upadarśayanti dhīrāḥ
translated: For the sake of which the wise ones display a smile,

original: taṃ śrotuṃ samabhilaṣanti te janaughāḥ // / // iti
analyzed: tam śrotum samabhilaṣanti te jana oghāḥ iti
translated: Those multitudes of people long to hear it.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: evam etat ānanda evam etat
translated: So it is, Ananda, so it is.

original: nāhetvapratyayam ānanda tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitaṃ prāviṣkurvanti /
analyzed: na a hetu a pratyayam ānanda tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ smitam prāviṣkurvanti
translated: Ananda, the Tathagatas, the Arhats, the Fully Enlightened Ones, do not display a smile without a cause or condition.

analyzed: evam bhadanta

translated: This girl, Ananda, by this wholesome root, this thought of enlightenment, and this relinquishment of a gift of Dharma, will not go to the lower realms for fifteen eons.

original: divyaṃ mānuṣaṃ sukham anubhūya ca cakrāntaro nāma pratyekabuddho bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: divyam mānuṣam sukham anubhūya ca cakrāntaraḥ nāma pratyekabuddhaḥ bhaviṣyati
