translated: all of them will meet their end.

analyzed: jana kāyena ca rājñe bimbisārāya niveditam
translated: And it was reported to King Bimbisāra by the people.

analyzed: atha rājñaḥ bimbisārasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to King Bimbisāra:

original: kas taṃ śakyati vinetum anyatra buddhād bhagavata iti /
analyzed: kaḥ tam śakyati vinetum anyatra buddhāt bhagavataḥ iti
translated: Who, other than the Blessed Buddha, is able to tame him?

original: atha rājā bimbisāro mahājanakāyaparivṛto yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha rājā bimbisāraḥ mahā jana kāya parivṛtaḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then King Bimbisāra, surrounded by a great crowd of people, approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇaṃ rājānaṃ bimbisāraṃ bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇam rājānam bimbisāram bhagavān dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśayati samādāpayati samuttejayati saṃpraharṣayati
translated: While King Bimbisāra was sitting to one side, the Blessed One instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted him with a discourse on Dharma.

original: anekaparyāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm /
analyzed: aneka paryāyeṇa dharmyayā kathayā saṃdarśya samādāpya samuttejya saṃpraharṣya tūṣṇīm
translated: Having instructed, inspired, fired, and delighted him with a discourse on Dharma in many ways, he was silent.

original: atha rājā bimbisāra utthāyāsanād ekāṃsam uttarāsaṅgaṃ kṛtvā dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavāṃs tenāñjaliṃ praṇamya
analyzed: atha rājā bimbisāraḥ utthāya āsanāt eka aṃsam uttarāsaṅgam kṛtvā dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya yena bhagavān tena añjalim praṇamya
translated: Then King Bimbisāra rose from his seat, arranged his upper robe over one shoulder, placed his right knee on the ground,

analyzed: bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: and said this to the Blessed One:

original: iha bhagavan rājagṛhe nagare 'muṣminn udyāne mahānāśīviṣaḥ kṛṣṇasarpo dṛṣṭiviṣaḥ prativasati /
analyzed: iha bhagavan rājagṛhe nagare muṣmin udyāne mahān āśīviṣaḥ kṛṣṇa sarpaḥ dṛṣṭi viṣaḥ prativasati
translated: Here, Blessed One, in this park in the city of Rājagṛha, a great poisonous snake, a black serpent with a poisonous gaze, dwells.

analyzed: mahājana vipraghātam karoti
translated: It causes great harm to people.

original: sādhu bhagavāṃs tam vinayed anukampām upādāyeti /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavān tam vinayet anukampām upādāya iti
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would subdue it out of compassion.

analyzed: adhivāsayati bhagavān rājñaḥ bimbisārasya tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: The Blessed One assented to King Bimbisāra by remaining silent.

original: atha rājā bimbisāro bhagavatas tūṣṇībhāvenādhivāsanāṃ viditvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvotthāyāsanāt prakrāntaḥ //
analyzed: atha rājā bimbisāraḥ bhagavataḥ tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsanām viditvā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā utthāya āsanāt prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then King Bimbisāra, knowing that the Blessed One had assented by remaining silent, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, rose from his seat, and departed.

original: atha bhagavāṃs tasyā eva rātrer atyayāt pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya yena tad udyānaṃ tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tasyāḥ eva rātreḥ atyayāt pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya yena tat udyānam tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, having passed the night, in the morning, having put on his robes and taken his bowl, approached the park.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavatā sūryasahasrātirekaprabhāḥ kanakavarṇā marīcaya utsṛṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavatā sūrya sahasra atireka prabhāḥ kanaka varṇāḥ marīcayaḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ
translated: Having approached, the Blessed One emitted golden rays surpassing a thousand suns.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidyāpatha

analyzed: yaiḥ tat udyānam sarvam avabhāsitam
translated: By which that garden was all illuminated.

analyzed: kalpa sahasra paribhāvitāḥ ca maitrī aṃśavaḥ utsṛṣṭāḥ
translated: And he emitted rays of friendliness matured for a thousand eons.

analyzed: yaiḥ asya spṛṣṭa mātram śarīram prahlāditam
translated: By which, as soon as his body was touched, it was refreshed.

original: atha sa āśīviṣa itaś cāmutaś ca prekṣitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: atha saḥ āśīviṣaḥ itas ca amutas ca prekṣitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then that venomous snake began to look around,

original: kasya prabhāvān mama śarīraṃ prahlāditam iti /
analyzed: kasya prabhāvāt mama śarīram prahlāditam iti
translated: Whose power has refreshed my body?

original: athāsau dadarśa buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
analyzed: atha asau dadarśa buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
translated: Then he saw the Buddha, the Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: aśītyā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks, adorned with a fathom-wide halo, his radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

analyzed: jaṅgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: like a moving jeweled mountain, beautiful on all sides.

analyzed: saha darśanāt ca anena bhagavataḥ ntike citam prasāditam
translated: And as soon as he saw him, his mind was filled with faith in the Blessed One.

original: prassannacittasya ca bhagavatā tan mayyā gatyās tan mayyā yonyā dharmo deśitaḥ /
analyzed: prassanna cittasya ca bhagavatā tat mayyāḥ gatyāḥ tat mayyāḥ yonyāḥ dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: And the Blessed One, knowing that his mind was ready, taught him the Dharma that was appropriate for him, that was good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, with its own meaning, with its own phrasing, complete,🔽pure,🔽and purified.

analyzed: bhadra mukha tvayā eva etat dravyam upārjitam
translated: Good man, you yourself earned this wealth.

analyzed: yena tvam āśīviṣa gatim upapāditaḥ
translated: By which you were reborn as a venomous snake.

analyzed: sādhu mama antike cittam prasādya
translated: It is good that you have faith in me.

analyzed: asmāt ca nidhānāt cittam virāgaya
translated: And turn your mind away from this treasure.

original: mā haiva itaḥ kālaṃ kṛtvā narakeṣūpapatsyasa iti /
analyzed: mā ha eva itas kālam kṛtvā narakeṣu upapatsyase iti
translated: Do not, after dying from here, be reborn in the hells.

analyzed: yadā asya bhagavatā jātiḥ smāritā
translated: When the Blessed One reminded him of his past life,

analyzed: tadā roditum pravṛttaḥ
translated: he began to weep.

original: atha bhagavāṃs tasyāṃ velāyāṃ gāthe bhāṣate /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tasyām velāyām gāthe bhāṣate
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke this verse on that occasion:

analyzed: idānīm kim kariṣyāmi tiryagyoni gatasya te
translated: What can I do now for you, gone to the animal realm?

analyzed: akṣaṇa pratipannasya kim rodiṣi nirarthakam
translated: Having entered an inauspicious state, why do you weep pointlessly?

analyzed: sādhu prasādyatām cittam mahā kāruṇike jine
translated: It is good to have faith in the mind of the Victor, the Greatly Compassionate One.

original: tiryagyoniṃ virāgyeha tataḥ svargaṃ gamiṣyasi // / // iti //
analyzed: tiryagyonim virāgya iha tatas svargam gamiṣyasi iti
translated: Having turned away from the animal realm here, you will then go to heaven.

original: yāvad bhagavatā pātre prakṣipya veṇuvanaṃ nītaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat bhagavatā pātre prakṣipya veṇuvanam nītaḥ
translated: Until the Blessed One threw it into his alms bowl and took it to the Bamboo Grove.

original: atrāntare rājñā māgadhena janakāyena ca śrutaṃ yathāsāv āśīviṣo bhagavatā vinīta iti //
analyzed: atrā antare rājñā māgadhena jana kāyena ca śrutam yathā asau āśīviṣaḥ bhagavatā vinītaḥ iti
translated: In the meantime, the king of Magadha and the people heard how the venomous snake had been disciplined by the Blessed One.

analyzed: atha asau āśīviṣaḥ sva āśrayam jugupsamānaḥ na āhāra tā pratipannaḥ
translated: Then the venomous snake, disgusted with its own body, undertook fasting.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntike cittam prasādya kālagataḥ
translated: Having generated faith in the Blessed One, he died.

analyzed: praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: He was reborn among the gods of the Thirty-Three, in the excellent realms.

original: dharmatā khalu devaputrasya vā devakanyāyā vā aciropapannasya trīṇi cittāny utpadyante /
analyzed: dharmatā khalu deva putrasya vā deva kanyāyāḥ vā acira upapannasya trīṇi cittāni utpadyante
translated: It is natural that when a god or goddess has been reborn for a short time, three thoughts arise:

analyzed: kutas cyutaḥ kutra upapannaḥ kena karmaṇā iti
translated: From where have I died? Where have I been reborn? By what action?

analyzed: paśyati āśīviṣebhyaḥ cyutaḥ
translated: He saw that he had died among the venomous snakes,

analyzed: praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannāḥ
translated: and been reborn among the gods of the Thirty-Three, in the excellent realms.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntike cittam prasādya iti
translated: By generating faith in the Blessed One.

analyzed: atha āśīviṣa pūrvakasya deva putrasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the god who had previously been a venomous snake:

original: na mama pratirūpaṃ syāt /🔽yad ahaṃ paryuṣitaparivāso bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmeyam /
analyzed: na mama pratirūpam syāt  yat aham paryuṣita parivāsaḥ bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāmeyam
translated: It would not be proper for me🔽to approach the Blessed One to see him with a stale offering.

original: yan nu aham aparyuṣitaparivāsa eva bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmeyam iti /
analyzed: yat nu aham a paryuṣita parivāsaḥ eva bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāmeyam iti
translated: Rather, I will approach the Blessed One to see him with a fresh offering.

analyzed: atha āśīviṣa pūrvakaḥ deva putraḥ cala vimala kuṇḍala dharaḥ hāra ardha hāra virājita gātraḥ maṇi ratna vicitra cūḍaḥ
translated: Then the god who had previously been a venomous snake, wearing swaying, pure earrings, his body radiant with necklaces and half-necklaces, his topknot adorned with various jewel gems,

original: kuṅkumatamālapatraspṛkkādisaṃsṛṣṭagātras tasyām eva rātrau divyānām utpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkamandāravāṇāṃ
analyzed: kuṅkuma tamāla patra spṛkkā ādi saṃsṛṣṭa gātraḥ tasyām eva rātrau divyānām utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka mandāravāṇām
translated: His body anointed with saffron, tamala leaves, and spṛkkā, in that very night he filled his lap with divine flowers of blue lotus, lotus, white water lily, white lotus, and coral jasmine,

original: puṣpāṇām utsaṅgaṃ pūrayitvā sarvaṃ veṇuvanaṃ kalandakanivāsam udāreṇāvabhāsenāvabhāsayan
analyzed: puṣpāṇām utsaṅgam pūrayitvā sarvam veṇu vanam kalandaka nivāsam udāreṇa avabhāsena avabhāsayan
translated: and illuminating the entire Bamboo Grove, the abode of Kalandaka, with a great radiance,

original: bhagavantaṃ puṣpair avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: bhagavantam puṣpaiḥ avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: he scattered the flowers before the Blessed One and sat down in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha bhagavān āśīviṣapūrvikasya devaputrasyāśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśīṃ caturāryatyasaṃprativedhikīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: atha bhagavān āśīviṣa pūrvikasya deva putrasya āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśīm catur ārya tya saṃprativedhikīm dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the inclinations, propensities, temperament, and nature of the god Āśiviṣapūrvaka, gave a discourse on the Dharma that was appropriate, beneficial, and related to the fundamentals of the spiritual life,

original: yāṃ śrutvā āśīviṣapūrvakeṇa devaputreṇa viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā āśīviṣa pūrvakeṇa devaputreṇa viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpatti phalam prāptam
translated: hearing which the god Āśiviṣapūrvaka shattered with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of view of the transitory collection, and manifested the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: sa dṛṣṭa satyaḥ tris udānam udānayati
translated: Having seen the truths, he exclaimed the threefold exclamation:🔽Excellent, O Gotama! Excellent, O Gotama!

original: idam asmākaṃ bhadanta na mātrā kṛtaṃ na pitrā na rājñā na devatābhir neṣṭena svajanabandhuvargeṇa na pūrvapretair na śramaṇabrāhmaṇair yad
analyzed: idam asmākam bhadanta na mātrā kṛtam na pitrā na rājñā na devatābhiḥ na iṣṭena sva jana bandhu vargeṇa na pūrvapretaiḥ na śramaṇa brāhmaṇaiḥ yat
translated: This, Venerable One, has been done for us by the Blessed One, not by our mother, not by our father, not by a king, not by a god, not by our relatives or friends, not by our ancestors, not by ascetics or brahmins.

analyzed: bhagavatā asmākam kṛtam  ucchoṣitāḥ rudhira aśru samudrāḥ
translated: What has been done for us by the Blessed One?🔽The ocean of blood and tears has been dried up.

analyzed: laṅghitāḥ asthi parvatāḥ  pihitāni apāya dvārāṇi
translated: The mountains of bones have been crossed.🔽The doors to the lower realms have been closed.

analyzed: vivṛtāni svarga mokṣa dvārāṇi
translated: The doors to heaven and liberation have been opened.

original: pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ smo devamanuṣyeṣu / āha ca /🔽Vaidya / p /
analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ smaḥ deva manuṣyeṣu āha ca  vaidya p
translated: We have been established among gods and humans. He also said:

analyzed: tava anubhāvāt pihitaḥ su ghoraḥ
translated: Doctor, by your power, the extremely terrible

analyzed: hi apāya mārgaḥ bahu doṣa yuktaḥ
translated: path to the lower realms, full of many faults, has been closed.

analyzed: apāvṛtā svarga gatiḥ su puṇyā
translated: The path to heaven, which is very meritorious, has been opened,

analyzed: nirvāṇa mārgaḥ ca mayā upalabdhaḥ  tvad āśrayāt ca āptam apeta doṣam
translated: and I have found the path to nirvana.

analyzed: mayā adya śuddham su viśuddha cakṣuḥ
translated: And by relying on you, I have attained today the pure, stainless eye, free from faults,

analyzed: prāptam ca śāntam padam ārya kāntam
translated: and the peaceful state loved by the noble ones.

analyzed: tīrṇaḥ ca duḥkha arṇava pāram asmi
translated: I have crossed to the other shore of the ocean of suffering.

analyzed: nara vara indra nara amara pūjita
translated: O best of men, worshipped by men and gods,

analyzed: vigata janma jarā maraṇa āmayam
translated: free from birth, old age, death, and disease,

analyzed: bhava sahasra su durlabha darśana
translated: difficult to see even in a thousand existences,

original: saphalam adya mune tava darśanam // / // iti
analyzed: saphalam adya mune tava darśanam iti
translated: O sage, seeing you today is fruitful.

original: avanamya tataḥ pralambahāraḥ🔽caraṇau dvāv abhivandya jātaharṣaḥ /
analyzed: avanamya tatas pralamba hāraḥ  caraṇau dvau abhivandya jāta harṣaḥ
translated: Then, bowing down, with his long necklace🔽bowing down to the two feet, filled with joy,

analyzed: parigamya ca dakṣiṇam jita arīm
translated: and circumambulating the one who has conquered the enemies,

analyzed: sura loka abhimukhaḥ divam jagāma
translated: he went to heaven, facing the world of the gods.

analyzed: atha āśīviṣa pūrvakaḥ deva putraḥ vaṇij iva labdha lābhaḥ
translated: Then the god who was formerly a venomous snake, like a merchant who has gained profit,

original: saṃpannasasya iva karṣakaḥ śūra iva vijitasaṃgrāmaḥ /
analyzed: saṃpanna sasyaḥ iva karṣakaḥ śūraḥ iva vijita saṃgrāmaḥ
translated: like a farmer with a good harvest, like a hero who has won a battle,

original: sarvarogaparimukta ivāturo yayā vibhūtyā bhagavatsakāśam upagatas tayaiva vibhūtyā
analyzed: sarva roga parimuktaḥ iva āturaḥ yayā vibhūtyā bhagavat sakāśam upagataḥ tayā eva vibhūtyā
translated: like a patient completely cured of all diseases, with the same splendor with which he had approached the Blessed One,

original: tasyām eva rātrau rājño bimbisārasya sakāśam upasaṃkramya sarvaṃ rājakulam udāreṇāvabhāsenāvabhāsya
analyzed: tasyām eva rātrau rājñaḥ bimbisārasya sakāśam upasaṃkramya sarvam rājakulam udāreṇa avabhāsena avabhāsya
translated: on that very night he approached King Bimbisāra, illuminating the entire royal palace with a great radiance,

analyzed: rājānam prabodhya etat uvāca
translated: and after awakening the king, he said this:

analyzed: mahā rāja uttiṣṭha uttiṣṭha
translated: Great king, arise, arise!

analyzed: kim svapiṣi iti
translated: Why are you sleeping?

original: atha rājā prabuddhaḥ paśyati tam udāram avabhāsaṃ taṃ ca devaputram /
analyzed: atha rājā prabuddhaḥ paśyati tam udāram avabhāsam tam ca devaputram
translated: Then the king awoke and saw that great radiance and that god.

original: dṛṣṭvā prītamanās taṃ papraccha kas tvam iti /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā prīta manāḥ tam papraccha kaḥ tvam iti
translated: Seeing him, with a delighted mind he asked him, Who are you?

analyzed: sa kathayati
translated: He said:🔽Great king, I am the god who was formerly a venomous snake.

original: ahaṃ sa dṛṣṭyāśīviṣo bhagavatā tatrodyāne vinītaḥ /
analyzed: aham sa dṛṣṭi āśīviṣaḥ bhagavatā tatra udyāne vinītaḥ
translated: I was that snake-headed one who was tamed by the Blessed One in that garden.

analyzed: kālam kṛtvā praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: After death, I was reborn among the gods of the Thirty-Three, in a pleasing place.

original: bhagavantaṃ ca me paryupāsya satyadarśanaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: bhagavantam ca me paryupāsya satya darśanam kṛtam
translated: And after attending on the Blessed One, I attained the vision of the truth.

analyzed: saḥ idānīm prabodhayāmi
translated: Now I am arousing you.

original: gatvā tad udyānam amukasmāt pradeśān mahānidhānam utpāṭya mama nāmnā bhagavantaṃ saśrāvakasaṃghaṃ bhojaya /
analyzed: gatvā tat udyānam amukasmāt pradeśāt mahā nidhānam utpāṭya mama nāmnā bhagavantam sa śrāvaka saṃgham bhojaya
translated: Go to that garden and dig up a great treasure from such and such a place, and in my name feed the Blessed One and the community of monks.

analyzed: dakṣiṇā deśanām ca kāraya iti
translated: And make an announcement of the gift.

analyzed: adhivāsayati rājā bimbisāraḥ devaputrasya tūṣṇībhāvena
translated: King Bimbisāra assented to the god's request by remaining silent.

original: athāśīviṣapūrvako devaputro rājñas tūṣṇībhāvenādhivāsanāṃ viditvā tatraivāntarhitaḥ //
analyzed: atha āśīviṣa pūrvakaḥ deva putraḥ rājñaḥ tūṣṇībhāvena adhivāsanām viditvā tatra eva antarhitaḥ
translated: Then the god who was formerly the snake-headed one, knowing that the king had assented by remaining silent, disappeared right there.

original: atha sa rājā bimbisāras tasyām eva rātrau māgadhānāṃ paurajānapadānāṃ nivedya tad
analyzed: atha sa rājā bimbisāraḥ tasyām eva rātrau māgadhānām paura jānapadānām nivedya tat
translated: Then King Bimbisāra, having informed the people of Magadha, both townspeople and country folk, of this on that very night,

original: udyānaṃ gatvā nidhānam utpāṭya bhagavantaṃ saśrāvakasaṃghaṃ traimāsyaṃ bhojayitvā
analyzed: udyānam gatvā nidhānam utpāṭya bhagavantam sa śrāvaka saṃgham traimāsyam bhojayitvā
translated: went to that garden, dug up the treasure, and after feeding the Blessed One and the community of monks for three months,

analyzed: bhagavantam papraccha
translated: asked the Blessed One:🔽Blessed One, what deed did the Blessed One perform in the past, by which he has such great wealth and is so dear to the hearts of many people?

original: kāni bhagavann aśīviṣapūrvakeṇa devaputreṇa karmāṇi kṛtāni /
analyzed: kāni bhagavan aśīviṣa pūrvakeṇa deva putreṇa karmāṇi kṛtāni
translated: What actions did the god who was formerly a snake perform, Blessed One?

analyzed: yena āśīviṣeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: By what actions did he take rebirth as a snake?

analyzed: kāni karmāṇi kṛtāni yena deveṣu upapannaḥ
translated: What actions did he perform by which he was reborn among the gods?

analyzed: satya darśanam ca kṛtam iti
translated: And did he attain the vision of the truth?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: yat tena atimātraḥ lobhaḥ utpāditaḥ
translated: The excessive greed that he generated,

analyzed: śramaṇa brāhmaṇa vanīpakānām ca antike cittam praduṣitam
translated: and the defilement of mind towards ascetics, brahmins, and the poor that he created,

analyzed: tena āśīviṣeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: by that he was reborn as a snake.

analyzed: yat mama antike cittam prasāditam
translated: The faith he generated towards me,

analyzed: tena deveṣu upapannaḥ
translated: by that he was reborn among the gods.

original: kāśyape ca samykasaṃbuddhe upāsakabhūtena śaraṇagamanaśikṣāpadagrahaṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: kāśyape ca samykasaṃbuddhe upāsaka bhūtena śaraṇa gamana śikṣā pada grahaṇam kṛtam
translated: And as a lay disciple of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, he took refuge and received the precepts.

analyzed: tena satya darśanam kṛtam iti
translated: By that he attained the vision of the truth.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi mahā rāja mātsarya prahāṇāya vyāyantavyam
translated: Therefore, great king, you should strive to abandon stinginess,

original: ete doṣā na bhaviṣyanti ye āśīviṣasya /
analyzed: ete doṣāḥ na bhaviṣyanti ye āśīviṣasya
translated: so that these faults of the snake will not occur for you.

analyzed: eṣaḥ eva guṇa gaṇaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And this very multitude of virtues will be yours,

original: yas tasyaiva devaputrasyety evaṃ te mahārāja śikṣitavyam /
analyzed: yaḥ tasya eva devaputrasya iti evam te mahā rāja śikṣitavyam
translated: which belong to that very god. You should train in this way, great king.

original: atha rājā bimbisāro bhagavato bhāṣitam abhinandyānumodya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvotthāyāsanāt prakrāntaḥ //
analyzed: atha rājā bimbisāraḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhinandya anumodya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā utthāya āsanāt prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then King Bimbisāra, having rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One's words, bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet, rose from his seat, and departed.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: This was said by the Blessed One.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo 'nye ca devāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragādayo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ nye ca deva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga ādayaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks and others, including gods, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, rejoiced in and praised the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidyāpatha

analyzed: candraḥ
translated: The Moon. Edited by Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, tribal chieftains, charioteers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas. He was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick. He was together with the community of monks.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

analyzed: śrāvastyām anyatamaḥ karṣakaḥ brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a certain farmer who was a brahmin.

original: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam /🔽sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam  sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: He brought a wife from a family of equal status.🔽He played, made love, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ patnī āpannasatvā saṃvṛttā /
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ patnī āpannasatvā saṃvṛttā
translated: While he was playing, making love, and enjoying himself, his wife became pregnant.

original: sā aṣṭānāṃ vā navānāṃ vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā /
analyzed: sā aṣṭānām vā navānām vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā
translated: After eight or nine months, she gave birth.

analyzed: dārakaḥ jātaḥ bhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ sarva jana manaḥ nayana prahlādana karaḥ
translated: A boy was born who was handsome, good-looking, and beautiful, delighting the eyes and hearts of all people.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā nāmadheyaṃ vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā nāmadheyam vyavasthāpyate
translated: When he was born, a great celebration was held and a name was chosen for him.

analyzed: kim bhavatu dārakasya nāma iti
translated: What should the boy's name be?

analyzed: jñātayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The relatives said,

analyzed: yasmāt asya jātau sarva lokānām nayana prahlādanam
translated: Since at his birth he delighted the eyes of all people,

original: tasmād bhavatu asya dārakasya candra iti nāmeti /
analyzed: tasmāt bhavatu asya dārakasya candraḥ iti nāma iti
translated: let the boy's name be Candra.

original: sa ca tena brāhmaṇena kṛcchreṇa labdhaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca tena brāhmaṇena kṛcchreṇa labdhaḥ
translated: And that boy was obtained by that brahmin with difficulty.

analyzed: na ca asya anyaḥ putraḥ na duhitā
translated: And he had no other son or daughter.

analyzed: saḥ unnītaḥ vardhitaḥ mahān saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He was raised, grew up, and became a man.

original: sa sarvalokaprahlādanakaratvād brāhmaṇagṛhapatibhiḥ kṛtsnaṃ nagaram anvāhiṇḍyata iti /
analyzed: sa sarva loka prahlādana kara tvāt brāhmaṇa gṛhapatibhiḥ kṛtsnam nagaram anvāhiṇḍyate iti
translated: Because he delighted all the people, he was taken around the entire city by the brahmins and householders.

original: sa brāhmaṇas tasmin bhūyasyā mātrayādhyavasito nityam eva kramasthānaśayyāsu saṃrakṣaṇaparo 'vatiṣṭhite /
analyzed: sa brāhmaṇaḥ tasmin bhūyasyā mātrayā adhyavasitaḥ nityam eva krama sthāna śayyāsu saṃrakṣaṇa paraḥ
translated: That brahmin became even more attached to him and always remained on guard while standing, walking, or lying down.

analyzed: tasya ca brāhmaṇasya anāthapiṇḍada samīpe gṛham
translated: And that brahmin's house was near Anāthapiṇḍada's.

original: atha sa brāhmaṇadārako 'nāthapiṇḍadasaṃsargāj jetavanaṃ gatvā buddhavacanaṃ śṛṇoti /
analyzed: atha sa brāhmaṇa dārakaḥ nāthapiṇḍada saṃsargāt jetavanam gatvā buddha vacanam śṛṇoti
translated: Then that brahmin boy, due to associating with Anāthapiṇḍada, went to the Jeta Grove and heard the Buddha's teachings.

analyzed: tena bhagavat śāsane prasādaḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: He attained faith in the Blessed One's teachings.

original: sa cālpāyuṣkaḥ kālaṃ kṛtvā praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannaḥ //
analyzed: sa ca alpa āyuṣkaḥ kālam kṛtvā praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: And he, having a short lifespan, died and was reborn among the gods in the excellent Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: dharmatā khalu devaputrasya vā devakanyāyā vā aciropapannasya trīṇi cittāny utpadyante /
analyzed: dharmatā khalu deva putrasya vā deva kanyāyāḥ vā acira upapannasya trīṇi cittāni utpadyante
translated: It is a natural law that when a god or goddess is newly reborn, three thoughts arise:

analyzed: kutas cyutaḥ
translated: From where have I transmigrated?

analyzed: kutra upapannaḥ ca kena karmaṇā iti
translated: Where have I been reborn? By what action?

original: paśyati manuṣyebhyaś cyutaḥ praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannāḥ /
analyzed: paśyati manuṣyebhyaḥ cyutaḥ praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannāḥ
translated: He sees that he has transmigrated from among humans and been reborn among the excellent gods in the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntike cittam a hiprasādya iti
translated: By generating faith in the Blessed One.

analyzed: atha brāhmaṇa pūrviṇaḥ deva putrasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the god who was formerly a brahmin:

original: na mama pratirūpaṃ syāt /🔽yad ahaṃ paryuṣitaparivāso bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmeyam /
analyzed: na mama pratirūpam syāt  yat aham paryuṣita parivāsaḥ bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāmeyam
translated: It would not be proper for me🔽to approach the Blessed One to see him with a stale offering.

original: yanv aham aparyuṣitaparivāsa eva bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmeyam iti /
analyzed: yanu aham a paryuṣita parivāsaḥ eva bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāmeyam iti
translated: Well now, I will approach the Blessed One to see him with a fresh offering.

original: atha brāhmaṇapūrvako devaputraś calavimalakuṇḍaladharo hārārdhahāravirājitagātro🔽maṇiratnavicitracūḍaḥ kuṅkumatamālapatraspṛkkādisaṃsṛṣṭagātras tasyām eva rātrau
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇa pūrvakaḥ devaputraḥ cala vimala kuṇḍala dharaḥ hāra ardha hāra virājita gātraḥ  maṇi ratna vicitra cūḍaḥ kuṅkuma tamāla patra spṛkkā ādi saṃsṛṣṭa gātraḥ tasyām eva rātrau
translated: Then the god who was formerly a brahmin, wearing swaying, pure earrings, his body radiant with necklaces and half-necklaces,🔽his topknot adorned with various jewels and gems, his body anointed with saffron, tamala-leaf, spṛk and other ointments, that very night

original: divyānām utpalakumudapuṇḍarīkamandāravāṇāṃ puṣpāṇām utsaṅgaṃ pūrayitvā sarvaṃ jetavanam
analyzed: divyānām utpala kumuda puṇḍarīka mandāravāṇām puṣpāṇām utsaṅgam pūrayitvā sarvam jetavanam
translated: filled the lap with divine blue, red, and white lotus flowers, and all the Jeta Grove

original: udāreṇāvabhāsenāvabhāsya bhagavataṃ puṣpair avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: udāreṇa avabhāsena avabhāsya bhagavatam puṣpaiḥ avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: with a great radiance, and having scattered the flowers over the Blessed One, sat down in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha bhagavān brāhmaṇapūrvakasya devaputrasyāśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśīṃ caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: atha bhagavān brāhmaṇapūrvakasya devaputrasya āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśīm catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikīm dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the inclinations, propensities, temperament, and nature of the god Brahmā's former wife, gave a talk on the Dharma that was compelling, concerned with the Four Noble Truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā brāhmaṇapūrvakeṇa devaputreṇa viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpattiphalam prāptam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā brāhmaṇa pūrvakeṇa devaputreṇa viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpatti phalam prāptam
translated: Having heard it, the god Brahmā's former wife shattered with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the false view of individuality, and realized the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: sa dṛṣṭa satyaḥ tris udānam udānayati
translated: Having seen the truths, he exclaimed three times:

original: idam asmākaṃ bhadanta na mātrā kṛtaṃ na pitrā na rājñā na devatābhir neṣṭena svajanabandhuvargeṇa na pūrvapretair na śramaṇabrāhmaṇair yad
analyzed: idam asmākam bhadanta na mātrā kṛtam na pitrā na rājñā na devatābhiḥ na iṣṭena sva jana bandhu vargeṇa na pūrvapretaiḥ na śramaṇa brāhmaṇaiḥ yat
translated: What the Blessed One has done for us, Bhadanta, has not been done by our mother, nor by our father, nor by a king, nor by deities, nor by our relatives, nor by our kinsmen, nor by our friends, nor by our ancestors, nor by ascetics and brahmins, namely,

analyzed: bhagavatā asmākam kṛtam  ucchoṣitāḥ rudhira aśru samudrāḥ
translated: that the Blessed One has done for us.🔽The ocean of blood and tears has dried up.

analyzed: laṅghitāḥ asthi parvatāḥ  pihitāni apāya dvārāṇi
translated: The mountain of bones has been scaled.🔽The doors to the lower realms have been closed.

analyzed: vivṛtāni svarga mokṣa dvārāṇi
translated: The doors to heaven and liberation have been opened.

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ smaḥ deva manuṣyeṣu āha ca
translated: We have been established among gods and humans. He also said:

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Doctor,

analyzed: tava anubhāvāt pihitaḥ su ghoraḥ
translated: by your power, the extremely terrible

analyzed: hi apāya mārgaḥ bahu doṣa yuktaḥ
translated: path to the lower realms, full of many faults, has been closed.

analyzed: apāvṛtā svarga gatiḥ su puṇyā
translated: The path to heaven is open for those with great merit,

analyzed: nirvāṇa mārgaḥ ca mayā upalabdhaḥ  tvad āśrayāt ca āptam apeta doṣam
translated: The path to heaven is open, and the path to nirvana has been attained.

analyzed: mayā adya śuddham su viśuddha cakṣuḥ
translated: By relying on you, I have attained today the pure and stainless eye, with perfect vision.

analyzed: prāptam ca śāntam padam ārya kāntam
translated: I have attained the peaceful state, dear to the noble ones,

analyzed: tīrṇaḥ ca duḥkha arṇava pāram asmi
translated: and have crossed to the other shore of the ocean of suffering.

analyzed: nara vara indra nara amara pūjita
translated: O best of men, worshipped by men and gods,

analyzed: vigata janma jarā maraṇa āmayam
translated: free from birth, old age, death, and disease,

analyzed: bhava sahasra su durlabha darśana
translated: so difficult to see even in a thousand existences,

original: saphalam adya mune tava darśanam // / // iti
analyzed: saphalam adya mune tava darśanam iti
translated: today, O Sage, seeing you is fruitful.

analyzed: avanamya tatas pralamba hāraḥ
translated: Then, bowing with his long necklace

analyzed: caraṇau dvau abhinandya jāta harṣaḥ
translated: and joyfully paying homage at the two feet,

analyzed: parigamya ca dakṣiṇam jita arim
translated: and circumambulating the Victorious One,

analyzed: sura loka abhimukhaḥ divam jagāma
translated: he went to heaven, facing the world of the gods.

original: atha brāhmaṇapūrvako devaputro vaṇig iva labdhalābhaḥ /
analyzed: atha brāhmaṇa pūrvakaḥ deva putraḥ vaṇij iva labdha lābhaḥ
translated: Then the god who was formerly a brahmin, like a merchant who has made a profit,

original: sasyasaṃpanna iva karṣakaḥ śūra iva vijitasaṃgrāmaḥ /
analyzed: sasya saṃpannaḥ iva karṣakaḥ śūraḥ iva vijita saṃgrāmaḥ
translated: like a farmer with a good harvest, like a hero who has won a battle,

original: sarvarogaparimukta ivāturo yayā hi vibhūtyā bhagavatsakāśam āgatas tayaiva vibhūtyā svabhavanaṃ gataḥ //
analyzed: sarva roga parimuktaḥ iva āturaḥ yayā hi vibhūtyā bhagavat sakāśam āgataḥ tayā eva vibhūtyā sva bhavanam gataḥ
translated: like a patient completely cured of all diseases, with the same splendor with which he had come into the presence of the Blessed One, he went to his own abode.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ pūrvarātra apararātram jāgarikā yogam anuyuktāḥ viharanti
translated: Monks, they dwell practicing the yoga of wakefulness in the first and last parts of the night.

analyzed: taiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhagavataḥ ntike udāraḥ vabhāsaḥ
translated: By them, a great light was seen in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā saṃdigdhāḥ bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Having seen it, they were doubtful and asked the Blessed One:

original: kiṃ bhagavann asyāṃ rātryāṃ bhagavantaṃ darśanāya brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ śakro devendraś catvāro lokapālā upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: kim bhagavan asyām rātryām bhagavantam darśanāya brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ śakraḥ deva indraḥ catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Blessed One, in this night, was it Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, or Śakra, the lord of the gods, or the four world guardians who came to see the Blessed One?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na bhikṣavo brahmā sahāṃpatir na śakro devendro nāpi catvāro lokapālā māṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ na śakraḥ deva indraḥ na api catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ mām darśanāya upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Monks, it was neither Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, nor Śakra, the lord of the gods, nor the four world guardians who came to see me.

original: api yo 'sāv ekaputro 'sya brāhmaṇasya putro 'lpāyuṣkaḥ kālagataḥ /
analyzed: api yaḥ sau eka putraḥ sya brāhmaṇasya putraḥ lpa āyuṣkaḥ kālagataḥ
translated: Rather, it was that young son of this brahmin, who had a short life and died.

original: sa mamāntike cittam abhiprasādya praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannaḥ /
analyzed: sa mama antike cittam abhiprasādya praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: Having generated faith in me, he was reborn among the excellent gods of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: saḥ syām rātrau mad sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: In this night, he came into my presence.

analyzed: tasya mayā dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: I taught him the Dharma.

analyzed: dṛṣṭa satyaḥ ca sva bhavanam gataḥ
translated: Having seen the truths, he went to his own abode.

original: atra cāntare sa brāhmaṇas tam ekaputrakam iṣṭaṃ kāntaṃ priyaṃ manāpaṃ kṣāntam apratikūlaṃ śmaśāne nirhṛtyotsaṅge kṛtvā karuṇakaruṇaṃ vilapan
analyzed: atra ca antare sa brāhmaṇaḥ tam eka putrakam iṣṭam kāntam priyam manāpam kṣāntam a pratikūlam śmaśāne nirhṛtya utsaṅge kṛtvā karuṇa karuṇam vilapan
translated: In the meantime, that brahmin, having taken his only son, who was dear, beloved, pleasing, agreeable, patient, and not disagreeable, to the charnel ground, placed him on his lap, and lamented piteously,

analyzed: hā putraka hā eka putraka iti
translated: Alas, my son! Alas, my only son!

original: jñātayaḥ subahv api śokavinodanaṃ kurvaṇā na śaknuvanty utthāpayitum /
analyzed: jñātayaḥ su bahu api śoka vinodanam kurvaṇāḥ na śaknuvanti utthāpayitum
translated: The relatives, though they made great efforts to console him, were unable to make him rise up.

original: sa kākakuraraśvaśṛgālagṛdhraparivṛtaḥ prakīrṇakeśībhiḥ strībhir anugato mahājanakāyena codvīkṣyamāṇas tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: sa kāka kurara śva śṛgāla gṛdhra parivṛtaḥ prakīrṇa keśībhiḥ strībhiḥ anugataḥ mahā jana kāyena ca udvīkṣyamāṇaḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: Surrounded by crows, herons, dogs, jackals, and vultures, followed by women with disheveled hair, and gazed at by a great crowd of people, he remained there.

original: tato 'sya putro devabhūtaḥ pitaraṃ paridevamānaṃ dṛṣṭvā kāruṇyād ākampitahṛdayaḥ pituḥ śokavinodanārtham ṛṣiveṣadhāriṇam ātmānam abhinirmāya
analyzed: tatas sya putraḥ deva bhūtaḥ pitaram paridevamānam dṛṣṭvā kāruṇyāt ākampita hṛdayaḥ pituḥ śoka vinodana artham ṛṣi veṣa dhāriṇam ātmānam abhinirmāya
translated: Then his son, who had become a god, seeing his father lamenting, with a heart moved by compassion, in order to remove his father's sorrow, manifested himself in the form of a sage,

analyzed: śmaśāna samīpe pañcatapāḥ avasthitaḥ
translated: and stood near the charnel ground, practicing the five austerities.

original: atha sa brāhmaṇas tam ṛṣiṃ papraccha /
analyzed: atha sa brāhmaṇaḥ tam ṛṣim papraccha
translated: Then that brahmin asked that sage,

original: bho maharṣe anena tapasā kiṃ prārthayasa iti /
analyzed: bho mahā ṛṣe anena tapasā kim prārthayase iti
translated: Sir, great sage, what do you seek by this austerity?

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ āha rājyam prārthaye
translated: The sage said, I seek a kingdom.

original: sauvarṇaś ca me rathaḥ syān nānāratnavicitraḥ /
analyzed: sauvarṇaḥ ca me rathaḥ syāt nānā ratna vicitraḥ
translated: And may my chariot be golden, adorned with various jewels.

analyzed: sūryācandramasau ratha cakre syātām
translated: The sun and moon would be the wheels of the chariot.

analyzed: catvāraḥ ca lokapālāḥ purastāt nameyuḥ
translated: And the four guardians of the world would bow in front.

original: so 'haṃ taṃ ratham abhiruhyemāṃ mahāpṛthivīm anvāhiṇḍeyeti /
analyzed: saḥ ham tam ratham abhiruhya imām mahā pṛthivīm anvāhiṇḍeya iti
translated: Having mounted that chariot, I would drive around this great earth.

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ kathayati
translated: The Brahmin said:

analyzed: yadi varṣa śatam pūrṇam tapiṣyasi nirantaram
translated: If you were to burn continuously for a full hundred years,

original: na lapsyase 'pi tat sthānaṃ paramatapasāpi hi // / // iti //
analyzed: na lapsyase tat sthānam parama tapasā api hi iti
translated: you would not attain that state, even with the highest austerities.

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ kathayati
translated: The Rishi said:

original: tvaṃ ca punar anena mṛtakuṇapenāśucinā paramadurgandhena śavena kāṣṭhabhūtena kiṃ prārthayasa iti /
analyzed: tvam ca punar anena mṛta kuṇapena aśucinā parama durgandhena śavena kāṣṭha bhūtena kim prārthayase iti
translated: And what do you seek with this dead corpse, impure, extremely foul-smelling, a corpse, a piece of wood?

analyzed: brāhmaṇaḥ prāha
translated: The Brahmin said:

analyzed: priyaḥ me eka putrakaḥ kālagataḥ
translated: My beloved only son has died.

original: taṃ prārthaya iti / ṛṣir āha /🔽Vaidya / p /
analyzed: tam prārthaye iti ṛṣiḥ āha  vaidya p
translated: I seek him. The Rishi said:

analyzed: yadi varṣa śatam pūrṇam rodiṣyasi nirantaram
translated: If you were to weep continuously for a full hundred years,

original: na lapsyase 'pi taṃ putraṃ ruditena hi kiṃ tava // / // iti //
analyzed: na lapsyase tam putram ruditena hi kim tava iti
translated: you would not attain that son, what is the use of weeping?

original: tatas tasya brāhmaṇasya bhūtam ṛṣivacanam avagatya prasādo jātaḥ /
analyzed: tatas tasya brāhmaṇasya bhūtam ṛṣi vacanam avagatya prasādaḥ jātaḥ
translated: Then, understanding the Rishi's words, the Brahmin's spirit was filled with faith.

analyzed: prasāda jātaḥ ca āha
translated: And, filled with faith, he said:

analyzed: kaḥ tvam iti
translated: Who are you?

original: tata ṛṣis taṃ veṣam antardhāpya svaveṣeṇa sthitvā pitaram āha /
analyzed: tatas ṛṣiḥ tam veṣam antardhāpya sva veṣeṇa sthitvā pitaram āha
translated: Then the sage, having made that form disappear, stood in his own form and said to his father:

original: ahaṃ te sa ekaputrako bhagavato 'ntike cittaṃ prasādya kālagataḥ /
analyzed: aham te saḥ eka putrakaḥ bhagavataḥ ntike cittam prasādya kālagataḥ
translated: I am your only son. Having generated faith in the Blessed One, I died.

analyzed: praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: I was reborn among the excellent gods of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: tava śoka vinodana artham iha āgataḥ
translated: I have come here to dispel your sorrow.

original: ehi tvaṃ tāta buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ śaraṇaṃ gaccha /
analyzed: ehi tvam tāta buddham bhagavantam śaraṇam gaccha
translated: Come, father, go for refuge to the Buddha, the Blessed One.

original: apy eva tvam api saṃsārasamatikrāmaṃ kuryā iti //
analyzed: api eva tvam api saṃsāra samatikrāmam kuryāḥ iti
translated: Perhaps you too will attain liberation from saṃsāra.

original: atha sa brāhmaṇo mṛtaśarīram apahāya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: atha sa brāhmaṇaḥ mṛta śarīram apahāya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then the brahmin, having abandoned the dead body, approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvā purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Having approached, he bowed at the feet of the Blessed One and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: tasmai bhagavatā catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikī dharma deśanā kṛtā
translated: For him, the Blessed One gave a teaching on the Dharma that penetrates the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā tena brāhmaṇeṇa viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpattiphalam prāptam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā tena brāhmaṇeṇa viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpatti phalam prāptam
translated: Having heard it, the brahmin, having shattered with the vajra of knowledge the mountain of the view of the transitory collection that had risen to a height of twenty peaks, attained the fruit of stream-entry.

original: sa labdhodayo labdhalābho bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantaṃ triḥ pradakṣiṇīkṛtya prakrāntaḥ //
analyzed: sa labdha udayaḥ labdha lābhaḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā bhagavantam tris pradakṣiṇīkṛtya prakrāntaḥ
translated: Having obtained the rising and the gain, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and departed.

original: tato bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Then the monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, who removes all doubts:

analyzed: paśya bhagavan
translated: Look, Blessed One,

original: yāvad anena devaputreṇāyaṃ pitā śokaṃ vinodya satyadarśane pratiṣṭhāpita iti /
analyzed: yāvat anena deva putreṇa ayam pitā śokam vinodya satya darśane pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ iti
translated: how this god's father was freed from sorrow and established in seeing the truth by this god.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kim atra bhikṣava āścaryaṃ yad anenaitarhi dṛṣṭasatyena pitā paritrātaḥ /
analyzed: kim atra bhikṣavaḥ āścaryam yat anena etarhi dṛṣṭa satyena pitā paritrātaḥ
translated: Monks, what is amazing about this, that now, having seen the truth, he has saved his father?

original: yat tv anena atīte 'dhvani pṛthagjanena satā yāvat trir api pitā jīvitād vyavaropyamāṇaḥ paritrātaḥ /
analyzed: yat tu anena atīte dhvani pṛthagjanena satā yāvat tris api pitā jīvitāt vyavaropyamāṇaḥ paritrātaḥ
translated: But that he saved his father from being killed by his own hand three times in the past, when he was an ordinary person,

analyzed: tat śruṇuta
translated: listen to that.

original: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta / bhāṣiṣye //
analyzed: sādhu ca suṣṭhu ca manasi kuruta bhāṣiṣye
translated: Listen well and pay attention, I will speak.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani vārāṇasyāṃ nagaryām anyatamaḥ pāradārikaḥ /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani vārāṇasyām nagaryām anyatamaḥ pāradārikaḥ
translated: Monks, in the past, in the city of Varanasi, there was a certain adulterer.

analyzed: tasya putraḥ bhadraḥ kalyāṇa āśayaḥ tīva lokasya abhimataḥ
translated: He had a good son, of good disposition, who was extremely beloved by the people.

analyzed: yāvat asya pitrā cauryam kṛtam
translated: Then, while he was still a child, his father committed a theft.

analyzed: tatas rājñā vadhyatām iti ājñaptam
translated: Then the king ordered him to be executed.

original: tataḥ putreṇa yāvat trir api rājānaṃ vijñāpya iṣṭena jīvitenācchāditaḥ //
analyzed: tatas putreṇa yāvat tris api rājānam vijñāpya iṣṭena jīvitena ācchāditaḥ
translated: Then the son, having appealed to the king three times, was spared his life by his father.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena pāradārika āsīt /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena pāradārikaḥ āsīt
translated: Monks, what do you think? The one who was the adulterer at that time, on that occasion,

analyzed: ayam sa brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: he is this brahmin.

analyzed: pāradārika putraḥ yam eva brāhmaṇa dārakaḥ
translated: The son of the adulterer is this very brahmin boy.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The monks said:

original: kiṃ karma kṛtaṃ yena pitāputrābhyāṃ satyadarśanaṃ kṛtam iti /
analyzed: kim karma kṛtam yena pitāputrābhyām satya darśanam kṛtam iti
translated: What karma was done by which father and son attained the truth?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: kāśyape samyaksaṃbuddhe upāsaka bhūtābhyām śaraṇa gamana śikṣā pada grahaṇam kṛtam
translated: In the time of the Perfectly Awakened One Kāśyapa, they were lay followers who took refuge and received the precepts.

analyzed: tena idānīm satya darśanam kṛtam
translated: By that, they have now attained the truth.

analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ sarva saṃskārāḥ anityāḥ
translated: Therefore, monks, all conditioned things are impermanent,

analyzed: sarva dharmāḥ anātmānaḥ
translated: all phenomena are without self,

original: śāntaṃ nirvāṇam iti nirvāṇe yatnaḥ karaṇīyaḥ /
analyzed: śāntam nirvāṇam iti nirvāṇe yatnaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: and nirvāṇa is peace. Thus, effort should be made towards nirvāṇa.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo 'nye ca devāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragādayo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ nye ca deva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga ādayaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks and other gods, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, etc. rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidyā.

analyzed: sālaḥ
translated: Sāla. Edited by Speyer. Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, tribal chieftains, charioteers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas. He was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick. He was together with the community of monks.

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena śrāvastyāṃ sālabhañjikā nāma parva pratyupasthitam /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena śrāvastyām sālabhañjikā nāma parva pratyupasthitam
translated: At that time, in Śrāvastī, a festival called Sāla-bhañjikā had arrived.

original: tatrānekāni prāṇiśatasahasrāṇi saṃnipatya sālapuṣpāṇy ādāya krīḍanti ramante paricārayanti /
analyzed: tatra anekāni prāṇi śata sahasrāṇi saṃnipatya sāla puṣpāṇi ādāya krīḍanti ramante paricārayanti
translated: There, many hundreds of thousands of living beings gathered, took sāla flowers, and played, enjoyed, and amused themselves.

original: yāvad anyatarā śreṣṭhidārikā sālapuṣpāṇy ādāya śrāvastīṃ praviśati /
analyzed: yāvat anyatarā śreṣṭhi dārikā sāla puṣpāṇi ādāya śrāvastīm praviśati
translated: Then a certain daughter of a guildmaster, having taken sāl flowers, entered Śrāvastī.

original: bhagavāṃś ca bhikṣugaṇaparivṛtaḥ śrāvastīṃ piṇḍāya caritvā nirgacchati /
analyzed: bhagavān ca bhikṣu gaṇa parivṛtaḥ śrāvastīm piṇḍāya caritvā nirgacchati
translated: And the Blessed One, surrounded by a group of monks, having gone for alms in Śrāvastī, was leaving.

original: dadarśa sā dārikā buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
analyzed: dadarśa sā dārikā buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
translated: That girl saw the Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: aśītyā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks, adorned with a fathom-wide halo, his radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

analyzed: jaṅgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: like a moving jeweled mountain, beautiful in every way.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punaḥ prasādajātayā bhagavān sālapuṣpair avakīrṇaḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar prasāda jātayā bhagavān sāla puṣpaiḥ avakīrṇaḥ
translated: And having seen him, with faith arisen, she scattered sāl flowers on the Blessed One.

analyzed: tatas pradakṣiṇīkṛtya pratinivṛttā
translated: Then, having circumambulated him, she turned back,

analyzed: bhūyaḥ nyāni gṛhasya arthe āneṣyāmi iti
translated: thinking, I will bring more for the sake of the house.

analyzed: yāvat asau sāla vṛkṣam adhirūḍhā patitā
translated: Then she climbed a sāl tree and fell down.

original: bhagavataḥ kṛtopasthānā kālagatā praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannā yāvat sālapuṣpavimānālaṃkṛtā devasamitim upasaṃkrāntā //
analyzed: bhagavataḥ kṛta upasthānā kālagatā praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannā yāvat sāla puṣpa vimāna alaṃkṛtā deva samitim upasaṃkrāntā
translated: Having rendered service to the Blessed One, she died and was reborn among the excellent Thirty-Three gods, and was adorned with a sāl flower palace, and went to the assembly of gods.

original: tasmiṃś ca kāle śakro devendraḥ sudharmāyāṃ devasabhāyāṃ devagaṇasya madhye buddhasya varṇaṃ bhāṣate /
analyzed: tasmin ca kāle śakraḥ deva indraḥ sudharmāyām deva sabhāyām deva gaṇasya madhye buddhasya varṇam bhāṣate
translated: At that time, Shakra, lord of the gods, in the midst of the assembly of gods in the Sudharma hall, was praising the Buddha,

analyzed: dharmasya saṃghasya ca varṇam bhāṣate
translated: praising the Dharma and the Sangha.

original: dadarśa śakro devendras tāṃ devakanyāṃ sālapuṣpavimānālaṃkṛtām uttaptakuśalamūlām /
analyzed: dadarśa śakraḥ deva indraḥ tām deva kanyām sāla puṣpa vimāna alaṃkṛtām uttapta kuśala mūlām
translated: Shakra, lord of the gods, saw that divine maiden adorned with a jeweled palace like a coral tree, with her roots of virtue well-developed.

analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca gāthayā pratyabhāṣata
translated: Having seen her, he replied with a verse:

analyzed: gātram kena vimṛṣṭa kāñcana nibham padma utpala ābham tava
translated: By what was your body made like gold, with the color of a lotus and blue lotus,

original: gātraśrīr atulā kṛteyam iha te dehāt prabhā niḥsṛtā /
analyzed: gātra śrīḥ atulā kṛtā iyam iha te dehāt prabhā niḥsṛtā
translated: your incomparable bodily beauty was created here, the radiance emanating from your body?

analyzed: vaktram kena vibuddha padma sadṛśam cāmīkara ābham tava
translated: By what was your face made like a fully bloomed lotus, with the color of molten gold,

original: brūhi tvaṃ mama devate phalam idaṃ yat karmajaṃ bhujyate // / //
analyzed: brūhi tvam mama devate phalam idam yat karma jam bhujyate
translated: tell me, divine maiden, what is this fruit that is being enjoyed, born from karma?

analyzed: devatā prāha
translated: The deity said:

analyzed: sa śrāvakaḥ narādityaḥ ākīrṇaḥ vara lakṣaṇaiḥ
translated: The sun among men, together with his disciples, is adorned with the excellent marks.

original: tat karma kuśalaṃ kṛtvā rājate 'bhyadhikaṃ mama /
analyzed: tat karma kuśalam kṛtvā rājate bhyadhikam mama
translated: Having done that wholesome action, I shine forth even more.

analyzed: jalaja indu viśuddha ābham vadanam kānta darśanam
translated: The face with the appearance of a beloved, pure like a lotus in the water,

analyzed: śakraḥ prāha
translated: Shakra said:

analyzed: aho guṇa mayam kṣetram sarva doṣa vivarjitam
translated: Ah, the field of merit, full of virtues, free from all faults,

original: yatra nyastaṃ tvayā bījam iṣṭaṃ svargopapattaye // / //
analyzed: yatra nyastam tvayā bījam iṣṭam svarga upapattaye

translated: The Parrot. Edited by Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: with merchants, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, who is worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, is known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he, together with the community of disciples, receives robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick,

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: he was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: rājagṛhe nagare rājā bimbisāro rājyaṃ kārayati ṛddhaṃ ca sphītaṃ ca kṣemaṃ ca subhikṣaṃ
analyzed: rājagṛhe nagare rājā bimbisāraḥ rājyam kārayati ṛddham ca sphītam ca kṣemam ca subhikṣam
translated: In the city of Rājagṛha, King Bimbisāra was ruling the kingdom, which was prosperous, abundant, peaceful, and well-fed,

original: ca ākīrṇabahujanamanuṣyaṃ ca praśāntakalikalahaḍimbaḍamaraṃ taskararogāpagataṃ śālīkṣugomahiṣīsaṃpannam
analyzed: ca ākīrṇa bahu jana manuṣyam ca praśānta kali kalaha ḍimba ḍamaram taskara roga apagatam śāli ikṣu go mahiṣī saṃpannam
translated: with a large population of people, free from quarrels, disputes, fights, and strife, free from thieves and disease, with plenty of rice, sugarcane, and cattle and buffaloes,

analyzed: akhilam akaṇṭakam
translated: without oppression or thorns.

analyzed: eka putram iva rājyam pālayati
translated: He ruled the kingdom like a single son.

original: sa ca rājā śrāddho bhadraḥ kalyāṇāśaya
analyzed: sa ca rājā śrāddhaḥ bhadraḥ kalyāṇa āśaya
translated: And that king was faithful, good, of good intentions,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: a physician,

analyzed: ātma hita para hita pratipannaḥ kāruṇikaḥ mahātmā dharma kāmaḥ prajā vatsalaḥ
translated: devoted to the welfare of himself and others, compassionate, magnanimous, devoted to the Dharma, and affectionate towards his people.

original: yāvad asau bhagavaddarśanotkaṇṭhitaḥ kare kapolaṃ datvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat asau bhagavat darśana utkaṇṭhitaḥ kare kapolam da tvā cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He remained there, his cheek resting on his hand, longing to see the Blessed One.

analyzed: tatas mātyaḥ uktaḥ
translated: Then the ministers said to him,

analyzed: kimartham deva śokaḥ kriyate iti
translated: Why is the king grieving?

analyzed: rājā uvāca cira dṛṣṭaḥ me sugataḥ
translated: The king said, I have not seen the Well-Gone One for a long time.

analyzed: saḥ ham ākāṅkṣāmi bhagavataḥ darśanam iti
translated: I am longing to see the Blessed One.

original: aśrauṣīd bhagavān divāvihāropagato divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhenātikrāntamānuṣeṇa rājā bimbisāra utkaṇṭhita iti /
analyzed: aśrauṣīt bhagavān divāvihāra upagataḥ divyena śrotreṇa viśuddhena atikrānta mānuṣeṇa rājā bimbisāraḥ utkaṇṭhitaḥ iti
translated: The Blessed One, who had gone to his daytime dwelling, heard with his divine ear, which is pure and surpasses human hearing, that King Bimbisāra was longing.

original: atrāntare nāsti kiṃcid buddhānāṃ bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam /
analyzed: atra antare na asti kiṃcid buddhānām bhagavatām ajñātam adṛṣṭam aviditam avijñātam
translated: In the meantime, there is nothing unknown, unseen, uncognized, or unrecognized by the Blessed Buddhas.

original: dharmatā khalu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ mahākāruṇikānāṃ lokānugrahapravṛttakānām ekārakṣāṇāṃ
analyzed: dharmatā khalu buddhānām bhagavatām mahā kāruṇikānām loka anugraha pravṛttakānām eka ārakṣāṇām
translated: It is the nature of the Blessed Buddhas, the Greatly Compassionate Ones, who have turned to grace the world, to have one protector,🔽who dwell in tranquility and insight, who are skilled in the three means of conversion,

analyzed: śamatha vipaśyanā vihāriṇām tri damatha vastu kuśalānām catur ogha uttīrṇānām catur ṛddhipāda caraṇa tala supratiṣṭhitānām
translated: who are well-established in the palms of the feet of the four bases of supernatural power,

analyzed: caturṣu saṃgraha vastuṣu dīrgha rātra kṛta paricayānām pañca aṅga viprahīṇānām pañca gati samatikrāntānām
translated: who have long been familiar with the four means of gathering disciples, who are free from the five parts, who have transcended the five destinies,

analyzed: ṣaṣ aṅga samanvāgatānām ṣaṣ pāramitā paripūrṇānām sapta bodhyaṅga kusuma āḍhyānām aṣṭāṅga mārga deśikānām
translated: who are endowed with the six superknowledges, who have fulfilled the six perfections, who are rich with the flowers of the seven factors of enlightenment, who teach the eightfold path,

analyzed: nava anupūrva vihāra samāpatti kuśalānām daśa bala balinām daśa diś samāpūrṇa yaśasām daśa śata vaśavarti prativiśiṣṭānām
translated: who are skilled in the nine successive abodes and concentrations, who are strong with the ten powers, whose fame fills the ten directions, who are superior to the lords of the ten hundred (trichiliocosms),

original: trī rātres trir divasasya buddhacakṣuṣā lokaṃ vyavalokya jñānadarśanaṃ pravartate /
analyzed: tris rātreḥ tris divasasya buddha cakṣuṣā lokam vyavalokya jñāna darśanam pravartate
translated: having surveyed the world with the Buddha-eye three times in a night and three times in a day, knowledge and insight proceed (thus):

original: ko hīyate ko vardhate kaḥ kṛcchraprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭaprāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādhaprāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchrasaṃkaṭasaṃbādhaprāptaḥ ko 'pāyanimnaḥ ko 'pāyapravaṇaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ hīyate kaḥ vardhate kaḥ kṛcchra prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃkaṭa prāptaḥ kaḥ saṃbādha prāptaḥ kaḥ kṛcchra saṃkaṭa saṃbādha prāptaḥ pāya nimnaḥ kaḥ pāya pravaṇaḥ
translated: Who is declining? Who is growing? Who has met with misfortune? Who has met with difficulty? Who has met with calamity? Who has met with misfortune, difficulty, and calamity? Who is going to the lower realms? Who is inclined to the lower realms?

analyzed: kaḥ pāya prāgbhāraḥ
translated: Who is leaning towards the lower realms?

original: kam aham apāyād uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam /
analyzed: kam aham apāyāt uddhṛtya svarge mokṣe ca pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I lift up from the lower realms and establish in heaven and liberation?

analyzed: kasya kāma paṅka nimagnasya hasta uddhāram anupradadyām
translated: Whom shall I give a helping hand to, who is sunk in the mire of desire?

analyzed: kam ārya dhana virahitam ārya dhana aiśvarya ādhipatye pratiṣṭhāpayeyam
translated: Whom shall I establish in the lordship and sovereignty of the noble wealth, who is devoid of the noble wealth?

analyzed: kasya ajñāna timira paṭala paryavanaddha netrasya jñāna añjana śalākayā cakṣuḥ viśodhayāmi
translated: For whose eyes, obscured by the cataract of ignorance, shall I open with the ointment of knowledge?

analyzed: kasya an avaropitāni kuśala mulāni avaropayeyam
translated: For whom shall I plant the roots of virtue that have not been planted?

analyzed: kasya avaropitāni paripācayeyam
translated: For whom shall I ripen those that have been planted?

analyzed: kasya paripakvāni vimocayeyam āha ca
translated: For whom shall I liberate those that have ripened? He also says:

analyzed: api eva atikramet velām sāgaraḥ makara ālayaḥ
translated: Even the ocean, the abode of makaras, may overstep its shoreline,

original: na tu vaineyavatsānāṃ buddho velām atikramet // / //
analyzed: na tu vaineya vatsānām buddhaḥ velām atikramet
translated: but the Buddha does not overstep the shoreline for those disciples who are like calves.

original: tato bhagavān rājño bimbisārasyānugrahārthaṃ trayāṇāṃ vārṣikāṇāṃ māsānām atyayāt kṛtacīvaro niṣṭḥitacīvaraḥ samādāya pātracīvaram janapadacārikāṃ 🔽prakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhagavān rājñaḥ bimbisārasya anugraha artham trayāṇām vārṣikāṇām māsānām atyayāt kṛta cīvaraḥ niṣṭḥita cīvaraḥ samādāya pātra cīvaram janapada cārikām  prakrāntaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to favor King Bimbisāra, after the three months of the rainy season had passed, having made his robes and having his robes finished, taking his bowl and robe,🔽set out on a tour of the country.

original: anupūrveṇa cārikāṃ carann anyatamaṃ vanaṣaṇḍam anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: anupūrveṇa cārikām caran anyatamam vana ṣaṇḍam anuprāptaḥ
translated: Wandering in stages, he arrived at a certain forest grove.

original: tatra ca vanaṣaṇḍe manuṣyapralāpī śukaḥ prativasati /
analyzed: tatra ca vana ṣaṇḍe manuṣya pralāpī śukaḥ prativasati
translated: And in that forest grove there lived a parrot who spoke like a human.

original: tena bhagavān dūrata dṛṣṭaḥ /🔽tatas tvaritatvaritaṃ bhagavantam uvāca /
analyzed: tena bhagavān dūrata dṛṣṭaḥ  tatas tvarita tvaritam bhagavantam uvāca
translated: He saw the Blessed One from a distance.🔽Then he quickly said to the Blessed One:

analyzed: etu bhagavān
translated: Come, Blessed One!

analyzed: svāgatam bhagavate
translated: Welcome, Blessed One!

analyzed: kriyatām asmākam anugrahaḥ
translated: Show us your favor.

analyzed: iha eva vana ṣaṇḍe ekām rātrim prativasa iti
translated: Stay just here in this forest grove for one night.

original: tato bhagavāñ chukasyānugrahārthaṃ yatra vkṣe śukasyālayas tatra tṛṇasaṃstaraṃ saṃstīrya paryaṅkeṇa niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhagavān śukasya anugraha artham yatra vkṣe śukasya ālayaḥ tatra tṛṇa saṃstaram saṃstīrya paryaṅkeṇa niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One, in order to favor the parrot, spread out a bed of grass where the parrot's nest was and sat down in full lotus posture.

analyzed: anya vṛkṣeṣu mahāśrāvakāḥ
translated: The great disciples were in other trees.

original: tataḥ śukaḥ kṛtsnāṃ rātrim itas tatas taṃ vanaṣaṇḍaṃ paryaṭati /
analyzed: tatas śukaḥ kṛtsnām rātrim itas tatas tam vana ṣaṇḍam paryaṭati
translated: Then the parrot roamed all around that forest grove all night,

original: mā haiva kaścid bhagavantaṃ saśrāvakasaṃghaṃ viheṭhayiṣyatīti manuṣyo vā amanuṣyo vā yakṣo vā rākṣaso vā śvāpadaś caṇḍaśṛṅgo veti /
analyzed: mā ha eva kaścid bhagavantam sa śrāvaka saṃgham viheṭhayiṣyati iti manuṣyaḥ vā amanuṣyaḥ vā yakṣaḥ vā rākṣasaḥ vā śvāpadaḥ caṇḍa śṛṅgaḥ vā iti
translated: thinking, I hope no one, whether human or non-human, yaksha or rakshasa, or wild animal with sharp horns, will harm the Blessed One and the community of disciples.

original: tataḥ prabhātāyāṃ rajanyāṃ bhagavantaṃ triḥpradakṣīṇīkṛtya kṣamayitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas prabhātāyām rajanyām bhagavantam tris pradakṣīṇīkṛtya kṣamayitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then, at dawn, after circumambulating the Blessed One three times, he began to ask for forgiveness.

analyzed: kṣamasva bhagavan tiryagyoni gataḥ ham
translated: Forgive me, Blessed One, I am an animal.

original: nāsti me vibhavo yena bhagavantam abhyarcayeyam /
analyzed: na asti me vibhavaḥ yena bhagavantam abhyarcayeyam
translated: I have no wealth with which to honor the Blessed One.

analyzed: api tu aham agratas gacchāmi
translated: But I will go ahead.

analyzed: rājñaḥ bimbisārasya bhagavataḥ āgamanam nivedayāmi iti
translated: I will inform King Bimbisara of the Blessed One's arrival.

analyzed: evam astu iti
translated: So be it.

analyzed: yāvat asau rājñaḥ sakāśam saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: Then he set out for the king.

analyzed: anupūrveṇa rājñaḥ sakāśam anuprāptam
translated: In due course, he arrived in the presence of the king.

original: tasmiṃś ca samaye rājā upariprāsādatalagato niṣpuruṣeṇa tūryeṇa krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: tasmin ca samaye rājā upari prāsāda tala gataḥ niṣpuruṣeṇa tūryeṇa krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: At that time, the king was on the top floor of the palace, playing, enjoying, and amusing himself with music without any men.

analyzed: tatas śukaḥ mānuṣa pralāpī rājānam uvāca
translated: Then the parrot, who could speak like a human, said to the king:

analyzed: bho rājan viditam te bhavatu
translated: Your Majesty, please be informed.

analyzed: bhagavān sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: The Blessed One, together with the community of monks,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: is like a doctor.

analyzed: tava vijitam anuprāptaḥ
translated: He has arrived in your realm.

original: tad arhati devo bhaktaṃ sajjīkartum iti /
analyzed: tat arhati devaḥ bhaktam sajjīkartum iti
translated: It is fitting that Your Majesty should prepare an offering.

original: tato rājā tvaritatvaritaṃ prāsādād avatīryāmātyagaṇaparivṛto bhagavato 'rthena āsanakāni prajñapya chatradhvajapatākābhir vicitraiś ca gandhapuṣpadhūpair
analyzed: tatas rājā tvarita tvaritam prāsādāt avatīrya amātya gaṇa parivṛtaḥ bhagavataḥ rthena āsanakāni prajñapya chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ vicitraiḥ ca gandha puṣpa dhūpaiḥ
translated: Then the king quickly descended from the palace, surrounded by his ministers, and set out seats for the sake of the Blessed One, with parasols, banners, flags, various fragrances, flowers, and incense,

analyzed: bhagavantam pratyudgataḥ
translated: and went out to meet the Blessed One.

original: tato rājñā bhagavān saśrāvakasaṃgho mahatā satkāreṇa praveśitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājñā bhagavān sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ mahatā satkāreṇa praveśitaḥ
translated: Then the king, with great honor, led the Blessed One, together with the community of monks, inside.

analyzed: praṇītena ca āhāreṇa saṃtarpitaḥ
translated: And he satisfied them with excellent food.

analyzed: atha śukasya etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the parrot:

original: yad bhagavān saśrāvakasaṃgha evaṃvibhūtis tat sarvaṃ māmāgamya /
analyzed: yat bhagavān sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ evam vibhūtiḥ tat sarvam mām āgamya
translated: Since the Blessed One, together with the community of monks, has such splendor, all that is due to me.

original: iti viditvā hṛṣṭatuṣṭapramudita udagraprītisaumanasyajāto rājñaḥ purastād itaś cāmutaś ca paryaṭan śyenakenāpahṛtya pañcatvam āpāditaḥ /
analyzed: iti viditvā hṛṣṭa tuṣṭa pramuditaḥ udagra prīti saumanasya jātaḥ rājñaḥ purastāt itas ca amutas ca paryaṭan śyenakena apahṛtya pañcatvam āpāditaḥ
translated: Knowing this, he was delighted, satisfied, joyful, elated, and full of happiness and gladness. Wandering here and there in front of the king, he was carried off by a hawk and met his end.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntike cittam prasādya kālagataḥ
translated: Having generated faith in the Blessed One, he died.

analyzed: praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: He was reborn among the excellent gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

original: dharmatā khalu devaputrasya vā devakanyāyā vā aciropapannasya trīṇi cittāny utpadyante /
analyzed: dharmatā khalu deva putrasya vā deva kanyāyāḥ vā acira upapannasya trīṇi cittāni utpadyante
translated: It is natural that when a god or goddess has been reborn for a short time, three thoughts arise:

analyzed: kutas cyutaḥ
translated: From where have I died?

analyzed: kutra upapannaḥ kena karmaṇā iti
translated: Where have I been reborn? By what action?

original: sa paśyati / tiryagbhyaś cyutaḥ praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannaḥ /
analyzed: sa paśyati tiryagbhyaḥ cyutaḥ praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: He sees that he has died from the animal realm and been reborn among the excellent gods of the Heaven of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntike cittam abhiprasādya iti
translated: Having generated faith in the Blessed One.

original: atha śukapūrviṇo devaputrasyaitad abhavat /🔽na mama pratirūpaṃ syād yad ahaṃ paryuṣitaparivāso bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmeyam /
analyzed: atha śukapūrviṇaḥ deva putrasya etat abhavat  na mama pratirūpam syāt yat aham paryuṣita parivāsaḥ bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāmeyam
translated: Then the god who had previously been a parrot thought this:🔽It would not be right for me to approach the Blessed One to see him with a stale offering.

original: yanv aham aparyuṣitaparivāsa eva bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāmeyam iti /
analyzed: yanu aham a paryuṣita parivāsaḥ eva bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkrāmeyam iti
translated: So I will approach the Blessed One to see him with a fresh offering.

original: atha śukapūrvī devaputraś calavimalakuṇḍaladharo hārārdhahāravirājitagātro maṇiratnavicitracūḍaḥ
analyzed: atha śukapūrvī devaputraḥ cala vimala kuṇḍala dharaḥ hāra ardha hāra virājita gātraḥ maṇi ratna vicitra cūḍaḥ
translated: Then the god Śuka, with his earrings swaying and his body shining with necklaces and half-necklaces, with his topknot adorned with various jewels,

original: kuṅkumatamālapatraspṛkkādisaṃsṛṣṭagātras tasyām eva rātrau divyānām utpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkamandāravāṇām🔽puṣpāṇām utsaṅgaṃ pūrayitvā sarvaṃ jetavanam udāreṇāvabhāsenāvabhāsya bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: kuṅkuma tamāla patra spṛkkā ādi saṃsṛṣṭa gātraḥ tasyām eva rātrau divyānām utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka mandāravāṇām  puṣpāṇām utsaṅgam pūrayitvā sarvam jetavanam udāreṇa avabhāsena avabhāsya bhagavantam
translated: with his body anointed with saffron, tamāla leaves, spṛkkā, and so on, filling the lap with divine flowers of blue lotus, lotuses, white lotuses, and coral jasmine,

original: puṣpair avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: puṣpaiḥ avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: illuminating the entire Jeta Grove with a great light, and scattering flowers before the Blessed One, sat down in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha bhagavāṃś chukapūrviṇo devaputrasyāśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśīṃ caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: atha bhagavān śukapūrviṇaḥ deva putrasya āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśīm catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikīm dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the god Śuka's inclinations, propensities, temperament, and nature, gave a discourse on the Dharma that was compelling, concerned with the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā śukapūrviṇā devaputreṇa viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpattiphalaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā śukapūrviṇā devaputreṇa viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpatti phalam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Hearing it, the god Śuka, with the thunderbolt of wisdom, shattered the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the false view of individuality, and actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: sa dṛṣṭa satyaḥ tris udānam udānayati
translated: Having seen the truths, he exclaimed the threefold exclamation:🔽Excellent, O Gotama! Excellent, O Gotama!

original: idam asmākaṃ bhadanta na mātrā kṛtaṃ na pitrā na rājñā na devatābhir neṣṭena svajanabandhuvargeṇa na pūrvapretair na śramaṇabrāhmaṇair yad
analyzed: idam asmākam bhadanta na mātrā kṛtam na pitrā na rājñā na devatābhiḥ na iṣṭena sva jana bandhu vargeṇa na pūrvapretaiḥ na śramaṇa brāhmaṇaiḥ yat

analyzed: bhagavatā asmākam kṛtam  ucchoṣitāḥ rudhira aśru samudrāḥ

analyzed: vivṛtāni svarga mokṣa dvārāṇi

analyzed: pratiṣṭhāpitāḥ smaḥ deva manuṣyeṣu āha ca
translated: We have been established among gods and humans. He also says:

analyzed: tava anubhāvāt pihitaḥ su ghoraḥ

analyzed: hi apāya mārgaḥ bahu doṣa yuktaḥ

analyzed: apāvṛtā svarga gatiḥ su puṇyā

analyzed: nirvāṇa mārgaḥ ca mayā upalabdhaḥ

analyzed: tvad āśrayāt ca āptam apeta doṣam  mayā adya śuddham su viśuddha cakṣuḥ
translated: And by relying on you, I have attained today🔽the pure, stainless eye, free from faults.

analyzed: speyeḥ su viśuddha cakṣuḥ
translated: The stainless eye

analyzed: prāptam ca śāntam padam ārya kāntam

analyzed: tīrṇaḥ ca duḥkha arṇava pāram asmi
translated: and I have crossed to the other shore of the ocean of suffering.

analyzed: nara vara indra nara amara pūjita
translated: O best of men, worshipped by men and gods,

analyzed: vigata janma jarā maraṇa āmayam
translated: free from birth, old age, death, and disease,

analyzed: bhava sahasra su durlabha darśana
translated: difficult to see even in a thousand existences,

analyzed: saphalam adya mune tava darśanam
translated: Today, Sage, seeing you has borne fruit.

analyzed: avanamya tatas pralamba hāraḥ
translated: Then, bowing with his long necklace

analyzed: caraṇau dvau abhivandya jāta harṣaḥ
translated: and joyfully worshipping the two feet,

analyzed: parigamya ca dakṣiṇam jita arim
translated: and circumambulating the Victorious One,

analyzed: sura loka abhimukhaḥ divam jagāma
translated: he went to heaven, facing the world of the gods.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidyā.

original: atha śukapūrvī devaputro vaṇig iva labdhalābhaḥ /
analyzed: atha śuka pūrvī deva putraḥ vaṇij iva labdha lābhaḥ
translated: Then the god Śuka, like a merchant who has gained profit,

analyzed: sasya saṃpannaḥ iva karṣakaḥ śūraḥ iva vijita saṃgrāmaḥ
translated: like a farmer with a good harvest, like a hero who has won a battle,
