analyzed: sarva roga parimuktaḥ iva āturaḥ yayā vibhūtyā bhagavat sakāśam āgataḥ tayā eva vibhūtyā sva bhavanam gataḥ
translated: like a patient completely cured of all diseases, with the same splendor with which he had come into the presence of the Blessed One, he went to his own abode.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ pūrvarātra apararātram jāgarikā yogam anuyuktāḥ viharanti
translated: The monks, engaged in the practice of staying awake in the first and last watches of the night,

analyzed: taiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhagavataḥ ntike udāraḥ vabhāsaḥ
translated: saw a great light in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā saṃdigdhāḥ bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Having seen it, they were doubtful and asked the Blessed One:

original: kiṃ bhagavann asyāṃ rātrau bhagavantaṃ darśanāya brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ śakro devendraś catvāro lokapālā upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: kim bhagavan asyām rātrau bhagavantam darśanāya brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ śakraḥ deva indraḥ catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: What, Blessed One, is this? In this night, did Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, Śakra, the lord of the gods, or the four world guardians come to see the Blessed One?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, this is not Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, nor Śakra, the lord of the gods, nor the four world guardians who have come to see me.🔽This is the god Śuka, a son of good family, who has come to see me.

original: na bhikṣavo brahmā sahāṃpatir na śakro devendro nāpi catvāro lokapālā māṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ na śakraḥ deva indraḥ na api catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ mām darśanāya upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Monks, neither Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, nor Śakra, lord of the gods, nor even the four world guardians have come to see me.

original: api tu dṛṣṭaḥ sa yuṣmābhiḥ śuko yena vayaṃ tasmin vanaṣaṇḍe rātriṃ vastum upanimintritā iti /

translated: But that parrot whom you saw, by whom we were invited to spend the night in that forest grove, has he been seen by you?

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The monks said:

analyzed: evam bhadanta iti
translated: Yes, Bhadanta.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: saḥ eṣa bhikṣavaḥ kālam kṛtvā
translated: Monks, he, having died,

analyzed: praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ iti
translated: was reborn among the gods of the Thirty-Three.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The monks said:

analyzed: kāni bhadanta śuka pūrvakeṇa deva putreṇa karmāṇi kṛtāni yena śukeṣu upapannaḥ

analyzed: kāni karmāṇi kṛtāni yena deveṣu upapannaḥ
translated: What actions did he perform that he was reborn among the gods?

analyzed: satya darśanam ca kṛtam iti
translated: And that he saw the truth?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: śukapūrvakeṇaiva bhikṣavo devaputreṇa pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny
analyzed: śuka pūrvakeṇa eva bhikṣavaḥ deva putreṇa pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni
translated: Monks, the god formerly a parrot himself performed and accumulated those actions in other lives, which have a nature to ripen, whose conditions have matured, which have arrived like an irresistible flood,

analyzed: avaśyaṃbhāvīni

analyzed: śuka pūrvakeṇa deva putreṇa karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: The god formerly a parrot performed and accumulated those actions.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience them?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /🔽na tejodhātau /

translated: Monks, actions that are done and accumulated do not ripen externally in the element of earth.🔽Nor in the element of water.

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /

translated: But rather, actions that are done, whether virtuous or non-virtuous, ripen in just these appropriated aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres.

original: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpaśatair api /
analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Actions do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When the conditions are complete and the time has come, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani asminn eva bhadrake kalpe viṃśativarṣasahasrāyuṣi🔽prajāyāṃ kāśyapo nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani asmin eva bhadrake kalpe viṃśati varṣa sahasra āyuṣi  prajāyām kāśyapaḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid
translated: Monks, in the past, in this very fortunate aeon, when the lifespan of beings was twenty thousand years,

analyzed: tasya karmaṇaḥ vipākāt śukeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: As a result of that action, he was reborn among parrots.

analyzed: yat mayā antike cittam prasāditam

analyzed: tena deveṣu upapannaḥ

analyzed: yat tena pariṣiṣṭāni śikṣā padāni rakṣitāni
translated: Because he kept the remaining precepts,

analyzed: tena satya darśanam kṛtam
translated: he attained the vision of the truth.

analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇānām karmaṇām ekānta kṛṣṇaḥ vipākaḥ  ekānta śuklānām ekānta śuklaḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the results of entirely dark actions are entirely dark,🔽the results of entirely bright actions are entirely bright,

analyzed: vyatimiśrāṇām vyatimiśraḥ

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇāni karmāṇy apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇāni karmāṇi apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca

translated: and apply yourselves to entirely bright actions.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, is known as the one of great merit,

translated: Then the householder Anāthapiṇḍada approached King Prasenajit of Kośala,

analyzed: yat khalu deva jānīyāḥ cira dṛṣṭaḥ smābhiḥ bhagavān  paritṛṣitāḥ smaḥ bhagavataḥ darśanāya
translated: Your Majesty, please know that we have not seen the Blessed One for a long time.🔽We are thirsty to see the Blessed One.

analyzed: icchāmaḥ vayam bhagavantam draṣṭum iti
translated: We wish to see the Blessed One.

analyzed: tatas rājā anāthapiṇḍadam gṛhapatim uvāca
translated: Then King Prasenajit said to the householder Anāthapiṇḍada:

analyzed: kaccit te gṛhapate śrutam kutra bhagavān etarhi varṣāḥ upagataḥ iti

analyzed: anāthapiṇḍadaḥ uvāca
translated: Anāthapiṇḍada said:

analyzed: śrutam me deva bhagavān rājagṛhe varṣāḥ upagataḥ iti

original: tato rājñā prasenajitā kauśalena anāthapiṇḍadādyaiś ca paurajānapadāmātyair anyatamaḥ puruṣo dūtyenāhūyoktaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājñā prasenajitā kauśalena anāthapiṇḍada ādyaiḥ ca paura jānapada amātyaiḥ anyatamaḥ puruṣaḥ dūtyena āhūya uktaḥ
translated: Then King Prasenajit of Kośala, Anāthapiṇḍada and other citizens and ministers of the country, having summoned a certain man as a messenger, said to him:

analyzed: ehi tvam bho puruṣa
translated: Come, good man.

analyzed: yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāma
translated: Approach the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramyāsmākaṃ vacanena bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vandasva /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya asmākam vacanena bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vandasva
translated: Having approached, with our words bow your head at the feet of the Blessed One.

original: alpābādhatāṃ ca pṛccha alpātaṅkaṃ ca laghūtthānatāṃ ca yātrāṃ ca balaṃ ca sukhaṃ cānavadyatāṃ ca sparśavihāratāṃ ca /
analyzed: alpa ābādha tām ca pṛccha alpa ātaṅkam ca laghu utthāna tām ca yātrām ca balam ca sukham ca anavadya tām ca sparśa vihāra tām ca
translated: Inquire about his little trouble, little affliction, lightness, strength, ease, freedom from distress, and pleasant abiding.

analyzed: evam ca vada
translated: And say this:

original: evaṃ cāhuḥ / ciradṛṣṭo 'smābhir bhagavān /🔽paritṛṣitāḥ smo bhagavato darśanāya /
analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ cira dṛṣṭaḥ smābhiḥ bhagavān  paritṛṣitāḥ smaḥ bhagavataḥ darśanāya
translated: And they say: We have seen the Blessed One after a long time.🔽We are thirsty to see the Blessed One.

analyzed: ichāmaḥ vayam bhagavantam draṣṭum
translated: We wish to see the Blessed One.

original: sādhu bhagavāñ chrāvastīm āgacched anukampām upādāyeti /
analyzed: sādhu bhagavān śrāvastīm āgacchet anukampām upādāya iti
translated: It would be good if the Blessed One would come to Śrāvastī out of compassion.'

original: evaṃ deveti sa puruṣo rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kauśalasya sāmātyapaurajānapadasya pratiśrutya śrāvastīto 'nupūrveṇa cañcūryamāṇo rājagṛhaṃ nagaram 🔽anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: evam deva iti sa puruṣaḥ rājñaḥ prasenajitaḥ kauśalasya sa amātya paura jānapadasya pratiśrutya śrāvastī itas nupūrveṇa cañcūryamāṇaḥ rājagṛham nagaram  anuprāptaḥ
translated: The man, having agreed to this, left Śrāvastī and gradually arrived at the city of Rājagṛha.

original: tataḥ pūrvaṃ rājagṛhaṃ nagaram avalokya yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tatas pūrvam rājagṛham nagaram avalokya yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: He then first looked at the city of Rājagṛha and approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvaikānte niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā ekānte niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One and sat to one side.

original: ekāntaniṣaṇṇaḥ sa puruṣo bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: ekānta niṣaṇṇaḥ sa puruṣaḥ bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: While sitting to one side, the man said this to the Blessed One:

original: rājā bhadanta prasenajit kauśalaḥ śrāvastīnivāsinaś ca paurā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā alpābādhatāṃ pṛcchanti /
analyzed: rājā bhadanta prasenajit kauśalaḥ śrāvastī nivāsinaḥ ca paurāḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā vanditvā alpa ābādha tām pṛcchanti

original: tatas tau brāhmaṇau āṣāḍhasya gṛhapateḥ sakāśād aṣṭāṅgasamanvāgatam upavāsam upalabhyopoṣitau /
analyzed: tatas tau brāhmaṇau āṣāḍhasya gṛhapateḥ sakāśāt aṣṭāṅga samanvāgatam upavāsam upalabhya upoṣitau
translated: Then those two brahmins, having obtained the eight-part fast from the householder Aṣāḍha, fasted.

analyzed: tadā ekena pariśuddhaḥ rakṣitaḥ
translated: At that time, one of them kept it pure and protected it.

original: sa kālaṃ kṛtvā rājñaḥ kṛkeḥ putratvam abhyupagataḥ /
analyzed: sa kālam kṛtvā rājñaḥ kṛkeḥ putra tvam abhyupagataḥ
translated: He, having died, was reborn as the son of King Kṛkī.

analyzed: tasya sujātaḥ iti nāmadheyam vyavasthāpitam
translated: His name was established as Sujāta.

analyzed: sa pituḥ atyayāt rājye pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ
translated: He, after his father's death, was established in the kingdom.

analyzed: dvitīyena upavāsaḥ khaṇḍitaḥ
translated: The second one broke the fast.

analyzed: sa kālam kṛtvā nāgeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: He, having died, was reborn among the nāgas.

original: tasyopari divase divase saptakṛtvaḥ taptavālukā nipatati yayā so 'sthiśeṣaḥ kriyate /
analyzed: tasya upari divase divase sapta kṛtvas tapta vālukā nipatati yayā saḥ sthi śeṣaḥ kriyate
translated: Above him, every day, seven times, hot sand falls, by which he is reduced to a skeleton.

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat
translated: This occurred to him:

original: kasyedaṃ karmaṇaḥ phalaṃ kasyāyaṃ karmaṇaḥ phalavipāko yenāham īdṛśaṃ duḥkham anubhavāmīti /
analyzed: kasya idam karmaṇaḥ phalam kasya ayam karmaṇaḥ phala vipākaḥ yena aham īdṛśam duḥkham anubhavāmi iti
translated: Whose is this fruit of action? Whose is this ripening of the fruit of action by which I experience such suffering?

original: sa paśyati / aṣṭāṅgasamanvāgataṃ me upavāsaṃ samādāya śikṣāśaithilyaṃ kṛtaṃ yenāham īdṛśaṃ mahadduḥkhaṃ pratyanubhavāmi /
analyzed: sa paśyati aṣṭāṅga samanvāgatam me upavāsam samādāya śikṣā śaithilyam kṛtam yena aham īdṛśam mahat duḥkham pratyanubhavāmi
translated: He saw: I, having undertaken the eight-part fast, made it loose. By that I experience such great suffering.

original: yena punaḥ samādāya rakṣitaṃ tena rājyaṃ pratilabdham iti /
analyzed: yena punar samādāya rakṣitam tena rājyam pratilabdham iti
translated: But by whom it was undertaken and protected, by him the kingdom was obtained.

analyzed: tasya etat abhavat
translated: This occurred to him:

analyzed: yanu aham idānīm api  vaidya p
translated: If now,

analyzed: tāvat aṣṭa aṅga samanvāgatm upavāsam upavaseyam
translated: I should observe the fast endowed with eight factors.

original: apy eva nāma nāgayoner mokṣaḥ syād iti /
analyzed: api eva nāma nāga yoneḥ mokṣaḥ syāt iti
translated: Perhaps there will be liberation from the nāga womb.

original: tato nāgavarṇam antardhāpya brāhmaṇavarṇam ātmānam abhinirmāya rājñaḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ /
analyzed: tatas nāga varṇam antardhāpya brāhmaṇa varṇam ātmānam abhinirmāya rājñaḥ sakāśam upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then, having disappeared in the nāga form, having manifested himself in the form of a brāhmaṇa, he approached the king.

analyzed: upasaṃkramya jayena āyuṣā ca vardhayitvā uvāca
translated: Having approached, he wished him victory and long life, and said:

analyzed: aṣṭāṅga samanvāgatena me mahā rāja upavāsena prayojanam
translated: Great king, I have a need for the fast endowed with eight factors.

analyzed: tat arhati devaḥ u ṣṭa aṅga samanvāgatam upavāsam paryeṣitum
translated: Therefore, it is fitting that the king should seek the fast endowed with eight factors.

analyzed: atha na paryeṣase
translated: If you do not seek it,

analyzed: niyatam devasya saptadhā mūrdhānam sphālayāmi
translated: I will certainly split your head into seven pieces.

analyzed: iti uktvā tatra eva antarhitaḥ
translated: Having said this, he disappeared right there.

original: tato rājā bhītas trastaḥ saṃvigna āhṛṣṭaromakūpo hiraṇyapiṭakaṃ dhvajāgre baddhvā sarvavijite ghaṇṭāvaghoṣaṇaṃ kārayāmāsa /
analyzed: tatas rājā bhītaḥ trastaḥ saṃvignaḥ āhṛṣṭa romakūpaḥ hiraṇya piṭakam dhvaja agre baddhvā sarva vijite ghaṇṭā avaghoṣaṇam kārayāmāsa
translated: Then the king, frightened, terrified, anxious, with his hair standing on end, having tied a golden casket to the top of his banner, had a proclamation made with a bell throughout his entire realm:

analyzed: yaḥ me ṣṭa aṅga samanvāgatam upavāsam deśayiṣyati
translated: Whoever will teach me the fast endowed with eight factors,

analyzed: tasya etam hiraṇya piṭakam dāsyāmi
translated: to him I will give this golden casket.

analyzed: mahatā satkāreṇa satkariṣyāmi iti
translated: I will honor him with great respect.”

analyzed: yāvat anyatamā vṛddhā strī palagaṇḍa duhitā
translated: Then an old woman, the daughter of a carpenter,

analyzed: tayā rājñaḥ stambhaḥ darśitaḥ
translated: showed the king a pillar,

original: atra me stambhe pitā asakṛdgandhadhūpapuṣpārcanaṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: atra me stambhe pitā asakṛt gandha dhūpa puṣpa arcanam kṛtavān
translated: saying, “Here, on this pillar, my father has repeatedly made offerings of incense, perfume, and flowers.

analyzed: tam utpāṭya pratyavekṣasva iti
translated: Pull it out and examine it.”

analyzed: tatas rājñā pauruṣeyāṇām ājñā dattā
translated: Then the king ordered his servants,

analyzed: ayam stambhaḥ utpāṭyatām iti
translated: “Pull out this pillar.”

analyzed: tatas rāja puruṣaiḥ stambhaḥ utpāṭitaḥ
translated: Then the king’s men pulled out the pillar.

analyzed: tasya adhastāt suvarṇa patra abhilikhitaḥ ṣṭāṅga samanvāgataḥ upavāsaḥ labdhaḥ
translated: Underneath it, they found an eight-part observance written on gold plates,

original: saha pañca copāsakaśikṣāpadāni saptatriṃśac ca bodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ /
analyzed: saha pañca ca upāsaka śikṣā padāni saptatriṃśat ca bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ
translated: together with the five precepts for lay followers and the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: tato rājñā tasya nāgasyāṣṭāṅgasamanvāgata upavāso likhitvā dattaḥ /
analyzed: tatas rājñā tasya nāgasya aṣṭa aṅga samanvāgataḥ upavāsaḥ likhitvā dattaḥ
translated: Then the king wrote out the eight-part observance for that nāga and gave it to him.

original: ṛṣipatananivāsibhiś ca dvādaśabhir ṛṣisahasraiḥ saptatriṃśadbodhipakṣyā dharmāḥ pratyakṣīkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣipatana nivāsibhiḥ ca dvādaśabhiḥ ṛṣi sahasraiḥ saptatriṃśat bodhi pakṣyāḥ dharmāḥ pratyakṣīkṛtāḥ
translated: And the twelve thousand sages living in Ṛṣipatana realized the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: sa ca nāgo 'ṣṭāṅgasamanvāgatam upavāsam upoṣya sthalam udgamyotsṛṣṭakāyo 'vasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca nāgaḥ ṣṭāṅga samanvāgatam upavāsam upoṣya sthalam udgamya utsṛṣṭa kāyaḥ vasthitaḥ
translated: And that nāga, having observed the eight-part observance, went up onto dry land and stayed there with his body abandoned.

original: so 'nāhāratāṃ pratipaṇṇaḥ kālaṃ kṛtvā pañcaśataparivāraḥ praṇīteṣū deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannaḥ /
analyzed: saḥ na āhāra tām pratipaṇṇaḥ kālam kṛtvā pañcaśata parivāraḥ praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannaḥ
translated: He, having undertaken fasting, died and was reborn with a retinue of five hundred in the excellent heaven of the Thirty-Three gods.

analyzed: atas bhikṣavaḥ upoṣadhasya utpattiḥ nāma abhinirvṛttiḥ ca iti
translated: Therefore, monks, this is the origin and appearance of Upavasatha.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: Thus spoke the Blessed One.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: Delighted, those monks rejoiced in what the Blessed One had said.

analyzed: haṃsāḥ
translated: Hamsa. Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers, country-folk, traders, local rulers, Brahmins, and householders,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas. He was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick, along with his community of disciples,

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: he was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: śrāvastyāṃ rājā prasenajit kauśalo rājyaṃ kārayati ṛddhaṃ ca sphītaṃ ca kṣemaṃ ca
analyzed: śrāvastyām rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ rājyam kārayati ṛddham ca sphītam ca kṣemam ca
translated: In Śrāvastī, King Prasenajit of Kośala was ruling the kingdom, which was prosperous, abundant, peaceful,

original: subhikṣaṃ ca ākīrṇabahujanamanuṣyaṃ ca praśāntakalikalahaḍimbaḍamaraṃ taskararogāpagataṃ
analyzed: subhikṣam ca ākīrṇa bahu jana manuṣyam ca praśānta kali kalaha ḍimba ḍamaram taskara roga apagatam
translated: with an abundance of food, and full of many people, with quarrels, fights, riots, and strife quelled, free from thieves and disease,

analyzed: śāli ikṣu go mahiṣī saṃpannam akhilam akaṇṭakam
translated: with rice, sugarcane, cows, and buffaloes in abundance, without oppression or thorns.

analyzed: eka putram iva rājyam pālayati
translated: He ruled the kingdom as if it were his only son.

original: yāvad apareṇa samayena rājā prasenajit kauśalo jetavanaṃ nirgato bhagavantaṃ darśanāyopasaṃkramituṃ paryupāsanāya /
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ jetavanam nirgataḥ bhagavantam darśanāya upasaṃkramitum paryupāsanāya
translated: Later, at another time, King Prasenajit of Kośala went out to the Jeta Grove in order to see the Blessed One and to attend upon him.

original: rājñā ca pañcālena rājñaḥ prasenajit kauśalasya prābhṛtaṃ pañca haṃsaśatāni preṣitāni /
analyzed: rājñā ca pañcālena rājñaḥ prasenajit kauśalasya prābhṛtam pañca haṃsa śatāni preṣitāni
translated: And King Pañcāla sent King Prasenajit of Kośala a gift of five hundred geese.

original: yadā rājā jetavanaṃ nirgatas tadā tāni pañca haṃsaśatāny upanāmitāni /
analyzed: yadā rājā jetavanam nirgataḥ tadā tāni pañca haṃsa śatāni upanāmitāni
translated: When the king went out to the Jeta Grove, those five hundred geese were presented to him.

original: tato rājñā prasenajitā teṣām abhayapradānaṃ datvā tatraiva jetavanae samutsṛṣṭāṇi /
analyzed: tatas rājñā prasenajitā teṣām abhaya pradānam da tvā tatra eva jetavane samutsṛṣṭāṇi
translated: Then, after King Prasenajit had given them a guarantee of safety, he released them right there in the Jeta Grove.

analyzed: yadā bhagavān mahāśrāvaka parivṛtaḥ jine speyeḥ śana
translated: When the Blessed One, surrounded by his great disciples, was sitting in Ajina Speyeer.

analyzed: upaniṣīdati
translated: he sat down.

analyzed: tadā te haṃsāḥ bhagavat sakāśam upasaṃkrāmanti
translated: Then those geese approach the Blessed One.

original: bhagavān api tebhya ālopam anuprayacchanti mahāśrāvakāś ca /
analyzed: bhagavān api tebhyaḥ ālopam anuprayacchanti mahāśrāvakāḥ ca
translated: The Blessed One also gives them a morsel, as do the great disciples.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vaidya.

analyzed: te muktvā tṛptāḥ praṇīta indriyāḥ tiṣṭhanti
translated: They remain satisfied, their faculties well-composed.

original: yadā bhagavān pratisaṃlayanād vyutthāya catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: yadā bhagavān pratisaṃlayanāt vyutthāya catasṛṇām parṣadām dharmam deśayati
translated: When the Blessed One rises from his meditative composure and teaches the Dharma to the four assemblies,

original: tadā te haṃsā bhagavatsakāśaṃ gatvā dharmaṃ śṛṇvanti /
analyzed: tadā te haṃsāḥ bhagavat sakāśam gatvā dharmam śṛṇvanti
translated: then those geese go to the Blessed One and listen to the Dharma.

original: te cālpāyuṣkāḥ kālaṃ kṛtvā praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannāḥ //
analyzed: te ca alpa āyuṣkāḥ kālam kṛtvā praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannāḥ
translated: And they, having a short lifespan, having died, are reborn among the gods of the Thirty-Three, in excellent places.

original: dharmatā khalu devaputrasya vā devakanyāyā vā aciropapannasya trīṇi cittāny utpadyante /
analyzed: dharmatā khalu deva putrasya vā deva kanyāyāḥ vā acira upapannasya trīṇi cittāni utpadyante
translated: It is a natural law that for a god or goddess who has been reborn not long ago, three thoughts arise:

analyzed: kutas cyutaḥ
translated: From where have I passed away?

analyzed: kutra upapannaḥ kena karmaṇā iti
translated: Where have I been reborn? By what action?

original: paśyanti haṃsebhyaś cyutāḥ praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣūpapannāḥ /
analyzed: paśyanti haṃsebhyaḥ cyutāḥ praṇīteṣu deveṣu trāyastriṃśeṣu upapannāḥ
translated: They see that they have passed away from the geese and been reborn among the gods of the Thirty-Three, in excellent places.

analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntike cittam abhiprasādya iti
translated: By having faith in the Blessed One, they think.

original: atha haṃsapūrviṇo devaputrāś calavimalakuṇḍaladharā hārārdhahāravirājitagātrā maṇiratnavicitracūḍāḥ🔽kuṅkumatamālapatraspṛkkādisaṃsṛṣṭagātrās tasyām eva rātrau divyānām utpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkamandāravāṇāṃ
analyzed: atha haṃsa pūrviṇaḥ devaputrāḥ cala vimala kuṇḍala dharāḥ hāra ardhahāra virājita gātrāḥ maṇi ratna vicitra cūḍāḥ  kuṅkuma tamāla patra spṛkka ādi saṃsṛṣṭa gātrāḥ tasyām eva rātrau divyānām utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka mandāravāṇām
translated: Then the gods who had previously been geese, wearing swaying, pure earrings, their bodies adorned with necklaces and half-necklaces, their topknots decorated with jewel gems,

original: puṣpāṇām utsaṅgaṃ pūrayitvā sarvaṃ jetavanam udāreṇāvabhāsenāvabhāsya bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: puṣpāṇām utsaṅgam pūrayitvā sarvam jetavanam udāreṇa avabhāsena avabhāsya bhagavantam
translated: their bodies anointed with saffron, tamala-leaf, spṛkkā, and other ointments, filling their laps with divine flowers of utpala, padma, kumuda, puṇḍarīka, and mandāra, illuminating the entire Jeta Grove with a great light,

original: puṣpair avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastān niṣaṇṇā dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: puṣpaiḥ avakīrya bhagavataḥ purastāt niṣaṇṇāḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: scattering flowers over the Blessed One, and sitting in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha bhagavān haṃsapūrviṇāṃ devaputrāṇām āśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśīṃ caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikīṃ dharmadeśanāṃ kṛtavān /
analyzed: atha bhagavān haṃsa pūrviṇām deva putrāṇām āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśīm catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikīm dharma deśanām kṛtavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the inclinations, propensities, temperaments, and natures of the gods who had previously been geese, gave a teaching of the Dharma that was relevant, excellent, and pure, which concerned the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā haṃsapūrvibhir devaputrair viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpattiphalaṃ prāptam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā haṃsa pūrvibhiḥ devaputraiḥ viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpatti phalam prāptam
translated: Hearing it, the gods who had previously been geese, with the thunderbolt of wisdom, shattered the twenty high peaks of the mountain of the false view of individuality, and attained the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: te dṛṣṭa satyāḥ vaṇij iva labdha lābhāḥ
translated: Having seen the truths, they were like merchants who had obtained a profit,🔽or like patients who had been cured of their illnesses.

original: sasyasaṃpannā iva karṣakāḥ śūrā iva vijitasaṃgrāmāḥ /
analyzed: sasya saṃpannāḥ iva karṣakāḥ śūrāḥ iva vijita saṃgrāmāḥ
translated: Like farmers with abundant crops, like heroes victorious in battle,

original: sarvarogaparimuktā ivāturāḥ yayā vibhūtyā bhagavatsakāśam āgatās tayaiva vibhūtyā svabhavanaṃ gatāḥ //
analyzed: sarva roga parimuktāḥ iva āturāḥ yayā vibhūtyā bhagavat sakāśam āgatāḥ tayā eva vibhūtyā sva bhavanam gatāḥ
translated: like patients completely cured of all diseases, with the same splendor with which they had come into the Blessed One's presence, they returned to their own abodes with that same splendor.

analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ pūrvarātra apararātram jāgarikā yogam anuyuktāḥ viharanti
translated: The monks, engaged in the practice of staying awake [in meditation] during the first and last parts of the night,

analyzed: taiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ bhagavataḥ ntike udāraḥ vabhāsaḥ
translated: saw a great light in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā saṃdigdhāḥ bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: Having seen it, they were doubtful and asked the Blessed One:

original: kiṃ bhagavann imāṃ rātriṃ bhagavantaṃ darśanāya brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ śakro devendraś catvāro lokapālā upasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: kim bhagavan imām rātrim bhagavantam darśanāya brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ śakraḥ deva indraḥ catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Blessed One, was it Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, or Śakra, the lord of the gods, or the Four Great Kings who came to see the Blessed One during this night?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: na bhikṣavo brahmā sahāṃpatir na śakro devendro nāpi catvāro lokapālā māṃ darśanāyopasaṃkrāntāḥ /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ brahmā sahāṃpatiḥ na śakraḥ deva indraḥ na api catvāraḥ lokapālāḥ mām darśanāya upasaṃkrāntāḥ
translated: Monks, it was neither Brahmā, the lord of the Sahā world, nor Śakra, the lord of the gods, nor the Four Great Kings who came to see me.

original: api tu dṛṣṭās te yuṣmābhir bhikṣavas tāni pañca haṃsaśatāni rājñā prasenajitā kauśalena ihotsṛṣṭāni /
analyzed: api tu dṛṣṭāḥ te yuṣmābhiḥ bhikṣavaḥ tāni pañca haṃsa śatāni rājñā prasenajitā kauśalena iha utsṛṣṭāni
translated: But, monks, did you see those five hundred geese released here by King Prasenajit of Kośala?

analyzed: evam bhadanta
translated: Yes, Bhadanta.

translated: The Blessed One gave him attention.

original: tena yujyamānena vyāyacchamānena ghaṭamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakaṃ saṃsāracakraṃ
analyzed: tena yujyamānena vyāyacchamānena ghaṭamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakam saṃsāra cakram
translated: By him, being diligent, striving, and persevering, this wheel of the five aggregates of clinging,

analyzed: calācalam viditvā sarva saṃskāra gatīḥ śatana patana vikaraṇa vidhvaṃsana dharmatayā parāhatya
translated: having known it to be moving and unmoving, having destroyed all the courses of conditioned things by the nature of their destruction, fall, disintegration, and dissolution,

analyzed: sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: having abandoned all afflictions, he realized arhatship.

original: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātukavītarāgaḥ samaloṣṭakāñcana ākāśapāṇitalasamacitto vāsīcandanakalpo vidyāvidāritāṇḍakośo vidyābhijñāpratisaṃvitprāpto
analyzed: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātuka vīta rāgaḥ sama loṣṭa kāñcanaḥ ākāśa pāṇitala sama cittaḥ vāsī candana kalpaḥ vidyā vidārita āṇḍakośaḥ vidyā abhijñā pratisaṃvid prāptaḥ
translated: He became an arhat, free from attachment to the three realms, with a mind like a mountain, like a polished beryl gem, his mind liberated, free from the sheath of afflictions. He attained the knowledges, the superknowledges, and the discriminations.

analyzed: bhava lābha lobha satkāra parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: He turned his back on worldly gain, greed, and honor.

original: sendropendrāṇāṃ devānāṃ pūjyo mānyo 'bhivādyaś ca saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: sa indra upendrāṇām devānām pūjyaḥ mānyaḥ bhivādyaḥ ca saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He became one to be worshipped, revered, and saluted by Indra, Upendra, and the gods.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha who removes all doubts:

original: kāni bhadanta suvarṇābhena karmāṇi kṛtāni yenaivaṃrūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ pravrajya ca acirād Speyer / cāciraṃ
analyzed: kāni bhadanta suvarṇābhena karmāṇi kṛtāni yena evaṃrūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ pravrajya ca acirāt ca acirāt
translated: What actions did Suvarṇābha perform, venerable one, by which he became so handsome, lovely, and pleasing to look at, and by which he quickly attained

analyzed: arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam iti
translated: arhatship after going forth?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: suvarṇābhenaiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: suvarṇābhena eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: Monks, Suvarṇābha himself performed and accumulated these actions in his previous lives, gathering the requisites and conditions, like a flood, they approached, inevitably to happen.

analyzed: suvarṇābhena karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: Suvarṇābha performed and accumulated these actions.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience them?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that are performed and accumulated do not ripen in the external earth element.🔽Nor in the water element.

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Nor in the fire element.

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor in the wind element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca
translated: But rather, actions that are performed and accumulated ripen in the appropriated aggregates, elements, and sense bases, the good and the bad.

original: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpaśatair api /
analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Actions do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When the conditions are complete and the time has come, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani ekanavate kalpe vipaśyī nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani ekanavate kalpe vipaśyī nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loka
translated: Monks, in the past, ninety-one aeons ago, there was a Perfectly Awakened One named Vipaśyin in the world.

original: udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He appeared in the world, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Fully Enlightened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.

analyzed: sa bandhumatīm rājadhānīm upaniśritya viharati
translated: He dwelt in the capital city of Bandhumatī.

original: yāvad vipaśyī samyaksaṃbuddho buddhakāryaṃ kṛtvā indhanakṣayād ivāgnir nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat vipaśyī samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ buddha kāryam kṛtvā indhana kṣayāt iva agniḥ nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Then, when the Perfectly Awakened Vipaśyin had done all that had to be done for the benefit of gods and humans, he attained final nirvāṇa like a fire without fuel, in the realm of nirvāṇa without any substratum left.

original: tato rājñā bandhumatā bhagavataḥ śarīre śarīrapūjāṃ kṛtvā samantayojanaḥ stūpaś catūratnamayaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ krośam uccatvena
analyzed: tatas rājñā bandhumatā bhagavataḥ śarīre śarīra pūjām kṛtvā samanta yojanaḥ stūpaḥ catur ratna mayaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ krośam ucca tvena
translated: Then King Bandhumat, having performed the funeral rites for the Blessed One's body, erected a stūpa of the four precious substances, one yojana in circumference and one yojana in height,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy. p.

analyzed: stūpa mahaḥ ca prajñaptaḥ
translated: and proclaimed a great festival for the stūpa.

original: yāvad anyatamo gṛhapatis tasmin stūpamahe vartamāne nirgataḥ /
analyzed: yāvat anyatamaḥ gṛhapatiḥ tasmin stūpa mahe vartamāne nirgataḥ
translated: Then a certain householder, on the occasion of that stūpa festival, went out.

original: tena tasmāt stūpāt sauvarṇavarṇa ādarśaḥ patito dṛṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: tena tasmāt stūpāt sauvarṇa varṇaḥ ādarśaḥ patitaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: He saw a golden-colored mirror fallen from that stūpa.

original: sa tenāvataṃsakaṃ kārayitvā tatra stūpe āropitaḥ /
analyzed: sa tena avataṃsakam kārayitvā tatra stūpe āropitaḥ
translated: He had a crest made from it and placed it on that stūpa.

original: gandhadhūpapuṣpārcanaṃ kṛtvā pādayor nipatya praṇidhānaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: gandha dhūpa puṣpa arcanam kṛtvā pādayoḥ nipatya praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Having offered incense, perfume, and flowers, he fell at the feet [of the stūpa] and made a vow:

original: aham apy evaṃvidhānāṃ guṇānāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: aham api evaṃvidhānām guṇānām lābhī bhaviṣyāmi
translated: I too will attain such qualities.

analyzed: evaṃvidham eva śāstāram ārāgayeyam iti
translated: I will please a teacher just like this.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena gṛhapatir āsīt /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena gṛhapatiḥ āsīt
translated: What do you think, monks, the one who was the householder at that time, on that occasion,

analyzed: ayam sa suvarṇa ābhaḥ
translated: he is this Suvarṇābha.

original: yat tena vipaśyinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya stūpe kārāḥ kṛtāḥ /
analyzed: yat tena vipaśyinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya stūpe kārāḥ kṛtāḥ
translated: Because he made offerings to the stūpa of the perfectly awakened Vipaśyin,

analyzed: tena asya evaṃvidhaḥ rūpa viśeṣaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: he attained such an excellent form.

original: yat praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ tad ihaiva janmany arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: yat praṇidhānam kṛtam tat iha eva janmani arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Because he made the aspiration, in this very life he realized arhatship.

original: iti hi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇānāṃ karmaṇām ekāntakṛṣṇo vipākaḥ /🔽ekāntaśuklānām ekāntaśuklaḥ /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇānām karmaṇām ekānta kṛṣṇaḥ vipākaḥ  ekānta śuklānām ekānta śuklaḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the ripening of entirely dark actions is entirely dark,🔽the ripening of entirely bright actions is entirely bright,

analyzed: vyatimiśrāṇām vyatimiśraḥ
translated: the ripening of mixed actions is mixed.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇāni karmāṇy apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇāni karmāṇi apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca
translated: Therefore, monks, having abandoned entirely dark actions and mixed actions,

analyzed: ekānta śukleṣu eva karmasu ābhogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: one should apply oneself to only entirely bright actions.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks, with uplifted minds, rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: sugandhiḥ
translated: Fragrant. Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, tribal chieftains, charioteers, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas. He was known as the one with great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: the one who receives robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for sickness, and requisites, together with the community of monks.

analyzed: kapilavastuni viharati nyagrodha ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Kapilavastu, in the Nyagrodha grove.

original: kapilavastuni anyatamaḥ kulaputraḥ prativasati āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogo vistīrṇaviśālaparigraho vaiśravaṇadhanasamudito vaiśravaṇadhanapratispardhī
analyzed: kapilavastuni anyatamaḥ kula putraḥ prativasati āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ vistīrṇa viśāla parigrahaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana samuditaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana pratispardhī
translated: In Kapilavastu, there lived a certain noble son who was wealthy, had great riches and possessions, had extensive and vast belongings, was equal to Vaiśravaṇa in wealth, and was a rival to Vaiśravaṇa in wealth.

analyzed: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam
translated: He took a wife from a family equal to his own.

original: sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: He played, made love, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putro jāto 'bhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādiko atikrānto mānuṣavarṇam asaṃprāptaś ca divyaṃ varṇam /
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putraḥ jātaḥ bhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ atikrāntaḥ mānuṣa varṇam a saṃprāptaḥ ca divyam varṇam
translated: While he was playing, enjoying, and amusing himself, a son was born, who was well-proportioned, pleasing to the eye, and beautiful, surpassing human complexion without attaining divine complexion.

original: tasya mukhān nīlotpalagandho vāti sarvaśarīrāc candanagandhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya mukhāt nīlotpala gandhaḥ vāti sarva śarīrāt candana gandhaḥ
translated: From his mouth there emanated the fragrance of blue lotuses, and from his entire body the fragrance of sandalwood.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā nāmadheyaṃ vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā nāmadheyam vyavasthāpyate
translated: At his birth, a great celebration was held and a name was given to him.

analyzed: kim bhavatu dārakasya nāma iti
translated: What should be the boy's name?

analyzed: jñātayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The relatives said:

analyzed: yasmāt asya mukāt nīlotpala gandhaḥ vāti
translated: Since the fragrance of blue lotuses emanates from his mouth,

analyzed: śarīrāt candana gandhaḥ
translated: and the fragrance of sandalwood from his body,

original: tasmād bhavatu dārakasya sugandhir iti nāmeti /
analyzed: tasmāt bhavatu dārakasya sugandhiḥ iti nāma iti
translated: therefore let the boy's name be Sugandha (Sweet Fragrance).🔽The boy Sugandha was given to eight nurses, two nurses to hold him, two to give him milk, two to clean him, and two to play with him.

original: sugandhir dārako 'ṣṭābhyo dhātrībhyo datto dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ kṣīradhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ maladhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ krīḍanikābhyāṃ 🔽dhātrībhyām /
analyzed: sugandhiḥ dārakaḥ ṣṭābhyaḥ dhātrībhyaḥ dattaḥ dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyām dvābhyām kṣīradhātrībhyām dvābhyām maladhātrībhyām dvābhyām krīḍanikābhyām  dhātrībhyām
translated: to two nurses to hold him, two to give him milk, two to clean him, and two to play with him.

original: so 'ṣṭābhir dhātrībhir unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍenānyaiś cottaptottaptair upakaraṇaviśeṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭābhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiḥ ca uttapta uttaptaiḥ upakaraṇa viśeṣaiḥ
translated: He was raised by eight nurses, nourished on milk, curd, butter, ghee, and cream, and on other special nourishing foods.

analyzed: āśu vardhate hrada stham iva paṅkajam
translated: grows quickly, like a lotus in a pond.

original: sa pūrvahetubalādhānāc chrāddho bhadraḥ kalyāṇāśaya ātmahitaparahitapratipannaḥ kāruṇiko mahātmā dharmakāmaḥ /
analyzed: sa pūrva hetu bala ādhānāt śrāddhaḥ bhadraḥ kalyāṇa āśayaḥ ātma hita para hita pratipannaḥ kāruṇikaḥ mahātmā dharma kāmaḥ
translated: He, due to the power of his previous causes, is faithful, good, of wholesome intentions, engaged in benefiting himself and others, compassionate, magnanimous, and desirous of the Dharma.

original: yadā sugandhir dārakaḥ keyūrahārakaṭakālaṃkṛto vīthīm avatarati /
analyzed: yadā sugandhiḥ dārakaḥ keyūra hāra kaṭaka alaṃkṛtaḥ vīthīm avatarati
translated: When the boy Sugandhi, adorned with armlets, necklaces, and earrings, descends into the street,

analyzed: tadā candana gandhena sarvam nagaram āpūrayati
translated: then the entire city is filled with the scent of sandalwood.

original: janakāyaś ca divyaṃ gandham āghrāya paraṃ vismayam āpadyte /
analyzed: jana kāyaḥ ca divyam gandham āghrāya param vismayam āpadyate
translated: And the people, having smelled the divine scent, are filled with great wonder.

original: evaṃ cāha / aho puṇyānāṃ sāmarthyam iti /
analyzed: evam ca āha aho puṇyānām sāmarthyam iti
translated: And they say, Oh, the power of merit!

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vaidya, p.

original: yāvad apareṇa samayena sugandhir dārako nyagrodhārāmaṃ gataḥ /
analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena sugandhiḥ dārakaḥ nyagrodha ārāmam gataḥ
translated: Then, at another time, the boy Sugandhi went to the Nyagrodha Grove.

original: athāsau dadarśa buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
analyzed: atha asau dadarśa buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
translated: There he saw the Buddha, the Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: aśītyā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks, adorned with a fathom-wide halo, his radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

analyzed: jaṅgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: like a moving jeweled mountain, beautiful in every way.

analyzed: saha darśanāt ca anena bhagavataḥ ntike cittam prasāditam
translated: And as soon as he saw the Blessed One, his mind became serene.

original: prasādajātaś ca bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvā purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: prasāda jātaḥ ca bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Having given rise to serenity, he bowed his head at the Blessed One's feet and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: tasmai bhagavatā āśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśī caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikī dharmadeśanā kṛtā /
analyzed: tasmai bhagavatā āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśī catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikī dharma deśanā kṛtā
translated: The Blessed One, knowing his aspirations, latent tendencies, temperament, and nature, gave him a discourse on the Dharma that penetrated the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā sugandhidārakeṇa viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpattiphalaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā sugandhi dārakeṇa viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpatti phalam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Hearing it, Sugandhi broke through the twenty-peak high mountain of the view of the transitory collection with the diamond-like wisdom, and actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: sa dṛṣṭasatyo mātāpitarāv anujñāpya bhagavacchāsane pravrajitaḥ /
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭa satyaḥ mātā pitarau anujñāpya bhagavat śāsane pravrajitaḥ
translated: Having seen the truths, he took his parents' permission and went forth in the Blessed One's teachings.

original: tena yujyamānena vyāyacchamānena ghaṭamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakaṃ saṃsāracakraṃ
analyzed: tena yujyamānena vyāyacchamānena ghaṭamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakam saṃsāra cakram
translated: While he was striving, persevering, and exerting himself, he understood that this five-constituent existence, this cycle of birth and death,

analyzed: calācalam viditvā sarva saṃskāra gatīḥ śatana patana vikaraṇa vidhvaṃsana dharmatayā parāhatya
translated: is unstable, and having destroyed all conditioned states with the knowledge that they are subject to destruction, falling, perishing, and dissolution,

analyzed: sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: he actualized the fruit of arhatship through the complete destruction of all defilements.

original: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātukavītarāgaḥ samaloṣṭakāñcana ākāśapāṇitalasamacitto vāsīcandanakalpo vidyāvidāritāṇḍakośo vidyābhijñāpratisaṃvitprāpto
analyzed: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātuka vīta rāgaḥ sama loṣṭa kāñcanaḥ ākāśa pāṇitala sama cittaḥ vāsī candana kalpaḥ vidyā vidārita āṇḍakośaḥ vidyā abhijñā pratisaṃvid prāptaḥ
translated: He became an arhat, free from the passions of the three realms, with a mind like a diamond toward earth, gold, and space, like a sandalwood tree, with the shell of the egg of ignorance broken by knowledge, attained to knowledge, insight, and wisdom,

analyzed: bhava lābha lobha satkāra parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: with his back turned on gain, honor, and fame.

original: sendropendrāṇāṃ devānāṃ pūjyo mānyo 'bhivādyaś ca saṃvṛttaḥ //
analyzed: sa indra upendrāṇām devānām pūjyaḥ mānyaḥ bhivādyaḥ ca saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He became one to be worshipped, revered, and saluted by Indra, Upendra, and the gods.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, being doubtful, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, who removes all doubts:

original: kāni bhadanta sugandhinā karmāṇi kṛtāni yenāsya mukhān nīlotpalagandho vāti /
analyzed: kāni bhadanta sugandhinā karmāṇi kṛtāni yena asya mukhāt nīlotpala gandhaḥ vāti
translated: Venerable One, what actions did Sugandhi perform that the scent of blue lotuses wafts from his mouth,

analyzed: sarva śarīrāt candana gandhaḥ ca
translated: and the scent of sandalwood from his entire body?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, Sugandhi himself performed and accumulated these actions in other lives, gathering the conditions,

original: sugandhinaiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni🔽sugandhinā karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni /
analyzed: sugandhinā eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni  sugandhinā karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: and Sugandhi himself will experience the results.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience the results of actions that were performed and accumulated by Sugandhi?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been done and accumulated do not ripen externally in the element of earth.🔽Nor in the element of water.

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Nor in the element of fire.

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor in the element of air.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca
translated: But rather, actions that have been done, whether good or bad, ripen in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases that have been appropriated.

analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: Actions do not perish even after hundreds of millions of eons.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //🔽bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani ekanavate kalpe vipaśyī nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām  bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani ekanavate kalpe vipaśyī nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loka
translated: When they encounter the assemblage and the right occasion, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: Monks, in the past, ninety-one eons ago, a Perfectly Awakened One called Vipaśyin arose in the world, a Tathāgata, an Arhat, a Perfectly Awakened One, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a Sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed Lord.

analyzed: sa bandhumatīm rājadhānīm upaniśritya viharati
translated: He dwelt and stayed in the capital city of Bandhumatī.

original: yāvad vipaśyī samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ kṛtvā indhanakṣayād ivāgnir nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat vipaśyī samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sakalam buddha kāryam kṛtvā indhana kṣayāt iva agniḥ nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Then, when the Perfectly Awakened Vipaśyin had completed all the activities of a Buddha, like a fire extinguished when the fuel is used up, he attained final nirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any substratum remaining.

original: tato rājñā bandhumatā bhagavataḥ śarīre śarīrapūjāṃ kṛtvā samantayojanaḥ stūpaś catūratnamayaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ krośam uccatvena /
analyzed: tatas rājñā bandhumatā bhagavataḥ śarīre śarīra pūjām kṛtvā samanta yojanaḥ stūpaḥ catur ratna mayaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ krośam ucca tvena
translated: Then King Bandhumat made offerings to the Blessed One's body, and erected a stūpa made of the four jewels, one yojana in circumference and one krosa in height.

analyzed: stūpa mahaḥ ca prajñaptaḥ
translated: And he instituted the Great Stūpa Festival.

original: tatrānyatamena gṛhapatinā prasādajātena vicitrair gandhaiḥ pralepaṃ datvā dhūpapuṣpārcanaṃ kṛtvā praṇidhānaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tatra anyatamena gṛhapatinā prasāda jātena vicitraiḥ gandhaiḥ pralepam da tvā dhūpa puṣpa arcanam kṛtvā praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: There, a certain householder, filled with faith, applied various fragrances, offered incense and flowers, and made a vow:

original: anenāhaṃ kuśalamūlena cittotpādena deyadharmaparityāgena evaṃvidhānāṃ guṇānāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyāmi /
analyzed: anena aham kuśala mūlena citta utpādena deya dharma parityāgena evaṃvidhānām guṇānām lābhī bhaviṣyāmi
translated: By this wholesome root, this resolve, this relinquishment of the Dharma to be given, may I attain such qualities.

analyzed: evaṃvidham eva śāstāram ārāgayeyam
translated: May I delight in such a teacher.

analyzed: mā virāgayeyam iti
translated: May I not be dispassionate.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena gṛhapatir āsīt /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena gṛhapatiḥ āsīt
translated: What do you think, monks, the one who was the householder at that time, on that occasion,

analyzed: ayam sa sugandhiḥ
translated: he is this Sugandha.

original: yad anena vipaśyinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya stūpe kārāḥ kṛtās tena tena sugandhaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: yat anena vipaśyinaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhasya stūpe kārāḥ kṛtāḥ tena tena sugandhaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: Because he made offerings at the stūpa of the perfectly awakened Vipaśyin, he became fragrant.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy.

original: yat praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ teneha janmany arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: yat praṇidhānam kṛtam tena iha janmani arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Because he made a vow, in this life he attained arhatship.

original: iti hi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇānāṃ karmaṇām ekāntakṛṣṇo vipākaḥ /🔽ekāntaśuklānām ekāntaśuklaḥ /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇānām karmaṇām ekānta kṛṣṇaḥ vipākaḥ  ekānta śuklānām ekānta śuklaḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the ripening of entirely dark actions is entirely dark,🔽the ripening of entirely bright actions is entirely bright,

analyzed: vyatimiśrāṇām vyatimiśraḥ
translated: the ripening of mixed actions is mixed.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇāni karmāṇy apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇāni karmāṇi apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca
translated: Therefore, monks, having abandoned entirely dark actions and mixed actions,

analyzed: ekānta śukleṣu eva karmasu ābhogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: you should apply yourselves to entirely bright actions.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks were delighted and rejoiced in what the Blessed One said.

analyzed: vapuṣmān
translated: Vapuṣmat. Edited by Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country-dwellers, messengers, celestial musicians, demons, serpents, human and non-human beings, and the assemblies of monks, nuns, male and female lay followers.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, who was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: He was a recipient of robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, remedies for sickness, and requisites, together with the community of monks.

analyzed: kapilavastuni viharati nyagrodha ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in the Nyagrodha grove near Kapilavastu.

original: kapilavastuni anyatamaḥ śākya āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogo vistīrṇaviśālaparigraho vaiśravaṇadhanasamudito vaiśravaṇadhanapratispardhī /
analyzed: kapilavastuni anyatamaḥ śākyaḥ āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ vistīrṇa viśāla parigrahaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana samuditaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana pratispardhī
translated: In Kapilavastu, there was a certain Shakya who was wealthy, had great riches and possessions, had extensive and vast property, was equal to Vaisravana in wealth, and was a rival of Vaisravana in wealth.

analyzed: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal standing.

original: sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: He played, made love, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putro jāto 'bhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādiko
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putraḥ jātaḥ bhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ
translated: While he was playing, making love, and enjoying himself, a son was born to him, who was handsome, good-looking, and pleasing to the eye.

original: gauro 'tikrānto mānuṣavarṇam asaṃprāptaś ca divyaṃ varṇaṃ ramyavapuḥ sūkṣmatvaṅ maheśākhyaḥ
analyzed: a tikrāntaḥ mānuṣa varṇam a saṃprāptaḥ ca divyam varṇam ramya vapuḥ sūkṣma tvac maheśa ākhyaḥ
translated: He was fair, surpassing the human complexion but not yet having the divine complexion, with a beautiful body, fine skin, and great majesty.

analyzed: prāpta ucchraya kāyaḥ ca
translated: And his body had attained height.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā nāmadheyaṃ vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā nāmadheyam vyavasthāpyate
translated: At his birth, a great celebration was held and a name was established for him.

analyzed: kim bhavatu dārakasya nāma iti
translated: What should the boy's name be?

analyzed: jñātayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The relatives said:

analyzed: yasmāt asya divyam vapuḥ
translated: Since he has a divine body,

original: tasmād bhavatu dārakasya vapuṣmān iti nāmeti /🔽vapuṣmān dārako 'ṣṭābhyo dhātrībhyo datto dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ kṣīradhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ maladhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ krīḍanikābhyāṃ 🔽dhātrībhyām /
analyzed: tasmāt bhavatu dārakasya vapuṣmān iti nāma iti  vapuṣmān dārakaḥ ṣṭābhyaḥ dhātrībhyaḥ dattaḥ dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyām dvābhyām kṣīradhātrībhyām dvābhyām maladhātrībhyām dvābhyām krīḍanikābhyām  dhātrībhyām
translated: Therefore, let the boy's name be Vapuṣmat.🔽The boy Vapuṣmat was given to eight nurses, two nurses to hold him, two to give him breast milk, two to clean away his excrement, and two to play with him.🔽to two nurses to hold him, two to give him breast milk, two to clean away his excrement, and two to play with him.

original: so 'ṣṭābhir dhātrībhir unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍenānyaiś cottaptottaptair upakaraṇaviśeṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭābhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiḥ ca uttapta uttaptaiḥ upakaraṇa viśeṣaiḥ
translated: He was raised by eight nurses, nourished on milk, curd, butter, ghee, and cream, and with other special nourishing foods.

analyzed: āśu vardhate hrada stham iva paṅkajam
translated: He grew quickly, like a lotus in a pond.

original: sa ca śrāddho bhadraḥ kalyāṇāśaya ātmahitaparahitapratipannaḥ kāruṇiko mahātmā dharmakāmaḥ sarvalokeṣu pūjyo mānyo 'bhivādyaś ca /
analyzed: sa ca śrāddhaḥ bhadraḥ kalyāṇa āśayaḥ ātma hita para hita pratipannaḥ kāruṇikaḥ mahātmā dharma kāmaḥ sarva lokeṣu pūjyaḥ mānyaḥ bhivādyaḥ ca
translated: And he was faithful, good, of good intentions, engaged in benefiting himself and others, compassionate, magnanimous, devoted to the Dharma, and worthy of veneration, respect, and homage in all the worlds.

original: tato vapuṣmān yān yān api sa bhūpradeśān gatvā krāmati /
analyzed: tatas vapuṣmān yān yān api sa bhū pradeśān gatvā krāmati
translated: Then wherever Vapuṣmat went and walked on the ground,

analyzed: te te sya medhyāḥ bhavanti
translated: that place became pure for him.

analyzed: evaṃvidhaḥ puṇya maheśākhyaḥ
translated: Such was his great merit and renown.

analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena nyagrodha ārāmam gataḥ
translated: Later, he went to the Nyagrodha grove.

original: athāsau dadarśa buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
analyzed: atha asau dadarśa buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
translated: Then he saw the Blessed Buddha, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: aśītyā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks, adorned with a fathom-wide halo, his radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

analyzed: jaṅgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: like a moving jeweled mountain, beautiful in every way.

analyzed: saha darśanāt ca anena bhagavataḥ ntike cittam  vaidya p  prasāditam
translated: And as soon as he saw the Blessed One, he generated faith in his mind,

original: prasādajātaś ca bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvā purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: prasāda jātaḥ ca bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: and with faith arisen, he bowed at the Blessed One's feet and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: tasmai bhagavatā āśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśī caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikī dharmadeśanā kṛtā /
analyzed: tasmai bhagavatā āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśī catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikī dharma deśanā kṛtā
translated: The Blessed One, knowing his aspirations, latent tendencies, temperament, and nature, gave him a teaching of the Dharma that penetrated the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā vapuṣmatā viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpattiphalaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā vapuṣmatā viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotaāpatti phalam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Hearing it, Vapushman shattered with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty-peak high mountain of the view of the transitory collection, and actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: sa dṛṣṭasatyo mātāpitarāv anujñāpya bhagavacchāsane pravrajitaḥ /
analyzed: sa dṛṣṭa satyaḥ mātā pitarau anujñāpya bhagavat śāsane pravrajitaḥ
translated: Having seen the truths, he took his parents' permission and went forth in the Blessed One's teaching.

original: tena yujyamānena vyāyacchamānena ghaṭamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakaṃ saṃsāracakraṃ
analyzed: tena yujyamānena vyāyacchamānena ghaṭamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakam saṃsāra cakram
translated: By him, being diligent, striving, and persevering, this wheel of the five aggregates of clinging,

analyzed: calācalam viditvā sarva saṃskāra gatīḥ śatana patana vikiraṇa vidhvaṃsana dharmatayā parāhatya
translated: having known it to be moving and unmoving, having destroyed all the courses of conditioned things by the nature of their destruction, fall, scattering, and dissolution,

analyzed: sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: having abandoned all afflictions, he actualized arhatship.

original: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātukavītarāgaḥ samaloṣṭakāñcana ākāśapāṇitalasamacitto vāsīcandanakalpo vidyāvidāritāṇḍakośo vidyābhijñāpratisaṃvitprāpto
analyzed: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātuka vīta rāgaḥ sama loṣṭa kāñcanaḥ ākāśa pāṇitala sama cittaḥ vāsī candana kalpaḥ vidyā vidārita āṇḍakośaḥ vidyā abhijñā pratisaṃvid prāptaḥ
translated: He became an arhat, free from attachment to the three realms, with a mind like a mountain, like space, like a diamond, his mind liberated, having attained the destruction of the taints.

analyzed: bhava lābha lobha satkāra parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: He turned his back on worldly gain, greed, and honor.

original: sendropendrāṇāṃ devānāṃ pūjyo mānyo 'bhivādyaś ca saṃvṛttaḥ //
analyzed: sa indra upendrāṇām devānām pūjyaḥ mānyaḥ bhivādyaḥ ca saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He became one to be worshipped, revered, and saluted by Indra, Upendra, and the gods.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha who removes all doubts:

original: kāni bhadanta vapuṣmatā karmāṇi kṛtāni yenāsyaivaṃvidha āśrayo 'rhatvaṃ ca prāptam iti /
analyzed: kāni bhadanta vapuṣmatā karmāṇi kṛtāni yena asya evaṃvidhaḥ āśrayaḥ ṛha tvam ca prāptam iti
translated: Venerable sir, what actions did Vapushman perform that he obtained such a body and attained arhatship?

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: vapuṣmataiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: vapuṣmatā eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: Monks, Vapuṣmat himself performed and accumulated these actions in his previous lives, with the right conditions and not without conditions, bound to come to pass, having no fixed time.

analyzed: vapuṣmatā karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: Vapuṣmat performed and accumulated these actions.

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience their results?

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated are not ripened in the external earth element.🔽Nor in the water element.

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Nor in the fire element.

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor in the wind element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca
translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated are ripened in the very appropriated aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres.

analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api
translated: Actions do not perish even in hundreds of koṭis of kalpas.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When they attain the right conditions and the right time, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani ekanavate kalpe vipaśyī nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani ekanavate kalpe vipaśyī nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loka
translated: Monks, in the past, ninety-one kalpas ago, there appeared in the world a Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened One named Vipaśyin,

original: udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: He appeared in the world, a tathāgata, arhat, perfectly awakened, perfect in knowledge and conduct, a sugata, a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a buddha, a bhagavat.

analyzed: sa bandhumatīm rājadhānīm upaniśritya viharati
translated: He took up residence in the capital city of Bandhumatī.

original: yāvad vipaśyī samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sakalaṃ buddhakāryaṃ kṛtvā indhanakṣayād ivāgnir nirupadhiśeṣe nirvāṇadhātau parinirvṛtaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat vipaśyī samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ sakalam buddha kāryam kṛtvā indhana kṣayāt iva agniḥ nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvṛtaḥ
translated: Then, after Vipaśyin, the Perfectly Awakened One, had completed all the activities of a buddha, like a fire extinguished when there is no more fuel, he passed into parinirvāṇa in the realm of nirvāṇa without any remainder of the skandhas.

original: tato 'sya rājñā bandhumatā śarīre śarīrapūjāṃ kṛtvā samantayojanaś catūratnamayaḥ stūpaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ krośam uccatvena /
analyzed: tatas sya rājñā bandhumatā śarīre śarīra pūjām kṛtvā samanta yojanaḥ catur ratna mayaḥ stūpaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ krośam ucca tvena
translated: Then King Bandhumat, after performing the body worship for his body, erected a stūpa made of the four precious substances, extending for a full yojana and one krośa in height.

original: tatra ca rājñā bandumatā saputravargeṇa sāmātyagaṇaparivṛtena stūpamahaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca rājñā bandumatā sa putra vargeṇa sa amātya gaṇa parivṛtena stūpa mahaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: And there, King Bandhumat, surrounded by his sons and retinue of ministers, held a stūpa festival.

original: yāvad anyatamasmin divase 'nyatamo daridrapuruṣaḥ stūpāṅgaṇaṃ praviṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat anyatamasmin divase nyatamaḥ daridra puruṣaḥ stūpa aṅgaṇam praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Then, on one occasion, a certain poor man entered the stūpa courtyard.

analyzed: tatra tena puṣpāṇi mlānāni dṛṣṭāni
translated: There he saw the flowers had withered.

analyzed: rajasā ca stūpa aṅgaṇaḥ malinīkṛtaḥ
translated: And the stūpa courtyard was soiled with dust.

original: tatas tena buddhaguṇān anusmṛtya prasādajātena saṃmārjanīṃ gṛhītvā stūpaḥ saṃmṛṣṭo nirmālyaṃ cāpanītam /
analyzed: tatas tena buddha guṇān anusmṛtya prasāda jātena saṃmārjanīm gṛhītvā stūpaḥ saṃmṛṣṭaḥ nirmālyam ca apanītam
translated: Then, remembering the Buddha's qualities and filled with faith, he took a broom, swept the stūpa, and removed the withered flowers.

original: tato 'pagatarajaṃ stūpaṃ nirmalaṃ dṛṣṭvā prasādajātaḥ pādayor nipatya praṇidhānaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: tatas upagata rajam stūpam nirmalam dṛṣṭvā prasāda jātaḥ pādayoḥ nipatya praṇidhānam kṛtam
translated: Seeing the stūpa free from dust and impurities, he was filled with faith, fell at the feet [of the Buddha], and made a vow:

original: anenāhaṃ kuśalena cittotpādena caivaṃvidhānāṃ guṇānāṃ lābhī bhaviṣyāmīty evaṃvidham eva śāstāram ārāgayeyam /
analyzed: anena aham kuśalena citta utpādena ca evaṃvidhānām guṇānām lābhī bhaviṣyāmi iti evaṃvidham eva śāstāram ārāgayeyam
translated: By this wholesome action and this thought, may I attain such qualities, and may I encounter such a teacher.

analyzed: mā virāgayeyam iti
translated: May I not be separated from him.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: Vidy.

original: bhagavān āha /🔽kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena daridraḥ puruṣa āsīt /
analyzed: bhagavān āha  kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena daridraḥ puruṣaḥ āsīt
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: ayam sa vapuṣmān
translated: What do you think, monks? The poor man at that time, on that occasion, was this very Puṣya.

analyzed: yatas tena stūpaḥ saṃmṛṣṭaḥ
translated: Because he swept the stūpa,

analyzed: tena abhirūpaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: he became handsome.

original: yat praṇidhānaṃ kṛtaṃ teneha janmany arhatvaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /🔽iti hi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇānāṃ karmaṇām ekāntakṛṣṇo vipākaḥ /🔽ekāntaśuklānām ekāntaśuklaḥ /
analyzed: yat praṇidhānam kṛtam tena iha janmani arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam  iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇānām karmaṇām ekānta kṛṣṇaḥ vipākaḥ  ekānta śuklānām ekānta śuklaḥ
translated: Because he made the vow, in this life he attained arhatship.🔽Thus, monks, the results of entirely dark actions are entirely dark,🔽the results of entirely bright actions are entirely bright,

analyzed: vyatimiśrāṇām vyatimiśraḥ
translated: and the results of mixed actions are mixed.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇāni karmāṇy apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇāni karmāṇi apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca
translated: Therefore, monks, having abandoned actions that are entirely dark and mixed,

analyzed: ekānta śukleṣu eva karmasu ābhogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: one should apply oneself only to actions that are entirely bright.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: Delighted, those monks rejoiced in what the Blessed One said.

analyzed: balavān
translated: powerful. Ed. Speyer, Vol. I

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, townspeople,

original: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhair devair nāgair yakṣair asurair garuḍaiḥ kinnarair mahoragair
analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: country people, messengers, attendants, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus, the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas. He was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ
translated: and he received robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick. He was accompanied by an assembly of monks.

analyzed: kapilavastuni viharati nyagrodha ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Kapilavastu, in the Nyagrodha grove.

original: kapilavastuni anyatamaḥ śākya āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogo vistīrṇaviśālaparigraho vaiśravaṇadhanasamudito vaiśravaṇadhanapratispardhī /
analyzed: kapilavastuni anyatamaḥ śākyaḥ āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ vistīrṇa viśāla parigrahaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana samuditaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana pratispardhī
translated: In Kapilavastu, there was a certain Śākya who was wealthy, had great riches and property, and had extensive and vast possessions, equal to Vaiśravaṇa's wealth, rivaling Vaiśravaṇa's wealth.

analyzed: tena sadṛśāt kulāt kalatram ānītam
translated: He took a wife from a family of equal standing.

original: sa tayā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: sa tayā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: He played with her, made love to her, and enjoyed himself with her.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putro jāto 'bhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādiko 'tikrāntapauruṣabalaḥ /
analyzed: tasya krīḍataḥ ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putraḥ jātaḥ bhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ atikrānta pauruṣa balaḥ
translated: While he was playing, making love, and enjoying himself, a son was born, who was handsome, good-looking, and pleasing, with strength surpassing that of men.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā nāmadheyaṃ vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā nāmadheyam vyavasthāpyate
translated: When he was born, a birth celebration was held for him and a name was established.

analyzed: kim bhavatu dārakasya nāma iti
translated: What should the boy's name be?

analyzed: jñātayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The relatives said,

analyzed: yasmāt ayam dārakaḥ balavān
translated: Since this boy is strong,

original: prāptaṃ syād asya balavān iti nāma /
analyzed: prāptam syāt asya balavān iti nāma
translated: it would be fitting for him to have the name 'Strong One'.

original: balavān dārako 'ṣṭābhyo dhātrībhyo datto dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ kṣīradhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ maladhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ krīḍanikābhyāṃ
analyzed: balavān dārakaḥ ṣṭābhyaḥ dhātrībhyaḥ dattaḥ dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyām dvābhyām kṣīradhātrībhyām dvābhyām maladhātrībhyām dvābhyām krīḍanikābhyām
translated: The boy Strong One was given to eight nurses, two nurses to hold him, two to give him milk, two to clean him, and two to play with him.

analyzed: dhātrībhyām
translated: to the nurses.

original: so 'ṣṭābhir dhātrībhir unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍenānyaiś cottaptottaptair upakaraṇaviśeṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭābhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiḥ ca uttapta uttaptaiḥ upakaraṇa viśeṣaiḥ
translated: He was raised and nourished by eight wet nurses with milk, curd, butter, ghee, and milk solids, and with other special nourishing foods.

analyzed: āśu vardhate hrada stham iva paṅkajam
translated: He grew quickly, like a lotus in a pond.

original: sa ca śrāddho bhadraḥ kalyāṇāśaya ātmahitaparahitapratipannaḥ kāruṇiko mahātmā dharmakāmaḥ //
analyzed: sa ca śrāddhaḥ bhadraḥ kalyāṇa āśayaḥ ātma hita para hita pratipannaḥ kāruṇikaḥ mahātmā dharma kāmaḥ
translated: And he was faithful, good, of good character, intent on benefiting himself and others, compassionate, magnanimous, and devoted to the Dharma.

analyzed: yāvat apareṇa samayena nyagrodha ārāmam gataḥ
translated: Later, he went to the Nyagrodha grove.

original: athāsau dadarśa buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
analyzed: atha asau dadarśa buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
translated: There he saw the Buddha, the Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: aśītyā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: his body radiant with the eighty minor marks, adorned with a fathom-wide halo, his radiance surpassing a thousand suns,

original: jaṅgamam iva ratnaparvataṃ samantato bhadrakam /🔽sahadarśanāc cānena bhagavato 'ntike cittaṃ prasāditam /
analyzed: jaṅgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam  saha darśanāt ca anena bhagavataḥ ntike cittam prasāditam
