analyzed: sa pñcabhiḥ purāṇa śataiḥ vahanam bhṛtvā pañca pauruṣeyān gṛhītvā āhāram nāvikam kaivartam karṇadhāram ca tris api ghaṇṭā avaghoṣaṇam kṛtvā mahā samudram
translated: He, having hired a ship with five hundred purāṇas, having taken five servants, a cook, a sailor, a boatman, and a helmsman, having made three announcements with a bell,

analyzed: samudraḥ ca sārthavāhaḥ tīrthika abhiprasannaḥ

analyzed: saḥ kāla mṛtyu bhaya bhītaḥ ṣaṭ śāstṝn āyācitum pravṛttaḥ

analyzed: bhuvi ca tuvimaghaḥ yaḥ viśva devaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ  vayam iha maraṇa ārtāḥ vaḥ prapannāḥ sma śīghram

analyzed: śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: He was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in the Jeta Grove, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: śrāvastyām anyatamo gṛhapatir āḍhyo mahādhano mahābhogo vistīrṇaviśālaparigraho vaiśravaṇadhanasamudito
analyzed: śrāvastyām anyatamaḥ gṛhapatiḥ āḍhyaḥ mahādhanaḥ mahā bhogaḥ vistīrṇa viśāla parigrahaḥ vaiśravaṇa dhana samuditaḥ
translated: In Śrāvastī there was a certain householder who was wealthy, having great riches and property, with extensive and vast possessions, equal in wealth to Vaiśravaṇa,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: a physician.

analyzed: vaiśravaṇa dhana pratispardhī
translated: equal in wealth to Vaiśravaṇa.

analyzed: na ca asya putraḥ na duhitā
translated: But he had no son or daughter.

original: sa kare kapolaṃ datvā cintāparo vyavasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa kare kapolam da tvā cintā paraḥ vyavasthitaḥ
translated: He placed his hand on his cheek and sat absorbed in thought.

analyzed: aneka dhana samuditam me gṛham
translated: My house is filled with much wealth,

analyzed: na me putraḥ na duhitā
translated: but I have no son or daughter.

original: mamātyayāt sarvasvāpateyam aputrakam iti kṛtvā rājavidheyaṃ bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: mama atyayāt sarva svāpateyam aputrakam iti kṛtvā rāja vidheyam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: After my death, all my property will be considered ownerless and will become subject to the king's law.

analyzed: sa śramaṇa brāhmaṇa suhṛd saṃbandhi bāndhavaiḥ ucyate
translated: He was told by ascetics, brahmins, friends, relatives, and kinsmen:

analyzed: devatā ārādhanam kuruṣva iti
translated: You should worship the gods.

original: asti caiṣa loke pravādo yadāyācanahetoḥ putrā jāyante duhitaraś ceti /
analyzed: asti ca eṣa loke pravādaḥ yadā āyācana hetoḥ putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca iti
translated: And there is this saying in the world: Sons and daughters are born because of supplication.

analyzed: tat ca na evam
translated: But that is not so.

analyzed: yadi evam abhaviṣyat
translated: If it were so,

original: ekaikasya putrasahasram abhaviṣyat tadyathā rājñaś cakravartinaḥ /
analyzed: ekaikasya putra sahasram abhaviṣyat tat yathā rājñaḥ cakravartinaḥ
translated: each person would have a thousand sons, just like a universal monarch.

original: api tu trayāṇāṃ sthānānāṃ saṃmukhībhāvāt putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: api tu trayāṇām sthānānām saṃmukhībhāvāt putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: But sons and daughters are born due to the convergence of three factors.

analyzed: katameṣām trayāṇām
translated: What are the three?

analyzed: mātā pitarau raktau bhavataḥ saṃnipatitau
translated: The mother and father are passionate and come together.

analyzed: mātā kalyā bhavati ṛtumatī
translated: The mother is healthy and in season.

analyzed: gandharvaḥ ca pratyupasthitaḥ bhavati
translated: And a gandharva is present.

original: eteṣāṃ trayāṇāṃ sthānānāṃ saṃmukhībhāvāt putrā jāyante duhitaraś ca /
analyzed: eteṣām trayāṇām sthānānām saṃmukhībhāvāt putrāḥ jāyante duhitaraḥ ca
translated: Due to the convergence of these three factors, sons and daughters are born.

analyzed: sa ca evam āyācana paraḥ tiṣṭhati
translated: And he remained thus, intent on supplication.

original: anyatamaś ca satvo 'nyatamasmād devanikāyāc cyutvā tasya prajāpatyāḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ /
analyzed: anyatamaḥ ca satvaḥ nyatamasmāt devanikāyāt cyutvā tasya prajāpatyāḥ kukṣim avakrāntaḥ
translated: And a certain being, having passed away from a certain divine realm, entered the womb of his wife.

analyzed: pañca āveṇikāḥ dharmāḥ ekatye paṇḍita jātīye mātṛgrāme
translated: There are five unique qualities in a certain wise woman.

analyzed: katame pañca
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: raktam puruṣam jānāti
translated: She knows a man is passionate.

original: viraktaṃ puruṣaṃ jānāti /🔽kālaṃ jānāti ṛtuṃ jānāti /
analyzed: viraktam puruṣam jānāti  kālam jānāti ṛtum jānāti
translated: He knows when a person is detached.🔽He knows the time, he knows the season.

original: garbham avakrāntaṃ jānāti /🔽yasya sakāśād garbho 'vakrāmati taṃ jānāti /🔽dārakaṃ jānāti /
analyzed: garbham avakrāntam jānāti  yasya sakāśāt garbhaḥ vakrāmati tam jānāti  dārakam jānāti
translated: He knows when a conception has taken place.🔽He knows from whom the conception has taken place.

original: dārikāṃ jānāti /🔽saced dārako bhavati dakṣiṇaṃ kukṣiṃ niśritya tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: dārikām jānāti  saced dārakaḥ bhavati dakṣiṇam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: He knows whether it is a boy or a girl.🔽If it is a boy, he knows that it is lying on the right side of the womb.

original: saced dārikā bhavati vāmaṃ kukṣiṃ niśritya tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: saced dārikā bhavati vāmam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: If it is a girl, he knows that it is lying on the left side of the womb.

analyzed: sā ātta manāḥ svāmine ārocayati
translated: She, being delighted, informs her husband:

analyzed: diṣṭyā āryaputra vardhase
translated: By good luck, noble sir, you are prospering.

analyzed: āpannasatvā asmi saṃvṛttā
translated: I have become pregnant.

original: yathā ca me dakṣiṇaṃ kukṣiṃ niśritya tiṣṭhati niyataṃ dārako bhaviṣyatīti /
analyzed: yathā ca me dakṣiṇam kukṣim niśritya tiṣṭhati niyatam dārakaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And because it is lying on the right side of the womb, it is certain that it will be a boy.

analyzed: saḥ pi ātta manāḥ pūrvakāyam abhyunnamayya speyeḥ  atyunnamayya
translated: He, being delighted, raises his right arm,🔽and stretching out his right arm,

analyzed: dakṣiṇam bāhum abhiprasārya udānam udānayati
translated: he utters a cry of joy:

analyzed: api eva aham cira kāla abhilaṣitam putra mukham paśyeyam
translated: At last I will see the face of a son, for whom I have longed for a long time.

analyzed: jātaḥ me syāt na avajātaḥ
translated: May he be born to me, not un-born.

analyzed: kṛtyāni me kurvīta  bhṛtaḥ pratibibhṛyāt
translated: May he do my work.🔽May he support me when I am in need of support.

analyzed: dāyāt yam pratipadyeta
translated: May he take possession of my inheritance.

analyzed: kula vaṃśaḥ me cirasthitikaḥ syāt
translated: May my family lineage last long.

original: asmākaṃ cāpy atītakālagatānām alpaṃ vā prabhūtaṃ vā dānāni datvā puṇyāni kṛtvā asmākaṃ nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādekṣyati /
analyzed: asmākam ca api atīta kāla gatānām alpam vā prabhūtam vā dānāni da tvā puṇyāni kṛtvā asmākam nāmnā dakṣiṇām ādekṣyati
translated: And when we have passed away, having given little or much in charity and performed meritorious deeds, he will dedicate the offerings in our names.

original: idaṃ tayor yatratatropapannayor gacchator anugacchatv iti /
analyzed: idam tayoḥ yatra tatra upapannayoḥ gacchatoḥ anugacchatu iti
translated: May this follow them wherever they go.'

original: āpannasatvāṃ caināṃ viditvopariprāsādatalagatām ayantritāṃ dhārayati /🔽śīte śītopakaraṇair uṣṇe uṣṇopakaraṇair vaidyaprajñaptair āhārair nātitiktair nātyamlair
analyzed: āpannasatvām ca enām viditvā upari prāsāda tala gatām a yantritām dhārayati  śīte śīta upakaraṇaiḥ uṣṇe uṣṇa upakaraṇaiḥ vaidya prajñaptaiḥ āhāraiḥ na ati tiktaiḥ na ati amlaiḥ
translated: And when she became pregnant, he kept her in the upper palace, protected, with no restrictions.🔽In the cold with cold remedies, in the hot with hot remedies, with food prescribed by physicians, not too bitter, not too sour,

analyzed: na ati lavaṇaiḥ na ati madhuraiḥ na ati kaṭukaiḥ na ati kaṣāyaiḥ tikta amla lavaṇa madhura kaṭuka kaṣāya vivarjitaiḥ āhāraiḥ
translated: not too salty, not too sweet, not too pungent, not too astringent, with food avoiding bitter, sour, salty, sweet, pungent, and astringent tastes.

original: hārārdhahāravibhūṣitagātrīm apsarasam iva nandanavanavicāriṇīṃ mañcān mañcaṃ pīṭhāt pīṭham anavatarantīm adharāṃ bhūmim /
analyzed: hāra ardhahāra vibhūṣita gātrīm apsarasam iva nandana vana vicāriṇīm mañcāt mañcam pīṭhāt pīṭham an avatarantīm adharām bhūmim
translated: Her body adorned with necklaces and half-necklaces, like a celestial maiden roaming the Nandana Grove, from bed to bed, from seat to seat, not descending to the lower ground.

original: na cāsyāḥ kiṃcid amanojñaśabdaśravaṇaṃ yāvad eva garbhasya paripākāya //
analyzed: na ca asyāḥ kiṃcid a manojña śabda śravaṇam yāvat eva garbhasya paripākāya
translated: And she did not hear any unpleasant sounds at all, until the embryo was fully developed.

original: sā aṣṭānāṃ vā navānāṃ vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā /
analyzed: sā aṣṭānām vā navānām vā māsānām atyayāt prasūtā
translated: After nine months had passed, she gave birth.

analyzed: dārakaḥ jātaḥ bhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ sarva aṅga pratyaṅga upetaḥ
translated: A boy was born, who was well-proportioned, pleasing to the eye, beautiful, with all the major and minor body parts,

analyzed: pāṇi dvaye ca asya lakṣaṇa āhatam karma vipāka jam dīnāra dvayam
translated: and in both his hands there appeared two dinars, the result of past actions.

original: yadā tad apanītaṃ bhavati tadā anyat prādurbhavati /
analyzed: yadā tat apanītam bhavati tadā anyat prādurbhavati
translated: When they were removed, two more appeared.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā nāmadheyaṃ vyavasthāpyate /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā nāmadheyam vyavasthāpyate
translated: At his birth, a great celebration was held and a name was chosen for him.

analyzed: kim bhavatu dārakasya nāma iti
translated: What should the boy's name be?

analyzed: jñātayaḥ ūcuḥ
translated: The relatives said:

original: yasmād asya jātamātrasya pāṇidvaye lakṣaṇāhataṃ karmavipākajaṃ dīnāradvayaṃ prādurbhūtam /
analyzed: yasmāt asya jāta mātrasya pāṇi dvaye lakṣaṇa āhatam karma vipāka jam dīnāra dvayam prādurbhūtam
translated: Since two dinars, the result of past actions, appeared in both his hands as soon as he was born,

original: tasmād bhavatu dārakasya hiraṇyapāṇir iti nāmeti /🔽hiraṇyapāṇir dārako 'ṣṭābhyo dhātrībhyo datto dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ kṣīradhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ maladhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ krīḍanikābhyāṃ
analyzed: tasmāt bhavatu dārakasya hiraṇyapāṇiḥ iti nāma iti  hiraṇyapāṇiḥ dārakaḥ ṣṭābhyaḥ dhātrībhyaḥ dattaḥ dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyām dvābhyām kṣīradhātrībhyām dvābhyām maladhātrībhyām dvābhyām krīḍanikābhyām
translated: let the boy's name be Hiraṇyakaṇṭha (Golden Neck).

analyzed: dhātrībhyām
translated: The boy Hiraṇyakaṇṭha was given to eight nurses, two nurses to hold him, two to give him milk, two to change his diapers, and two to play with him.

original: so 'ṣṭābhir dhātrībhir unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍenānyaiś cottaptottaptair upakaraṇaviśeṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭābhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiḥ ca uttapta uttaptaiḥ upakaraṇa viśeṣaiḥ
translated: He was raised and nourished by eight wet nurses with milk, curd, butter, ghee, cream of clarified butter, and other nourishing and wholesome foods,

analyzed: āśu vardhate hrada stham iva paṅkajam
translated: growing quickly like a lotus in a lake.

original: sa śrāddho bhadraḥ kalyāṇāśaya ātmahitaparahitapratipannaḥ kāruṇiko🔽Vaidya / p /
analyzed: sa śrāddhaḥ bhadraḥ kalyāṇa āśayaḥ ātma hita para hita pratipannaḥ kāruṇikaḥ  vaidya p
translated: He was faithful, good, of good character, intent on benefiting himself and others, compassionate,🔽a great man,

analyzed: mahātmā dharma kāmaḥ prajā vatsalaḥ
translated: loving the Dharma, and affectionate towards his people.

analyzed: ya yadā vīthīm avatīrṇaḥ bhavati
translated: Whenever he went out into the street,

analyzed: tadā śramaṇa brāhmaṇa kṛpaṇa vanīpakān dṛṣṭvā pāṇi dvayam prasārayati
translated: seeing ascetics, brahmins, the poor, and beggars, he would extend both hands.

analyzed: tatas lakṣaṇa āhatasya hiraṇya suvarṇasya rāśiḥ prādurbhavati
translated: Then a heap of gold and silver marked with auspicious signs would appear,

analyzed: yena tān saṃtarpayati
translated: with which he would satisfy them.

analyzed: tasya yaśasā sarvā śrāvastī āpūrṇā
translated: The entire Śrāvastī was filled with his fame.

original: yāvad hiraṇyapāṇir dārako 'pareṇa samayena jetavanaṃ nirgataḥ /
analyzed: yāvat hiraṇyapāṇiḥ dārakaḥ pareṇa samayena jetavanam nirgataḥ
translated: Later, the young Hiraṇyapaṇi went out to the Jetavana.

original: athāsau dadarśa buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣalakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
analyzed: atha asau dadarśa buddham bhagavantam dvātriṃśatā mahāpuruṣa lakṣaṇaiḥ samalaṃkṛtam
translated: There he saw the Buddha, the Blessed One, adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great man,

analyzed: aśītyā ca anuvyañjanaiḥ virājita gātram vyāma prabhā alaṃkṛtam sūrya sahasra atireka prabham
translated: His body was adorned with the eighty minor marks, his radiance extended an arm's length, and his splendor surpassed that of a thousand suns.

analyzed: jaṅgamam iva ratna parvatam samantataḥ bhadrakam
translated: He was like a moving jeweled mountain, beautiful in every way.

analyzed: saha darśanāt ca anena bhagavataḥ ntike citte prasāditam
translated: As soon as he saw the Blessed One, he generated faith in his mind.

original: prasādajātaś ca bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvā purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: prasāda jātaḥ ca bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Having generated faith, he bowed at the feet of the Blessed One and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

analyzed: tatas sya bhagavatā dharmaḥ deśitaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One taught him the Dharma.

analyzed: saḥ āyuṣmantam ānandam idam avocat
translated: He said to the Venerable Ānanda:

original: icchāmy aham ācārya bhagavataḥ saśrāvakasaṃghasya bhaktaṃ kartum iti /
analyzed: icchāmi aham ācārya bhagavataḥ sa śrāvaka saṃghasya bhaktam kartum iti
translated: Teacher, I wish to make an offering to the Blessed One and the community of monks.

analyzed: sthavira ānandena uktaḥ
translated: The elder Ānanda said to him:

analyzed: vatsa kārṣāpaṇaiḥ prayojanam iti
translated: My son, you will need kārṣāpaṇas.

original: tato hiraṇyapāṇinā buddhapramukhasya bhikṣusaṃghasya purastāt sthitvā pāṇidvayaṃ prasārya hiraṇyasuvarṇasya mahān rāśiḥ sthāpitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas hiraṇyapāṇinā buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṃghasya purastāt sthitvā pāṇi dvayam prasārya hiraṇya suvarṇasya mahān rāśiḥ sthāpitaḥ
translated: Then Hiraṇyapaṇi stood in front of the community of monks headed by the Buddha, extended both hands, and set up a great heap of gold and silver.

original: yaṃ dṛṣṭvā saṃghasthaviro 'nye ca bhikṣavaḥ sthavirānandaś ca paraṃ vismayam āpannāḥ /
analyzed: yam dṛṣṭvā saṃgha sthaviraḥ nye ca bhikṣavaḥ sthavira ānandaḥ ca param vismayam āpannāḥ
translated: Seeing this, the elder of the saṃgha and the other monks, as well as the elder Ānanda, were filled with great wonder.

original: tato hiraṇyapāṇir dārako buddhapramukhaṃ bhikṣusaṃghaṃ bhojayitvā bhagavataḥ purastān niṣaṇṇo dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: tatas hiraṇyapāṇiḥ dārakaḥ buddha pramukham bhikṣu saṃgham bhojayitvā bhagavataḥ purastāt niṣaṇṇaḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: Then the boy Hiraṇyapaṇi, having fed the community of monks headed by the Buddha, sat down in front of the Blessed One to listen to the Dharma.

original: tasya bhagavatā āśayānuśayaṃ dhātuṃ prakṛtiṃ ca jñātvā tādṛśī caturāryasatyasaṃprativedhikī dharmadeśanā kṛtā /
analyzed: tasya bhagavatā āśaya anuśayam dhātum prakṛtim ca jñātvā tādṛśī catur ārya satya saṃprativedhikī dharma deśanā kṛtā
translated: The Blessed One, knowing his aspirations, latent tendencies, temperament, and nature, gave him a teaching on the Dharma that penetrated the four noble truths.

original: yāṃ śrutvā hiraṇyapāṇidārikeṇa viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotāpattiphalaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: yām śrutvā hiraṇyapāṇi dārikeṇa viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotāpatti phalam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: Hearing it, the boy Hiraṇyapaṇi shattered with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty-peaked mountain of the view of real self and actualized the fruit of stream-entry.

original: dṛṣṭasatyo jñātīnāṃ bhāgasaṃvibhāgaṃ kṛtvā śramaṇabrāhmaṇkṛpaṇanīpakān saṃtarpya mātāpitarāv anujñāpya bhagavacchāsane pravrajitaḥ /🔽tena yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakaṃ saṃsāracakraṃ
analyzed: dṛṣṭa satyaḥ jñātīnām bhāga saṃvibhāgam kṛtvā śramaṇa brāhmaṇa kṛpaṇa nīpakān saṃtarpya mātā pitarau anujñāpya bhagavat śāsane pravrajitaḥ  tena yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakam saṃsāra cakram
translated: Having seen the truths, he shared his inheritance with his relatives, satisfied ascetics, brahmins, the poor, and the destitute, took leave of his parents, and went forth in the Blessed One's teaching.🔽While he was striving, exerting himself, and endeavoring, he

analyzed: calācalam viditvā sarva saṃskāra gatīḥ śatana patana vikiraṇa vidhvaṃsana dharmatayā parāhatya
translated: realized that this five-part cycle of existence is moving and unmoving, and having destroyed all the courses of conditioned existence with the thunderbolt of wisdom,

analyzed: sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: he actualized the fruit of arhatship through the complete abandonment of all defilements.

original: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātukavītarāgaḥ samaloṣṭakāñcana ākāśapāṇitalasamacitto vāsīcandanakalpo vidyāvidāritāṇḍakośo vidyābhijñāpratisaṃvitprāpto
analyzed: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātuka vīta rāgaḥ sama loṣṭa kāñcanaḥ ākāśa pāṇitala sama cittaḥ vāsī candana kalpaḥ vidyā vidārita āṇḍakośaḥ vidyā abhijñā pratisaṃvid prāptaḥ
translated: He became an arhat, free from the passions of the three realms, with a mind equal to a lump of earth, gold, or space, with a mind like a wall, a pillar, or a sword, his mind like a diamond, his mind purified like a washed cloth. He had split the egg of ignorance with the vajra of knowledge, and attained knowledge, higher knowledge, and discrimination.

analyzed: bhava lābha lobha satkāra parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: He turned his back on worldly gain, greed, and honor.

original: sendropendrāṇāṃ devānāṃ pūjyo mānyo 'bhivādyaś ca saṃvṛttaḥ //
analyzed: sa indra upendrāṇām devānām pūjyaḥ mānyaḥ bhivādyaḥ ca saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He became one to be worshipped, revered, and saluted by Indra, Upendra, and the gods.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, being in doubt, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the one who removes all doubts:

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca
translated: But rather, actions that have been performed and accumulated are ripened in the very aggregates, elements, and sense-spheres that have been appropriated, whether wholesome or unwholesome.

original: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpakoṭiśatair api /🔽sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi kalpa koṭi śataiḥ api  sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: Actions do not perish even in hundreds of cosmic aeons.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: When they attain their assemblage and the time [is right], they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvany asminn eva bhadrake kalpe catvāriṃśadvarṣasahasrāyuṣi🔽prajāyāṃ krakucchando nāma samyaksaṃbuddho loka udapādi vidyācaraṇasaṃpannaḥ sugato
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani asmin eva bhadrake kalpe catvāriṃśat varṣa sahasra āyuṣi  prajāyām krakucchandaḥ nāma samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ loke udapādi vidyā caraṇa saṃpannaḥ sugataḥ
translated: [The Buddha said:] Monks, in the past, in this very fortunate aeon, when the lifespan of beings was forty thousand years,🔽there appeared in the world a Blessed One, a Worthy One, a Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with perfect knowledge and conduct, a Sugata,

original: lokavid anuttaraḥ puruṣadamyasārathiḥ śāstā devamanuṣyāṇāṃ buddho bhagavān /
analyzed: loka vid anuttaraḥ puruṣa damya sārathiḥ śāstā deva manuṣyāṇām buddhaḥ bhagavān
translated: a knower of the world, an unsurpassed trainer of those who can be trained, a teacher of gods and humans, a Buddha, a Blessed One, named Krakucchanda.🔽He dwelt in the capital city of Śobhāvatī.

analyzed: sa śobhāvatīm rājadhānīm upaniśritya viharati
translated: [The Buddha said:] Monks,

analyzed: śobhena rājñā keśa nakha stūpaḥ pratiṣṭhāpitaḥ
translated: King Śobha erected a stūpa for the hair and nails.

original: yāvat kasmiṃścit parvaṇi pratyupasthite goṣṭhikāḥ stūpasamīpaṃ gatāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat kasmiṃścid parvaṇi pratyupasthite goṣṭhikāḥ stūpa samīpam gatāḥ
translated: When a certain festival arrived, the friends went near the stūpa.

original: tais taṃ stūpaṃ dṛṣṭvā pasādajātaiḥ puṣpāropaṇaṃ kartum ārabdham /
analyzed: taiḥ tam stūpam dṛṣṭvā pasāda jātaiḥ puṣpa āropaṇam kartum ārabdham
translated: Having seen that stūpa, they, with faith arisen, began to offer flowers.

analyzed: tatra ekaḥ goṣṭhikaḥ kathayati
translated: There one friend said,

analyzed: aham na karomi
translated: I will not do it.

analyzed: mama vibhavaḥ na asti iti
translated: I have no wealth.

analyzed: sa taiḥ ca goṣṭhika madhyāt niṣkāsitaḥ
translated: He was expelled from the group of friends.

analyzed: tasya vipratisāraḥ jātaḥ
translated: He felt remorse.

original: tena vicitrapuṣpasaṃgrahaṃ kṛtvā tasminn eva stūpe puṣpāropaṇaṃ kṛtam //
analyzed: tena vicitra puṣpa saṃgraham kṛtvā tasmin eva stūpe puṣpa āropaṇam kṛtam
translated: Having collected various flowers, he offered them to that very stūpa.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena goṣṭhika āsīt /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena goṣṭhikaḥ āsīt
translated: Monks, what do you think? The one who was the friend at that time, on that occasion,

original: yena vipratisārajātena krakucchandasya keśanakhastūpe puṣpāripaṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yena vipratisāra jātena krakucchandasya keśa nakha stūpe puṣpa aripaṇam kṛtam
translated: who, feeling remorse, offered flowers to the stūpa of Krakucchanda's hair and nails,

analyzed: ayam asau śobhitaḥ
translated: is this very Śobhita.

original: anyāny api hi bhikṣavaḥ śobhitena karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni /
analyzed: anyāni api hi bhikṣavaḥ śobhitena karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: Monks, Śobhita also performed and accumulated other actions.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani vārāṇasyāṃ nagaryām anyatamaḥ śreṣṭhī /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani vārāṇasyām nagaryām anyatamaḥ śreṣṭhī
translated: Monks, in the past, in the city of Vārāṇasī, there was a certain guildmaster.

analyzed: tena glānaḥ pratyekabuddhaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: He saw a sick solitary buddha.

original: tataḥ prasādajātena pādayor nipatya piṇḍakena pratipāditaḥ paṭena cācchāditaḥ //
analyzed: tatas prasāda jātena pādayoḥ nipatya piṇḍakena pratipāditaḥ paṭena ca ācchāditaḥ
translated: Then, with faith arisen, he fell at his feet and offered him alms and covered him with a cloth.

original: kiṃ manyadhve bhikṣavo yo 'sau tena kālena tena samayena śreṣṭhī /
analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena śreṣṭhī
translated: Monks, what do you think? The one who was the guildmaster at that time, on that occasion,

analyzed: ayam śobhitaḥ
translated: is this very Sobhita.

analyzed: bhūyas kāśyape bhagavati daridraḥ bhūt kāṣṭha hārakaḥ
translated: Again, in the time of the Blessed Kāśyapa, he was poor, a wood-gatherer.

analyzed: sa kāṣṭhānām arthe parvata darīm praviṣṭaḥ
translated: He entered a mountain cave for the sake of wood.

analyzed: tena stūpaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: He saw a stūpa there.

analyzed: tatra ca stūpa aṅgaṇe tṛṇāni jātāni
translated: And in the stūpa courtyard, grass had grown.

original: tatas tena prasādajātena tṛṇāny utpāṭya saṃmārjanīṃ gṛhītvā stūpāṅgaṇaṃ ca saṃmṛṣṭam /
analyzed: tatas tena prasāda jātena tṛṇāni utpāṭya saṃmārjanīm gṛhītvā stūpa aṅgaṇam ca saṃmṛṣṭam
translated: Then, with faith arisen, he pulled out the grass, took a broom, and swept the stūpa courtyard.

original: tataḥ pādayor nipatya praṇidhānaṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas pādayoḥ nipatya praṇidhānam kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then, falling at the feet, he began to make a vow:

analyzed: anena aham kuśala mūlena citta utpādena dey dharma parityāgena ca abhirūpaḥ syām darśanīyaḥ prasādikaḥ
translated: By this wholesome root, this thought of enlightenment, this giving up of a gift, may I become handsome, good-looking, and pleasing.

original: anāgatāṃś ca buddhān ārāgayeyaṃ mā virāgayeyam iti //
analyzed: anāgatān ca buddhān ārāgayeyam mā virāgayeyam iti
translated: I will please the Buddhas of the future and not displease them.'

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: kim manyadhve bhikṣavaḥ yaḥ sau tena kālena tena samayena kāṣṭha hārakaḥ āsīt
translated: 'What do you think, monks, he who was the wood-gatherer at that time, on that occasion,

analyzed: ayam eva asau śobhitaḥ
translated: this very Sobhita was he.

analyzed: yat anena stūpa aṅgaṇam saṃmṛṣṭam
translated: Because he swept the courtyard of the stūpa,

original: tena yatra yatra jātas tatra tatrābhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prasādikaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: tena yatra yatra jātaḥ tatra tatra abhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prasādikaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: wherever he was born, there he was beautiful, handsome, and pleasing.

analyzed: tena eva hetunā idānīm ārha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: For that very reason, now he has realized arhatship.

original: iti hi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇānāṃ karmaṇām ekāntakṛṣṇo vipākaḥ /🔽ekāntaśuklānām ekāntaśuklaḥ /
analyzed: iti hi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇānām karmaṇām ekānta kṛṣṇaḥ vipākaḥ  ekānta śuklānām ekānta śuklaḥ
translated: Thus, monks, the ripening of entirely dark actions is entirely dark,🔽the ripening of entirely bright actions is entirely bright,

analyzed: vyatimiśrāṇām vyatimiśraḥ
translated: the ripening of mixed actions is mixed.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava ekāntakṛṣṇāni karmāṇy apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ekānta kṛṣṇāni karmāṇi apāsya vyatimiśrāṇi ca
translated: Therefore, monks, having abandoned entirely dark actions and mixed actions,

analyzed: ekānta śukleṣu eva karmasu ābhogaḥ karaṇīyaḥ
translated: one should apply oneself to entirely bright actions alone.

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.'

analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān
translated: The Blessed One said this.

original: āttamanasas te bhikṣavo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandan //
analyzed: ātta manasaḥ te bhikṣavaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan
translated: The monks, delighted, rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.

analyzed: kapphiṇaḥ
translated: Kapphina. Ed. Speyer, Vol. II

original: buddho bhagavān satkṛto gurukṛto mānitaḥ pūjito rājabhī rājamātrair dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
analyzed: buddhaḥ bhagavān satkṛtaḥ gurukṛtaḥ mānitaḥ pūjitaḥ rājabhiḥ rājamātraiḥ dhanibhiḥ pauraiḥ
translated: The Buddha, the Blessed One, was honored, revered, esteemed, worshipped, and venerated by kings, royal ministers, the wealthy, city-dwellers,

analyzed: śreṣṭhibhiḥ sārthavāhaiḥ devaiḥ nāgaiḥ yakṣaiḥ asuraiḥ garuḍaiḥ kinnaraiḥ mahoragaiḥ
translated: merchants, caravan leaders, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.

analyzed: iti deva nāga yakṣa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga abhyarcitaḥ buddhaḥ bhagavān jñātaḥ mahā puṇyaḥ
translated: Thus the Buddha, the Blessed One, was worshipped by gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, and was known as one of great merit,

analyzed: lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārāṇām
translated: and he obtained robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick,

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: the doctor.

analyzed: sa śrāvaka saṃghaḥ śrāvastyām viharati jetavane nāthapiṇḍadasya ārāme
translated: together with the community of monks, was staying in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park.

original: tena khalu samayena dakṣiṇāpathe kalpo nāma rājā rājyaṃ kārayati ṛddhaṃ ca sphītaṃ
analyzed: tena khalu samayena dakṣiṇāpathe kalpaḥ nāma rājā rājyam kārayati ṛddham ca sphītam
translated: At that time, in the southern region, a king named Kalpa was ruling a prosperous, flourishing,

original: ca kṣemaṃ ca subhikṣaṃ ca ākīrṇabahujanamanuṣyaṃ ca praśāntakalikalahaḍimbaḍamaraṃ
analyzed: ca kṣemam ca subhikṣam ca ākīrṇa bahu jana manuṣyam ca praśānta kali kalaha ḍimba ḍamaram
translated: peaceful, well-fed, and populous kingdom, free from strife, quarrels, famine, and disease,

analyzed: taskara roga apagatam śāli ikṣu go mahiṣī saṃpannam
translated: abounding in rice, sugarcane, cows, and buffaloes.

analyzed: priyam iva eka putrakam rājyam pālayati
translated: He ruled the kingdom as if it were his own beloved only son.

original: so 'pareṇa samayena devyā sārdhaṃ krīḍati ramate paricārayati /
analyzed: saḥ pareṇa samayena devyā sārdham krīḍati ramate paricārayati
translated: At another time, he was playing, having fun, and enjoying himself with the queen.

original: tasya krīḍato ramamāṇasya paricārayataḥ putro jāto 'bhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ sarvāṅgapratyaṅgopetaḥ /

translated: While he was playing, having fun, and enjoying himself, a son was born, who was well proportioned, pleasing to the eye, beautiful, with all the major and minor limbs perfectly formed.

original: tasya jātau jātimahaṃ kṛtvā kapphiṇa iti nāmadheyaṃ vyavasthāpitam /
analyzed: tasya jātau jāti maham kṛtvā kapphiṇaḥ iti nāmadheyam vyavasthāpitam
translated: When he was born, a great birth festival was held and he was named Kappa.

original: kapphiṇo dārako 'ṣṭābhyo dhātrībhyo datto dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ kṣīradhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ maladhātrībhyāṃ dvābhyāṃ krīḍanikābhyāṃ 🔽dhātrībhyām /
analyzed: kapphiṇaḥ dārakaḥ ṣṭābhyaḥ dhātrībhyaḥ dattaḥ dvābhyām aṃsadhātrībhyām dvābhyām kṣīradhātrībhyām dvābhyām maladhātrībhyām dvābhyām krīḍanikābhyām  dhātrībhyām
translated: The boy Kappa was given to eight nurses, two nurses to hold him, two wet nurses, two nurses to bathe him, and two nurses to play with him.

original: so 'ṣṭābhir dhātrībhir unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍenānyaiś cottaptottaptair upakaraṇaviśeṣaiḥ /
analyzed: saḥ u ṣṭābhiḥ dhātrībhiḥ unnīyate vardhyate kṣīreṇa dadhnā navanītena sarpiṣā sarpimaṇḍena anyaiḥ ca uttapta uttaptaiḥ upakaraṇa viśeṣaiḥ
translated: He was raised by the eight nurses, nourished and grew up, drinking milk, yogurt, butter, ghee, and milk solids, and other special nourishing foods.

analyzed: āśu vardhate hrada stham iva paṅkajam
translated: He grew quickly, like a lotus in a pond.

original: yasminn eva divase kapphiṇaḥ kumāro jātaḥ /
analyzed: yasmin eva divase kapphiṇaḥ kumāraḥ jātaḥ
translated: On the very day that the boy Kappa was born,

analyzed: tasmin eva divase aṣṭādaśānām amātya sahasrāṇām putrāḥ jātāḥ
translated: on that very day, the sons of eighteen thousand ministers were born.

analyzed: sarve mahānagnāḥ
translated: All of them were great men.

analyzed: teṣām pratirūpāṇi nāmāni vyavasthāpitāni
translated: Their names were established as suitable.

analyzed: yat rājā kalpaḥ kāladharmeṇa saṃyuktaḥ
translated: When King Kalpa was united with the dharma of time,

analyzed: tasya atyayāt kapphiṇaḥ kumāraḥ rājye pratiṣṭhitaḥ
translated: after his passing, Prince Kapphina was established in the kingdom.

analyzed: tāni ca aṣṭādaśa amātya putra sahasrāṇi sarvāṇi amātya tve niyuktāni
translated: And those eighteen thousand sons of ministers were all appointed as ministers.

original: athāpareṇa samayena rājā mahākapphiṇo 'ṣṭādaśāmātyasahasraparivṛto mṛgavadhāya nirgataḥ /
analyzed: atha apareṇa samayena rājā mahākapphiṇaḥ ṣṭādaśa amātya sahasra parivṛtaḥ mṛga vadhāya nirgataḥ
translated: Then at another time, King Mahākapphina, surrounded by eighteen thousand ministers, went out to hunt.

original: purastāt pṛṣṭhataś ca sarvabalaugham avalokyāmātyān āmantrayate /
analyzed: purastāt pṛṣṭhatas ca sarva bala ogham avalokya amātyān āmantrayate
translated: Looking at the entire army in front and behind, he addressed the ministers, saying:

original: asti bhavantaḥ kasyacid evaṃrūpo balaughaḥ tadyathā mamaivaitarhīti /
analyzed: asti bhavantaḥ kasyacid evaṃrūpaḥ bala oghaḥ tat yathā mama eva etarhi iti
translated: Gentlemen, is there anyone who has an army like this, just like mine now?

analyzed: tatas priya vādibhiḥ amātyaiḥ abhihitam
translated: Then the ministers who spoke pleasantly said:

analyzed: deva na anyasya kasyacid iti
translated: Your Majesty, no one else has such an army.

analyzed: atha madhyadeśāt vaṇijaḥ dakṣiṇāpatham gatāḥ
translated: Then merchants from the Middle Country went to the South.

analyzed: taiḥ rājñaḥ mahākapphiṇasya prābhṛtam upanītam
translated: They presented a gift to King Mahākapphina.

analyzed: rājñā uktāḥ
translated: The king said to them:

analyzed: bho vaṇijaḥ
translated: Gentlemen, merchants!

analyzed: kaḥ tatra rājā iti
translated: Who is the king there?

analyzed: vaṇijaḥ kathayanti
translated: The merchants said:

original: deva kecid deśā gaṇādhīnāḥ kecid rājādhīnā iti /
analyzed: deva kecid deśāḥ gaṇa adhīnāḥ kecid rāja adhīnāḥ iti
translated: Your Majesty, some countries are ruled by assemblies, some by kings.

original: yāvad rājñā mahākapphiṇena śrāvastyādiṣu ṣaṭsu mahānagareṣu dūtasaṃpreṣaṇaṃ kṛtam /
analyzed: yāvat rājñā mahākapphiṇena śrāvastī ādiṣu ṣaṭsu mahā nagareṣu dūta saṃpreṣaṇam kṛtam
translated: Then King Mahākappin sent messengers to the six great cities beginning with Śrāvastī,

analyzed: yadi utthitāḥ bhavatha na upaveṣṭavyam
translated: saying, If you rise up, you should not sit down.

analyzed: śīghram āgantavyam
translated: You should come quickly.

analyzed: anyathā vaḥ uttamena daṇḍena samanuśāsiṣyāmi iti
translated: Otherwise, I will punish you with the highest penalty.

original: etad vacanam upaśrutya ṣaṇmahānagaravāsino rājāno bhītās trastāḥ saṃvignā āhṛṣṭaromakūpāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya ekasamūhena śrāvastīm anuprāptāḥ
analyzed: etat vacanam upaśrutya ṣaṣ mahā nagara vāsinaḥ rājānaḥ bhītāḥ trastāḥ saṃvignāḥ āhṛṣṭa romakūpāḥ saṃgamya samāgamya eka samūhena śrāvastīm anuprāptāḥ
translated: Having heard this message, the kings of the six great cities became frightened, terrified, anxious, and their hair stood on end. They assembled, gathered together, and in one group they arrived in Śrāvastī.

analyzed: tatas bhagavat sakāśam gatāḥ
translated: Then they went to the Blessed One.

original: taiḥ sa vṛttānto bhagavato vistareṇa niveditaḥ /
analyzed: taiḥ sa vṛttāntaḥ bhagavataḥ vistareṇa niveditaḥ
translated: They related the whole story in detail to the Blessed One.

analyzed: bhagavatā te samāśvāsitāḥ
translated: The Blessed One comforted them.

original: uktāś ca / sa dūto matsakāśam ānetavya iti /
analyzed: uktāḥ ca sa dūtaḥ mad sakāśam ānetavyaḥ iti
translated: And he said, That messenger should be brought before me.

analyzed: tatas taiḥ dūtasya niveditam
translated: Then they informed the messenger,

analyzed: asti asmākam rāja adhirāja
translated: We have a king of kings.

analyzed: tam tāvat paśya iti
translated: First see him.

analyzed: tatas bhagavatā dūta āgamanam avetya jetavanam catur ratna mayam nirmitam devānām iva sudarśanam nagaram
translated: Then, knowing that the messengers had come, the Blessed One manifested the Jeta Grove as made of the four precious substances, like the city of Sudarśana of the gods.

analyzed: atra catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ dauvārikāḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: And the four great kings were appointed as doorkeepers there.

analyzed: airāvata sadṛśāḥ hastinaḥ  bālāhaka sadṛśāḥ aśvāḥ
translated: The elephants were like Airāvata.🔽The horses were like Bālāhaka.

analyzed: nandī ghoṣa sadṛśāḥ rathāḥ
translated: The chariots were like Nandīghosa.

analyzed: vyāḍa yakṣ sadṛśāḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: The men were like the Yakṣa Vyāḍa.

analyzed: svayam ca bhagavatā cakravarti veṣaḥ nirmitaḥ
translated: The Blessed One himself manifested the attire of a universal monarch.

original: saptatālodgataṃ ca simḥāsanaṃ yatra bhagavān niṣaṇṇāḥ /
analyzed: sapta tāla udgatam ca simḥāsanam yatra bhagavān niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: And there was a lion throne rising seven tālas high, where the Blessed One sat.

original: tato dūtas tathāvidhāṃ śobhāṃ dṛṣṭvā paraṃ vismayam āpannaḥ /
analyzed: tatas dūtaḥ tathāvidhām śobhām dṛṣṭvā param vismayam āpannaḥ
translated: Then the messenger, seeing such splendor, was filled with great amazement.

original: tato bhagavatā lekhaṃ lekhayitvā sa dūto 'bhihitaḥ /
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā lekham lekhayitvā sa dūtaḥ bhihitaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One had a letter written and said to the messenger,

analyzed: kapphiṇaḥ mad vacanāt vaktavyaḥ
translated: You should tell Kapphina in my words,

analyzed: lekha vācana sama kālam eva yadi utthitaḥ bhavasi
translated: if you get up at the same time as the letter is read,

analyzed: na upaveṣṭavyam
translated: you should not sit down.

analyzed: śīghram āgantavyam
translated: You should come quickly.

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: O physician!

analyzed: athavā na āgacchasi
translated: Or if you do not come,

original: aham eva mahatā balaughena sārdham āgamiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: aham eva mahatā bala oghena sārdham āgamiṣyāmi iti
translated: I myself will come with a great host of troops.

original: tato dūtena gatvā rājño mahākapphiṇasya lekhaṃ vācikaṃ ca yat saṃdiṣṭaṃ tat sarvaṃ niveditam //
analyzed: tatas dūtena gatvā rājñaḥ mahākapphiṇasya lekham vācikam ca yat saṃdiṣṭam tat sarvam niveditam
translated: Then the messenger went and delivered to King Mahākapphina the letter and the message, all that was sent.

original: tataḥ kapphiṇo rājā aṣṭādaśāmātyagaṇasahasraparivṛto 'nupūrveṇa cañcūryamāṇaḥ śrāvastīm anuprāptaḥ /
analyzed: tatas kapphiṇaḥ rājā aṣṭādaśa amātya gaṇa sahasra parivṛtaḥ nupūrveṇa cañcūryamāṇaḥ śrāvastīm anuprāptaḥ
translated: Then King Kapphina, surrounded by eighteen thousand ministers, gradually wandering, reached Śrāvastī.

original: prātisīmāś ca rājāno rājānaṃ mahākapphiṇaṃ pratyudgatāḥ /
analyzed: prātisīmāḥ ca rājānaḥ rājānam mahākapphiṇam pratyudgatāḥ
translated: And the kings of the neighboring countries came out to greet King Mahākappina.

analyzed: taiḥ mahā satkāreṇa nagaram praveśitaḥ
translated: They brought him into the city with great honor.

analyzed: mārga śramam prativinodya bhagavataḥ niveditavantaḥ
translated: After he had rested from the fatigue of the journey, they informed the Blessed One.

original: tato bhagavatā tasyāgamanam avetya jetavanaṃ catūratnamayaṃ nirmitaṃ devānām iva sudarśanaṃ nagaram /
analyzed: tatas bhagavatā tasya āgamanam avetya jetavanam catur ratna mayam nirmitam devānām iva sudarśanam nagaram
translated: Then, knowing of his arrival, the Blessed One manifested Jetavana as a city of the four great kings, like the gods' Sudarśana city.

analyzed: yatra catvāraḥ mahā rājānaḥ dauvārikāḥ sthāpitāḥ
translated: And the four great kings were appointed as gatekeepers.

analyzed: airāvata sadṛśāḥ hastinaḥ  bālāhaka sadṛśāḥ aśvāḥ
translated: There were elephants like Airāvata.🔽Horses like Bālāhaka.

analyzed: nandī ghoṣa sadṛśāḥ rathāḥ
translated: Chariots like Nandīghosa.

analyzed: vyāḍa yakṣa sadṛśāḥ manuṣyāḥ
translated: Men like the yakṣa Vyāḍa.

analyzed: svayam ca bhagavatā cakravarti veṣaḥ nirmitaḥ
translated: And the Blessed One himself manifested the form of a universal monarch.

original: saptatālodgataṃ ca siṃhāsanaṃ sarvaṃ tathaiva nirmitam /
analyzed: sapta tāla udgatam ca siṃhāsanam sarvam tathā eva nirmitam
translated: And a lion throne rising seven tālas, all of it manifested just like that.

analyzed: tatas rājā mahākapphiṇaḥ jetavanam praviṣṭaḥ
translated: Then King Mahākappina entered Jetavana.

analyzed: saha darśanāt asya yaḥ rūpaḥ rūpa madaḥ
translated: As soon as he saw it, the pride of his form,

analyzed: aiśvarye aiśvarya madaḥ
translated: the pride of his sovereignty,

analyzed: sa prativigataḥ
translated: all that was dispelled.

analyzed: bala darpaḥ dyā api pratibādhate eva
translated: But the pride of his strength still persisted.

analyzed: tatas bhagavatā laukikam cittam utpāditam
translated: Then the Blessed One generated a worldly thought.

original: aho bata śakro devendra aindraṃ dhanur ādāya āgacchatv iti /
analyzed: aho bata śakraḥ deva indraḥ aindram dhanuḥ ādāya āgacchatu iti
translated: Oh, may Shakra, Lord of the Gods, come with his divine bow.

original: sahacittotpādād bhagavataḥ śakro devendraḥ sārathiveṣeṇa aindraṃ dhanur upanāmayati /
analyzed: saha citta utpādāt bhagavataḥ śakraḥ deva indraḥ sārathi veṣeṇa aindram dhanuḥ upanāmayati
translated: As soon as the Blessed One had this thought, Shakra, Lord of the Gods, in the guise of a charioteer, presented the divine bow.

analyzed: bhagavatā mahākapphiṇasya upanāmitam
translated: It was presented to the Blessed One by King Mahakaphina.

original: tac ca rājā mahākapphiṇa utkraṣṭum api na śaknoti /
analyzed: tat ca rājā mahākapphiṇaḥ utkraṣṭum api na śaknoti
translated: And the king was not even able to draw it,

analyzed: kutas punar āropayiṣyati
translated: let alone string it.

analyzed: tatas bhagavatā saptā āyobheryaḥ nirmittāḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One created seven iron drums,

original: svayaṃ ca tad dhanur ardhacandrākāreṇāropya śaraḥ kṣiptaḥ /
analyzed: svayam ca tat dhanuḥ ardhacandra ākāreṇa āropya śaraḥ kṣiptaḥ
translated: and himself strung the bow in the shape of a half-moon and shot an arrow,

analyzed: yena tāḥ sapta ayaḥ bheryaḥ chidrīkṛtāḥ
translated: which pierced those seven iron drums.

analyzed: tatas śabdam nirgataḥ
translated: Then a sound came forth:

analyzed: ārabhadhvam niṣkrāmata yujyadhvam buddha śāsane
translated: Strive, go forth, apply yourselves to the Buddha's teaching,🔽like an elephant breaks down a door,

original: dhunīta mṛtyunaḥ sainyaṃ naḍāgāram iva kuñjaraḥ // / //
analyzed: dhunīta mṛtyunaḥ sainyam naḍa āgāram iva kuñjaraḥ
translated: destroy the army of death.

original: yo hy asmin dharmavinaye apramattaś cariṣyati /
analyzed: yaḥ hi asmin dharma vinaye apramattaḥ cariṣyati
translated: He who will practice heedfully in this Dharma and Vinaya,

analyzed: prahāya jāti saṃsāram duḥkhasya antam kariṣyati iti
translated: having abandoned the cycle of birth, will make an end to suffering.

original: sa ca śabdo yāvad akaniṣṭhān devān gataḥ /
analyzed: sa ca śabdaḥ yāvat akaniṣṭhān devān gataḥ
translated: And that sound went as far as the Akanishtha gods.

analyzed: tatas rājñaḥ kapphiṇasya yaḥ bhūt bala madaḥ
translated: Then the pride of King Kaṇha's army

analyzed: sa prativigataḥ  tasya buddhiḥ utpannā
translated: was dispelled.🔽He had the thought:

analyzed: kim idam iti
translated: What is this?

original: tato bhagavān rājño mahākapphiṇasya cittaprakāram upalakṣya rājaveṣam antardhāpya idaṃ sūtram āradbhavān / Cf / DbSū
analyzed: tatas bhagavān rājñaḥ mahākapphiṇasya citta prakāram upalakṣya rāja veṣam antardhāpya idam sūtram ārat bhavān
translated: Then the Blessed One, noticing the state of mind of King Mahākaṇha, disappeared from the royal attire and recited this sūtra:

original: daśabalasamanvāgato bhikṣavas tathāgato 'han samyaksaṃbuddhaś catur vaiśāradyaviśārada udāram ārṣabhaṃ sthānaṃ pratijānīte /
analyzed: daśa bala samanvāgataḥ bhikṣavaḥ tathāgataḥ han samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ catuḥ vaiśāradya viśāradaḥ udāram ārṣabham sthānam pratijānīte
translated: Monks, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, endowed with the ten powers, confident in the four grounds of self-confidence, declares the great bull's place,

analyzed: brahmacaryam pravartayati
translated: proclaims the holy life,

analyzed: parṣadi samyak siṃhanādam nadati
translated: and roars the lion's roar in the assemblies.

analyzed: yat uta asmin sati idam bhavati
translated: Namely, when this exists, that comes to be.

analyzed: asya utpādāt idam utpadyate
translated: From the arising of this, that arises.

analyzed: yat uta avidyā pratyayāḥ saṃskārāḥ
translated: Namely, conditioned by ignorance are volitional formations.

analyzed: saṃskāra pratyayam vijñānam
translated: Conditioned by volitional formations is consciousness.

analyzed: vijñāna pratyayam nāma rūpam
translated: Conditioned by consciousness is name-and-form.

analyzed: nāma rūpa pratyayam ṣaṣ āyatanam
translated: Conditioned by name-and-form are the six sense bases.

analyzed: ṣaṣ ayatana pratyayaḥ sparśaḥ  sparśa pratyayā vedanā  vedanā pratyayā tṛṣṇā
translated: Conditioned by the six sense bases is contact.🔽Conditioned by contact is feeling.🔽Conditioned by feeling is craving.

analyzed: tṛṣṇā pratyayam upādānam
translated: Conditioned by craving is clinging.

analyzed: upādāna pratyayaḥ bhavaḥ
translated: Conditioned by clinging is existence.

analyzed: bhava pratyayā jātiḥ
translated: With becoming as condition: birth.

analyzed: jāti pratyayāḥ jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ saṃbhavanti
translated: With birth as condition: old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair (all) arise.

original: evam asya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya samudayo bhavati /
analyzed: evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya samudayaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus there is an origination of this whole great mass of suffering.

analyzed: yat uta asmin asati idam na bhavati
translated: Namely, with the non-existence of this, that does not come to be.

analyzed: asya nirodhāt idam nirudhyate
translated: With the cessation of this, that ceases.

analyzed: yat uta avidyā nirodhāt saṃskāra nirodhaḥ  vaidya p
translated: Namely, with the cessation of ignorance, there is the cessation of volitional formations.🔽[The Buddha said:] Monks, volitional formations cease due to the cessation of ignorance.

analyzed: saṃskāra nirodhāt vijñāna nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of volitional formations, consciousness ceases.

analyzed: vijñāna nirodhāt nāma rūpa nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of consciousness, name-and-form ceases.

analyzed: nāma rūpa nirodhāt ṣaṣ āyatana nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of name-and-form, the six sense spheres cease.

analyzed: ṣaṣ āyatana nirodhāt sparśa nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of the six sense spheres, contact ceases.

analyzed: sparśa nirodhāt vedanā nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of contact, feeling ceases.

analyzed: vedanā nirodhāt tṛṣṇā nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of feeling, craving ceases.🔽With the cessation of craving, clinging ceases.
With the cessation of clinging, existence ceases.

analyzed: bhava nirodhāt jāti nirodhaḥ
translated: With the cessation of existence, birth ceases.

analyzed: jāti nirodhāt jarā maraṇa śoka parideva duḥkha daurmanasya upāyāsāḥ nirudhyante
translated: With the cessation of birth, old age, death, grief, lamentation, pain, sorrow, and despair cease.

original: evam asya kevalasya mahato duḥkhaskandhasya nirodho bhavati /
analyzed: evam asya kevalasya mahataḥ duḥkha skandhasya nirodhaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus there is a cessation of this whole great mass of suffering.🔽[The Buddha said:] Monks, old age and death cease due to the cessation of birth.

analyzed: su ākhyātaḥ me bhikṣavaḥ dharmaḥ
translated: Monks, my Dharma is well-expounded.

original: uttāno vivṛtaś chinnaplotiko yāvad devamanuṣyebhyaḥ samyaksuprakāśitaḥ /
analyzed: uttānaḥ vivṛtaḥ chinna plotikaḥ yāvat deva manuṣyebhyaḥ samyak su prakāśitaḥ
translated: It is clear, open, explicit, leading to Nibbāna, and is expounded by me to the gods and humans.

original: evaṃ svākhyāte me dharme uttāne vivṛte chinnaplotike yāvad devamanuṣyebhyaḥ samyaksuprakāśite yāvad alam eva bhikṣavaḥ śraddhāpravrajitena
analyzed: evam su ākhyāte me dharme uttāne vivṛte chinna plotike yāvat deva manuṣyebhyaḥ samyak su prakāśite yāvat alam eva bhikṣavaḥ śraddhā pravrajitena
translated: Thus, in this well-expounded Dharma, clear, open, explicit, leading to Nibbāna, and expounded by me to the gods and humans, it is enough for a faithful one who has gone forth from the home life to the homeless life,

analyzed: kula putreṇa alam yogāya alam apramādāya
translated: a son of good family, to practice, to strive, to be heedful, to be energetic, to be resolute, and to be committed to the undertaking of wholesome qualities.

original: alaṃ śāstuḥ śāsane yogam āpattum /🔽kāmaṃ tvaksnāyvasthy avatiṣṭhatām /
analyzed: alam śāstuḥ śāsane yogam āpattum  kāmam tvak snāyu asthi avatiṣṭhatām
translated: It is enough to apply oneself to the Teacher's instructions.🔽Let the skin, sinews, and bones remain,

analyzed: pariśuṣyatu śarīrāt māṃsa śoṇitam
translated: but let the flesh and blood dry up in the body.

original: atha ca punar yat tadārabdhavīryeṇa prāptavyaṃ sthāmavatā vīryavatā utsāhinā dṛḍhaparākrameṇānikṣiptadhureṇa kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu /
analyzed: atha ca punar yat tad ārabdha vīryeṇa prāptavyam sthāmavatā vīryavatā utsāhinā dṛḍha parākrameṇa a nikṣipta dhureṇa kuśaleṣu dharmeṣu
translated: However, that which is to be attained by one who has begun to strive, by one who is strong, energetic, enthusiastic, resolute, and does not lay down the burden, in wholesome qualities,

analyzed: tad vahana anuprāptāḥ na vīryasya sraṃsanam bhaviṣyati
translated: having attained that, there will be no slackening of energy.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

analyzed: duḥkham hi kusīdaḥ viharati vyavakīrṇa
translated: Because one who is lazy lives miserably, scattered.

original: pāpakair akuśalair dharmaiḥ sāṃkleśikaiḥ paunarbhavikaiḥ sajvarair duḥkhavipākaiḥ āyatyāṃ jātijarāmaraṇīyaiḥ mahataś cārthasya parihāṇir bhavati
analyzed: pāpakaiḥ akuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ sāṃkleśikaiḥ paunarbhavikaiḥ sa jvaraiḥ duḥkha vipākaiḥ āyatyām jāti jarā maraṇīyaiḥ mahataḥ ca arthasya parihāṇiḥ bhavati
translated: There is a great loss of wealth from bad, unwholesome, defiled, rebirth-producing, feverish, painful, and in the future, from birth, old age, and death.

original: ārabdhavīryas tu sukhaṃ viharaty avakīrṇaḥ pāpakair akuśalair dharmaiḥ sāṃkleśikaiḥ paunarbhavikaiḥ sajvarair duḥkhavipākaiḥ āyatyāṃ jātijarāmaraṇīyaiḥ
analyzed: ārabdha vīryaḥ tu sukham viharati avakīrṇaḥ pāpakaiḥ akuśalaiḥ dharmaiḥ sāṃkleśikaiḥ paunarbhavikaiḥ sa jvaraiḥ duḥkha vipākaiḥ āyatyām jāti jarā maraṇīyaiḥ
translated: But one who has begun effort dwells happily, unmixed with bad, unwholesome, defiled, rebirth-producing, feverish, painful, and in the future, from birth, old age, and death.

analyzed: mahataḥ ca arthasya pāripūriḥ bhavati
translated: And there is the completion of a great purpose.

original: maṇḍayeyam idaṃ pravacanaṃ yaduta śāstā ca saṃmukhībhūtaḥ /
analyzed: maṇḍayeyam idam pravacanam yat uta śāstā ca saṃmukhībhūtaḥ
translated: I would adorn this teaching, namely that the Teacher is present,

original: dharmaś ca deśyata aupaśamikaḥ pārinirvāṇikaḥ saṃbodhigāmī sugatapraveditaḥ /
analyzed: dharmaḥ ca deśyate aupaśamikaḥ pārinirvāṇikaḥ saṃbodhi gāmī sugata praveditaḥ
translated: and the Dharma is taught, which is conducive to peace, to final Nirvāṇa, leading to enlightenment, proclaimed by the Well-Gone One.

original: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣava ātmārthaṃ ca samanupaśyadbhiḥ parārthaṃ cobhayārthaṃ ca /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi bhikṣavaḥ ātma artham ca samanupaśyadbhiḥ para artham ca ubhaya artham ca
translated: Therefore, monks, those who see it as for their own sake, for the sake of others, and for the sake of both,

analyzed: idam pratisaṃśikṣitavyam
translated: should train in this.

analyzed: kaccit naḥ pravrajyā amoghā bhaviṣyati
translated: May our going forth not be fruitless,

analyzed: saphalā sukha udayā sukha vipākā
translated: may it be fruitful, blissful, and have blissful results.

analyzed: yeṣām ca paribhokṣyāmahe cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārān
translated: and we will enjoy the robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, medicines for the sick, and other personal belongings,

original: teṣāṃ ca te kārāḥ kṛtāḥ kaccid atyarthamahāphalā bhaviṣyanti /🔽mahānuśaṃsā mahādyutayo mahāvaistārāḥ /
analyzed: teṣām ca te kārāḥ kṛtāḥ kaccit atyartha mahā phalāḥ bhaviṣyanti  mahā anuśaṃsāḥ mahā dyutayaḥ mahā vaistārāḥ
translated: will those deeds of theirs be very fruitful, very beneficial, very glorious, and very radiant?

analyzed: iti evam vaḥ bhikṣavaḥ śikṣitavyam
translated: Thus, monks, you should train.

original: asmin khalu dharmaparyāye bhāṣyamāṇe rājñā mahākapphiṇena aṣṭādaśāmātyagaṇasahasraparivāreṇa
analyzed: asmin khalu dharmaparyāye bhāṣyamāṇe rājñā mahākapphiṇena aṣṭādaśa amātya gaṇa sahasra parivāreṇa
translated: When this Dharma discourse was being spoken, King Mahākappina, surrounded by an assembly of eighteen thousand ministers,

original: viṃśatiśikharasamudgataṃ satkāyadṛṣṭiśailaṃ jñānavajreṇa bhitvā srotāpattiphalaṃ sākṣātkṛtam /
analyzed: viṃśati śikhara samudgatam satkāyadṛṣṭi śailam jñāna vajreṇa bhitvā srotāpatti phalam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: having shattered with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty-peak high mountain of the view of a real personality, directly experienced the fruit of stream-entry.

analyzed: sa dṛṣṭa satyaḥ bhagavat śāsane pravrajitaḥ
translated: Having seen the truths, he went forth in the Blessed One's teaching.

original: tena yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakaṃ saṃsāracakraṃ🔽calācalaṃ viditvā sarvasaṃskāragatīḥ śatanapatanavikiraṇavidhvaṃsanadharmatayā parāhatya
analyzed: tena yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakam saṃsāra cakram  calācalam viditvā sarva saṃskāra gatīḥ śatana patana vikiraṇa vidhvaṃsana dharmatayā parāhatya
translated: While he was striving, struggling, and striving energetically, he understood this five-constituent existence🔽to be impermanent, suffering, and without self, and having cut off all the fetters,

analyzed: sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: he directly experienced Arhatship.

original: tataḥ śākyaiḥ śarīrāvalagnānāṃ hārārdhahāramaṇimukhtāvaiḍūryakeyūrāṅgulīyakānāṃ mahān rāśiḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: tatas śākyaiḥ śarīra avalagnānām hāra ardhahāra maṇi mukhtā vaiḍūrya keyūra aṅgulīyakānām mahān rāśiḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: Then the Śākyas made a great heap of necklaces, half-necklaces, jewels, pearls, lapis lazuli, bracelets, and rings that were attached to their bodies.

original: tata upāleḥ kalpakasya tān dṛṣṭvā vicitraṃ cālaṃkāram abhivīkṣya yoniśo manasikāra utpannaḥ /
analyzed: tatas upāleḥ kalpakasya tān dṛṣṭvā vicitram ca alaṃkāram abhivīkṣya yoniśas manasikāraḥ utpannaḥ
translated: Then Upāli the barber, seeing those various ornaments, had a proper thought:

original: ime tāvac chākyāḥ kularūpayuvanavanto 'ntaḥpurāṇi imaṃ cālaṃkāraṃ kheṭavad utsṛjya pravrajitāḥ /
analyzed: ime tāvat śākyāḥ kula rūpa yuvanavantaḥ ntaḥpurāṇi imam ca alaṃkāram kheṭa vat utsṛjya pravrajitāḥ
translated: These Śākyas, who are of noble lineage, appearance, and youth, have abandoned this ornament like spittle and gone forth.

original: kim utāham alpavibhavaḥ imam alaṃkāraṃ gṛhaṃ neṣyāmi / alam anena /
analyzed: kim uta aham alpa vibhavaḥ imam alaṃkāram gṛham neṣyāmi alam anena
translated: What then shall I, of little wealth, take this ornament home? It is enough.

analyzed: yanu aham etān anupravrajeyam iti
translated: Let me go forth after them.

analyzed: atha upāliḥ kalpakaḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ
translated: Then Upāli the barber approached the Blessed One.

original: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādayor nipatya bhagavantam idam avocat /
analyzed: upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ nipatya bhagavantam idam avocat
translated: Having approached, he bowed at the feet of the Blessed One and said this to the Blessed One:

analyzed: yadi bhagavat mādṛśānām pravrajyā asti
translated: If, Blessed One, there is going forth for those like me,

original: labheyāhaṃ svākhyāte dharmavinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadaṃ bhikṣubhāvam /
analyzed: labheya aham su ākhyāte dharma vinaye pravrajyām upasaṃpadam bhikṣu bhāvam
translated: may I receive the going forth, full ordination, and monkhood in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

analyzed: careyam aham bhagavataḥ ntike brahmacaryam iti
translated: May I practice the holy life in the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: tatas bhagavatā ehibhikṣukayā pravrājitaḥ
translated: Then the Blessed One ordained him with the words, Come, monk.

original: tato bhadrikapramukhāni pañca śākyaśatāni bhikṣunepathyadhārīṇi Speyer /
analyzed: tatas bhadrika pramukhāni pañca śākya śatāni bhikṣu nepathya dhārīṇi speyeḥ
translated: Then the five hundred Śākyas headed by Bhadrika, who were wearing the attire of monks,

analyzed: bhikṣu veṣa dhārīṇi
translated: who were wearing the robes of monks,

analyzed: buddha pramukhasya bhikṣu saṃghasya praṇāmam kartam pravṛttāni
translated: set out to pay homage to the community of monks headed by the Buddha.

original: te upāliṃ jñātvā kularūpavibhavānvitatvān necchanty upāleḥ🔽Vaidya / p /
analyzed: te upālim jñātvā kula rūpa vibhava anvita tvāt na icchanti upāleḥ  vaidya p
translated: Knowing that Upāli was of noble family, appearance, and wealth, they did not want to pay homage to Upāli,

analyzed: praṇāmam kartum
translated: thinking, How can we pay homage to one who is of low caste?

analyzed: tatra bhagavān āyuṣmantam bhadrikam āmantrayate
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the venerable Bhadrika,

analyzed: bhadrika kartavyaḥ sya praṇāmaḥ
translated: Bhadrika, homage should be paid to him.

original: yasmād idaṃ māmakaṃ śāsanaṃ na kularūpayauvanaiśvaryacāturvarṇyaviśuddhim apekṣata iti /
analyzed: yasmāt idam māmakam śāsanam na kula rūpa yauvana aiśvarya cāturvarṇya viśuddhim apekṣate iti
translated: Because my teaching does not depend on purity of family, appearance, youth, or wealth, nor on the four castes.

original: tato mūlanikṛttā iva drumā bhadrikapramukhāni pañca śākyaśatāni dharmatām avalambya pādayor nipatitāni /
analyzed: tatas mūla nikṛttāḥ iva drumāḥ bhadrika pramukhāni pañca śākya śatāni dharmatām avalambya pādayoḥ nipatitāni
translated: Then the five hundred Śākyas headed by Bhadrika, like trees cut at the root, fell at his feet, relying on the nature of things.

original: teṣām pādavandanasamakālam eveyaṃ mahāpṛthivī ṣaḍvikāraṃ prakampitā /
analyzed: teṣām pāda vandana sama kālam eva iyam mahā pṛthivī ṣaṣ vikāram prakampitā
translated: At the very moment they paid homage at his feet, this great earth shook in six ways.

original: tatrāyuṣmatā bhadrikeṇa yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakaṃ
analyzed: tatra āyuṣmatā bhadrikeṇa yujyamānena ghaṭamānena vyāyacchamānena idam eva pañcagaṇḍakam
translated: There, the venerable Bhadra, striving, exerting, and endeavoring, having known this five-part

analyzed: saṃsāra cakram calācalam viditvā sarva saṃskāra gatīḥ śatana patana vikiraṇa vidhvaṃsana dharmatayā
translated: wheel of existence to be turning and not turning, having overcome all the courses of conditioned things with the nature of breaking, falling, scattering, and perishing,

analyzed: parāhatya sarva kleśa prahāṇāt arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam
translated: having attained arhatship through the abandonment of all defilements,

original: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātukavītarāgaḥ samaloṣṭakāñcana ākāśapāṇitalasamacitto vāsīcandanakalpo vidyāvidāritāṇḍakośo vidyābhijñāpratisaṃvitprāpto
analyzed: arhan saṃvṛttaḥ traidhātuka vīta rāgaḥ sama loṣṭa kāñcanaḥ ākāśa pāṇitala sama cittaḥ vāsī candana kalpaḥ vidyā vidārita āṇḍakośaḥ vidyā abhijñā pratisaṃvid prāptaḥ
translated: he became an arhat, free from the passions of the three realms, with a mind like a diamond or space, like a polished beryl gem, his fetters ended, his intentions fulfilled, with a mind like a mountain, well liberated, with knowledge and conduct, a great man, a knower of the world, an instructor of gods and men, a great seer, a lord, a tamer of tamers, a teacher of gods and men, a buddha, a blessed one.

analyzed: bhava lābha lobha satkāra parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: He turned his back on worldly gain, greed, and honor.

original: sendropendrāṇāṃ devānāṃ pūjyo mānyo 'bhivādyaś ca saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: sa indra upendrāṇām devānām pūjyaḥ mānyaḥ bhivādyaḥ ca saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: He became one to be worshipped, revered, and saluted by Indra, Upendra, and the gods.

original: sa ca mahātmā hīnadīnānukampī /🔽so 'pareṇa samayena pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya śrāvastīṃ gocarāya prasthitaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca mahātmā hīna dīna anukampī  saḥ pareṇa samayena pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya śrāvastīm gocarāya prasthitaḥ
translated: And that great being had compassion for the lowly and the poor.🔽On another occasion, in the morning, he put on his lower robe, took his bowl, and set out for Śrāvastī for alms.

analyzed: yāvat anyatara caṇḍāla kaṭhinam piṇḍāya praviṣṭaḥ
translated: As he was entering for alms, he saw a certain caṇḍāla village.

original: tena khalu samayena rājā prasenajit kauśala ekapuṇḍarīkaṃ hastināgam abhiruhya dīrgheṇa cārāyaṇena sārathinā bhagavato darśanāya saṃprasthitaḥ
analyzed: tena khalu samayena rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ eka puṇḍarīkam hasti nāgam abhiruhya dīrgheṇa cārāyaṇena sārathinā bhagavataḥ darśanāya saṃprasthitaḥ
translated: At that time, King Prasenajit of Kosala, having mounted his one-holed elephant, together with Dirghacharayana as his charioteer, set out to see the Blessed One.

original: dadarśa rājā prasenajit kauśalo bhadrikaṃ śāntendriyaṃ śāntamānasam /
analyzed: dadarśa rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ bhadrikam śānta indriyam śānta mānasam
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala saw Bhadra, with his faculties and mind at peace,

original: parameṇa ca cittadamavyupaśamanasamanvāgataṃ pāṃsukūlaprāvṛtaṃ lūhaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ gṛhītvā tasmāc caṇḍālakaṭhinān nirgacchantam /
analyzed: parameṇa ca citta dama vyupaśamana samanvāgatam pāṃsu kūla prāvṛtam lūham piṇḍapātam gṛhītvā tasmāt caṇḍāla kaṭhināt nirgacchantam
translated: endowed with the highest self-control and tranquility, wearing a rag-robe, taking a coarse alms-food, leaving the Chandala's hut.

original: dṛṣṭvā ca punar dīrghaṃ cārāyaṇaṃ sārathim āmantrayate /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā ca punar dīrgham cārāyaṇam sārathim āmantrayate
translated: Having seen him, he addressed his charioteer Dirghacharayana, saying:

analyzed: syāt ayam cārāyaṇa bhadrikaḥ bhikṣuḥ
translated: Charayana, could this be the monk Bhadra?

analyzed: evam yathā vadasi
translated: Yes, just as you say.

original: iti śrutvā rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ saṃmoham āpannaḥ /
analyzed: iti śrutvā rājā prasenajit kauśalaḥ saṃmoham āpannaḥ
translated: Having heard this, King Prasenajit of Kosala became confused.

analyzed: pṛthivyām mūrcchitaḥ patitaḥ
translated: He fell to the ground in a faint.

analyzed: tatas jala pariṣeka pratyāgata prāṇa cetasaḥ labdha mānasaḥ cārāyaṇena sārathinā utthāpitaḥ
translated: Then, having regained his breath and mind by being sprinkled with water, and having regained his senses, he was raised up by his charioteer Charayana.

original: tato rājā bhagavatsakāśam upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādābhivandanaṃ kṛtvā bhagavantam uvāca / bhagavan /
analyzed: tatas rājā bhagavat sakāśam upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pāda abhivandanam kṛtvā bhagavantam uvāca bhagavan
translated: Then the king approached the Blessed One, bowed at his feet, and said to the Blessed One: Blessed One,

analyzed: adbhutam me dṛṣṭam
translated: I have seen a wonder.

original: asau bhadrikaḥ śākyarājaḥ pāṃsukūlaprāvṛto lūhaṃ piṇḍapātaṃ gṛhītvā devamanuṣyāvarjanakareṇātipraśānteneryāpathena piṇḍapātam ādāya caṇḍālakaṭhinān 🔽nirgataḥ /
analyzed: asau bhadrikaḥ śākya rājaḥ pāṃsukūla prāvṛtaḥ lūham piṇḍapātam gṛhītvā deva manuṣya āvarjana kareṇa ati praśāntena īryāpathena piṇḍapātam ādāya caṇḍāla kaṭhinān  nirgataḥ
translated: That good Śākya king, wearing a rag robe, taking a coarse alms-food, with a very peaceful deportment that attracts gods and humans, took his alms-food and left on the hard ground of the outcasts.

analyzed: tasya mama etat abhavat
translated: I thought this:

analyzed: āścarya yāvat su vinītam bhagavat śāsanam
translated: How wonderful, how well-disciplined is the Blessed One's teaching,

original: yatra nāma evaṃvidhāḥ kumārāḥ sukhaidhitā evaṃvinītapracārāḥ saṃvṛttā iti /
analyzed: yatra nāma evaṃvidhāḥ kumārāḥ sukha edhitāḥ evaṃvinīta pracārāḥ saṃvṛttāḥ iti
translated: where princes who have been so well-cared for and have such well-disciplined conduct have become like this.

analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

analyzed: aparam api mahā rāja bhadrikasya āścaryam śṛṇu
translated: Great king, listen to another wonder of Bhadra.

original: ayaṃ mahārāja bhadriko 'raṇyagato vā vṛkṣamūlagato vā śūnyāgāragato vā trir udānayati /
analyzed: ayam mahā rāja bhadrikaḥ raṇya gataḥ vā vṛkṣa mūla gataḥ vā śūnya āgāra gataḥ vā tris udānayati
translated: Great king, when Bhadra is in the wilderness, at the foot of a tree, or in an empty building, he utters this exclamation three times:

analyzed: aho bata saukhyam
translated: 'Oh, what happiness!

original: yad aham apravrajitaḥ san rājakulamadhyagato 'mātyanaigamajānapadasusaṃrakṣitaḥ prākāraparikhādvārastūpābhinigūḍhaḥ pariśaṅkitahṛdayaḥ saṃvignaḥ
analyzed: yat aham a pravrajitaḥ san rāja kula madhya gataḥ mātya naigama jānapada su saṃrakṣitaḥ prākāra parikhā dvāra stūpa abhinigūḍhaḥ pariśaṅkita hṛdayaḥ saṃvignaḥ
translated: If I had not gone forth, but remained in the royal palace, well-protected by ministers, townspeople, and country people, hidden behind walls, moats, and gates, with a suspicious mind, anxious,

analyzed: samantataḥ śaṅkī nidrām na āsādayāmi
translated: fearful in all directions, I would not have attained sleep.

original: so 'ham etarhi nirapekṣaḥ kāye jīvite ca sukhaṃ yatratatrastho viharāmīti //
analyzed: saḥ ham etarhi nirapekṣaḥ kāye jīvite ca sukham yatra tatrasthaḥ viharāmi iti
translated: But now, being free from concern for body and life, I dwell happily wherever I am.

original: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātāḥ sarvasaṃśayacchettāraṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ sarva saṃśaya chettāram buddham bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: The monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the Vanquisher of Doubts,

original: kāni bhadanta bhadrikeṇa pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni /
analyzed: kāni bhadanta bhadrikeṇa pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni
translated: Venerable One, what actions did Bhadraka perform in his previous lives,

original: yenābhirūpo darśanīyaḥ prāsādika āḍhye rājakule pratyājātaḥ /
analyzed: yena abhirūpaḥ darśanīyaḥ prāsādikaḥ āḍhye rājakule pratyājātaḥ
translated: that he was born in a wealthy royal family, handsome, good-looking, and pleasing,

analyzed: pravrajya ca arha tvam sākṣātkṛtam iti
translated: and after going forth, he realized arhatship?

original: bhagavān āha /🔽bhadrikeṇaiva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni labdhasaṃbhārāṇi pariṇatapratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāny avaśyaṃbhāvīni
analyzed: bhagavān āha  bhadrikeṇa eva bhikṣavaḥ pūrvam anyāsu jātiṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni labdha saṃbhārāṇi pariṇata pratyayāni oghavat pratyupasthitāni avaśyaṃbhāvīni
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽Monks, Bhadraka himself performed and accumulated these actions in his previous lives,

analyzed: bhadrikeṇa karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni
translated: having done them, stored them up,

analyzed: kaḥ nyaḥ pratyanubhaviṣyati
translated: Who else will experience it?

analyzed: vaidya p
translated: The doctor.

original: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāny upacitāni bāhye pṛthivīdhātau vipacyante /🔽nābdhātau /
analyzed: na bhikṣavaḥ karmāṇi kṛtāni upacitāni bāhye pṛthivī dhātau vipacyante  na ap dhātau
translated: Monks, actions that have been done and accumulated do not ripen in the external earth element.🔽Nor in the water element.

analyzed: na tejaḥ dhātau
translated: Nor in the fire element.

analyzed: na vāyu dhātau
translated: Nor in the wind element.

original: api tūpātteṣv eva skandhadhātvāyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāny aśubhāni ca /
analyzed: api tu upātteṣu eva skandha dhātu āyataneṣu karmāṇi kṛtāni vipacyante śubhāni aśubhāni ca
translated: But rather, actions that have been done and accumulated ripen in the appropriated aggregates, elements, and sense bases, whether wholesome or unwholesome.

original: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpaśatair api /
analyzed: na praṇaśyanti karmāṇi api kalpa śataiḥ api
translated: Actions do not perish even after a hundred aeons.

original: sāmagrīṃ prāpya kālaṃ ca phalanti khalu dehinām // / //
analyzed: sāmagrīm prāpya kālam ca phalanti khalu dehinām
translated: When the conditions are complete and the time has come, they certainly bear fruit for embodied beings.

original: bhūtapūrvaṃ bhikṣavo 'tīte 'dhvani vārāṇasyāṃ nagaryām anyatamaḥ koṭṭamallakaḥ kṣutkṣāmaparigataśarīraḥ itaś cāmutaś cānvāhiṇḍate /
analyzed: bhūta pūrvam bhikṣavaḥ tīte dhvani vārāṇasyām nagaryām anyatamaḥ koṭṭamallakaḥ kṣudh kṣāma parigata śarīraḥ itas ca amutas ca anvāhiṇḍate
translated: Monks, in the past, in the city of Varanasi, there was a certain wrestler who, with his body emaciated by hunger, wandered here and there.

original: yāvad anyatarā dārikā pūpalikā ādāya gacchati /🔽tatas tena koṭṭamallakena sā dārikā pūpalikānām arthe abhibhūtā /
analyzed: yāvat anyatarā dārikā pūpalikāḥ ādāya gacchati  tatas tena koṭṭamallakena sā dārikā pūpalikānām arthe abhibhūtā
translated: Meanwhile, a certain girl was going along carrying some cakes.🔽Then, that wrestler overpowered that girl for the sake of the cakes.

original: tato balād ekām pūpalikām ādāya itas tataḥ Speyer /🔽tatas tataḥ
analyzed: tatas balāt ekām pūpalikām ādāya itas tatas speyeḥ  tatas tatas
translated: Then, taking one cake by force, he ran away here and there.

analyzed: palāyitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then, he started to run away.

analyzed: sā ca asya dārikā pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhā eva
translated: And that girl was always following behind him.

analyzed: tatas sau koṭṭamallakaḥ sahasā nadī cārikām uttīrṇaḥ
translated: Then that wrestler suddenly crossed the river.

original: asati buddhānām utpāde pratyekabuddhā loka utpadyante hīnadīnānukampakāḥ prāntaśayanāsanabhaktā ekadakṣiṇīyā lokasya /
analyzed: asati buddhānām utpāde pratyekabuddhāḥ loke utpadyante hīna dīna anukampakāḥ prānta śayanāsana bhaktāḥ eka dakṣiṇīyāḥ lokasya
translated: When the Buddhas do not appear, Pratyekabuddhas appear in the world, who are compassionate towards the lowly and the poor, who enjoy living in remote places, and are the world's sole recipients of offerings.

original: tadā anyataraḥ pratyekabuddhas tasya koṭṭamallakasyāgrataḥ sthitaḥ /
analyzed: tadā anyataraḥ pratyekabuddhaḥ tasya koṭṭamallakasya agratas sthitaḥ
translated: At that time, a certain Pratyekabuddha stood in front of that wrestler.

original: tataḥ koṭṭamallasya taṃ pratyekabuddhaṃ śānteryāpathaṃ dṛṣṭvā mahān prasādo jātaḥ /
analyzed: tatas koṭṭamallasya tam pratyekabuddham śānta īryāpatham dṛṣṭvā mahān prasādaḥ jātaḥ
translated: Then, seeing that Pratyekabuddha with a peaceful demeanor, the wrestler experienced great faith.

original: tena svaṃ vyasanam agaṇayya pratyekabuddhāya pūpalikā pratipāditā /
analyzed: tena svam vyasanam a gaṇayya pratyekabuddhāya pūpalikā pratipāditā
translated: Without considering his own misfortune, he offered a flat cake to the Pratyekabuddha.

original: tasya vipraharṣasaṃjananārthaṃ vitatapakṣa iva haṃsarājo gaganatalam abhyudgamya vicitrāṇi prātihāryāṇi vidarśayitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tasya vipraharṣa saṃjanana artham vitata pakṣaḥ iva haṃsa rājaḥ gagana talam abhyudgamya vicitrāṇi prātihāryāṇi vidarśayitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: In order to generate great joy in him, he rose up into the sky like the king of swans with outstretched wings and began to display various miracles.

original: tataḥ koṭṭamallakas tad atyadbhutaṃ devamanuṣyāvarjanakaraṃ prātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā mūlanikṛttā iva drumaḥ pādayor nipatya praṇidhānaṃ kartum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas koṭṭamallakaḥ tat ati adbhutam deva manuṣya āvarjana karam prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā mūla nikṛttā iva drumaḥ pādayoḥ nipatya praṇidhānam kartum ārabdhaḥ
translated: Then the village overseer, having seen that amazing miracle that caused gods and humans to rejoice, fell at his feet like a tree felled at the root and began to make a vow:

original: yan me siddhavrato dakṣiṇīyaḥ pūpalikayā pratipāditaḥ /
analyzed: yat me siddhavrataḥ dakṣiṇīyaḥ pūpalikayā pratipāditaḥ
translated: Since I have offered a small cake to this one whose vows are fulfilled, who is worthy of offerings,

original: anenāhaṃ kuśalamūlena cittotpādena deyadharmaparityāgena ca yatra yatra jāyeya /
analyzed: anena aham kuśala mūlena citta utpādena deya dharma parityāgena ca yatra yatra jāyeya
